Reviews.Author: Kevin W.
Reviews.Content: THROWBACK!Stepping into Canter's is like going back in time. It has such a old school feel to it. Free parking with validation next to the restaurant. It gets full so might have to wait for a spot.It was annoying at first because all the servers were running around doing a million things and I could not get anyones attention to take my order. I didn't want to raise my hand wave someone down like a fool. Greg ended up at my table. He was awesome! Had wonderful service with him.I had a Groupon, $10 for $20. Yelp check in gives you free Chocolate Chp Rugula.- Fresser - $15.50 - I think the Fresser is the perfect offering. I am the type to want to try multiple different things a restaurant is popular for in one dish. Fresser offers, both popular meats, corned beef and pastrami and both sides, cole slaw and potato salad. Corned beef and pastrami portions were huge! It literally was piled high. Both meats were well flavored and seasoned and cooked perfectly. Potato salad was top notch. I loved the apple, it added a nice sweet crisp crunch. Cole Slaw was plain and simple alone. I put it in the sandwich because the meat and bread alone was to dry for me and it was delicious.- Avocado, Mushroom And Swiss Omelet - $7 - Breaskfast special price before 10:30 am everyday. One of the best omelets I have ever had! Huge and super cheesy! It was stuffed with mushroom and avocado. Usually restaurant barely give you any but I had a bunch of toppings with each bite, so BOMB! You also get a bagel, hashbrowns, and a drink. You probably cannot find a breasfast deal this good anywhere!- Matzo Ball Soup - $6.75 - HOLY SOFTBALL SIZED MATZO BALL! This thing was huge! I never had a matzo ball before but this was delish! It has the taste and texture of a dumpling. I had to add a dash of pepper with each bite. The soup was amazing. Such good deep chicken flavor and not salty at all. The crispy bagels that it comes with are so good dip in the soup or by themselves. I would crave for this if I was sick.- Chocolate Chp Rugula - Free with Yelp Check In - Very tasty pastry. Full of chocolate chips. Dipped in coffee, it was very good!Sad to see such a low rating for an LA landmark. I really enjoyed the food and would come back!

Reviews.Author: Zoey O.
Reviews.Content: I came here around 11pm with a friend. The restaurant was busy, but still had a lot of seating available. We we're sat in the room where the live band was playing. We couldn't handle the noise and was asked to be moved immediately. We were moved and our server quickly came over and took our order. I had the matzah ball soup while my friend had the mish mosh. His was so unbelievably hot that he couldn't eat it and had to wait so long for it to cool, that he took it home to eat.

Reviews.Author: Brandon P.
Reviews.Content: If you ever crave a Rueben Pastrami sandwich at 2 in the morning then this is your place!!I love the feel of this place, it has this old Hollywood mystic to it. There's drafts coming from areas where there's no vents. A lot of the servers are old and really friendly. The matzah ball soup is good. They have complimentary pickles and through Yelp when you check in you get free chocolate chip rugula, it's great with a cup of joe.

Reviews.Author: Laura R.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places I've wanted to go to my whole life.  Seriously.  Why I haven't, I have no idea.I walk into the smell I can only define as that smell when you were a kid and walked into grandma's house at Passover.Tons of seating.  We got a booth in the middle of the restaurant.  Hot corned beef on rye and matzo ball soup.  Good god the corned beef was fantastic.  The rye bread was good, but it could have been fresher.  The soup was delicious! One ginormous ball ... couldn't even finish it.  I do want to come back and try the pastrami.The pickles here are cut longways and DELICIOUS.  The service was awesome.  By far the best i've ever had at a jewish deli.  The outside of the parking lot has some very cool murals of jewish history.  And, the parking lot at the side is free parking for 1.5 hours and they validate for you for in the deli.Next up, Langers!

Reviews.Author: Jill F.
Reviews.Content: Food:Had a Hot Corned Beef Sandwich. It tasted similar to Langers's Pastrami #19, so pretty good. Canters has more baked goods, while Langers has a much more extensive listing of possibilities for what you might want in your pastrami sandwich/coupled with pastrami. Had a side of sweet potato fries. They were a-okay.Service: Server was nice and suggested we try the sweet potato fries with the dressing dip.Atmosphere:Canter's is a more cutesy diner than Langers, which has a more real-people-living-life feeling.  It's analogous to their locations: Canter's is not too far from the Grove while  Langers is in Echo Park. Parking:Canter's has its own parking lot and validates parking, good up for a few of hours.

Reviews.Author: Eric F.
Reviews.Content: When I first came to LA it was all about Canter's: my California friends took me there; I felt at home and welcome there; it was open deep into the night for coffee and Hungarian cheesecake, and there is always a line, a buzz, and the great smell of deli. In other words, Canter's in a definitive Hollywood experience not to be missed.Deli is never cheap, but Canter's prices are actually a little bit lower than some others. And they have a half a deli sandwich and a bowl of soup special that is very reasonable, delicious, and filling. Canter's is also one of the last places to offer Kishke with gravy, and also Kreploch soup. If you like "old" pickles then that's the way they serve them. I like new pickles myself but they are hard to get. Also at Canter's you have to buy a side of the green tomatoes, they are not free as with most other places. I love the pastrami here, on rye (nice and chewy), but the corned beef is also great, probably their signature dish. The Matzo ball soup is good but it is not huge. Specialty sandwiches are also tasty like the Danny Thomas or the Marilyn Monroe. Whatever you have I recommend having it with a black cherry soda. It pairs well.Other fare include the Mish Mosh soup, a huge bowl of everything starchy (Matzo ball, noodles, Kreploch, chicken meat, and carrots) all in chicken soup. Also hot beef and hot turkey sandwiches with mashed potatoes and gravy. And if you want a full dinner, with appetizers and sides, they have quite a few of these too.Don't miss the excellent home baked pastries and a cup of coffee after the meal. You can go pick out what you want at the bakery counter.Canter's also offers a take out deli where you can but things by the lb, and a bakery. It is a great place to eat.... more than once.

Reviews.Author: Danielle C.
Reviews.Content: Come to Canter's if you want a great pastrami or corned beef sandwich! I don't live near this deli by any means but when I'm in the area and in the mood for a good sandwich, I make my way over to Canter's. I've had both the pastrami and the corned beef sandwiches and haven't been disappointed! At $12, it might seem pricy but they stack the finely sliced meat nice and high in between two slices of fresh rye bread and offer a side of cole slaw or potato salad. During my most recent visit to Canter's, I couldn't decide between the pastrami and the corned beef sandwich so I opted for the Canter's Fairfax sandwich which stacks corned beef on top of delicious pastrami. Once again, I wasn't disappointed. We got some pastries on our way out and picked up a big black & white cookie, a few chocolate macaroons, and an apple strudel. I liked all of them! They were made fresh and weren't too sweet.My overall experience was great. The restaurant is old fashioned with a relaxed atmosphere. The service is efficient and our waitress was very nice. Parking in the designated lot next to the deli is free up to an hour and a half, just don't forget to get your ticket validated inside. It's also open 24hrs so that's pretty great!

Reviews.Author: Michelle R.
Reviews.Content: My review was really leaning toward a 4 star, but I gave it 3 stars because of the subpar service.Perhaps Canter's has surly service because its an LA institution?Or, perhaps they brought the NYC attitude so you can "feel" you're eating in a NYC style deli?Or, perhaps this place is located in such a touristy area, that the staff figured most people are tourists anyway?So I drove up on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch, arrived around 3:30 pm, and scored a parking spot in the Canter's lot. We walked inside, and was taken back 50 years in time.  Talk about vintage!!  We walked up to the sign that said "WAIT TO BE SEATED" with a red arrow pointed to a line.  So, we waited, and waited... a few waitstaff dropped off some menus, but not one said "someone will be with you".  We finally get seated in one of the vintage looking booths and the woman plops down 2 menus and a "cocktail" menu.Another man sets our table and gives us 2 dinky water glasses (despite the sign that says "water served upon request").  We wait and wait for someone to take our drink order. Finally "Penny", an older lady, comes by and plops a plate of pickles and disappears.  She does come back a few minutes later for our drink order, and then disappears.  Meanwhile, while waiting for Penny to reappear, we checked into "Yelp" and saw if you check in you get an order of chocolate chip rugula.  I stopped Penny and showed her the app, and she brought back a plate of 5 rugulas. Score! Best check in deal in a long time!She finally comes back to take our order. I order the 1/2 classic sandwich (comes with a small side of potato salad or slaw) and a bowl of matzo soup (adding noodles cost extra) and also a side of onion rings.  Stephen ordered the 1/2 sandwich and matzo soup, no noodles.The soup came out immediately.  I wish she waited so we could have our soup with the sandwich, but oh well... I was famished, and started in on the soup.  The matzo was a good size ball, but was just the soup and matzo. No carrots, noodles, or anything else.  It did come with a small plate of bagel chips.I was about done with my soup when the 1/2 sandwich came. The sandwich was not a NYC "sky high" sandwich, but the portion was ok.  I don't think it was worth the price we paid, but its sliced fresh, and the meat was lean and tender.  I debated if I should wait for my onion rings but I figure at the rate they bring out food, my hot sandwich would get cold.  Lucky I didn't wait.  The onion rings never came.  I waited for Penny to refill on my drink, but had to flag another server to get her.  When she arrived, we asked for the refill, the check, and  I told her to cancel the onion rings as I was done with my lunch.She had a surprised look on her face, as in "Oh My! I can't believe I forgot about your o-rings", but honey, you were too busy chatting with your fellow servers, I'm not surprised you remembered I was sitting in your station.The food was good, but the service was subpar, even by LA standards.  Canter's is open 24 hours for your dining pleasure.  Good thing I had a Groupon, but its stil not a cheap place to eat.

Reviews.Author: Travis W.
Reviews.Content: Oh the history alone is worth 3 stars. A very classic and famous deli with one of the darkest bars I have ever seen in my life. This place is a piece of LA history. I finally got it off my list of places to check out thanks to a buddy forcing me to go here. The menu is chalked full of different items that pretty much can cover anything you could want from a restaurant. Now looking at the menu I had to go with a sandwich, how could you not?  I was torn between the pastrami and the brisket. My wife grabbed a corn beef Brooklyn on sourdough (should have asked for it toasted) and I grabbed the brisket dip. The sandwiches are nice in size and will definitely fill you up.  My dip was pretty darn good, nice flavor from the beef and the au jus was perfect. Nice and salty to and complimented the flavors. The prices here are pretty much $10.00 and above but the portions are pretty nice so it kind of evens it out. You can grab a bottle of beer or they have about 6 taps if you want a draft. The ambiance is really cool with old pics of G&R and a killer drawing that Slash did of Aerosmith. Next time I roll in I am hitting the Kibitsz room. If those walls could talk they would have stories for days. CHEERS!!!

Reviews.Author: Kitty K.
Reviews.Content: Very old school diner that probably hasn't changed since they first opened. One side leads straight into the bakery & deli while the other straight into the restaurant (but still not where you wait to get a table). In the bar area (also where the bathrooms are), there are several TVs where you can catch a game. Be careful when going into the ladies' room. It's TINY and the sink is literally right next to the door. If you don't open carefully, you can hit another patron! Talk about unsafe! If the private parking lot for Canter's is full, you'll have to find street metered parking (yes, you have to pay on Sundays). The place very popular so the lot gets filled quickly. When we walked in, we came through the restaurant entrance. Little did we know that you're supposed to go through the bakery/deli entrance. There were no signs posted by the restaurant entrance to go through the other side. Throughout our meal, we constantly saw people walking in and making the same mistake that we did. Gives off a bad impression when you're standing waiting to get seating and you're being completely ignored by all the employees, only to be finally told that the wait-line is at the other side. We were lucky and came when there was a lull in customers and we were seated within 10min.Order:Belgium Waffle Special: ($12.50) Belgian Waffle, One Egg, choice of two pieces of bacon or sausage, and hash-browns.Smoked Salmon (Lox) Benedict: ($12.25) served with Potatoes, Tomatoes, Cottage Cheese, or Fresh Fruit. Served on Potato Pancakes (+$2)The Deli: ($10.95) Pastrami, Corned Beef or Salami, Eggs, Potatoes, and ToastChocolate Phosphate: $2.50Coffee: $2.50They brought out complimentary pickles that didn't have the nice snap/crunch as you bite into it. The pickles also didn't have the a sharp tartness. We left nearly two plates full of pickles behind (felt so bad but I couldn't even finish one!).I had the Belgium Waffle Special (and even though on the menu it says it comes with coffee or tea, they said they stopped doing it. Another place with false advertising which I hate). The waffle was slightly crispy on the outside and  airy on the inside. Apparently there's only two waffle makers so when our table ordered three of the Belgium Waffle Specials, the waitress told us that the workers nearly freaked out. Makes me wonder how they fair during really busy times.. =/ I like my eggs poached but mine was over-done. Sadness. The sausages tasted how they looked, over-cooked.I've had pastrami from Katz's Delicatessen in NY so other delis have some major work to impress me now. I took a bite from my sister's pastrami sandwich and thought it wasn't as juicy (could be that the slices are thinner) or flavorful compared to Katz's. Makes me want to go back to NY to get my fix! ^^;;I was debating on either the Chocolate Phosphate or the Chocolate Egg Cream as they're both fairly uncommon to find. Both tastes like chocolate soda, one is just slightly creamier than the other. Egg Cream is a drink with milk, soda water, and either vanilla or chocolate syrup. Typically very popular in the Brooklyn area. A chocolate Phosphate on the other hand is chocolate syrup with acid phosphate and soda/mineral water. I opted for the phosphate as of the two, I see it even less on menus. The Chocolate Phosphate came with another glass of mineral water which is a nice gesture but really waters down the chocolate flavor as you add to the drink. =/I didn't have the coffee but my sister's bf did and he said it was really strong. This is coming from a coffee drinker with a minimum of one cup in the morning to get going for the day. He couldn't finish two cups because it got him jittery.Our waitress was cordial and got waters or coffee refilled when needed. We didn't need much besides that so service was decent.When having to pay, you have to bring you ticket back to where you waited to get in. The lady there was very cranky and looked like she didn't want to be there at all. Again, not a very welcoming place.If I ever came back, it'd be for the Belgium waffle and either the chocolate phosphate/egg cream. It's not a "omg, I have to go back again" type place though.

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: A friend of a friend gave a glowing review of this place so we thought we'd give it a try.  It sounded like another winner like Langer's.Got in at around 1 PM and was promptly seated.  I was feeling sick that day so I ordered matzo balls and their Lox plate. First, the person who greeted was very nice.  Then, our waitress approached us and asked if we were ready to order.  We asked for a few minutes.  A few minutes actually equates to a minute for her.  She came back and stood right next to us looking pissed we were not ready to order within the minute timeframe she allotted.  Eh.  We sent her back saying, we're still not done looking at the menu.  All throughout our meal she had that bored, get me out of this place look.  I understand that she's tired and she wants to sit but she should at least make some effort in looking friendly.  Well, that's a lie.  She did smile at us while bringing us water (finally!) with our check.  She was all smiles.  Let me tell you.  She did not get a single dime as tip.  What?!?Matzo balls - I'd give it 4 stars.  It was pretty good; really big, too.  Perfect when you're feeling sick.  It just might be my taste buds but I had to add salt and pepper.  I blame it on my being sick.The lox took 30 min to come out.  No joke.  Good thing I had the matzo balls or I would've been grumpy from hunger.  Now I had high expectations because of the lox I got from Langer's.  Well. Silly me.  Of course this is a different place.The platter was really big.  Different cuts and slices of lox, white fish and smoked salmon.  And holy moly.  Is that the head of a fish?  Look, I love fish.  Sashimi, mojarra frita.. Name it.  But there was just something off about presenting lox with the head of a fish.  Yeah, it was right there next to the onions, tomato, cream cheese and 2 bagels.  Geez.  And to make things worse, it was nowhere near the lox we had at Langers.  Maybe we should've stuck to their pastrami sandwich or something.  That was a complete waste of $45.Fried pancakes on the side were okay.  You have the option to put applesauce on it.  Well, at least they validate for parking.  I took a good look around coz I sure am not going back.

Reviews.Author: Derek K.
Reviews.Content: Serving classic, Jewish deli-style food, the now legendary Canter's Deli has been in business since 1931. It's been nearly 2 years since I moved to LA, and because I had yet to come here, my thoroughly LA-acquainted buddy thought it prudent to bring me.They do have quite a bit to choose from on the menu, but their claim to fame is their Pastrami on Rye. Although I'm not typically a fan of rye bread, I felt a pressing obligation to order it as is, and I must say I was pleasantly satisfied. The meat is towering, and is seasoned with simplicity yet charm. The bread is fresh, the rye seeds contrasting nicely with the saltiness of the meat. I loaded it with deli mustard, sealing its destiny.Fulfilling our pastrami obligation, we additionally ordered a reuben sandwich to share, which comes with corned beef on pressed rye, further adorned with swiss cheese, sauerkraut, and Russian sauce. As far as taste, I personally felt the reuben overpowered the plainer (and slightly drier) pastrami. The meat was more moist, and the cheese-kraut-beef made for a nice trifecta. Still glad I tried them both, though.The fries were thick and potato-ey; the cole slaw was good, just a tick above average.We closed with some chocolate chip rugula and a black & white cookie, both of which were excellent texture- and taste-wise, and wafting with deli freshness.The table next to us ordered a Matzah Ball Soup, which looked humongous. I could only taste it with my eyes, but I made a mental note to order it next time.Service is great. Parking's a synch. Open 24 hours. Don't forget that in addition to their famous pastrami, they also have a great selection of desserts and deli foods, making this more than just a tourist spot you try once. The variety means you can come back for more and more and enjoy yourself each time.I give the famous pastrami sandwich itself 4 stars, but add to that the historic charm and variety of deli desserts, as well as 24-hour availability, I give the full experience 4.75 stars. Bottom line: Canter's puts the deli in delicious.Recommended Dish: Get the pastrami, but if you can, split it and a corned beef with a friend. And make sure you pick up some deli baked desserts!

Reviews.Author: Lionel L.
Reviews.Content: Classic deli food with tons of menu items, how could you not love this LA icon?  With over 1,000 reviews, just had to add my two cents and give it the 5 star with thumbs up!Open 24 hours, cannot be beat!

Reviews.Author: Matthew H.
Reviews.Content: My first time at Canter's was a pleasant experience. I had the deli omelette with potato cakes and toast. I also checked in on yelp and got free chocolate chip rugula.The portions were great and the price was reasonable for around $10. FREE PARKING!!!  Always a plus. I took off one star for the staff. The waitress was very inattentive and some bus boy walked up to our table to tell us that he is the king of latinos in LA. It was very awkward.

Reviews.Author: Dan W.
Reviews.Content: I either come here for three things....Cheese omelet with steak fries and bagel and cream cheeseSome sort of deli sandwich (all are good)Matzah ball/Mishmosh soup.It depends on my mood, but have never been dissapointed. It may seem expensive for just a single sandwich, but it is high quality, and you will invariably have enough for lunch the next day.After that, taking a hamentashin (sp?) or something else from the bakery area is a way to make people who couldn't come feel not as bad. Their loss, but whatever, karma and all that crap

Reviews.Author: Brandon C.
Reviews.Content: Great classic deli. The pastrami is superb, and their lox is pretty good too. They have free parking in a lot ~50' down the street, which is always nice in LA. Huge selection of about every dessert and baked good you could imagine, and all the deli staples. Is open 24/7, so is a good place to go after catching a show or after an all-nighter of studying.

Reviews.Author: M C.
Reviews.Content: I love places like this where you can feel the history and age of a place. It's definitely not the fanciest place, and the service isn't the best, but its homey vibe is a refreshing break from LA.The Little New Yorker, their version of a bagel and lox, was a great, late night alternative. It was refreshing and filling but not heavy in the weigh-you-down kind of way. All the ingredients came together beautifully. I could taste the lox, the cream cheese melded into it without overloading it, and the saltiness of the capers finished it off. The onion roll was dense but soft. Pickles were weird the day I went.

Reviews.Author: Ken T.
Reviews.Content: This Place ,The sandwich With Soup,is Very Good,They are Known to Have  Good Quality food.A very Satisfy Roofer,Having a Long Lunch Enjoying this great Tasting Place.Recommend you Try this Place, From a Roofer, K.S.T. Ken Tasaka

Reviews.Author: Alex V.
Reviews.Content: I was there at 5 in the morning. There was a group of 3-4 people and one server. Server didn't really care about serving me, the sandwich was sitting on the counter (I don't know how that thing is called where they put ready food before bringing to customers) for 5-7 minutes, after that cook went to call her and she brought it. I would take it by myself if I knew that's my sandwich, but I wasn't sure, that's why I was waiting. Btw pastrami sandwich was excellent. This is great place and I'll be there again, and there are handful of such great restaurants with culture, history, vibes, etc., so don't get me wrong, this is just review for bad service at that particular early morning visit.

Reviews.Author: Jesse T.
Reviews.Content: Brought yet another canter's virgin.  Gotta love the kitsch here.  While eating, Ron Jeremy and his entourage arrived.  I know we weren't the only one's who recognized him, but as usual, celebrities get respect and their space....and again we have yet another fan of Canter's who is thinking of excuses of why to be in the area.

Reviews.Author: Pancho V.
Reviews.Content: Great place to nosh on authentic Jewish deli food - USA TodayThe Best Sandwiches in America - Esquire MagazineI could go on and on how so many people rave about this place, any Jews that might be reading this... Imma put them on blast! Canters is much like Pink's, an LA landmark been around for years! people come from all over the country/world to come eat here BUT that doesn't make them "The Best" on a positive they are open Open 24 hours and only closed on Jewish Holidays, Oy Vey Ordered Nosh ToGo and ate at a park in the area....Turkey Reuben (($14.50)) yelp.com/biz_photos/cant… Oven Roasted Turkey, Swiss Cheese, Sauerkraut, Russian Dressing on Grilled Rye... served with French Fries and a Pickle. They do give you plenty of meat and it was good, my complaints are everything was PILED towards the middle so when they cut the sandwich in half "IT L@@KS BIGGER" than it really is yelp.com/biz_photos/cant… yeah that looks good! but after two bites I had NO more "Sauerkraut or Russian Dressing" it was just a small pile right in the center of the sandwich yelp.com/biz_photos/cant… where's the Kraut and Dressing? If this was a ($7.00) Sandwich I wouldn't really complain BUT ((($14.50))) Bupkes 2-StarsFries - yelp.com/biz_photos/cant… Cooked nicely but "Naked Potatos" C'Mon guys a little salt goes a long way.... "SEASONING"My Wife has been craving Matzo Ball Soup, don't ask my why... something I've never had before today, might be the last!Matzo Ball Soup ($6.75) yelp.com/biz_photos/cant… ToGo orders they do pack the ball and broth in separate containers, nice.... *Now I'm NO authority on Matzo Ball Soup! but the Ball was just some "Bland Dough Thing" and the broth was like a weak chicken base? you Jew's call this.... Jewish Penicillin? I'll stick with the traditional Pill form!  Feh! 1-StarPickle - yelp.com/biz_photos/cant… Now I don't know if this is supposed to be Dill or Kosher or if theirs such a thing as Kosher Dill? but just something else that was seriously lacking flavor.    Other than the Turkey itself, the only other thing that was good was the Cole SlawCole Slaw ($?) yelp.com/biz_photos/cant… I'm picky about what Cole slaw I like and I will say this was good! 4-StarsIn parting I leave you with One Word: LANGERS

Reviews.Author: Robert K.
Reviews.Content: I went there for lunch in fairfax area.Love the pastrami sandwich. The meat was lean and not greasy, But that was the only good thing to write about, the cole slaw was too sweet and pickle had a bitter nasty after taste !Even thou they have lot in the front,  Parking really sucks at lunch time and be prepare to wait a good 20 minutes or so.

Reviews.Author: Jon A.
Reviews.Content: I equate sinking my teeth into the rye, then the pastrami, then the mustard, then more rye at Canter's in LA between the hours of 9pm and 9am with the way I'm sure some reach summits on some lonely mountain or the way others reach different levels on Donkey Kong or whatever seance you prescribe to.The creak of the rubbery leather when you slide in. The clink of the linoleum table from the clack of the metal corners on the menus. The odd yellow hue. The consideration of the kibbutz room. The sighting of Leo Dicaprio in a velour track suit back in 2002 buying some cookies. Canter's is extremely well-known. It's seen everywhere. It was just in Mad Men. However, eventually, most of LA's greats will be seen somewhere at some point, over hyped on Yelp, over hyped in whateversaphere, but ultimately it comes down to: that neon yellow glow, the quietness of Fairfax in the middle of the night, and when you bite into a sandwich like their Fresser you know that you're incredibly jealous LA has so many damn good Jewish delis compared to your slump of a town's Jewish deli options (Hi San Francisco). Also, if you like to avoid the scene, order it to go. In fact. I recommend it.  Always remember the mustard. And, get a cookie.

Reviews.Author: Crystal L.
Reviews.Content: God, please grant me the strength to never ever buy a Groupon deal for this place again.Look, it's an institution.  But that's probably because the food is like, institutional food.  The service is generally bad - the men seem to be better, the women servers will let you starve.  Came there on a Saturday morning for brunch and although it was BRUNCH in a WeHo adjacent area, the bar was locked up, so we couldn't get a Mimosa or Bloody although they are both on the menu.  Whatever, we moved on.  Ordered breakfast from the specials menu.  It was cheap. It was not good.   My cheese omelet was like melted goo.  Her eggs were so undercooked I felt sick just looking at them.  Coffee was decent.  There is no WiFi but they do have phone jacks in the walls (ok, what?  For my AOL or Compuserve account?)We paid and were then told that the Groupon didn't work for the breakfast special menu.  Of course, it says that nowhere on the menu or the Groupon.  Again, whatever...  just let me out of here.  Yes, you can park for free in their lot.  So that and a halfway decent cup of coffee gets you two stars.  Seriously, I've done this place and I'm never going back again (great Fleetwood Mac song).

Reviews.Author: Wade E.
Reviews.Content: I call this place "Ol' Reliable" because you can always go in and get something decent to eat.  They remember you from your first visit on, and actually act like they like to have you as a customer.  "Most other restaurants in this city, take a lesson from Canter's!"

Reviews.Author: Suzi M.
Reviews.Content: I am serious about this. I lived in Los Angeles 24 years ago. Moved back to my native Portland, OR (currently the little foodie-darling capital of the world) and never thought I'd ever be in LA again this life time. However, here I am, unexpectedly -- on business -- and I am visiting all of my old food haunts. Basic bare bones truth: Canter's simply R O C K S !!! Anybody who comes into Canters and complains, or leaves less than 4 stars, is clueless. My review will probably not make it past the Yelp editors, and so be it. Truth is truth. If you dis Canters, you are a clueless moron. Thank you.

Reviews.Author: Puzant C.
Reviews.Content: 2014 YELP 365 CHALLENGE - 117/365I always have a good experience at Canter's Deli. They have an extensive menu so I try to have something new every time. Love their pastrami sandwich. Tried breakfast once, and it wasn't bad either. Their desserts are amazing too. Customer service is a hit or a miss depending on the night but I really like this place, can't complain.

Reviews.Author: Richie W.
Reviews.Content: I only goto jewish delis for mazzo ball soup and pastrami.  Been coming here for quite a while, although to be fair, it's been 7 years since my revisit (and what this review is based on).  Unfortunately, Canter's has to compete with Langer's in my book now.... even though the Canter's hours are way better.  The pastrami is actually decent, and cheaper than Langers, which is why I'm still generously rating it.   Can't go wrong!  Anywhere opened 24 hours gets a bonus star when it meets this level of competency.  Their reputation for being an LA institution is well well deserved.  Not to mention I get nostalgic about my college summers partying all night and coming here for some food after.

Reviews.Author: Bill S.
Reviews.Content: Give me a good Jewish Deli that's been around for over 80 years and I know exactly what to expect :* An extensive menu filled with hearty, fresh and delicious options.* An "old School" vibe from the decor to the staff. ( this is not to imply bad service, but good service based on many years of experience )* An eclectic clientele, consisting of "hipsters", regular folks, and obvious loyalists that have been coming here since they opened.After your first visit here, it's easy to see how this place has lasted the test-of-time, and I'm guessing will continue to thrive.

Reviews.Author: Andrew S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for my sister's birthday dinner.  Had a solid dinner and a happy birthday sing.  Rockin' bar kicked up in the later hours of the evening.  Makes it great for people walking...- Solid Chopped Liver- Pastrami is not bad... not the best I've had, which is definitely either 2nd Ave Deli or Katz' in NYC, but hit the spot.- Rye bread was pretty baller- Really tasty potato salad and cole slaw- Baked goods are tasty.Very friendly staff and overall great experience for a late bite (they are open 24 hours a day) after a movie down the street.

Reviews.Author: Emma W.
Reviews.Content: Went back to Canter's again last night with my family. I have given them another star, mostly because of the Kibitz room.We ate dinner there this time, so I got a better feel for the place. Overall I was content with my food, and the service was ok. Nothing memorable.After dinner I stepped into the Kibitz room where a band was playing. That was pretty sweet.I guess there was some confusion and a very rude employee again last night, but not the same one from the last time. Canter's just really needs to work on their customer service and I think the whole experience would be significantly better.

Reviews.Author: I G.
Reviews.Content: Let's set the record straight. Canter's is a great, old-school Jewish style deli. They are open 24 hours a day. You walk inside, and its like you're walking into the 1950s. The sandwiches are amazing -- I had the Brooklyn Ave (pastrami, coleslaw, russian dressing) with a side of potato salad and pickles. Canter's is the real deal. It might get busy during rush time, but what popular place doesn't? This is an LA staple. Enjoy the food, enjoy the ambience. One day, it might be gone, and you can say "I ate at the famous Canters Deli."

Reviews.Author: George Z.
Reviews.Content: "It ain't what it used to be"Went on a Sunday for takeout ... corn beef sandwich and a chopped chicken liver sandwich.  Also bought 2 bear claws, 2 hamantaschen and a loaf of rye bread.  Yuk.  The corn beef was dry.  The chopped chicken liver had beef in it. The bear claws were doughy.  Tossed the remaining claw away The hamantaschen was stale and dry. Tossed the remaining one away.N/A = never again

Reviews.Author: Ariel C.
Reviews.Content: Service here was decent and the food was alright. I had their submarine sandwich and we ordered matzo ball soup to go. The matzo ball soup with chicken was only two big matzo balls and some chicken. There's no veggies in it at all. The potato salad had a bit of a sweet taste to it.I'll give it another go and try one of their signature sandwiches.

Reviews.Author: Daisy C.
Reviews.Content: Venue:There is both street parking and a private parking lot (make sure that you get validated)The miracle mile location is huge ! It has tables and booths, no outdoor seating. There is an upstairs and a downstairs. When you walk in, you will find the bakery counter, which is stacked with pastries, candies, and breads. As you make your way to the heart of the building there are plenty of tables and booths for seating. This is definitely a place that could use some updating, but for some reason I believe that updating would make it lose that certain je ne sais quoi.Food: Looking for some deli style comfort food. This is the place to go. The menu is endless here- sandwiches, soups, salads, fries, Jewish cuisine, American cuisine, pasta, etc. I love getting the grilled veggie sandwich, with homemade chips, and pickles (YUM!)You will get hefty portions and you will leave full. Service:The staff is always friendly and very attentive. Despite the abundant menu, they seem to know the menu well and are always able to provide their personal opinion on the dish, when asked.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay C.
Reviews.Content: OK it's taken me awhile to write this review because I love it THAT MUCH. This LA/Hollywood institution has a firm grasp on my heartstrings and I don't really ever care to get free. Here's a breakdown (best I can do) of why:Parking:-free parking. If you're nice, sometimes the guy will park it for you. Tip him.Ambiance:-Americana diner/Jewish Deli, has hosted tons of folks over the years, from Guns 'n' Roses to the next up and coming band, comedian, actor, etc.-Open 24/7-little to no wait for seating-comfortable seating from a table of one to large groups (tables, booths, bar)-busy, bustling environment that doesn't interfere with the personal experienceStaff:-eight million stars for this one: Fale, the best waitress that has ever existed. I always get treated like a dear friend and I tip her like I'm a millionaire (I'm not). I could go on about her for hours.-everyone else is just fine too: to-the-point and efficient while maintaining a polite aire.Food:-a million stars for these dishes: blintzes with sour cream and strawberry sauce, pastrami eggs benedict on an english muffin, bacon, fresh fruit.-bakery offerings you must try: bagels (duh) and chocolate chip rugelach (Fale's favorite parting gift for me).I can't for the life of me rationalize how people could have a negative experience here. I live in Arizona, travel to Hollywood every couple of months and these people remember me each time. They know where I want to sit, what I'm going to order. Maybe it's because I pay each person the respect they deserve, give them a little smile and make their day a little brighter. Canter's is quite simply, the cornerstone of a happy day in Hollywood to me. Long live Canter's! Seriously, don't ever close. xx

Reviews.Author: Joey J.
Reviews.Content: There can be only one. The mother of all Jewish delis, with a long history of serving fine food to Los Angeles since 1931. In with the out crowd, it's open all night and attracts everything from Hollywood power players to the down and out of Beverly Hills. Unlike its closest rival Nate 'n' Al's, Canter's has its own parking lot, free with validation. My favorite fish is the matzoh brie, just like my grandmother used to make. There is never a bad time to pop in for a bite at Canter's.

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: The sandwich I ordered was good, but I thought it was a little pricey, like $4 too much.There's parking on the south/west side of Fairfax and there's tons of seating.It's 24 hours AND breakfast is served all day.

Reviews.Author: Greg N.
Reviews.Content: It's been a long time since my gigging days, used to go to Canter's after playing for a great, late-night feast.Went here yesterday and had the Brooklyn Ave sandwich...soooooooo good!  I've missed you, Canters!

Reviews.Author: Suzie Q.
Reviews.Content: Suzie Q's Fun Facts:Canter's Deli is famous not only for its pastrami, but for its Kibitz Room, which features nightly live music and comedy and has seen several now-famous bands/ musicians pass through its doors, including Guns N' Roses, The Wallflowers and Fiona Apple. =~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~The corned beef is paper-dry. The matzo ball floating in the soup is as big as your head, but if you want bagel chips with your soup, you're out of luck. The restaurant's trademark pickles never made it to our table of ten. Our waitress, and the decor, dated from approximately 1962. So, yeah..... haute cuisine this is not. But the chocolate martini.... wow, is it the deal of the century. Suggestion: Order one and share it with a friend. You think you're getting a petite martini in its sundae-like old-fashioned glass, but then you see the *entirely extra* mini carafe of the stuff. And let's not forget the generous plate of chocolate-covered lace cookies that unexpectedly arrived with my drink, prompting me to eat dessert first. While Canter's wouldn't recognize a food trend if it bit it in the knish, there's something comforting about dining at a restaurant with the approximate vintage of your grandparents.

Reviews.Author: Kelly R.
Reviews.Content: Formerly a strict vegetarian, Canter's broke me of my aversion to meat. It was the pastrami!!In all seriousness, I've been coming here at least 20 years, my mom introduced me to this fantastic deli.Whether it's 1am, 5am, or normal meal hours; the food is fabulous!  Service is always stellar!!  If I'm here with friends, or dining solo (sitting at the counter) Canter's is always a great experience with delicious food!!

Reviews.Author: Em P.
Reviews.Content: We stopped in for breakfast which i'd say was just mediocre. Service was horrible. The servers were all standing and gabbing as we sat there and stared at them to get drinks and then for the check. Wishing i would have grabbed a sandwich from here instead cause the smells from the deli were just divine. Its very old and outdated but i guess thats part of the charm (and history).

Reviews.Author: Veronica C.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite Jewish deli's in L.A. when its very famous. The food is fresh and delicious. It's open 24 hours so if you get hungry late at night wanting a 2nd dinner or midnight snack you can come here.  When I feel like having corned beef or pastrami sandwiches and Matzo Ball soup with noodles and keplache this is where I go. The matzo ball soup bowl is filling with a huge matzo ball you'll feel full unless you have a huge appetite order 1/2 of a sandwich with the potato salad or coleslaw.                   Maybe even order a side of potato pancakes with apple sauce and sour cream if you want to go all out on a Jewish traditional meal. They don't skimp on pastrami or corned beef here when it comes piled high that even when you take a bite into the sandwich the meat falls out. They have lots of pastries and sweet treats at the bakery. There are so many selections that you won't know what to buy when its all deliciously satisfying to your sweet cravings. Got to try this hidden gem in L.A. when you'll come back for more Jewish deli food again and again.

Reviews.Author: Albert M.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. The employees make sure you have a great time and you can not go wrong with the pastrami or corned beef. Try and save some room for some cheesecake on the way out.

Reviews.Author: Becca D.
Reviews.Content: My pops used to take us as kids and now I bring my son to Canters whenever we're in the area! The sandwiches are tasty and filling, the coleslaw is refreshingly yummy, and the chicken noodle soup is perfectly comforting and tasty on a cool day! Call me crazy but the flavor combination of there pickles with a sip of coke is amazing! PS...the sandwiches are large enough for two! Just make sure you get an extra side of coleslaw!

Reviews.Author: Annie D.
Reviews.Content: I'm giving Canter's a 5 for many reasons and not all food related. Yes, I love the food. The matzoh ball soup, bagels, potato pancakes, sandwiches and rugulah make me a happy girl. I love the kitsch factor. The ceiling lit up with leaves that makes the room very yellow. The 50's looking plates on the walls in the room "upstairs" and the light fixtures. Really just 3 or 4 steps. I love the glass display case behind the counter in the main room with jello and fruit in dessert cups. I love the older servers who have an attitude and then call you honey. I love how they love guns and roses. When I come here I want to drink White Russians and eat cookies. Anytime of day it's awesome. I've probably been here over the years at almost every hour of the day and night and Canter's at 3 in the morning is a pretty trippy place to be. Especially after a night of partying but I guarantee that if you have the Matzoh Ball soup your hangover will be cut in at least half the next day. They have a traditional to go deli where you can buy knishes, kugles, salads, cold cuts and salads. I think you can even get a bottle of manischvitz. But, the best, most favorite part is the memories I have as a kid. My entire childhood of coming here with my grandmother all the time and going to the bakery. The smell when I'd first come in and the anticipation of picking out whatever cookies I wanted. That was the best. Leaving with my sample that the women would give me and the pink canters box made my day. Thank you Canter's for being you and not changing what works. You do what you do well. Love the 7 and 37 year old me.

Reviews.Author: randi i.
Reviews.Content: What can I say but that this place is awesome!! It's real old school right down to the register and the written receipts.  I've been here several times and the food is always SO good!!  It's a favorite go to spot after work to grab some dinner with coworkers.  I also like going after the club or the morning after the club for that really nice hangover breakfast!! yum!! haha.   Definitely try the pickles! They are free like bread sticks and you wont regret getting them because they are pickled fresh at Canters! If your lucky you'll also spot a celebrity or to.  P.S.  I love that it's open 24 hours a day!

Reviews.Author: Erika J.
Reviews.Content: Let me start with,I LOVE Canter's and always have. The food is delicious and the deli is phenomenal! I'm writing this review because of my last experience there and I feel it should be made public. A friend of mine and I went and were sat in the middle section where there are 6 booths and when it's slow usually assigned to one waitress.When we were seated, the waitress Gina was helping the booth in front of us and the booth across from us was also occupied with delightful seniors finishing their evening. Gina finished with the table in front of us, turned to the table of seniors and asked if they needed anything else. She didn't look at us or in any way acknowledge us. About 6-8 minutes later (of being completely ignored), the section started to fill and another couple was seated diagonally from us, she attended to them and got them beverages and took their orders. (We still couldn't get her attention or any service) Two more groups were seated and attended to. Finally, Brian (I believe was his name) came to our booth and began taking our order. I expressed to him that Gina didn't in any way acknowledge we were sitting there and served THREE other booths that arrived quite a bit after we did. He said that he was there now to assist, which I thanked and acknowledged him for but that I was very displeased with being outright ignored. We wouldn't have gotten water if it had not been for the bus boy we were able to flag down. Ultimately, I don't know if Gina was just having a bad day, or disliked serving mixed race tables. It was wrong and could have been handled in a more professional manner. She easily could have said, "Another server will be with you shortly" as soon as we were seated instead of just out right ignoring a table in her section. Little does she know, my friends and I are wonderful tippers.Canter's I love you and always have. This review is not for food or the wonderful history and great times I've had here. This review is for outlandishly rude waitress you have on staff.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer Q.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Sunday night to meet up with a friend at the bar (in the back of the restaurant) and had a grand ole' time!  The live music was my FAVORITE - love this bar aspect - wish more bars in the area followed this format.  It wasn't too busy and my friend is a regular there; we were able to get a booth for just us two.  Drinks were served fast and everyone seemed happy to be there.  A lot of the musicians came to support one another which I find refreshing esp for it being "Hollywood".  Overall, I find this place charming and a good escape from all the popular bars in the area. I'll definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Frannie P.
Reviews.Content: Park in the lot just ahead and get 1.5 hours free parking if you dine in the restaurant.Matzah ball soup was average. Not bad, not incredible. But holy cow, the corned beef and pastrami really are extraordinary. Service was attentive. Prices seemed a little steep. As another reviewer mentioned, the kitsch factor is great and it's still clean. The restrooms could definitely use a remodel, however!Wasn't able to sample any baked goodies on this trip but my mom has fond memories of their cookies and breads.

Reviews.Author: Eric B.
Reviews.Content: I had a great maiden voyage with Canter's. I went to Langer's a couple years ago when I heard about the great Jewish deli tradition in LA and was pleased, so I decided to make it a point to try the equally important historical delis in the area.The decor and vibe is as cool as it gets. Old school NY deli vibe, but with a diner flare that only the west coast can provide (since we have more physical space). It's important to note that this old school vibe is not tacky, nor is it like walking into a dusty mausoleum. The place is not old, rather, it is classic, meaning they have faithfully preserved the fundamental character of the place, while still maintaining a modern restaurant.Food: The pickles are spot on. Crisp with just the right amount of spice. I had the Brooklyn ave. w/ corned beef and potato salad, while my guest had a pastrami Reuben w/ fries. My sandwich hit all the right notes---corned beef, slaw, Russian dressing, Jewish rye. I had a couple bites of the Reuben and was equally as pleased. The potato salad has an interesting sweet side to it that contrasts really well with the smoke of the meat and bite of the dressing and pickles. The only thing I am sad about, is not being able to take advantage of the bakery. There are some amazing looking things in that cabinet.

Reviews.Author: Rick L.
Reviews.Content: What is this Beverly Grove nonsense.This is Canter's This is Fairfax!Since 1931 this is Canter'sKishka, knish, brown gravy, grilled Swiss cheese sandwich with tomatoes and a baked apple.OrBlueberry blintzes and matzah ball soup, OrPastrami on rye, coleslaw and a pastry from the counter.This is Canter's

Reviews.Author: Jayde Y.
Reviews.Content: I went to Canter's again. I sometimes get a strong craving for a good cup of soup and salad. This time, I could not resist my craving for Matzo ball soup. Matzo ball soup at Canter's was super delicious. The matzo ball was huge. It's about the size of my fist!  Potato salad also stays #1. No need to explain why. You just have to eat it. No one makes Potato salad like Canter's. They are always open when i need  soup. The service is always good. Thanks, Canter's. i will be back again.

Reviews.Author: Lucy H.
Reviews.Content: This past weekend was my first time eating an entire  Pastrami Sandwich. At this location I try the "Brooklyn Ave".. First off Im a fan of Cole slaw, so u must at least like cole slaw cause they serve you a good amount. The meat was DELICIOUS!!.. it literally melts in your mouth and you can taste the flavors. Im in LuvI will def be back for the Reuben.Some may say the price is a bit high, but for the quality of the food, its fair.

Reviews.Author: Antoinette G.
Reviews.Content: The sweet treats were great, but not so sweet to have my kids jumping off walls forever. Restrooms are clean, but you have to climb a bunch of stairs to get to there. The sandwiches all look great and as fresh as fresh gets. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Lisa W.
Reviews.Content: We love Canter's!  Everything we've ever had is made fresh and it's all oh, so good!!!  Lox, bagel and cream cheese with extra capers is my favorite nosh.

Reviews.Author: Missy G.
Reviews.Content: Went to two delis in NYC and neither could hold a candle to this one! Best deli I have ever been to. The only one that could be in the same boat as this is Lenny's. This had the best ruben, potato salad, and salami my hubby and I ever had.I have also eaten at wonderful deli's in south florida, but still not anywhere as good as this. On top of that, we had a wonderful server. I wish I could remember her name. The hostess was also very sweet.We cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Author: Franklin M.
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of old school restaurants. We ordered a Brooklyn and shared it, it was really good but next time I will have the bread toasted. The Brooklyn and a slice of carrot cake set us back $18, plus added a tip. The workers here are very nice and in good spirits.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia L.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Everything on the menu is amazing. The Brooklyn pastrami sandwich is my favorite.

Reviews.Author: Phil W.
Reviews.Content: Canters is by far my favorite breakfast spot and one of my favorite lunch places as well.  And it's much more than that as it's bakery is unmatched and the Kibitz room feels like the bar at the end of the universe.  So it's great for late night as well.I have basically 2 questions about any breakfast place:1) Do they serve lox, eggs and onions?2) Do they still serve whole milk?Canters answers yes to both.  Hilariously Denny's and IHOP out here have stopped serving whole milk.  Thus they've stopped serving me.Back to Canters. It's identity is so different from Greenblatts that I'm able to love them both without comparing them.  The menu has loads of choices, and you can always order cookies or danish to go with.  Btw, try the warned up cheese danish with butter.  It sits well atop locks eggs and onions.For lunch I like the Little New Yorker, which is lox and bagel with the trimmings.For dinner and late night I order lunch or breakfast stuff, though you might find other stuff on the menu you dig.  It's all good, G's.The Kibitz room sometimes has music.  If you find yourself there, your having fun.  And what more can you ask from a place but good food and fun?  So check it out.

Reviews.Author: Bret W.
Reviews.Content: Okay, I acquiesce... New York has the most fine-a** delis in the nation.  But being a California native and living in L.A. for the last twenty years, I've been to a bunch of delis here and Canter's is my favorite.  They have been a Los Angeles institution since 1931 and for good reason: great-tasting, huge-portions and the best "salty waitresses" this side of the Mississippi.  The restaurant itself is huge with tons of tables for the inevitable late-night crowds and a separate bar area.  The menu is like a thick encyclopedia about deli food.  Anyone can find something they like in the dozens & dozens of items on their menu.  Prices are reasonable and you will almost for sure wanna come back.

Reviews.Author: Gerry B.
Reviews.Content: My friend wanted to try a deli restaurant that was featured in the show `Mad Men'. Sandwichs was good with no distinctive flavor. Decor was cool and take you back in time.

Reviews.Author: Sal P.
Reviews.Content: Service: 5 StarsFood: 4 StarsWe finally made it here after wanting to eat here for so many years. We were seated in less than 2 minutes. We were greeted by our server Kimmie. We started off with some potato cakes. They were PERFECT! We got some of the complimentary pickles which were perfect as well. We also had a side of chili fries. At the table we ordered a Philly Cheesesteak, turkey burger, and 2 pastrami reubens. The cheesesteak was decent. Not that impressive but not bad. The turkey burger was pretty standard. The pastrami reubens were incredible. Cooked perfectly and probably the best I've had. The french fries were good. They serve thick steak fries. The chili fries were probably in the top 5 I've ever had. They were incredible. We finished the meal off by sharing a strawberry cheesecake. This was one of the best cheesecakes I remember having. Huge strawberries on top in a delicious syrup. Now, don't forget to check in. We received a nice sized order of chocolate pastries for FREE for checking in. This place is as good as the hype in my opinion. We will return here very soon.

Reviews.Author: Frankie L.
Reviews.Content: Canter's had something for everyone! While I had a 3 egg Denver omelette my bf had turkey & dressing. Both dishes were excellent! Mac & Cheese was best I ever tasted even NY. Coffee brewed strong. Service was excellent by Debbie. Has bar in back and after lunch we went shopping and then stopped back by in for very inexpensive drinks but it was also noon so might have been happy hour. The nostalgic decor and building are very well kept and clean, was like walking back in time. 5 stars & 2 thumbs up! Take mom and relatives there, they will love it!

Reviews.Author: Stephen G.
Reviews.Content: I can really only rate the corned beef sandwich, since I've been there five or six times, and that's the only thing I order - it's just so damned good. Perhaps next time, I'll try something else... But probably not.

Reviews.Author: Shanel S.
Reviews.Content: After debating and debating and even more debating, we accidentally stumbled upon Canter's Deli. We originally wanted The Golden State but when we walked in, we realized they didn't have very many options and we wanted options. We just didn't realize that Canter's would provide SO many!You can definitely compare this place to DZ Akins except it's not as Jewish. (I hope that's ok to say haha)So since this was a continuation of cheat meals since we were both on vacation, we decided to order anything we could read. Or at least it felt that way.We started with Chili Cheese Fries to share and they were the BOMB DIGGITY. They use the steak fries and lather it with one of the best chili's I have ever had on this side of the coast. I'm usually more of a cheese sauce person like they do at Coney Island, but their cheese melted perfectly and they were hot the entire time. I'm drooling now.Then I got the half sandwich/half soup. I wanted the Tuna Melt but they don't make it as a combo so I did the Tuna Salad sandwich instead. The tuna salad was a bit dry. It was missing something. I just can't put my finger on what it needed. Maybe mayo? Maybe mustard?I got the Matzo Ball soup with it and the ball was huge (that's what she sure did say!). And soooo delicious. My friend who isn't normally a fan of soup helped me tear it up!He got the Reuben and it was pretty damn good. Not as big as DZ Akins make them, but still pretty flavorful.Since I checked in on Yelp we got the Chocolate Chip Rugulas for free. They brought out four and they were damn good! I ate two before he was able to put them on the table.Lastly, (I know we actually ate more), we shared a Banana Split. A waitress made it earlier and basically sold one as soon as she walked by. This thing was HUGE and OMG so good. Piled high with whipped cream and delicious scoops of ice cream. Bonus: THEY HAVE PINEAPPLE SUNDAE TOPPING! Love when I can find that. We basically had to be rolled out. We definitely were hurting until the middle of the following day. Don't do what we did... haha actually... Why the hell not?

Reviews.Author: T W.
Reviews.Content: A bit overpriced for what it is. At least it's open late. For a more than $13 sandwich, I was expecting a little more. Turkey, lettuce, and bread--that's all you get. Would totally be satisfied if it were $6.

Reviews.Author: Jill A.
Reviews.Content: Every Xmas, my grandfather, a holocaust survivor, requested we go to canters for lunch. Since his passing in 1999 we've continued this tradition. Çanters service is incredible, their roast beef sandwich, pastrami sandwich, kreplach soup and pickles (grandpa's favorite) continue to wow. Canters is the epitome of hole in the wall family restaurant. You can't miss this famous family joint if you visit LA.

Reviews.Author: Robbyn A.
Reviews.Content: This place is KING!I get the Hard Salami on a Kaiser roll with cheddar cheese, mustard on the side. Potato pancakes with apple sauce if I'm feeling skinny and BBQ beans...weird I know, but damn good!Canter's has something for everyone. I might stop in this weekend. Cool thing about Canter's is they have enough traffic and don't need my business, but they  ALWAYS get my order right! I love that!Good service is something you can't beat! LOVE THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Author: Sarah P.
Reviews.Content: Hands down some of the best Deli sandwiches I've ever eaten. Let me tell you something, the sandwiches are huge and packed with your meat choices. Their service is super friendly and they just make you feel at home. The staff have no problem striking a conversation with you so you can feel more comfortable.The food is delicious, served fast, and the serving size is just ridiculous. One thing I truly like is they don't pile on sauces or coleslaw or lettuce. They give you the sandwiches plain, (except the Reubens of course) and let their meats do all the talking. And yes they do give you all the sauces if you ask. The prices are a little higher here so consider it and plan wisely. Average sandwich with side is 12-16 dollars. In my case, we go to Canters once a month with our entire family of 6. Summary; Delicious food and friendly staff. If you're ever in Los Angeles, head on down to Canters on Fairfax.

Reviews.Author: Saul G.
Reviews.Content: Review is limited to sandwiches as that is all we had. The rye bread is outstanding -- better than any I have had in New York. The pastrami is excellent. I have not had a lot of LA pastrami  so I don't have a local frame of reference (other than on pastrami burgers), but in general Langer's pastrami is moist, well seasoned, and appropriately fatty. It's not as good as Katz's, but the rye levels the playing field. The corned beef is lean but moist, also a success. I add Swiss as the menu recommends. A good sandwich as well. Unlike  the Carnegie Deli you can eat a whole sandwich here, maybe with a cup of soup. Dr. Brown's comes in bottles, not cans. Nice. Cucumber salad on the side strikes me as more Hungarian than Jewish style, but I like it. The included potato salad is good.I love the decor/vibe which is straight out of the Jewish delis of Philly and Miami Beach I remember as a child of the 70s, and next to impossible to find in either of those places these days. For me the whole place is kind of like a Proustian madeleine.

Reviews.Author: Johnny M.
Reviews.Content: I dont make it out to LA often, but when I do this is one of my favorite spots! The sandwiches, desserts, pickles... everything is great!Atmosphere: Old school dinner feel, always hustling and bustling. This is a great place to bring a group of friends and its kid friendly! Sports and music memorabilia all over the walls!Food/Drinks: The food is just awesome, NY Deli style sandwiches that will fill you up to the brim! My favorites are the Ruebens or the Fairfax (Pastrami and Corned Beef). I've tried a couple of other things such as the Matzo Ball soup, chicken sandwiches, etc. and can vouch for all of them! They make their own pickles here. Once you get past their smell they are delicious and crisp!Price: Now the prices are a little steep, but you are paying for great quality! Sandwiches range from $10-$17ish. Matzo Ball soup is around $7. So if you go you can ball park it around those prices.***TIP***After you stuff yourself full of deli sandwich goodness go over and buy a Black and White cookie... you'll thank me later.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan B.
Reviews.Content: This place hit the spot. Parking was easy because they have they're own lot, if not it would be a nightmare. We we're seated immediately and our waiter  was on point with everything. Order sweet potato fries which were delicious and the Italian salad. Everything was exceptional. The place was great!!'

Reviews.Author: Johnny V.
Reviews.Content: The food was tasteless. Service mediocre and slow. No gloves were used by the kitchen personnel. They are touching meat with their bare hands. I've ordered the eggplant parmesan sandwich and it tasted like NOTHING. Same goes for the Pastrami Dip sandwich and fries. Ketchup was best! It helped add a little taste. Too sad. We've decided to get the cheesecake. That was OK, but the crust too sweet. Our bill was $40 for two...money wasted!Perhaps time to break away from the tasteless food distributors?
Reviews.Author_Location: Marina Del Rey, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: David T.
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find good East-Coast deli-style restaurants in SoCal. But there are a handful scattered about and Canter's Deli is one of them. Come in anytime of the day or night and order from their vigorous menu - there's a lot of pages. I'm in love with their matza ball soup, simple but eagerly tasty. Add on a traditional Reuben and I'm spent. This is also a great place to people watch as some really odd characters, including deranged celebrities with entitlement issues, situate themselves in a booth for an hour or two. If you've never been to New York, start here and make your way there.

Reviews.Author: Lorena C.
Reviews.Content: It's really very mehhh. The unfortunate thing is I could see how it would have been great back in the day. Matzo Ball Soup is pretty good. The service is not so good. The sandwiches are average. It's more of an L.A. staple to visit then a great place to eat.

Reviews.Author: cassy c.
Reviews.Content: No taste, small portions, and expensive. Sherman's deli in Palm Springs is what a deli should be. Pass on Canter's.

Reviews.Author: L P.
Reviews.Content: I can never get enough of the Pastrami Rueben. Been there twice this year already and hope to go back for another with extra Russian dressing as always.And there is always the delicious pickles.

Reviews.Author: Adam C.
Reviews.Content: I love Canter's.  Been going off and on for (gulp) 20 years.  Few things have remained constant in that time, so I'm very happy that, despite the recent new menus, Canter's is much the same now as it was then.  Would never describe the food as top-of-the-line, but it's always good, and you're going for comfort food, not for a Top Chef experience.  The service is usually quick, and varies widely from friendly to NYC-indifferent, but that's part of the charm.I'd especially recommend the following dishes:Matt's Special (Roast Turkey, Cole Slaw, Russian and Munster on Grilled Rye)Potato Pancakes (They'll usually let you sub these in for fries - and you should)San Francisco Joe's Omelette Scramble (Eggs, Ground Beef, Mushrooms, Spinach and Onions)Anything with Corned Beef (Pastrami is good too, but not as good as Langer's)Track Russian chocolate coffee cakeRugelachEven though I'm eating healthier these days, I was able to enjoy a meal there recently - vegetarian vegetable soup, and a lox, eggs and onion scramble.  Delish.And, where else can you see Corey Feldman holding court with 2 or 3 young ladies?  Well, besides any dive bar in Hollywood, of course.Canter's - don't question it, don't ponder it, don't analyze it.  Just go.

Reviews.Author: Ali B.
Reviews.Content: So my family and I were in Los Angeles  yesterday and we decided to have lunch a Canter's Deli.   I ordered the " Canter's Fairfax" sandwich which included a couple of pickles on the side and  a 1/4 cup of potato salad.Nothing special about the sandwich hot corned beef and pastrami  on rye bread and that 's it.  No mayo or fresh lettuce and tomato.  Not much flavor, dry and disappointing.  According to "Diners, Dives and Drive In" sandwiches at Canter's are to die for.  The restaurant it self was dark , old fashion and boring.  The  servers were very mature aged individuals moving to and from very slowly.  However they got the job done.If u want to go someplace to eat that is fun, upbeat, energetic, exciting, full of life do not go to Canter' Deli in LA.

Reviews.Author: Stacy Y.
Reviews.Content: AWFUL, awful delivery service. I had ordered through Eat24 a sandwich and salad. 30 minutes goes by... then an hour. Called the restaurant to be told different things -- first they denied ever receiving my order, then they claimed it just  left, --no wait, they're actually right in front of your place.There's no organization, no one knows what's going on, and delivery orders are just all over the place. Does it make sense that it's been an hour and a half since ordering, and no food, and no information?_______________UPDATE: After an hour and 45 minutes, they finally came, and of course our food is cold. Not even lukewarm, just straight up cold and soggy. I never had delivered food come this cold. Oh and they forgot our salad dressing, so right now I just have a container of vegetables, no salad dressing, and a cold, soggy Mac-n-Cheese sandwich.  Seriously, do yourself a favor, save your hard-earned $30 for a salad and soggy sandwich.

Reviews.Author: S K.
Reviews.Content: I'm a Philly girl, used  to some pretty good deli's, so I was excited to try what's supposed to be the best Jewish deli in the area.But this was a HUGE disappointment. 1) At most deli's, you can either order off the menu or order a combination of items from the deli counter. At Canter's the waitress told me emphatically that I could not.I wanted a scoop of the liver pate, she insisted that in order to do that I'd have to order the entire sandwich plate. Same with the pickled tongue and gefilte fish. No substitutions, nothing from the deli.2) The gefilte fish. It was from a jar, or someone trying to imitate the worst jarred gefilte fish I've ever had. I ordered it along with the tongue dinner (the tongue was fatty, but tasty, the onion gravy with it tasted like it came from a packet).It was hard, discolored, and fishy. It's supposed to be light, gelatinous, and delicate. UGH3) The pickled herring was from a jar too. I think I buy the same brand at home, it's very similar. Decent, but nothing to write home about.4) The service. The waitress didn't even know how to say gefilte fish, looked dazed when I asked about the liver, and it went downhill from there.She told me to pay the check and she'd stamp parking. I got to the counter to pay the check, and they told me I should have brought the parking ticket up there too. The waitress never returned after that point.Needless to say, we will not be returning to or recommending this place any time in the near future, even though the items served at the deli counters looked markedly better than what was brought to our table. What we were served was not good, and not traditional Jewish food.It was like a charicature.

Reviews.Author: R. S.
Reviews.Content: I used to LOVE this place.Now  I never have to eat here again. Service was slow and there was no one on our side of the restaurant. . Food took forever. My hot pastrami wasn't hot, but it was dry and totally unremarkable. Awful bread. Latkes were dry.Prices were high for the crappy food and service. I'm a former New Yorker and I know my Jewish delis. This is a place for people who are too drunk to realize the food sux, but I hear  you can't go wrong with breakfast anytime.PS: But The Kibitz room is still the shabby chic rocker place  it always was with great drinks, hence the crappy food on the other side!

Reviews.Author: Sarah B.
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to stop in at 2am and hang out til the sun comes up.Canter's does some things really well and other not so much.First things first.They have a parking lot, 2 in fact, but there are not many spaces. Be prepared to possibly wait or circle the block looking.It's validate the first hour and a half....Seating--I have never had a problem getting a table. This place is gigantic.Service. Sometimes it's a hit, sometimes it's a miss.At least the food is consistent.My favorites here are:Kasha varnishkasbeef soupmatzoh brieRueben sandwichcheesecakechocolate egg creamOh, you noticed their matzoh ball soup didn't make the menu?That's because it's not good.Yes, you heard me. It isn't worth the 6 bucks.Greenblatt's has better matzoh ball soup.That doesn't stop me from going here.. I used to come here almost twice a week and had my birthday here 2 years in a row.Usually some bizarre celebrity sighting or better yet, a really loud dispute between a hooker and her wealthy producer john...Oh those fights are so golden.Now I might have to stop by for lunch!

Reviews.Author: Jim C.
Reviews.Content: It took what might be the worst service I've ever experienced in my adult life to come here, retrieve my Yelp password (I haven't written a review in a long, long time) just so I could share today's lunch experience at Canter's.After the food was ordered and set on the table, I noticed I was missing a plate of bacon. When I asked where it was, I was told my order was the "a la carte" version of the special I thought I ordered. Why wasn't it the special? Well, that ended at 11 am, and I didn't notice that on the menu. I mentioned to my waitress what it would have been nice if she said something when I ordered the combo.Her reply?"I just assume my customers can read."Yea. No exaggeration. No made-up lie in order to spread rumors. After she walked away, my friends said I should complain. I bit into my scrambled eggs, and they were cold. That did it for me.I asked to see the manager, and it took maybe 15 minutes until she showed. She came with a menu opened, ready to point out the hours my combo were available. I explained that it was all about her "reading" comment....and the fact my eggs were cold."Can I talk now?" she replied, coldly. She attempted to show me the menu (again), to which I replied, "who's your boss?"Turns out it's Mark Canter...or a dude named Terry. "Neither one is here right now." I got on the phone while my friends ate, called the restaurant, and immediately spoke with Mark. You know...the one who wasn't there. After I told him what just went down, he was at my table in maybe 30 seconds. And he acted appropriately. He apologized, offered free desert, removed the items from the bill...and took off some more from the bill. He also explained that our waitress had 31 years under her belt, is about to retire, and "can act that way sometimes. As can our managers."I wish this had a happy ending. As some of you may know, there's two lines as you're about to pay your bill: cash and credit. I didn't know this. I was standing back from the line maybe five feet when another manager asked me to step up and pay. And she asked if I was paying with cash or credit. I said credit, to which she said (rudely), "then get into the right line." "Um...which line?" I asked.She pointed to to signs hanging from the ceiling. "Can you read the signs?" she asked.Yea. No joke. Then Mark walked up. I told him what just happened...AFTER what I had just been though. He laughed. "That's the mother of the manager you just complained about."I told him I didn't think it was funny.I still don't.Here's an idea: travel up Fairfax to Sunset, make a left, and eat at Greenblatt's. The food is just as good -- and often times better -- and the wait staff / managers actually care about the way you're treated.

Reviews.Author: Karli P.
Reviews.Content: This place doesn't need another review, but I sure could use one!I will admit that I am fairly disappointed with my experience.I saw this place on a "Diner Paradise" special on Travel TV. I am obsessed with food shows, so I knew it had to visit on my next trip to California. The place is in need of a serious remodel, but that really is none of my concern. The service here was not memorable at all, but I would have remembered it if it was rude. I ordered the Mac N Cheese with a side of some sort of bread. The Mac n cheese was nothing special, but the bread was actually pretty good! I wanted to ask for more, but never did.I fail to understand why Yelp advertises that "vegetarians go nuts for this place" because the Mac n cheese was almost the only vegetarian thing on the menu.After dinner I decided to stop by their bakery and grab something sweet. I ordered something that look like some sort of chocolate croissant. Boy are looks deceiving! I basically bit into some sort of chocolate play dough. It was pretty disgusting. I threw it out almost immediately.Even if I lived in California, I would most likely not return.

Reviews.Author: Meilee S.
Reviews.Content: Jewish delis are dying out, but we're glad this one is still alive. Our family considers this the only place we could ever possibly eat when we come to "Jew Town".We often come here for large family brunches, but we were very happy with our service the last time we came. We don't remember the waiter's name, but his service was an example of what all waiters should do. He welcomed us, was patient, and always kept our glasses filled. Service was relatively quick (food was not too slow- after all it gets packed on a Sunday afternoon).We also got hamentashen and cheesecake. Hamentashen had dry bread, but the poppyseed center was delicious. For a better poppyseed taste, try the other bakery treat with the ingredient that they offer (can't remember that name either).My favorite dish is the corned beef reuben. My parents typically get pastrami and corned beef sandwiches.

Reviews.Author: Liz R.
Reviews.Content: First, let me explain why I gave the rating I did- 3 stars for quality of the food, 1 star for customer service=average two stars.I have been to Canters several times, but not in the past 5 years. I don't know if they are under we ownership/management or WHAT, but the quality of food had seriously slacked. In the hay days I would have rated Canter's 5-star without hesitation. I always came for the matzah ball soup. This time, the soup was barely warm and SO bland. There was no flavor to the broth at ALL. It was literally like sipping tinted water. When I used to order the soup they would have a sprig of dill as well. I saw the dill in the bowl of soup of someone sitting near me. When I asked the waitress for dill she said there was none.Ugh.The broccoli cheddar stuffed baked potato was flavorful, but very dry. Needed butter or sour cream, which I couldn't ask for because our waitress went on break and very other waitress failed to notice/acknowledge my trying to gain their attention. By the time out server came back from break, I was finished with my dry potato so there was no need to ask her.I decided to order dessert (regular cheesecake) and when it came to my table there was a dead flea stuck to the frosting. The waitress looked at it and confirmed it was a bug, apologized and offered to bring me a different piece. Thanks, but no thanks.(My BF got the Lil brisket panini (#3) and enjoyed it.)Now for the service part (aside from the lack of attention). As We approached the counter to pay, a lady was storming off shouting "THIS IS HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! What a horrible way to handle a customer!" I smiled at the counter lady and we joked about how upset the lady was.........if only I knew! I showed the lady at the counter my Groupon voucher ($20 for $45 worth of food for four) she refused to accept it.I will admit fault in that I didn't happen to notice that the voucher stated "for four". We were a party of 2.My total came to $41, meaning that still actually had $4 worth of value leftover that was not being used. The lady at the counter still refused to take my groupon since there were only 2 ppl in our party.
