I explained that I had made a mistake, but asked if it were possible to still honor it since I had 1) already paid for the groupon and could not refund it and 2) I hadn't even used the FULL value that I had paid for.The counter lady rudely told me no and made no effort to even pretend that she cared. I asked her what the problem was, being that I payed the full amount for the voucher and she simply replied "because there aren't 4 ppl". The lady standing next to her looked fed up with he coworker's attitude and sympathetic towards us.Although I did misread the terms, there was no reason for them to not honor my voucher. Especially considering they had justattempted to serve me a flea infested piece of cheesecake.If the flavorless, lukewarm matzah ball soup wasn't enough to make me never want to return, their lack of compassion and basic customer service certainly was. What a shame.

Reviews.Author: Steve M.
Reviews.Content: I've gone to Canter's on number of occasions and I can only speak in regards to their Matzah ball soup, pastrami sandwiches, and bagel with Lox. When it's time to get my Matzah on, this is my place. Canter's has a nice, old school vibe that I enjoy. The waitresses may get frazzled during the rush, but there is absolutely enough food to go around.Also, saw Pu$$y Cow perform in the Kibitz Room. A bit divey, but fun as can be!

Reviews.Author: Philip D.
Reviews.Content: Omg I fell so fat lol that was amazing !! Hands down the best food I have had in a long time .

Reviews.Author: Peter L.
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Canter's. Semi-regular customer here. If you're looking to indulge, try the meatloaf. You can even request a meatloaf sandwich, although it's not on the menu. If it's not a a cheat day for whatever diet you might (or probably should) be on, try an egg white omelette with avocado and onions. Their steak fries are amazing and so is their iced tea. Sounds odd, but if you're a tea fan, you'll get the importance. I saw a one-star review from a girl bitching about slow delivery service on New Year's Day. NEW. YEAR'S. DAY. Get a life, sweetie.  Haven't read any of the other reviews because I don't need to. Been coming here for years and I love it. There's even a parking lot which is a rarity in the area. Old school deli ambiance with great food and service. Enjoy !

Reviews.Author: Bita P.
Reviews.Content: This is a great New York deli. If you have never been here, then I recommend u trying it out. They have an extensive menu that includes what you find in a deli as well as liver and other daring choices. From the Reuben pastrami to the tuna melt, all their sandwiches are great. The barely soup is hearty and a favorite and comes with bagel chips. The hamburger buns are made fresh and the hamburger meat is very tasty. Overall it is a hearty meal in an Art Deco setting.

Reviews.Author: David O.
Reviews.Content: Been coming to this place on and off for years and its still just average. They nickel and dime you to death.; order a sandwich that comes with chips...ff you want coleslaw its a buck extra, that is fair. But then they remove the chips with the sandwich. How cheap can you be. I know ALL delis are overpriced, its there thing, but this place takes it to a new level. A much better choice is Izzy's Deli in Santa Monica, at least they give you good food at a decent ( for a deli) price.

Reviews.Author: Akiko I.
Reviews.Content: **** This is a review for pastry side ****- Locale Destination - It's on N Fairfax Ave and Oakwood Ave in West Hollywood, LA.It's located in "Fairfax district" - they have a huge Jewish community. They would love these type of establishments. All the Jewish places I've tried were like this - old fashioned, eclectic and charming atmosphere with bland foods. The time seems to stop here since they opened (I believe long long time ago). I love the classy sign outside. You feel the history. Decor is very classy (see my pics) and casual. They have a very high ceiling on the seating area.They're BIG. So they have several entrances. Bakery section on the left side of restaurant - pastries on the left, and deli on the right side. There's a sign for "Wait here for dine-in" in the middle of bakery. They have 2 huge seating areas - one in front of the sign, and the other on the right. On the far right side of restaurant, there's a very dark bar (by bathroom). It's so dark and you see only the lights from TVs... Kinda scary and too divey for me. The staff were charming. Clientele is well over 40s. 30 min free parking with the validation if you bought something at Deli. 1.5 hrs for dine in. It's hard to find a parking spot around here.Pastries: Very old fashioned. You can find all kinds of "classy" sweets here (See my pics). - Gluttony Expedition - Poppy seed Strudel : This stuffing is way too sweet and too dry. They cut the long pie for the size you want. It was $2 or so. It was pretty cheap. It's kinda like a "baklava". But I'm sorry - I'm so spoiled by Japanese pastries in Japan, which are the best in the world! One bite, I'm done. No more. - Conqueror's Deduction - Everything is very old fashioned and eclectic. Food wise, the pastries didn't click on my curiosity. I'm a hardcore foodie after all. Overly sweetened and unhealthy looking pastries won't cut it to me.  If you like something so classy or need something for your grandpa, you might like here. My curiosity about this place is sorta satisfied. I'm not a fan of Jewish food nor sweets. I'm not your clientele - I wouldn't like this type of food even if I became a grandma... I'm sorry, Canter's. Just not my ally.

Reviews.Author: K X.
Reviews.Content: Rugelach reviewHad strawberry and chocolate chipMoist, soft, fresh, buttery goodnessMust try!Will update review when I get a chance to eat here.

Reviews.Author: John P.
Reviews.Content: Love my pastrami sandwich.  Just as good as the other famous pastrami restaurant.  Our waitress was this older woman that served us with a smile.  Made our experience so much better. If you're looking a great pastrami sandwich (there are many other sandwiches too!) and loads of dessert selections (mouth-watering goodness!), Canters is the place to be.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany Y.
Reviews.Content: I've grown up going here with my mom and now it's a place I go with friends. I now appreciate that it's 24 Hrs for late night cravings. My go to is a Corned Beef Sandwich and Matzah Ball Soup. It gives me the warm fuzzies inside! They pack their sandwiches to the max so it's worth the money. Their Pastrami Sandwich is a close 2nd for me. This place will always be a neighborhood staple for me and parking is always easy in their lot.

Reviews.Author: Vince H.
Reviews.Content: Came here Sunday night with kids to pick-up a few deserts from the bakery for the ride back home. Not a huge selection but enough to cause some tough choices.  We got a great cheese danish, apple turnover & a few cupcakes.All & all pretty good but I was expecting something out of this world.  Regardless, we'll definnately be back for a deli lunch down the road.

Reviews.Author: Jason B.
Reviews.Content: Canters is by far my favorite deli in LA.My favorite thing there is my own creation. Downtown Brooklyn. Pastrami and smoked turkey on rye with swiss and Russian dressing. mmmm So good! Also, depending on who is your server, they made one hell of a milk shake.The service has gotten better in the past 10 years or so. Back in the day when you went to Canters, the average age of the servers was like 85. Now its only like 50 heheh. All kidding aside, if I want deli its Canters or nothing. Makes Jerrys look like Arbys.

Reviews.Author: Alan D.
Reviews.Content: Pastrami. Pastrami.See, I'm from Northern California.. erm, NorCal as we strangely refer to ourselves as. And I'll admit, we REALLY don't know how good pastrami is. You see, here in the Bay Area, we get our pastrami from Subways... Togo's... y'know... Quizzno's...So imagine my surprise when I went to SoCal this past weekend for a proposal to hear about the legendary Pastrami Sandwich at Canter's. It was probably 11PM, really late, and in this neighborhood in LA that I thought I'd be shot in. The streets were lit up by people blowing their cigarette smoke in my face, and by people yapping at random people. I initially thought that the sandwich wasn't worth it -- I was drunk, hungry, and my contacts were getting dry. But my cousin BEGGED us to try it; I love family to death so I had to believe her and press on.Thanks Cousin.This place is themed as if you're in the 50's. The walls are lined up with discs, there is live music blasting in the next room, and everything is beige or tanned. I felt as if I needed to wear bell bottom pants. I felt as if I was in a Quentin Tarantino film, I FELT as if I was living in another time. It was amazing, fun, and full of life at the dawn of midnight. My buzz was wearing off, and the waiter brought us a plate of pickles... UNFFFFFFFFFFF. I looked at their extensive menu but it didn't matter. Pastrami it is, and pastrami it was.This sandwich came out in blazing glory. The steak fries that accompanied the sandwich was absolutely fantastic and it fit right in with the theme of this restaurant. The sandwich itself, oh God. Oh Jesus Christ. The... HOW DO I EXPLAIN THIS?!?!?! Other than saying my tastebuds were jizzing with happiness, how do I say I loved every bite? Every finger-licking moment of this goddamned sandwich. No put away your fork and knife you evil son of a bitch, you earned this sandwich and you will eat it with your hands! You will foam at the mouth and you will probably go home happier than you should. Make love to your husband or wife after this affair, it won't feel the same. Yeah, that's right, you had an affair with the sandwich and yeah it was bad -- but it felt so good.Go to Canter's if you ever go to SoCal... and if you're from SoCal, well, go to Canter's. Enjoy the historic restaurant, take a journey back in time, and yes ladies and gentlemen, have that affair.

Reviews.Author: Christian S.
Reviews.Content: Good deal on bagels, but overpriced deli. I had to pay $8.60 for 3 potato pancakes, and when I checked the menu online when I got back it said I could have gotten 6 for $9.50-ish. What the heck? Also, service sucks. It's cool that they use retro registers but it's not cool when there's complete disorganization

Reviews.Author: Ashley W.
Reviews.Content: My father and I visited Canter's last night and he asked me to post this:In the forty years that I have been coming to Canter's, I have had sandwiches that weren't quite up to par, but this had to be the worst of the worst in food and treatment.I shared the sandwich with my daughter.Never having the Fairfax sandwich before, when biting into the sandwich for the first time and experiencing the flavor of the two meats together, it seemed kind of strange. After taking another bite I asked my daughter, what did she think? She stated that the sandwich didn't have any taste or flavor. At that time I separated the two meats, smelled and tasted them separately and came to the conclusion that neither of the two meats had any identifying signature smells between the two. In other words, the Cornbeef nor the Pastrami could not be identified by smell or taste, only by look.And to top it off, the Pickles were old, soft, rubbery and limp. Maybe because they were pre-wrapped and stacked a mile high on the counter, and not cut fresh like before. What a sad sandwich and pickle. The last time I complained about a sandwich was about seven years ago, when you cut the proportions of the meat down. I have never returned anything to Canters. And when I did this time I was browbeaten and verbally attacked by some crude lady named Eva.She told me "Hell no, you I took more than one bite out of the sandwich."  At that point, it didn't make any difference what I said to this lady as she was making faces and negative body gestures. She threw the bag with the partially eaten sandwich on the counter and asked me if I wanted it, another tactless move further humiliating me. As I stated previously that I was Sharing the Sandwich with my daughter who has been eating Corned beef and Pastrami Sandwiches from Canter's for twenty four years. Probably about the time Eva was in what ever country she was in.So, this is how I feel and this is what I am going to do. The treatment that I received was so unreal, disrespectful and unprofessional  and should have never happened.  Your quality and service has been slipping and suffering for some time now. This really takes the cake. And if this is the treatment of a long standing customer, it's horrible.  That lady treated me with disdane and a total lack of respect.  I really hate to think it's because I am black, and I was not in a suit and tie like I am usually in when I visit the restaurant..That  is not only poor customer service, that is no customer service, and that equals two lost customers and maybe a lot more. It is pretty stupid to have a manager in this day and age, that does not understand the protocols of customer service! No tact, no professionalism equals a lot of lost business.At this point I am finished with Canters. In the seventies and eighties it was a different Restaurant. And that $14 sandwich that she threw at me is going to cost your restaurant ten fold!  You don't know how that really made me feel, mad!!! That lady is a total fool and if this is your new policy you are fooling yourself in believing that you are not loosing business!If she thought I was trying to get something for nothing, she made a tragic mistake!

Reviews.Author: Heather S.
Reviews.Content: Well, it may be an L.A. landmark, but it's a restaurant that's clearly resting on its laurels. The food's just not that fantastic for the price. It's very expensive, and frankly you can get a sandwich that tastes as good for half the price at ToGos.  The corned beef and cabbage meal looks and tastes like it's been in the pot for a month. You're clearly paying for being able to say you ate at Canter's.  Doesn't look like they clean the place a lot either; it's got a well-used look a little like an airport. Bon apetit folks!

Reviews.Author: Michael F.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is one of the places that I've been wanting to try for years.  I finally got my opportunity this past Sunday, and it lived up to all my expectations, and then some.I asked our waiter what their specialties are, and he said both the pastrami and corned beef.  My mouth was salivating thinking about both, but I decided on a corned beef reuben.  The sandwich was one of the best I have ever tasted.  Everything about it was delicious, from the bread to the meat, and everything in between.  It was love at first bite!  I also substituted potato salad for the side of fries that the sandwich came with, and it was amazing as well.  It was one of the sweetest potato salads I have ever had, but the flavor was outstanding.  The sandwich and the salad were a match made in heaven, and made for great meal.My first experience at Canter's was great!  I can't wait to go back again and see if the rest of their menu is just as tasty.

Reviews.Author: Brian B.
Reviews.Content: Last visit was a major disappointment based solely on the service and the way it was poorly handled. I did a carry out, waited 25 minutes, and no one acknowledged me. They were empty, had three guys at the counter, and were filling a large order for later. I left after half an hour empty handed.Called the owner the next day to let her know of unacceptable visit, so she said she would issue a credit next visit and took my info. Month later, i called in advance to confirm and it took a 20 min delay waiting on the phone and no one could locate. They told me to call back in an hour for the manager. I did that, she had me on hold another 15 mins and said she could not find so call tomorrow for exec management. Poor excuse for service, will not return as they could care less about the customer and are way disorganized.

Reviews.Author: Alex W.
Reviews.Content: Canter's Delicatessen has been a Los Angeles landmark for over half a century.  Originally located in the Boyle Heights section, it eventually relocated to the Fairfax District, where it remains to this day.  A Jewish deli, Canter's is renowned for its pastrami sandwiches and is open 24 hours a day.  Due to its proximity to Hollywood, West Hollywood, and the Sunset Strip, the deli has served as a noteworthy location in Hollywood lore.  Many musicians and celebrities have dined at the restaurant, and it is also known as one of the starting points for artists such as Fiona Apple and the Wallflowers, as well as Guns N' Roses.Although I had been to Canter's before, I made my most recent trip after purchasing a half priced Groupon.  I pounced for the Pastrami Sandwich as my main course.  Despite not enjoying rye bread all that much, I opted to keep it rather than substitute it for my preferred white bread.  Though not piled as high as a New York sandwich, it is still a pretty good size, with a good portion of meat slabbed in between the rye.  The pastrami is sliced thin, and although I prefer thick pastrami, it is still pretty tasty.  Add a bit of mustard and the sandwich is a simple, yet classic sandwich that has enough flavor without complexity.  A pastrami sandwich will set you back $11.95, and while it does not come with fries, they do throw in a pickle on which to munch.In addition to the pastrami sandwich, I decided to get a matzoh ball soup.  Sure, I did not really need the soup, but I had never tried this famed style of soup before and figured I could always bring it to work for lunch (plus I had a Groupon that needed spending!).  Not having anything to compare it to, I thought the soup was a simple, but satisfying soup.  A large matzoh ball accompanied the chicken broth and noodles that composed the soup.

Reviews.Author: Elysse P.
Reviews.Content: I haven't tried their amazing Pastrami and Corned Beef... :( I promise I will next time I'm on Fairfax, which is often. SO WILL UPDATE SOON!Went to the Welcome to the Block party for the Crooks and Castles opening this past weekend slightly buzzed. Came across Canter's to use the restroom and saw a small dark room tucked away in the back. Very chill, old school (like for real old school) vibe... $5 shots! Juke box. Interesting heads in the mix. I dig it.

Reviews.Author: Aaron E.
Reviews.Content: It was okay. I didn't feel super good after about 4 hours eating here. It's cool but super run down. This is an iconic place in LA but they have relied upon that to stay open. Their history is what keeps them open, not their service or food. It needs to be retrofitted, I use that word because if it were brought to it's original glory it would be very awesome. But aside from that, they need to get the place fixed up. Also, they need to do a better job of being 21st century. (Photo copying my receipt is ghetto)

Reviews.Author: Kanani N.
Reviews.Content: Many great memories coming here. My favorite is the matzo ball soup. Bakery items are to die for! So yummy....

Reviews.Author: Cynthia L.
Reviews.Content: I ate a matzo ball in my soup the size of Gerard Depardieu's head. It was crazy, CRAZY big. And even though I have never had a bad matzo ball soup, per se, I'll have to say that this was a cut above all the rest I've had. My dough ball of joy was chock full of flavor. Good delis with all the east coast accoutrements are hard to come by in my corner of the world. The chicken broth is really rich: I wonder if they use bouillon? Is that sacrilege to ask?I'm not a corned beef or pastrami eater, so I chose to have the whitefish with tomato and cream cheese on an onion bagel. Just 10 minutes earlier, I didn't know what I wanted to eat, then BOOM it turns out whitefish was exactly what I was needing in my life.My husband had the corned beef and sniffed sadly at the sandwich when it arrived. Plain, small bread slices (although piled high with meat.) He put a little mustard on the sandwich and nearly fell over with delight. He said (and continues to say) that it is the best sandwich he's eaten. Their bakery items were crazy tempting but we were too full to attempt a bite. I can't wait to go back and try some of the sweeter things; leaning far back in my seat to stare at the beautiful ceiling.

Reviews.Author: Sterling A.
Reviews.Content: Very good place to eat in LA. It's fame has true reason.I came here with some friend's after attending the annual Johnny Ramone tribute at Hollywood Forever and had never been here before. Well, the spots it had on the Travel Channel were very correct when they praised it. I had their famous pastrami/corned beef and it was unbelievably good. Plain and simple.Even the pickles you get on the side somehow stand out amongst the world of relatively normal pickled cucumber spears. Kosher truly has a new place in my heart(No, that was not a clogged artery joke, but I digress). I ended my visit by stopping at their wall of baked goods, purchasing a slice of their cheesecake while I was at it to take home with me. The next day when I had it, I found Nirvana. And it wasn't the Washington based grungy kind either, but the rich and creamy kind dipped in udder glory.Ok, now to be human for a change. The only things to not enjoy about the place is:1.) The noise level. It's a bit noisy, but maybe only if you were me and were sitting next to an unknown music producer who had a flock of desperate woman with him, laughing at every little joke he would make, regardless of it truly being funny or even without a single hint of successful timing to them as if they were Ray Liotta in "Goodfellas" kissing Joe Pesci's ass via his trademark hyena cackle.2.) The price. But you gotta spend money to get what's worth the money, so deal with it and you'll be in jewish heaven. If that's a thing...

Reviews.Author: Buala E.
Reviews.Content: Love this place! :) I came here on a Saturday night around 1am with the BF and we expected it to be packed, but it wasn't too bad. Yummy trim pastrami sandwich on rye. I like this place more than johnnie's pastrami! The brisket was moist and delicious. I love the atmosphere. It feels like a very laid back diner full of life and great service. I'll definitely be coming back ;)

Reviews.Author: Slade B.
Reviews.Content: Canters is an awesome deli. It's history and original as possible decor, enhance the experience. I've been here multiple times over the years. The wait staff can be a little edgy and weird but, the service is usually pretty good. If you're drunk and there at 2am with the rest of drunken Hollywood. The service gets a little spotty and the food usually does take awhile. But, it's 2am. What can you expect? Parking is always bad, worse on Friday and Saturday nights. The lot, sometimes completely full. But, go around the block 3-4 times and you'll find a spot on the street, somewhere adjacent. I've had the corned beef on rye here many times, amazing. (See picture). Last night, I had the pastrami Reuben. To die from, literally. Soooo good! I told the server, I may die in my sleep tonight from this but, it was amazing. Their latkes are also excellent as well. Make sure to ask for pickles while you wait for your food, a must have.

Reviews.Author: Jackie C.
Reviews.Content: Canter's Canter's. You can always count on Canter's to be open when you need that cheesecake or pastrami or anything you can think of from a deli.This is an iconic institution, not just a restaurant. I am not the biggest fan of this place but it is what it is.Their food are decent but their prices are pretty expensive. Their cheesecakes used to be amazing but now it has less cream so it is not as amazing, maybe it is trying to be healthier but come on, if I am eating a cheesecake, I am not trying to be healthy.Their pastries are pretty bomb, be sure to try some or all of them.I come here late night, I have never or will I ever come here before 12 am.You meet some interesting characters here, so do come to check it out!

Reviews.Author: German S.
Reviews.Content: A LA institution and the food is typical NY deli style...nothing special really. A bit overpriced and the bakery is ok; most items are a bit stale tasting. Haven't been back since 2010 when I saw a cockroach crawling up the wall while waiting to be served...eat at your own risk. The "A" doesn't mean much I guess...

Reviews.Author: Roya S.
Reviews.Content: If you are on the lookout for a NYC-style eatery with good food (and deli items) at reasonable prices, look no further. Canter's is a very popular spot with some absolutely delicious deli sandwiches, soups, baked goods, etc., the works. I am a huge fan--it definitely competes with some of the best places I've been to back in NY, which is loaded with Delicatessen style restaurants. I don't see how you could go wrong with hardly anything on the menu. I went with my cousin for the first time recently, and ordered the half sandwich and soup combo--pastrami on rye and a cup of chicken noodle soup. The sandwich was so yummy, and very filling, so it was plenty in spite of only being half. My cousin ordered the tongue sandwich on egg challah and a cup of cabbage soup, which is good too. We split the mac n cheese with added bacon on top- which was the absolute highlight of the meal, and some of the best mac n cheese I've had to date. Also, the pickles here are to die for--fresh, crispy perfection. I returned back and had what I would recommend as my favorite sandwich so far-- the "Little Corned Beef Panini"--oh.em.gee. It was delectable--perfectly tender corned beef on rye, panini style, with melted Swiss cheese, Russian dressing, and cole slaw ON THE SANDWICH. My mouth waters just thinking about it. Canter's also has a bakery and deli counter on site, for some to-go items, including made-to-order deli sandwiches. I am already looking forward to returning and trying some other items. So mouthwatering good. I love it here and will go back pronto.

Reviews.Author: michael h.
Reviews.Content: Went to Canter's Deli for the first time just the other day after seeing it on a food network special. I ordered the pastrami reuben sandwich. The pastrami was top grade, not that stringy fat pastrami that low end deli's use. Any way the sandwich was very good, but a little pricey ($14.50) and came with fries. So i do recommend giving it a try.

Reviews.Author: Alexandria B.
Reviews.Content: Ken Marcus makes me go here all the time, lol, but I've learned to really like this place. The service is consistently good and the food is good.

Reviews.Author: Scott S.
Reviews.Content: The times I've been, the pastrami has been uneven. The corned beef, however, is as solid as they come.Probably the best matzo ball soup I've had, either in NY or LA.

Reviews.Author: Jim F.
Reviews.Content: This place is very large and very very mediocre. It's nice that's it's 24/7 but that's probably the biggest draw. I went there recently and ordered potato latkes as appitizer and had their "Famous" corned beef on rye.Both were very disappointing. The corned beef was dry. Not the rye bread. The corned beef it self. I took it out of the sandwich at had to cut it with a knife. I couldn't chew and swallow it with the bread. Too dry.The Latkes, which are on par with chicken wings and pizza in their ease in making, were terrible. wet and under cooked yet somehow burnt as well. Not a fan. We got some cookies and klatchis as we left. They were OK. A little dry as well. Not sure if this place just thrives on notoriety. It was pretty crowded when we went in on 6pm on a Saturday. BEST BETIf you're drunk on Fairfax and the bar closes...this place will be perfect.

Reviews.Author: Cari C.
Reviews.Content: Delicious sandwiches! Yummy horseradish sauce in a jar for sure. I will be going again, but they REALLY need to work on their potato salad and homemade pickles..not good. Parking is awful, but once you go in it's a fantastic experience of what old LA used to be like. I imagined all the old movers and shakers that used to eat there. The decor is awesome, but bathrooms were sketchy. Service was good and pleasant dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C.
Reviews.Content: There's no ifs or buts about it. Canter's is LA's top deli to nibble and nosh at; it's a landmark to the Fairfax neighborhood and a popular tourist spot and local hangout. The food is great, the people watching is excellent and you'll leave with a happy tum and a smile. If you're going to Canter's you gotta do it up. As I have been here more times than I can count, I've sampled many of their goods and here's what I got for you The Pastrami is to die. to die for and I would highly recommend putting one of these to your face.If that is not so much your thing, you can't go wrong with the bagels and lox platter. The guys here don't skimp on the good stuff and you'll leave feeling blissful.Egg creams? Yes, please. If you don't know what one is, get one. Don't worry; there are no eggs in here. Just a little seltzer, milk, choco syrup and magic. As far as I know, this is the only place to get a good egg cream ( or an egg cream) in LA. Yolo. I love bread. I love breakfast. I love challah. I'm essentially in a committed relationship with their challah french toast ( don't tell my mother). you'll finish your plate and be challahing back for more. Was that funny? I laughed.Also, the pastry case. don't even. Don't even.  Everything in this case essentially taste the same but in a very good way.  Please, you'll know when you get there. Get half a pound of butter cookies, a few mini black and white cookies, and some rugelach. You won't regret it. Also, ask for pickles. Everyone needs a little nosh before their meal comes.Canter's is a deli. The ambiance is well... indicative of a deli? So yes, you can go in yoga pants and it's no big deal and if you are a guy you could wear an Adidas warm-up suit and you'd probably leave with two ladies. It's all part of the experience. Don't forget to buy a t-shirt!and the service? Again, it's a deli. The servers are sometimes friendly but typically just want you to eat and move your patoot out the door. c'est la vie.Canter's is pricey. Every single time I get my bill, I am a little shocked with how much my meal cost. So yes, I can prepare my own lox and shmear at my house but given that I deactivated my Jdate account, I've got like thirty jbucks to burn a month without guilt so my moolah issues with this place are no mo. Canter's also constantly has groupons if that's your thing, but I am waiting until I am in a committed relationship with a Jewish man who will embarrass me and pay for all our meals here with them.Whether you live around the block or you're in the hood to check out the sights, grab a nibble or nosh at Canter's. You'll love it.

Reviews.Author: Pablo L.
Reviews.Content: You want lots of food that tastes good?  Reasonable prices?  Friendly service?  Lots of characters in your vicinity?  And it's 4 a.m.?  Canter's Deli is the place.  Actually, a great deli at any time.

Reviews.Author: Serene E.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is pretty much your classic Jewish delicatessen. The restaurant is huge, and the service is great.  The food is great, but you have to go all in.  Pastrami, French dip, or a Reuben.  It's a lot of food, so if possible split a sandwich.  The fries are awesome.  The soups are good.  It's pricey, but convenient and you know what you're going to get.  Parking is not fun at all.  There is a lot that is always full.  The guy working the lot is the man though.  :)). Always nice and professional.  It's been there forever, and I can't imagine it leaving anytime soon.  If you are a Guns and Roses fan, you should go.  Oh, there is a bakery and to-go delicatessens that you can take home.

Reviews.Author: Brittany S.
Reviews.Content: They have parking but the lot can get full. My boyfriend and I went on a Sunday at noon and immediately got seated even though the place was very busy.  They have a large menu including beer, wine and cocktails which you wouldn't expect a deli restaurant to have but it is definitely a plus!I got the Brooklyn Ave sandwich. I chose pastrami as my meat. It was so delicious. They also gave us  a plate of delicious pickles as a free appetizer.My sandwich was one of the few that came with potatoes salad instead of fries... they wouldn't sub for the fries so I had to order them as an additional side for $4.25... hence the 4 stars.This is a great lunch spot and would also be a great place to get desserts for work birthdays or parties at home. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Jeannie E.
Reviews.Content: This place was decent, but I definitely like Langers more. I like the environment and location of Canters more, but the food at Langers remains unmatched by Canters.

Reviews.Author: Andy S.
Reviews.Content: Best. Pastrami. Reuben. Better than Katz's in NYC. It's not really even close, and if you talk to foodies around here they'll always say Langer's or some other really respectable option. First of all, the other options don't toast their bread which is stupid. Canter's: the butter oozes from the bread, the pastrami is delicious and the cheese and the melting and the oh my...just cause it's not the fancy option or the fashionable one doesn't make it not the best. Objectively and subjectively the best pastrami Reuben in the world.

Reviews.Author: Magnolia B.
Reviews.Content: Wow, I really can't believe I am saying this, but I will not be returning to Canter's.  Just moved back to the LA area after a 2 year stint up in the Bay Area.  Took my boyfriend here to give him a taste of the city since it's his first time living in LA and we were both truly disappointed.  Food was great as usual, but the staff was rude and seem burned out to be perfectly honest.  I let it go that our waiter said he wouldn't bring us food unless we asked nicely saying please and thank you.  After we got our food he kinda redeemed himself minus the fact that he messed up our order.  WORST PART OF OUR VISIT ended up being the rude older woman at the cash register and reasoning behind 1 star and the loss of a two customers.  Paying the bill should never be a point of contention.  When we went to pay the check, she scoffed at us when we tried to split it and flat out refused our payment.  I should have asked to speak to a manager.  I would say next time if there's an issue I will, but there won't be a next time.  We went at dinner time on a Saturday.  You'd think after all their years of success that they would staff it with friendlier people.  I always enjoyed my experience up until today.

Reviews.Author: Claire M.
Reviews.Content: Went back recently after attending a Craig Ferguson taping, and I noticed a few improvements! NOT that the food was horrible the previous time, but I was happy to see/taste how much more Yummy their matzo ball soup has gotten!! And their potato knish is good for West Coast Kosher fare :) My mother said the Pastrami was amazing like always, as well. Lastly, the cherry phosphate I ordered was interesting (after a while to get used to it's fizziness , it was enjoyable) and the rugelachs in the bakery are Delicioussss..the chocolate being my favorite. They've got a variety, so we just ordered a combination bag.

Reviews.Author: Jingni W.
Reviews.Content: Went in just for the bakery. We got a red velvet cupcake and the strawberry cheese cake. Both items was really disappointing. The presentation of both items was beautiful , but they both tasted dry.

Reviews.Author: Roxanne M.
Reviews.Content: Decide to stop here since it is a nostalgic resturtuar n we frequently pass by. Huge mistake I love nostalgic places but this was just run down n old. I asked to see a menu before we sat down n I was handed a damp wet smelly menu. After looking through the menu we decided to just try their desserts TO GO. When ordering a few slices of different types of cheesecake the man behind the counter continue to cut way larger slices then what we would request, keep in mind that you pay by weight. We also tired the carrot cake we do not recommended it is extremely dry, like my  BF put it it is as dry as my grandmothers cough. Sorry but this place was just not for us, were not picky but when something is bad its just bad.

Reviews.Author: David D.
Reviews.Content: It's been years since my last meal at Canter's.  We were in the area for an event and decided to give them a try again for dinner.Here are my ratings based on the food we ordered.Chicken Soup Mish Mash:  Overall 4 of 5 Broth: 4 of 5Noodles: 3 of 5Matzo Ball: 4 of 5Rice: 3 of 5Kreplah: 2 of 5 (change them--they can be better)Chicken: 4 of 5 Nate and Al's Deli (Beverly Hills)  Chicken in the Pot edges them out--we have not had better unless Grandma is cooking her old school recipe.---Roasted Turkey: 4 of 5 (a bit dry with aftertaste)(We prefer Applegate Farms (Whole Foods)  or Boars-head Natural (Gelson's))Pickles: 4 of 5---Service: SUPER FAST, accurate,  4 of 5 Atmosphere: 3 of 5 , No Ambiance, Not romantic, Hectic--SUE  (Shut Up & Eat) place.  Canter's does a pretty good job considering its sheer volume, no one will walk away saying their meal was awful, but there is better out there.It's hard maintaining top quality with food when you are open all night, constantly rotating staff.

Reviews.Author: S S.
Reviews.Content: Best Reuben of my life! I dream of it. Blows Katz Deli out of the water and is 1/2 the price : )Also, its 24 hrs, you can't beat that.

Reviews.Author: Loni Q.
Reviews.Content: Great matzo ball soup (nice large matzo ball) and my friend raved about the pastrami! The bagels and lox with cream cheese is also really good! Must try desserts next time. Cool, "Mad Men" decor. But then I'm partial to retro!

Reviews.Author: Jeri L.
Reviews.Content: Very good pastrami looked amazing the opened face sandwich and mash potatoes was great.  Parkings a bit tricky they have a lot but it's very small you can park on the residential streets but make sure you read the parking signs for limits.

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: I'm addicted! So many good sandwiches - crazy awesome, never ending menu.  Pastrami Dog & reubens are some of my faves thus far.  Skip the salami sandwich-I had a craving but it was really boring.  Really cool spot-even have a dark bar on the side w/a couple screen for sports.  When eating there, the drinks came in crazy small glasses.  Cool feel both in the main restaurant and bar (bar is a little too dark) and we met some really cool, old school east coasters at the bar that I swear came straight out of a b&w movie.  Good times.Dessert selection is cool-need to explore it more-but I'm kind of a dessert connoisseur (aka fat kid) and the selection, though huge, hasn't really spoken to me yet.  A little too bakery for my taste-we'll see.  For everything else though-OMG!  24/7 and you can have Thanksgiving dinner any time.Just wish they hadn't disabled Grubhub ordering :/ ...I get prizes for ordering on grubhub-not so with the other sites.

Reviews.Author: Carol O.
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, Canter's has been a favorite of mine for many years.  The sandwiches are huge, their pastrami the best and their chopped chicken liver is out of this world.  We always split a side of their french fries so can easily take home half a sandwich, the coleslaw or potato salad side dish and the pickles.  So basically, two meals for the price of one and we're quite full.The only problem I ever have is their bakery department which few people can pass on the way out without buying "a little something."  It is so slow and the prices are higher than in other shops in the area.  I keep telling myself that this time I'll just pass it by, save a lot of time and maybe pick up something a few doors down.  But I rarely do.  Yup, I'm weak.  I just really wish it were faster.

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: It is rare that I continue to eat a sandwich after I am no longer hungry, but I just couldn't stop myself. This is some great pastrami.

Reviews.Author: Dave G.
Reviews.Content: These guys make a mean pastrami sandwich.  The pastrami melts in your mouth.  There is a reason why this is considered one of the best delis in L.A.

Reviews.Author: Maidie V.
Reviews.Content: Ehhhhhhhhhh... food is ok, nothing that makes me say "OMG, I LOVE the..." and the service  was not so great... I most likely will not come back...

Reviews.Author: Rebecca O.
Reviews.Content: Food was good and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Author: Dee G.
Reviews.Content: Best deli in LA. The corned beef sandwich is amazing. And order some cheese fries to go with it. Don't forget to stop by the bakery on the way out. The rugulas, cupcakes, and cookies are delish!

Reviews.Author: Richard M.
Reviews.Content: Had the Spicy Pastrami and my wife had the Monte Cristo. UNBELIEVABLE!!!! We will be coming back. Prices are super reasonable for the quality and the portion sizes.

Reviews.Author: Jeff G.
Reviews.Content: Finally found a good place that knows how to do Jew food. Reminds me of easy coast delis. Matzo ball soup, potatoe pancakes, and pastrami, Swiss, and rye sandwich were all very excellent. Do recommend will go again in the future. Mazel Tov!!

Reviews.Author: Khalia B.
Reviews.Content: I've only been here for the bakery. Today,we loaded up. My mom ordered four chocolate chip danishes. My auntie ordered an almond biscotti-like pastry. I ordered plain and chocolate-topped cheesecake. It had been a few years since we had come here. It pleases me very much that the quality hasn't decimated.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: I've lived in LA a long while and been to Canters a few times, ordered delivery about a month ago for the first time and it was a wonderful experience with great food. But tonight, my visit to Canters will go down in history as one of the most insane and disturbing dining experiences of my life. A group of 5 of us came in at around 7:30/8pm on a Saturday night. We were seated promptly in the back of the main dining room and approximately 15 minutes later, menus closed, no waiter had been over. No water, no pickles, nada. Being boisterous, I volunteered to stop the next person that happened by.  A tall, white fellow (I say this because it gets important later) happened by. I say nicely, "I'm sorry, excuse me, but we've been waiting about 10/15 minutes, do you think you could---" Here the waiter cuts me off saying, "Oh ok, no problem. I'll send over some other white person to take care of you." Now, we were a table of 4 Caucasian people and 1 (very obviously not white) Hispanic person. While most of us were shocked into silence, my friend, a fearless type, quickly responded saying, "What?! What did you just say?? That was an extremely inappropriate and uncalled for comment!"The waiter then apologized for his "sense of humor" and quickly ran away, appearing again moments later with water and pickles for us, and sensing the disgust oozing off our table, offered another apology.A few moments later, our server appeared. A nice enough fellow, except that he very obviously hates. his. life. And, in turn, hated us for being a part of it. Anyway...Right after we placed our order, a chirpy British lady we assumed to be the manager, came over to apologize for the wait, informed us that our new surly server came on early just to help, and offered to bring us some complementary cookies suggesting we "save room for desert!" She had obviously been informed of our wait but not of our exchange with the first server we spoke with.Look, our food came out quick and was pretty good. And we're a fun bunch, we managed to turn an unfortunate incident into a quirky story and enjoy ourselves, but that waiters comment....I'm hard pressed to think of a time I've experienced anything so blatantly racist in my life.  If you want good deli, do yourself a favor and skip this place in favor of Factor's Famous Deli or take a drive up to the Beverly Glenn Deli. You'll have much better food without being served by a possible member of the Klan. Disgusting.

Reviews.Author: Jesseca S.
Reviews.Content: An early hangout for the original members of one of the greatest bands in the world, Canter's Deli and its Gn'R tables are utter perfection. (And I haven't even gotten to the food yet!)

Reviews.Author: Ryan S.
Reviews.Content: I went to Canter's Deli in Fairfax Village for the first time on a Sunday afternoon at about 2:00PM.  The dining room was still packed at this time; however, the wait was not that long.  This is your typical NY style full service deli restaurant, only with actual room to sit down.  It is a 24 hour establishment with a big menu.I found the staff to be very friendly, as long as you treat them with respect.  The food was good.  I shared part of an omelette and part of a sandwich, both had excellent flavor.  The speed of service was also very efficient.  I really don't have a reason to complain about this place at all.

Reviews.Author: Brian U.
Reviews.Content: A Los Angeles institution also belongs in an institution. With frozen fries from a bag and corned beef with fat layers like bacon, Canter's is comparable to the food at Jerry's Deli which is NOT a compliment. The bakery isn't much better with forgettable desserts and flavorless rugelach. Despite being open since 1931, the place doesn't feel like the period with the tacky yellow-lit ceiling.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany H.
Reviews.Content: It was a late night at work & we ordered via Seamless which is pretty awesome! While they have a great selection, I think I ordered the wrong thing because I was so underwhelmed. The Turkey Reuben was so so dry. I had to drown it in mustard. Also, it was served with a side of fries and while it was nice to know the food is fresh, the fries melted the Styrofoam box..so before I noticed, I was eating some chemically gunk that might kill me eventually. Awesome.To top it off, I had a massive stomachache after. Woo.

Reviews.Author: Rick C.
Reviews.Content: Had the fairfax- best deli sandwich!!! Pastrami & corned beef were tender & amazing, potato salad was excellent & the pickle

Reviews.Author: Sarah C.
Reviews.Content: It hurts me to rate a place like this with two stars because I love old school deli places and Katz's in NYC is where I take people from out of town. But nothing I had was very memorable and even the fries were wanting, how can you go wrong with fries? I don't know but they did. Even the desserts from the bakery were disappointing.

Reviews.Author: Colleen L.
Reviews.Content: The parking lot attendant was extra attentive as I entered to meet some friends for lunch.  He had his eye on my car from the stoplight, before I had even turned.  The sign read 11/2 hours parking FREE with validation.  First time in this legendary Jewish deli I was immediately welcomed once inside too.   The bakery's cookies called out to me from behind the glass cases, but I stuck to my guns and found my old coworkers first.  Somewhat perplexed as to where my friends were, the staff were intuitive and showed me immediately where they were. Our table looked as though it was meant to be seated for 8, however our group swelled to about 12.  Our waitress, Charisse, could not have been kinder.  She was so sweet and flexible, taking a number of pictures of our old work group.   Some of us had camera phones and others just a camera.  It did not matter, she just took it in stride.  She offered us individual checks which made taking care of business a pleasure.  She brought extra chairs as did the busboy. Plate of pickles were placed before us.  They were delicious and made my mouth pucker.  No complaints about the food from anyone.  We gawked the size of one person's matzo ball soup.  Afraid I missed taking the picture as I was spell bound by it. The nurse who sat beside me ordered a brisket without the bread.  It was brown alright, smothered in gravy.  He seemed to enjoy it.  The one who sat across from me ordered the panini.  It looked so good I wished I had ordered a vegetarian panini.  I ordered a vegetarian Reuben.  The rye bread was crispy, the cheese melted well, however the vegetarian patty inside could have been a vegan burger from Costco.   Nothing homemade about that patty.  It was between 2-3 stars.  What I really liked about that dish was the steak fries.  Perfectly hot and not too salty, I could have eaten a plate of these! We had a wonderful time catching up with each other and thanks to the staff at Canter's they truly made our time together very meaningful.  At the conclusion of our luncheon, our waitress gave us our separate checks with tax & tip included.  They even gave us a complimentary plate of cookies in the end.  Ate the poppyseed and apricot mini pastries, they were so delicious that I had to stop myself quickly so I passed the plate around a second time.

Reviews.Author: Kathryn A.
Reviews.Content: Don't want to offend anyone but I just don't get why this place continues to be so popular. Eaten here twice since back in LA and the food has been very poor quality. Maybe I just haven't ordered the right things. Anyway, can't beat their hours so if you're looking for huge portions in the middle of the night guess this is a reasonable choice. Note that if you order delivery it's best to check the contents before they leave. Likely to be something missing. They do win for worst Frozen French fries I've had in awhile. Maybe they've gotten a bit lazy being such an LA institution? So many better delis in NY...have to find one here.

Reviews.Author: Mischa M.
Reviews.Content: Went to Canter's (a place I have always loved) and had such a disappointing experience! First let's start with the fact that the service was slow when they weren't even busy. The second (and probably most disgusting) moment happened when a living bug... A baby roach crawled out of the dinner salad I had ordered. Gross! The waiter took the plate away and brought my friend and I a sandwich we decided to split. The sandwich was still good luckily. Then the busboy accidentally dropped his cleaning rag on the floor, picked it up and proceeded to clean tables for incoming customers with the now dirty rag. I have never been so disappointed as I was coming here tonight!

Reviews.Author: Brian Y.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is amazing! A landmark in Los Angeles. If you love a good deli sandwich, you cant beat Canters. The matzo ball soup is awesome. Great spot for a drunken meal. If you haven't been to Canter's, you have not lived the LA life.

Reviews.Author: Leslie T.
Reviews.Content: Perfectly executed chocolate egg cream and Ruben with Russian on the side. What is not to love? Especially when you can get it in the middle of the night with a crowd that looks like they just rolled down the hill from Sunset blvd. circa 1978 - instant rock n roll nostalgia party.I hadn't been here in a few years but they delivered on and exceeded expectations. Just thinking about it makes me want to go and get a bowl of matzoh ball soup right now.

Reviews.Author: Skye J.
Reviews.Content: There was a twist tie cooked into my noodle kugel when I was there 4/19/14. Makes me question the cleanliness of the kitchen. It was really disgusting. The waitress who was nice and apologetic brought me two cookies on a plate-??. I've been going there since old Mr. Canter was behind the register but I'll think twice before ever going again.

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I've been back since the roach infestation long ago. Service was decent but forgot about us after given our food (i.e. no water until we waived someone down).The inside of this place  doesn't seem like it changed much at all, maybe it has but doesn't feel like it. The pastrami and cornbeef are Ok, I've gotten much better else where.The Live music is pretty cool.Overall it's overpriced for what it is. I think people come here when they are out really late, if you are comparing it to places open super late it would probably be 3.5 stars. Oh and remember the lot is 1.5 hours free with validation and then they start charging quick.

Reviews.Author: Stella K.
Reviews.Content: I would give this place 6 stars if I could. Their menu selection is freaking amazing. Their food is freaking amazing. Their service is freaking amazing. Bonus points for having freshly squeezed orange juice.So far I've had:Waffles: big, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, vanilla-y, and mmmmmmm. BBQ pork sandwich: they use REAL meat. Pretty thick slices of it. Nuff said. Florentine Benedict: ever since I had my first florentine Benedict at The Wooden Spoon (in Connecticut), I've been looking for it. EVEN BETTER THAN WOODEN SPOON'S. Ps My New Years resolution is to eat everything on their menu.

Reviews.Author: Mile M.
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here for about 28 years. Seems like the place never changes. Feels like you step back in time. The food is very good, its an experience every time you are there. It's nothing fancy, but you know you are in Los Angeles, by all the different types of people that walk through the door. I feel like I enjoy my meal, and get some free entertainment also by people watching. Open 24 hours, so a great place to go late at night. Smoked Turkey Reuben, and Mishmosh Matzah ball soup is my favorite.

Reviews.Author: Stan S.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is one of a kind... The only other place that comes close is Carnegie Deli in NYC. I don't know which I like better: the food or the atmosphere. This place is busy 24/7, and the after midnight crowd always makes for fun people watching.It's the 'must see' place for all my friends who visit from out of town.The corned beef is the best in LA, hands down. Doesn't matter if you want it lean, fatty or somewhere in between, it's perfection on a plate.

Reviews.Author: Judy H.
Reviews.Content: Yes, their sandwiches are pretty good.....but their pickles are to die for!  Seriously, I could make a meal out of just their pickles with some rye bread and butter.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan L.
Reviews.Content: At first, I thought I would be getting a sandwich that would blow me off of my toes, but instead I got something overpriced and wasn't as good as The Hat. I ordered the hot pastrami and the hot corned beef sandwich both were super dry. I like some of the other reviewers had to use the mustard provided to soften the bite.Afterwards, I had a really bad stomach ache. I would not go back there again even if they provided me free food.

Reviews.Author: Doug P.
Reviews.Content: I came here for two reasons: I found a Groupon and  it seemed like a "classic" LA spot. The place looks like it was last updated approximately 1975, and the staff probably started working there around that time. Nothing wrong with that, just an observation...... But for those is not a place to dine, its a place to eat.   The waitress acted like we were more of a spot on her daily checklist than customers. No small talk or smile- just asked for the order and walked off.  The food itself was basic dinner food. Nothing great, but it was decent. The price didn't bother me because of the deal, but I would never pay full price here. I think the experience was what one would expect with an old school diner for a little extra cost. You can try it but there are much better options near by.....

Reviews.Author: Miriam E.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there yesterday for a late dinner after a concert. Although they were a bit busy, the service was at first very pushy (which we hate as my husband likes to drink his beer before start eating), we ordered French fries to munch on so he could have his time. The problem was that after bringing the fries, was almost impossible to get our server's attention again. A lady finally came when we were already losing our patience and wrote our order in a paper napkin. My husband ordered another beer, I ordered the Roast Brisket and my husband ordered the Chicken Milanese.10 minutes went by and the beer never came. We had to complain and the answer was "The Bar is packed, our manager had to go get it!", really???? The lady (the same who took our order) came back with the beer, no clean glass thought. Fine, we were trying to save the rest of our night, so we waited for the food. When it came, what a deception! My Brisket was overcook, I got to say that it was not roast, but tasted boiled instead, with tons of thick cut onion gravy over it, the mashed potatoes was from those potato mix, not real potato, super dry and with a weird looking gravy over it. Super sloppy presentation, the kind that does not inspire you to eat whatsoever! As I was hungry and it was way too late (after midnight already) I ate the dry overcooked brisket and did not touch the mash or the onions.My husband's Chicken Milanese was to come with fries and salad, the salad did not come and when my husband asked the server, she was absolutely lost, my husband had to show her the menu in order to get her to go get the salad. The chicken was also overcooked, super dry, and the breading tasted almost burned.At the register, they do not charge you while seated, you have to go to the cashier to pay (really?!?) the guy asked about our experience, my husband tells him and surprise, he blame on the server, who had put the blame on the hostess.... and life goes on.... Besides the mess, the not so clean dinner room, pretty old and not inviting ambiance, the server was nice and apologized many times, even giving us pastries for dessert, which  we brought home, I have to say that the fries and the pastries were super good, but other than that, I have no intention whatsoever of going back to Canters. Next time I need a place for late dinner, I will look for the nearest IHOP so I can go with no big expectations!

Reviews.Author: Rik M.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!Been coming here since I was just a kid.Gotta stop on the way out and grab some sinful from the bakery. (Pastry, cookies, cakes, etc). You just cant beat this place for it's laid-back-good-food-no-attitude environment. Jeff was our server today: cheerful and like always never had to ask for anything. Woulda-shoulda-coulda mention the other servers, but today I took note for the Yelpy. All the servers are great! Kosher! Lets shlep to Canters!

Reviews.Author: Jeff D.
Reviews.Content: Words can not describe this place. It is a must on anyone's list to stop by and eat at. My family has been coming here for years! The mataz ball soup and the Canters Fairfax are the only two things I have ever go here.. The pickles are great....

Reviews.Author: The US Postals X.
Reviews.Content: No Messin'.

Reviews.Author: Samantha G.
Reviews.Content: The menu is absurdly big, but all you need to know is MATZO BALL SOUP. Or in the case that you're running a marathon in the near future and you need to carb load (or you just need to carb load, AMIRITE LADIESSSSS?), Mish-Mosh, which is just the matzo ball soup but now with 80% more carbs! They will also bring you a massive plate of pickles and bagel chips if you ask politely, because they care about you and they wouldn't let you leave with lower blood pressure than what you came in with. Speaking of blood pressure, definitely try the Fresser - it's got corned beef and pastrami because it's just too hard to make the call sometimes. I got 99 problems but deciding between pastrami and corned beef is now officially not one. If all this isn't enough for you, go ahead and get yourself some of the onion rings and a Mai Tai (I know I sound like a maniac, but the Mai Tais are really good here!), because you're already well on your way to cardiac arrest so, why not. There is this one waitress who I love and she's always saying things like "well, I'm not supposed to, but for you, I'll ask my friend in the back" and she brings us onion rings with a sandwich even though they technically can't do the onion rings with sandwiches. Bless that lady. One time a homeless guy came up to us just after we got our food and he asked my boyfriend for his food, so my boyfriend gave the homeless guy half his sandwich. The waitress saw that exchange and she had the kitchen make my bf another half a sandwich and wrap it to go, which was really nice but unnecessary -- even half a sandwich from Canters is a more than full meal for someone with a reasonable appetite.Also, they frequently have live music and other things (want some open mic night with your tuna salad?) in the bar, which is sorta fun. They're really hawking their affiliation with Guns'n'Roses via the Kibitz room lately, but it lends an air of debauchery and dim fluorescence that is very comforting to me. Parking is available for a small fee in the lot at the south corner of the block that Canter's is on, and god forbid you return to your car without getting at least 3 cookies out of the bakery case up front. I am a huge fan of the mini rugelach and the black and white cookies, but there's a cookie for everyone there. Except gluten free vegans, who should never set foot in Canter's anyway. Long live our noble Canter's.

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C.
Reviews.Content: Death by pastrami deliciousness! So I've been around Portland, San Francisco and Los Angeles looking for the best Jewish deli and this is undeniably my favorite one. My boyfriend is part Jewish so this was a must. We ended up sharing the Brooklyn style Corned Beef and Pastrami. The coleslaw made everything so juicy a perfect. Yumm it definitely was filling and so worth the drive. Even their pastry section was decked out. There were so many things that I had not seen before meaning that I definitely will have to make a second trip here another day.

Reviews.Author: B E.
Reviews.Content: After an hour and a half, I called to check on my order. I was told--after waiting on hold 2 minutes--it would arrive in 7 minutes. They were right. It arrived at 1:40 minutes. Ice cold. The food was so cold it was inedible. I called to complain--having spent $45--and was asked by the monotone woman if I wanted to speak to a manager. I waited another 5 minutes on hold before giving up. The food is mediocre. The service is abysmal. It is all overpriced. Order from any nearby merchant for better everything. This overpriced, over-hyped resto had it's day.

Reviews.Author: Winston S.
Reviews.Content: Love the 24 local spots, especially the retro atmosphere/historic spots.  After going to The Bazaar an hour earlier, and still feeling hungry, we had to find more food.Our server, Jason, was more than patient with us, as some were buzzed and indecisive on our orders.  We all changed our minds and I can understand how frustrating that could be.  I wouldn't wanna be our server, as I don't have the patience to deal with people like us, lol.I ordered corned beef and cabbage.  That was a huuuugggeee dish!  I loved the tenderness of the beef, they gave a whole potato(not very tasty), and a half head of cabbage.  I ate all of the corned beef and left most of the cabbage.  I had a lot of cabbage, but even my friends couldn't help put a dent in what was left.The onion rings were also very tasty and my buddy enjoyed his reuben.  I am here once every few years, but I want to come here more.Too bad my Israeli ex-gf flaked on me the last day of our relationship and ruin my plan of coming here for dinner in April, hence my decision to end it, lmao!

Reviews.Author: Lisa F.
Reviews.Content: Hi.I am compelled to write. My aunt, cousin, brother and I went to Canter's on January 27th. My aunt had fond memories of the place from her childhood and requested it on a road trip through LA. I imagine none of us will go back.The food is greasy, but I expected that. What I didn't anticipate was actually getting ill. We all got sick from the food. Serious vomiting. NASTY. I lost a couple of days recovering. So did the rest of my family. I feel awful about this. The place is so dirty. We also waited an eternity for the food. The waitress seemed high. For example, she added a glass to our table every time one of us asked for more water. It looked like 14 people ate instead of 4.And as for the pastries, skip them. They are nothing like the ones I grew up eating in delis in and around NYC. They are very "Hollywood." They look good, but lack taste. Tip: the rugalach in the bakery at the Mayfair on Franklin Blvd are amazing.Skip this joint, for real. Yes, even if you are hammered and nothing else is open. They need to clean it up.

Reviews.Author: Luu T.
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip here. The first was because of midnight cravings and had the pastrami rueben that was absolutely fabulous. Piled high with pastrami and the sauerkraut was not overwhelming like other places. My friend had the Thanksgiving dinner...it was so-so, it wasn't hot.Anyways this time we took our parents for our Saturday breakfast and they loved the ambience and the old feeling of the place.Our Italian server Anna was fabulous. She was really patient and she checked on us as we needed. There was just the four of us but we practically ordered for a small village. We had the pastrami Reuben, roast beef sandwich, waffles, buttermilk pancakes, matzo ball soup, vegetable soup, and one of the omelet specials. Everything was delicious, although we had so much food, we had to take the roast beef sandwich to go because the portions are big!This definitely won't be our last time coming here!!!

Reviews.Author: Chicagofoodie S.
Reviews.Content: So about a week ago to buy some desserts... The desserts looked like a bunch of stale cookies, so I tried the brownie and the employee gave us some samples of some cookies...one was a white sugar powdered cookie that was dry and tasteless...the other one looked like a macaroon dipped in chocolate that was so hard, I'm sure you'll break a tooth, and the brownie, yea not great, It definitely tasted like it had been sitting out for days.Last night my friend and I decided to go there and try the deli, thinking possibly they might be good on that side of the spectrum.  We sat down, the menu's were gross and dirty, among the rest of the restaurant.  I mean if that's what the front of the house looks like, the I cant imagine the back of the house!!! Yuck! We asked for two waters and the server gave us tiny baby brown cups. Okayyyyyy..... Then asked if we wanted pickles.... We said yes... He delivered a couple and they already looked old.  If you have ever been to a Jewish deli then you already know.  My friend tasted one and spit it back onto the place and said it was DISGUSTING.. If you can't get your pickles right, thenI wonder what there is to come. We told the server we changed out minds and walked out.THIS PLACE IS NOT WORTH GETTING FOOD POISONING!I would NEVER RECOMMEND anyone to eat here, AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!!

Reviews.Author: Arshag D.
Reviews.Content: As old school as old school gets.  The matzo ball soup kicks nazi butt.  The pickles are delicious.  The interior is VERY OG Hollywood, honestly 50's throwback to the max.Prices are not 50s prices though, but it's worth giving it a shot.  Or a corned beef sandwich, y'all!Mazel Tov!

Reviews.Author: Jay A.
Reviews.Content: Matzo ball soup for the win!!!Actually everything else is just fine too!From their desserts to their breakfast menu, it was all quite tasty.Got the soup and the corned beef hash breakfast.  Boyfriend got the French dip and it was delicious.One thing I would make note of.....if you come by around 10-12.  Sometimes there's band gigs going on.  So if you're ok with the extra noise then by all means come sit and stay.  There was a group that left cuz the noise from the band was a bit too loud for them but hey it's not for everyone.Anyhoo.....try their food and pick up some baked goodies on the way out.....so worth it!

Reviews.Author: Adolph L.
Reviews.Content: This place has a lot of history..... I think that's what you're paying for. The pastrami and corned beef is really good but man o man $17 for a sandwich? Service is pretty decent, and it is always clean. 1. The fairfax Reuben is a sandwich with a bunch of corned beef and pastrami on rye with sourkrout. It's good and looks intimidating but after finishing it I realized it wasn't that big of a bully. It has great flavor but its pricey for $16.50. 2. Avocado melt was sad looking, we had to ask the waitress to add more avocado. A tiny sandwich consisting of half an avocado, alfalfa sprouts and some other greens. $13.50- what a joke. 3. The pickles are really good. I don't care much for pickles but these get torn up. 4. The hummus sucks. I've liked this place for years but its too overpriced. I think I'll stick to Golden State across the street for a while.

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: Bad food. Dirty. Bitchy and lazy waitstaff. Bad service. And Expensive! Worst Pastrami sandwhich in LA.Tourists: don't believe the hype. This is NOT anything like a New York deli. Only go here if you are into S&M, and you are the M.

Reviews.Author: Jenny C.
Reviews.Content: Love their pastries. Have yet to try their food. But if your having sweet cravings you might wanna check it out. They have a ton of variety. Yummy! Look for Canters parking lot. 30 mins free w/validation. Otherwise, parking meters as well on street.

Reviews.Author: Alique B.
Reviews.Content: It's so hard to find a real old school deli. But Canters made it happen!The waitresses are really down to earth, they treat you like you're a regular whether its your first time there or not.The menu is extensive, the food is good. Nothing fancy, but its great if your searching for diner food that's clean, fast, and friendly.The prices are not so old school, but definitely worth a shot for a late night craving!

Reviews.Author: Dan P.
Reviews.Content: Order the pastrami on rye, anything else you're pressing your luck.  Brisket was ok, soup was ok, pastry or cakes were not that good to me.

Reviews.Author: Shalizeh D.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is a great spot for late night eats.  I tried their mac attack minus the bacon and it was DELISH.  Macaroni and cheese in a sandwhich, can you possibly go wrong? I also tried their chicken tenders with the honey mustard dressing and was pleased.  They are open late and in a good location that includes plenty of parking.  There is hardly ever a wait.  The servers are friendly and put up with a loud crowd late at night. Avoid Mels lines and come to Canters.

Reviews.Author: Matthew S.
Reviews.Content: I hate to give Canter's a 1 star rating but it deserved to be no stars. 20 years ago when I last ate here the food was incredible but now nothing is fresh, nothing. I first ordered eggs benedict, it was a cold untoasted English muffin with a cold slice of Canadian bacon, 3 poached eggs that had been poached much earlier then when I ordered them, the hollandaise sauce was thick cold and slightly green. I've had bad eggs benedict several times exploring new places but this was hands down the worst I've ever had. I complained and they let me order something else. I ordered the French dip, the beef was refrigerator cold and dry, the oju was warm but not hot. The waitress was very quick at taking our order and getting the food out but then never came back to see if we were ok or to check back to see if we liked the food. I waited 20 minutes for her then went to find a manager. You would think that after that she would give a little more attention to us but no after I got my French dip she never checked back. After 30 minutes of not seeing her she finally walked by and I asked for the check. It's pretty simple, fresh food is great, old food is not. In my opinion go somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Les L.
Reviews.Content: My appreciation for good pastrami and Jewish delis knows no bounds so I was anxious for my long awaited visit to Canter's.  We stopped by for lunch and were happy to see that Canter's has a parking lot that validates for 1.5 hours of parking.  It's tiny and we ended up parking nearby on the street instead.  Inside, we noticed how large Canter's is.  They have multiple seating areas and the room in which we were seated was barely filled.  It was trippy to see the 60's decor, Jetsen's like light fixtures, and rock floors. The Mish Mosh soup was a giant bowl of carbs.  The chicken broth had a giant, baseball sized matzoh ball in the center.  The matzoh ball was fluffy and had a subtle savoriness from schmaltz.  In the broth moat was rice AND noodle AND kreplach, which is a free form Jewish dumpling with a bit of ground meat inside and egg.  If that's not enough carb, there were also bagel chips, which I liked a lot since it added the extra zing from the bagel, whether it was onion, garlic or poppy.   The soup was really soothing and warm but hard to eat a lot of so this went around the table as we shared it.  The Pastrami Ruben was delicious.  The meat was very thinly sliced by machine.  I do think I would have preferred thickly sliced and with a more pronounced peppery crust but it was hard to deny that the pastrami was flavorful and tender.  The rye bread was less impressive than at Langer's (because at Langer's I always marvel at how good the bread is).  The sandwich comes with a big pile of fat fries. Their club is also a nice version.  It's very crisp with toasted bread, crispy bacon, and crispy iceberg and cut into perfect tiny triangles. After our lunch, we stopped by the bakery in front and picked up an apricot pastry, which was a little dry and stale.  The bear claw was better with tender pastry and lots of cinnamon.  With coconut macaroons dipped in chocolate, the pastries only cost us a little more than $5.

Reviews.Author: Rem R.
Reviews.Content: Out of all the times I have been in New York City I have never been to a Delicatessen before. So when I saw a 'Groupon' special $22 for $12 for Canter's I figured it was worth a visit. My girlfriend and I decided we would have lunch/dinner and drove from the South Bay to West L.A. very quickly. We arrived and were able to find 'free' parking in the Canter's lot just adjacent to the Delicatessen. Once you park you are given a ticket and when 'validated' parking is free. My girlfriend and I walked inside and I am not sure what I was expecting to expect. I was told many years ago by my mother never trust a restaurant that is open '24 hours a day' they can never truly clean it. This theory always made sense to me and still does. I did not notice that upon walking in Canter's didn't really smell like anything, it didn't have an intoxicating smell, it is just smelled 'bland.' My girlfriend and I sat down and the staff (i.e. waitress, busboy) all very extremely nice and fast with service. Our drinks orders were taken quickly. I ordered a chamomile tea with Honey, my girlfriend ordered water. Another one of my theories is never trust a place with too many items on the menu. When you have too many items on the menu, how do you really master everything? To me it is impossible. The menus were quite confusing so many different items to choose from. I ended up going with the Downtowner sandwich which was your choice of meat on Rye bread with Swiss cheese. I ended up going with Pastrami as my choice of meat. My girlfriend ordered the Corned beef sandwich on rye. For sides we ordered potato salad & coleslaw, we also ordered 'French fries' well done with no salt. The food came out quickly and having tried both the Pastrami & Corned beef I would say 'Ehhhhhhh,' I am not sure I would ever come back. Both my girlfriend and I ended up just eating the meat and leaving the bread behind, the sandwiches were HUGE. Do not get me wrong the sandwiches were good but I believe I could have got the same quality of meat pretty much anywhere. While we were eating our meals on several occasions I had to brush away flies, yes flies that were buzzing the tower (My ears). That goes back to my mother's theory of never trusting a restaurant that is open 24 hours. The French fries were another story, they were incredible. They were cooked to perfection. The fires were 'steak' cut fries and so crispy and still hot to the touch. To me that was the highlight of the meal.At the end of the meal the bill came and I was quite shocked to see that it was almost $40.00, I am sooooo glad we had our 'Groupon' to cash in on which brought the bill down to a more reasonable level. We had our parking ticket validated and we on our way back home. Overall I was glad that finally I got to experience a Delicatessen and that finally after living in Los Angeles for so many years that I got to experience Canter's. On the way out the door my girlfriend and I did take a look at the Baker section of Canter's and the items looked very yummy but we decided to leave without purchasing any dessert. My overall experience can be summed up like this after the meal and buzzing flies away from my face I do not think the words will ever come out of mouth of 'Hey let's go to Canter's.'

Reviews.Author: Tom W.
Reviews.Content: Guys, I am a native Angelino and so I'm totally biased towards anything LA given the amount of crap we take from anywhere outside of LA, let alone the East Coast!!!In this particular instance though, my review of Cantors is going to be anything but favorable. The place is just plain dirty , disgusting and outdated.  I've tried SO many times to give it a try and not be so picky but it's impossible. I cannot imagine management being so blind to not see how bad the place is, especially given the loyal following.  The reality is that LA is SO short on late night dining establishments let alone early morning eateries or traditional old school places we can call 'ours', that Cantors gets a hall pass of sorts. The service is inconsistent, the food is mediocre at best, and the service is horrific. It truly saddens me.In a city like LA old time traditional establishments are scarce by NYC standards, and I believe Cantors gets a HUGE hall pass of sorts because it's one one of the few old time traditional go-to places in LA. BUT, my hope and prayer is that they would give back just a smudge, clean up the place, modernize a bit, pump out decent grub besides pastrami, and begin listening to long time loyal customers that just wanna see a little improvement in how this beloved LA institution operates.My comments are meant with all of the love and respect that this establishment deserves, and for so many tears of tireless service! We hope u listen and we wish you nothing but success !Tommy

Reviews.Author: Derek T.
Reviews.Content: Half of pastrami and matzo ball soup is the best, go to, always happy, glad you made the decision, classic, complete meal to go for. Not tooooo full, just right, so good

Reviews.Author: Miguel C.
Reviews.Content: We were sat at a table with no server. So we were waiting needlessly for someone to take pur order. We had to flag down a waitress. She was delightful. Unfortunately the damage had been done. The meal was plain. Our waitress had to go on break and mentioned that another waitress wpuld chek up on us. That did not happen. I was thoroughly disappointed in the service, with the exception of one our original waitress. I will definitely not be returning.

Reviews.Author: Miles B.
Reviews.Content: After being told by so many friends, YOU HAVE TO GO TO CANTER'S....I gave it a shot.I was disappointed. I chose the Corned-beef Ruben. It was the size of any normal sandwich but for some reason was priced just under $20. Now I am willing to pay for a sandwich if it is going to feed me for a few days. For me it was too much for too little.The decor reminds me of great aunts house, or that rare family member who has plastic on their furniture.
