Everything here is definitely done traditionally so there aren't many surprises to be had, but I don't think I'm going out on a limb here when I say that if you're going to a Jewish Deli you are craving exactly the vibe this place puts down.STATS:Value:For my sandwich with coleslaw, and potato salad it was around 11.25, so it's a bit pricey but they give you more than enough, and I do think the quality is worth paying for.Likes:The pastrami (trying the other meats on my next visit) seesaw was tilted all the way up on the flavor side, and completely down on the greasy side. I will just say glorious and you can take it from there.Dislikes:The weird leaf tiled ceiling thing, for some reason it made me feel uneasy, but my complete fat boy devotion to my food when it arrived soon made me forget about my decor woes.In Conclusion:This place in my view is to be experienced, I think whether you're from the East coast Or west coast I'm thinking this might be a spot that you'd want to check out if for no other reason but to rank it in your personal Worlds best Delis list. Also this is a place that I find I will have to come and try again in order to perhaps cement this into a five star, the menu is giant but cohesive.DONE.

Reviews.Author: Nicoline C.
Reviews.Content: Still as good as it was the last time I was there, which was over 20 years ago.  Great Reuben sandwiches.  My husband had the pastrami sandwich.  I love their coleslaw.  Yummy.  You have to be a strong person to walk by their bakery counter.  BE STRONG!Parking is free up to hour and half.

Reviews.Author: Kristen J.
Reviews.Content: I am definitely a fan.  I make it a point to come here any time I make a trip into Hollywood.  Breakfast, lunch, or very late night; this place is FANTASTIC and much more than a simple deli.There is something to satisfy everyone.  Their menu selection is huge.  Everything I've had at Canter's has been  fresh and delicious!  Don't forget to ask for some fresh pickles to munch on at the table.  Their Matzo Ball Soup, served with bagel chips, is a classic.  Their loaded baked potato is a late night favorite as well.  I've tasted bits and bites of many other things from the menu and have enjoyed all of it.  Leave room for something sweet from their bakery.  The stacks of various cookies, cakes, and pastries will get you coming and going.The restaurant itself is simple and straightforward.  The decor, floor plan, and kitchen setup are all classic-diner.  I imagine the place did not look too much different when it first opened (maybe it was a little smaller).  The staff are a little rough around the edges, not too many bright and shining faces around this place, but they are not rude nor do they ignore customers by any means.  Flagging someone down is usually pretty easy.  Canter's is a delicious, round-the-clock Hollywood classic.  I recommend it over Fred 62 or Brite Spot in Echo Park.

Reviews.Author: Anthony T.
Reviews.Content: Always a great breakfast or late night stop. Usually once per week after work I will go, dine, then hit the deli and bakery afterwards to pickup a weeks worth of salads, meats & cheese's and great breads. I always start with cheese fries w/side of ranch and brown gravy. Then potato pancakes with extra apple sauce. After that, it's always a toss up of what to get. Always ask what the local fav's are!

Reviews.Author: Tom W.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is to most delis what In-N-Out is to McDonald's: incomparable!  Even with the enormous dining room, you may have to wait a few minutes to be seated, as popular as this place is.  Once you're at the table, it would be a mistake not to try the hot mustard.My earliest memory of Canter's was, oddly, horseback riding in Griffith Park.  The sponsors of the youth group had provided sandwiches from Canter's that contained so much meat I nearly went catatonic with overwhelming joy.  Happily, this has not changed.  The "bulging sandwich" is still a trademark of Canter's, and no matter what meat you choose, it will be delicious.When it comes to pastrami, there is one other considerably smaller yet just as well established deli that will remain nameless (located catty-corner of MacArthur Park; you know the place that I mean) that I admit serves better tasting pastrami, though they don't stack it as thickly as Canter's does (the only drawback to Canter's pastrami is that it is too lean, which detracts slightly from the flavor).  However, no one makes a better corned beef or roast beef sandwich than Canter's.  It ain't cheap, but you WILL be full after eating.What makes Canter's truly special for me is that they have an in-house bakery that makes, bar none, the best twice-baked rye in the world.  Another plus is the location, right down the street from Farmer's Market and The Grove, where you can walk off some of the calories you just consumed.  Dead center between West Hollywood, Beverly Hills and the Miracle Mile, you'll find hundreds of diversions for those who love to shop all around you.

Reviews.Author: Dick C.
Reviews.Content: Over-rated, over-priced and not enough food.The sandwiches were tiny.  Apparently, there are midget loaves available and served here.  The plates were smaller, which made the average-size sandwiches appear bigger than they really were; $14.95 for a corned beef and pastrami sandwich with 2 sides are a little expensive for what you get.Their "special" pickles... hmmm, not that special.

Reviews.Author: Raquel G.
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry but Canter's can do no wrong! Yes, their service is the best. Yes, the place always looks a bit dirty. Yes, it has dated decor and at this point you are wondering why I gave it 5 stars.I will tell you, because they have the best Roast Beef, Pastrami, Corned Beef, and steak fries in LA. Oh, and did I mention, you can get these lovely treats 24 HOURS A DAY! Yes, that is right, 24 hours a day!!! This place is an LA legend and deserves to be treated as such. If you are looking for LA lime light...keep driving. This is a place you make memories not babies!

Reviews.Author: Carlos W.
Reviews.Content: We loved it so much we may go back for seconds before our vacation is over!     I read the mixed reviews here before taking my BF to Canter's, but pressed on because I remembered it being really fun and good.  I'm glad i ignored some of you yelpers... it was even better than I'd recalled.  Not only that - almost every review here trashes the wait staff - we had an awesome, interactive experience with both the hostess, and our waitress, Fale.     Maybe the difference is that we went during the day.  We arrived at around 11am and it wasn't terribly crowded. I ordered the pastrami (more magical than jesus, as one reviewer noted!) and eggs with an everything bagel.  Nom Nom!!  My BF had the same with Corned Beef.  Both were excellent.Much thanks to Canter's and to Fale for contributing to a great L.A. vacation.

Reviews.Author: Mimi D.
Reviews.Content: Not a fan of the parking. But service was great. Manager was friendly & sweet. Bakery looked awfully tempting. Will be back.

Reviews.Author: K F.
Reviews.Content: I ordered a cup of vegetable soup which was ok along with a salami sandwich...I prefer packaged salami from dominicks/safeway better. The bread was ok. I tasted my friends pastrami sandwich which is probably the way to go when you come here. I thought the service was relatively quick and decent but I didn't like the feel of this place. Sort of felt like a dirty cafeteria you would find in a neglected nursery home. I wouldn't recommend this spot nor would I look forward to returning, though the bakery and pastries in the front look pretty good for ordering to go.

Reviews.Author: susan d.
Reviews.Content: Canter's pastrami sandwich has so  much more filling compared to other deli 's .it's always overwhelming . I like mine with Swiss cheese and Russian dressing on egg bread. I just love Matzo ball soup so I make it at home now , just follow the recipe in the 2 pkg  box of  Streit .  One pkg yields 6 Ping  Pong balls size that magically turns into 6 Tennis balls size .( Tip for fluffy Matzo balls ,roll balls lightly do not over handle) .Mazel Tov !Their  bakery  has a lot of selection for take home. Whenever  we go to Farmers Market on Fairfax , a stop at Canter's is a must.

Reviews.Author: R C.
Reviews.Content: Yah- I was being a tourist on my personal, restaurants from Curbed tour around LA and happened to be passing Canter's on the way from La Brea to LAX. I'd give 3.5 stars if I could but rounded up to acknowledge the awesome service we got from our waitress. The BBQ chicken was decent, fries pretty good and slaw really good. My friend had the Thanksgiving Dinner and was mostly satisfied but not really thrilled. It disappeared from his plate pretty quickly and he was full by the time he dug down into the stuffing, which he didn't like. The free parking was a nice surprise and the ride to LAX didn't take too long.

Reviews.Author: Trina L.
Reviews.Content: "Look to the black and white cookie!" Seinfeld references galore last nite at Canter's with my sister and her dude. That cookie was delicious and huge! I also got some pastries to go for my mama, aunt, and myself. But for the main course, I ordered the half sandwich special; hot brisket of beef with a bowl of matzoh ball! Delicious! I've never tried matzoh before that, but I was really anxious to. The complimentary, refillable might I add, spicy kosher dills were yummy! We had 2 plates of it... I'm sure we would've asked for more if we weren't stuffed to the brim with delicious carbs. The brisket was very tender and full of beef flavor. Gotta add spicy mustard to yr. sandwiches, always. That matzoh ball was full of flavor. I almost couldn't finish the bowl but I committed since it was too good not to finish, regardless of how full I was. Plus, gotta douse any soup with pepper; no arguments. Finally, we finished stuffing our faces, we paid our bill and went back to the bakery counter to choose our to go boxes. I chose the Russian Apple Coffee Cake, Open Faced Cheese Danish, and the Coconut Custard pastry for myself. That Coconut Custard was pretty damn delightful. I gotta go back to Canter's for the Mish Mosh! Nom nom nom I wants more!

Reviews.Author: David B.
Reviews.Content: This is not the place to go when a friend has expressed "hey , haven't you gained a few pounds".The desserts are worth ordering as your entree.Portions are Fred Flintstone sized.This place is convenient to the great off-Broadway style theaters on Melrose, future home of the upcoming "The Deep Throat Sex Scandal" at the Zephyr Theater.I will be making Canters my nearby outside office...love this place!

Reviews.Author: Joe B.
Reviews.Content: Pretty expensive, but so incredible.  And the vibe in there is just so great.

Reviews.Author: Shane R.
Reviews.Content: we stopped by before a lakers game on a friday night and the place was pretty empty.  they have a parking lot that has reasonable prices or you can park within 1-2 blocks in a residential neighborhood.got the corn beef sandwich.  it was tender, juicy, and had a strong flavor without the harsh edge that these meats sometimes have.  sauerkraut added a nice tanginess but not overwhelming.the phosphate soda is something unique.  its similar to an italian soda.  less carbonated and less sweet than a fanta.not a bad place at all.  i dont know if i would drive through all that traffic to get there again, but i would stop by if i were in the area.

Reviews.Author: Rick S.
Reviews.Content: I've loved this place for years. Always eager to go back. A great place to go on a whim in the middle of the night -- or any time! The food is almost always great (although the rye bread has been dry on a coupe of occasions). The bakery and deli are to die for.SIDEBAR: Years ago, my ex-wife and I (typical WASPs) lived in Jericho, NY, which was somewhere around 97% Jewish. One day our neighbor -- I think in friendliness -- told me, "You and your wife are very white bread." "That's true," I replied, "but I have a rye sense of humor. Badoom-boom!

Reviews.Author: Scott P.
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what some people are talking about... Jerry's is HARDLY a substitute for Canter's, AND it's (Jerry's) probably one of the most overpriced places in L.A....  But, that's another review.Anyway...  There's probably no place better at midnight or 4 AM for that matter when you're hungry.Me... Pastrami on Sourdough.  My girlfriend... Potato pancakes.Their prices are very reasonable, their food is very good.  On the weekends they even have a live music thing next door in the Kibitz room.

Reviews.Author: Kona Boy P.
Reviews.Content: Aloha:We come 2850 miles to start our L.A. time.Lox's plate and a Ruben for Sunday breakfast. "Best time". Take a pink box with you when you leave. This is one of those places where people come in sit down and the waitress bring out their food with out them ordering.

Reviews.Author: Torey B.
Reviews.Content: I'd never heard of Canter's the first time I went, although everybody told me I should have. And being a Guns N Roses fan, Canter's told I should have heard of them, too. Well, I hadn't and aside from the little signs that inform you that Axl, Slash and the boys practically grew up there, I still am not totally sure what makes this place so famous. Movie stars, perhaps?Nevertheless, the food alone could pass along their reputation. I've never had anything there that wasn't exactly how I wanted it to be. Nor have I been accompanied by anyone that didn't touch their food to their lips and have the moment immediately followed by a "Oh my god." It's delicious.My favorites so far have been the turkey philly, the cheese to veggie ratio was downright perfect and the turkey was that just-this-side-of-dry that you need in a chopped meat sandwich. Most recently I went for the roast turkey open faced sandwich. It's pretty much Thanksgiving on a plate. They also have complimentary spiced pickles that will have you asking for a second plate before your meal even arrives.The one star subtraction has to do with the price. Get a salad, a soup, two sandwiches and two beers and you'll easily have a $60 bill. But I guess if you're famous, you can charge what you want. Whatever. I go here when I feel like splurging. It's good food. The decor and the crowd are enough to keep you coming back. I'm sold.

Reviews.Author: Jess K.
Reviews.Content: I'm ASIAN and going to this place is a family tradition.  Every LA-er knows this place or isn't an LA native at all.  I always get soup (vegetable and bean and barley are both good) and a pastrami sandwich.  The baked bagels they give you instead of bread is amazing and I love Canter's pickles as well.Pros: Good Food.  I've spotted celebrities here and there and I love the neighborhood.  Cons:  Every time I've gone, the waitresses have been quite laggy and forgetful.  But who cares, it's Canter's!

Reviews.Author: Ryan C.
Reviews.Content: Forget what anyone else says this is truly the best deli in Los Angeles!  I've been to just about every deli in town over the years, and even though others like Roll n' Rye are very good, Canter's just does everything a bit better.  I generally always order the Corned Beef Sandwich on Rye if I go there for lunch or their lox and bagels or eggs and onions for breakfast (for dinner I'll leave it up to you).  I think they have the second best potato salad in town (right after Phillippe's) and make sure to ask for their pickles which are ridiculously great.  On your way out, make sure to pick up some rugula or chessecake from the bakery, and if you want the greatest toast in the world the next morning, make sure not to forget to buy their seedless rye!P.S. As much as I love this Canter's in LA, DO NOT go to the one in Las Vegas.  That'll be another Yelp review, but needless to say, Grandpa Canter would be rolling over in his grave.

Reviews.Author: Kiana M.
Reviews.Content: Simple, Good, Plenty of Food, Nice Service and reminds me of back east diners.  I use to go there every other weekend my ex and every we have ever ordered was good.I do not know about the bakery though, I have heard it is not that great.

Reviews.Author: Sean M.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is a favorite to me, but not because of its pastrami, no, its because of their pickles and fries, and thee huge menu. I have to say, sadly, that Langers has better pastrami, but in Canter's defense, they're better at everything else, and have things that Langers doesn't have, and its open all day:]

Reviews.Author: Lisa K.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is one of a kind... The only other place that comes close is Carnegie Deli in NYC.I don't know which I like better: the food or the atmosphere. This place is busy 24/7, and the after midnight crowd always makes for fun people watching. It's the 'must see' place for all my friends who visit from out of town. The corned beef is the best in LA, hands down. Doesn't matter if you want it lean, fatty or somewhere in between, it's perfection on a plate. Ditto for the lox and the latke. The wait staff is eclectic, ranging from aspiring actors to women in their 70s who have worked there for decades. Jeanne is my favorite, especially for Sunday morning breakfast. Her station is in the back of the main dining room and always filled with her regulars. The decor is dated. I think the last time the dining rooms were renovated was in the 70s. The main dining room has these backlit panels of trees that remind me of a really bad wallpaper choice for my childhood bedroom.The cashier's area is always clogged with customers, owing to the two lines (one for cash, the other for credit). Handwriting the credit purchases in a notebook is archaic. You can only pay cash at the bakery and deli counters... so if you have a credit card, you have to pay in the restaurant's credit card line. It's a total pain, but in a twisted way adds to Canter's charm.

Reviews.Author: Spencer D.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I love Canter's. It's the one place in LA I can go back to at least a couple times a month and never get bored. Probably the biggest draw for me is that there is always something weird going on. Not within the restaurant usually, but out on the streets, on the sidewalk and perhaps sometimes within the restaurant. I was in one Friday night when a man came in wearing only a cape... That made the whole night for me. As far as the food goes, it totally depends on your taste. I have tried a great deal of their foods and I can say that I've truly enjoyed most of it. (The one exception was gefilte fish which I hear is an acquired taste anyway.) Their corned beef sandwiches are very good and the rye they serve it on is usually also very good. The turkey is a little dry and lacking in flavor, but it's still pretty good.The soups, especially the vegetable and vegetable with whatever meat in it, are very good and I've tried a few of those as well. They go perfectly with a sandwich.By and large, my favorite food is definitely one of their desserts. The plain Cheesecake. It is the perfect consistency, the perfect temperature, and it's whatever size you want it to be (though they usually serve it larger than you'd anticipated). It is so freaking fantastic I will drive from North Orange County almost any day of the week to have it.The service... well, that's a hit or a miss. The people that take the money when you pay are usually in very poor moods. Some of the servers are also in poor moods time and time again but you can usually find a server that is super nice.And the pickles are awesome too! Can't forget those.

Reviews.Author: Teaghe Y.
Reviews.Content: I went in to Canter's the other day because it was late and almost everything else had closed. My friends and I were quickly seated at a booth. I could hear a band playing in the bar that sounded pretty bad, but it was quiet enough in the dining area for my friends and I to talk at a normal level, so that was easy enough to ignore.I thought it was pricey for diner food so I just ordered the matzoh ball soup. I got one giant matzoh ball in some yummy chicken broth and proceeded to steal bites from my boyfriend who ordered a french dip. He didn't mind though, because the portion was large enough for the two of us. Delicious but standard fare. Nothing exciting.

Reviews.Author: C H.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a couple of locals after a movie.  They were pretty persistent about this place's quality and I needed some confection, so we headed over.I was completely underwhelmed with the selection and up deciding on a chocolate/chocolate cupcake and my girlfriend got the chocolate vanilla.  Being a lover of cupcakes, who isn't, I waisted no time taking a bite out of that cupcake once we made it back.  I can only say a one thing about that cupcake.  I have never spit a cupcake out, but this came close.  It tasted as old as the place looked.

Reviews.Author: M.A. C.
Reviews.Content: Bitchy rude servers who act like they are such grizzled pros, but they can't keep a water glass or coffee cup full.  Better be prepared to order twice too.Maybe I'm not cool enough to 'get it' but at these prices you should do better than some premade corned beef strips for corned beef hash.Save your money and go to Golden State or Langers.

Reviews.Author: Linda B.
Reviews.Content: I love Canters!  This place is the best.  I'm eating an egg & onion bagel from there as I speak.  Delish!!  Canters is caught in a time warp and that a big part of the charm.  I love their pastrami & chicken soup!

Reviews.Author: Kate K.
Reviews.Content: If you haven't been, you should go at least once. One of the old school delis from back in the day; service sucks though so get ready for a wait and then some attitude.I had some fries, they were not so great, but my friend had the Reuben and loved every second of it.We also went after the clubs closed around 230a, so maybe that had something to do with the service? ;)

Reviews.Author: Terry S.
Reviews.Content: Great for sandwiches and deli-staples. This place is an institution here. Always busy,always consistent. Food is good, nothing outstanding and nothing bad.The sandwiches are huge and you can get pretty much anything you want with a huge selection of the typical deli components.

Reviews.Author: Matthew D.
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised it's taken me this long to get to Canter's (it being a 24 hour place), but I'm pleased I finally ventured over.First off, I love the atmosphere/decor.  The place was full, but it wasn't overwhelmingly loud.  I could have conversation and not feel like I had to strain to hear or speak.Second, the food was great.  I had the apple pancakes, and man did they ever hit the spot.  Really big portions too.  Three GIANT pancakes for a very reasonable price.Our service was TERRIBLE though, but I can't fault the place for one bad trip.  The waitress just did not care about us and couldn't have been more curt.  It also sucked that, even though we ordered meals, she only refilled my coffee twice (and to be fair, the first time she refilled it, it was about half empty).  I can understand that a lot of people probably come in there and just drink cup after cup after cup, but I feel like, if you've ordered a full meal, you probably deserve several refills.I really love that they have a private lot too.  The first 90 minutes are free, but what they charge you after is very reasonable.A comfortable 4 stars.  Not mind-blowing, but a decent place to relax and grab a bite at any hour.

Reviews.Author: Liz L.
Reviews.Content: Oh yes yes yes! ^ Is this the result of an orgasm or eating a Canter's french dip sandwich? IS THERE A DIFFERENCE? This place is deli-cious. Ho ho ho. Such a relief that this place is open 24 hours, great for times that I'm on a bender in tinsel town. The service I had last time was quick and friendly, the time before that was a bit slow so I guess it depends on who you get! Either way the waiters deserve a gold medal for dealing with the late night customers as most people there in the middle of the night are quite intoxicated. All the food I've had here is excellent and the pastries are yum. Go forth and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: Always Open, so whenever we can't decide where to go late at night in LA this is our fall back.Typical Deli food and although a bit pricey they do serve portions that are abundant.  French Dip, Pastrami, Potato Pancakes & Breakfast Hash are all A+Take a look around you may see someone famous (or infamous), Jimmy Kimmell came in with a group of 5 on one night when we were there.  From Punk Rockers to Grandma, you can find something for everyone.Skip the desserts and grab something from the Bakery Counter on the way out, again something for everyone!

Reviews.Author: Jessika J.
Reviews.Content: ...but id probably take my chances and eat there again one day cuz it was that good. 5 stars on taste1 star on digestion

Reviews.Author: Pac C.
Reviews.Content: Been going to Canters for almost 40 years, and I am young!!!!Love love love it..The best cheese bagels ever... Loads of great bakery choices.The sandwiches are stacked so high and so good.The decor hasn't changed & it shouldn't... It's perfect..This has become a family tradition for our Christmas breakfast bagels & lox.I have even run into my past classmates from Fairfax High there.

Reviews.Author: Aaron D.
Reviews.Content: I love Canter's!! I've been coming here ever since I was a little boychik. Delicious food, sometimes nice, sometimes sassy waiters/esses. Only thing is they should repaint maybe redecorate and get some better lighting. Other then that it's awesome!if you have never beenGO NOW.

Reviews.Author: Brian K.
Reviews.Content: With 1400+ reviews and being an LA institution, what's one more review!  Great food.  Great service.  And a sinful bakery as you leave.... how can you go wrong?If you never been to Canter's, try it out.  Prices are resonable.If you haven't been there in a long time, what are you waiting for?If you're a regular, enough said!

Reviews.Author: Nikki N.
Reviews.Content: My parents had their engagement party there. I grew up eating there and it's only a few blocks away from home. Love this place!

Reviews.Author: Tam F.
Reviews.Content: This Jewish girl begged her Mormon in-laws to try Jewish Deli for the first time ever. I hadn't been to Canter's since I was a kid (maybe 7 or 8) and the place still looks the same as I remembered it (the bathroom too) but the neighborhood has changed substantially.We arrived around 2pm on a Sunday to a relatively empty restaurant. The menu is huge and the in-laws (and husband) weren't terribly hungry since they had filled up at the hotel breakfast earlier in the day (I abstained) so they all ordered something small. Since I don't like a lot of standard Jewish fare, I pointed out certain things in the deli case (chopped liver, whitefish salad, gefilte fish, etc) and since the family has already had my matzah ball soup, they weren't interested in the giant softball sized ones offered here(plus it was HOT out).Our waitress was nice but definitely had the deer in the headlights look.  Soda, iced teas and water were ordered. I also ordered a Dr. Brown's cream soda (served in a bottle) and after that a black cherry one. The MIL had never had nor heard of Dr. Browns. She liked both A LOT. Pickles were put on the table and luckily since neither the husband or MIL like the taste of dill, the FIL and I had the pickles all to ourselves. I liked the half pickles better than the spears but they were both spicy. Since no one except for me was truly hungry, I did order kasha and varnishka's for a starter(something I knew was mellow enough for them to taste). It wasn't huge but enough to share and they all slopped the brown gravy on theirs while I opted to just have it plain. It could have been that Canter's was gearing up for Yom Kippur because this didn't taste as fresh as it should have. Yes, I could make it better and for you non-Jews out there, this dish is just (buckwheat oats and bowtie (or farfalle pasta) mixed together. My husband and FIL had hot dogs and the MIL had 1/2 grilled cheese sandwich and cold borscht. She also had a side of fruit that wasn't ripe and quite disappointing. I had a hot pastrami sandwich and thankfully it wasn't as big as my head (though I was a little bummed that it wasn't because of the way it USED to be...).The rye bread was great-and I took a loaf to go (put it in the freezer in the fridge at the hotel) and the pastrami was delicious.I would come back if/when I am in the area again, but have a feeling there might be another good Jewish deli to be found down in the LA area.

Reviews.Author: Mark G.
Reviews.Content: Good kosher deli, had matzo ball soup and corned beef and got the great taste I was looking for. Loved that I got to eat at Hollywood staple. If you like kosher food you gotta go here when in town, it will be worth it.

Reviews.Author: Andrea C.
Reviews.Content: Been around forever! There's a pickle factory downstairs and a bakery upstairs! We live right behind this place and go at least once a week now. Its a kitchen a way from our kitchen. There are always lots of characters and excitement late night at the Kibitz  room. The menu is huge and everything tastes "homemade." The people make you feel like you're at home. Also, you can get a cocktail if you want. Not typical for a "24 hour diner." A Hollywood staple, lots of history. Watch the full review with our recommendations here: youtube.com/watch?v=-9ze…

Reviews.Author: Albert G.
Reviews.Content: Use to go there back in the day and it use to be good and had not gone back since a report on the news showed how disgusting they kept Their food. Fast forward at least a decade later and decided to give it another shot. I regretted it! I think the place survives on  its old reputation. Food was below average and over priced for what you get. Don't bother going!

Reviews.Author: Kristen H.
Reviews.Content: $10/lb for the rugula (sp?) and cookies.  Not bad!  The workers at the counter were friendly and helpful.  They said their most popular item is the chocolate chip rugula.  I ordered a 1/2 lb of the chocolate chip, raspberry, and cinnamon.  Thought they were good but nothing noteworthy.  I'll be back for the cookies.

Reviews.Author: Bruce S.
Reviews.Content: Black & white cookies are my drug.

Reviews.Author: Doug M.
Reviews.Content: I come to LA about once a year and lately have been searching out family delicatessens for pastrami.  (I don't get to New York anymore).  On a recent weekend we ended up in Canter's twice because Langer's is closed on Sundays.  Canter's is huge - two spacious dining rooms not counting its bar.  Contrary to some of the reviews, the waitstaff was very friendly and helpful - especially since we had a lively four year old in tow.  Despite the voluminous menu, I only had two things (three if you count the pickles) - pastrami sandwiches and potato salad.  The pastrami sandwich is a more than respectable representation with a noticeably more smoky flavor than most.   The potato salad is a little soupy to my taste, but my taste likes Iowa-style potato salad and Canter's doesn't appear to do Iowa-style anything. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Author: Eric L.
Reviews.Content: pickles are good.. their pastrami's and corned beef is good.. and of course their breakfast foods are good (hard to go wrong with breakfast)But the last time i went.. i really enjoyed the french dip!  the meat is tender.. the sauce is tasty and warm.I got a fruit salad as well and it wasn't good at all, its just a bunch of fruit, cottage cheese and ton of salad lettuce below it.Summary: FRENCH DIP, and good after drinkin/partying place to grub at while you move from drunken stupor to regular consciousness

Reviews.Author: Olivia B.
Reviews.Content: It is what it is and I love it. It is nothing fancy and you will not find the best and most high class food there either but it makes up for it all in character and personality. It is perfect for a late night meal or cappuccino or pie or or or.... It is not pretentious at all which is very refreshing in this town. It is what it is, it is by no means perfect or ideal but i love it! And it just feels like a great place to just be. =)

Reviews.Author: Jenny K.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is a staple open 24 hours.  This was one of the only places we could find open at 2:00 a.m. on a Sun. night.  The place is old school.  Straight out of the 70's decor and the waitresses are super friendly and working a tough shift during late night.  The place has an eclectic crowd at that time of night (couples, cops, groups of college kids, trendy Hollywood-ites) but I thoroughly enjoyed it.  Had some good random conversations with others while waiting in the register line.Definitely keep this spot on your go-to places for late night eats in LA.  It's chill and although I only had a cup of coffee, the food looked really good.

Reviews.Author: Cookie E.
Reviews.Content: BEST potato salad you will EVER eat in your entire life.It is open 24 hours woo hoo!And the menu is ginormous.Drawbacks is the cold air that they blow on you so that you don't pass out drunk in your pastrami sandwich at 3am.And I kind of like the grouchy waitresses...  :)

Reviews.Author: Josh G.
Reviews.Content: They have free parking,And that's good enough for me.Twenty-four hours?  Sold!

Reviews.Author: L M.
Reviews.Content: Love that it's 24 hours and has free parking. Food is fine, nothing spectacular.  I always order the same ol' thing: Matzo Ball soup with those bagel crisp things and you get a plate full of pickles.  I usually go in the early afternoon--during the week and it's deserted by this time. Once in awhile I'll go at about 2am or whatever.  I like this place.  Nothing fancy about it.  Slightly divey.  I just read my newspaper while I eat here (if I'm alone) and it's just fine.  I love looking at the wierd leafy "stained glass" looking walls.  It's bizarre.

Reviews.Author: Wesley P.
Reviews.Content: So, I grew up on the east coast, DC.  Not known for its famous deli's like NY, but still just seems like deli's are better in general on the right side. I made my way to Canter's with two friends at about 3:30 am (its open 24 hours) after a night of drinking at a local club on a friends recommendation.  Once you enter you know you're in a legit deli.  The glass counters filled with typical deli stuff, smell of fresh bread and sliced meats.  I have to say we had a great experience.  I ordered a Ruben and fries, which was delicious.  The corned beef was lean enough and piled high.  The bread was toasted/grilled so I didn't notice the "west coast bread effect" so much.   Even though it was late they were pretty busy!  Our waiter was an interesting character, but attentive and good service.  The pickles were amazing!!!  I would guess this is one of the better deli's outside of your traditional good deli areas like NY and Miami.   It definitely has character and you can tell right away it's an establishment with a long history.

Reviews.Author: Brandice W.
Reviews.Content: Note: The food is not kosher, just kosher-style. With so much history and historic value to Los Angeles, you would think they would have kept it kosher, but alas, they serve B.L.T.s (and it's not turkey bacon). This is why it gets 4/5 stars.As said, interesting history, cozy and bustling establishment, great people-watching opportunities (especially late nights), and 24 hours. Los Angeles just doesn't have enough 24-hour establishments. The potato pancakes are good but not great, but the ruben is AMAZING. Just beware, don't expect to get the same ruben at the Canter's in Vegas; it's made differently. Also, the portions are huge! Very reasonable prices, and pleasant staff.  Parking (validated/free after-hours) can be crowded sometimes, but it's usually not a problem. If the parking is full, sometimes the parking attendant will valet, or you can park around the block. Take-out orders are made very quickly.

Reviews.Author: Mother L.
Reviews.Content: WOW and I mean WOW!!!!!!!The menu....wowThe food.....wowThe Deli....wowThe bakery.... double wow!!!!!NOW this place really does have IT ALL!!!!!Im speechless this place knocked my socks off.  Just try it there really is something there for everyone!

Reviews.Author: Liz A.
Reviews.Content: I go here at least once every two weeks. I looooove the cookies and raspberry rugalah. Parking is terrible on Friday and Saturday nights. I ordered a Tuna Melt once and when I bit into it there were pieces of plastic (that tasted gross). Unfortunately for me it was in the middle of the second part of the sandwich. The waiters are rude sometimes and if you ask them to bring you extra condiments they don't take it well. The actor/waiters tend to be nicer.I give it three stars because I feel it's part of the Canter's charm. It's totally old and very very cool.

Reviews.Author: Cy P.
Reviews.Content: When I think Canters... I used to think "That's that Jewish deli across the street from Cafe Nova Express. Now after Nova's closing, I think "THE TURKEY MELT! OH GOD THE TURKEY MELT!"... And then I begin licking my lips like a coke fiend on payday...Canters is one of my favorite restaurants of all time... Usually my late-late night recovery meal after clubbing with some friends. What can I say about Canters....... THE TURKEY MELT!!! Seriously, if you liked getting hooked up on the meat when it comes to sandwiches... THIS IS THE SANDWICH TO GET!... The pickles that we bring out as an appetizer are godly. In the six years that I've been going, I can honestly say I've never had one bad experience there. They simply know how to run their sh!t... and run it good!The prices are pretty good for the amount and quality of your food per person, nothing really over 10-12 bucks... Canters has always had no problem catering for me and my girlfriend or up to me and 15 other people. Size never seems to be an issue which is a big plus!!One more thing... BUY SOMETHING FROM THE BAKERY!!! Oh god, so delicious...

Reviews.Author: Matthew S.
Reviews.Content: Some words of advice as to how to look at Canters:If you stick to the things you should order at a Jewish deli, you'll be in good shape. If you order spaghetti at a Jewish deli, you're on your own. if you've got a set idea of what something is because that's how momma made it, you will probably end up disappointed, they're a deli, not a mind-reader. If you feel the compulsion to compare a Deli with haute cuisine, do us all (and yourself) a favor and don't go to Canters.*******That being said, this is some serious, un-fancy, comfort, Jew-food, and I love it for what it is.I particularly like the Fisherman's Folly #3, whitefish salad on a roll. The brisket sandwich is fantastic too. But mostly Canter's s great because it's consistent, it's never closed (literally), the pickles are delicious, and the service is great, they really do treat you like family, for better or for worse, just like real family.

Reviews.Author: Kendra R.
Reviews.Content: All of the pastries are incredible! But the RUGALACH are seriously to die for.Breakfast is cheap and delicious and the coffee tastes great. Definitely try to hit up Canter's whenever I'm in LA.

Reviews.Author: Andrea R.
Reviews.Content: Good deli. Good food, large portions. Sandwiches are overstuffed so I usually have the other half for lunch the next day. The corned beef and cabbage is good and so are their omelets. The cobb salad is huge. One weird thing - no chicken salad. I don't think I've ever been to a deli that didn't have chicken salad.I love it that they're open all nght. It's the perfect place to go after a concert or movie. They don't attract an obnoxious after hours crowd - or maybe they're just on their good behavior. No matter what time of day, you go, it's a good place to watch people. Even the waitstaff is interesting.

Reviews.Author: Eduard G.
Reviews.Content: Canters is amazing they have the best sweet potato fries in the city .They have a very warm and welcoming environment, Along with late night sweets. Does not get much better than this!

Reviews.Author: Megan W.
Reviews.Content: I love this style of deli. However, I don't eat land meat so, my order can be a challenge. But they did it just right. Veggie burger ruben style with swiss, craut, and canter's sauce (russian dressing). The rye was classic. I would give them top five best breakfast potatoes ever. The is no way you can exit without a bag from the bakery. The claim to fame is it's history of G n R ate here a good bit back in the day. But they don't need that.  The food, service, menu, speed, decor, etc, is right on for that type of spot. Down to the original stonefire dishware.

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: A 24 hour Jewish deli-whats not to love? I get the Corned Beef and only eat half so I can eat the other half later on in the day or later in the day. Whenever I'm hungering for a sandwich at 3:00AM I hit this place up. The pickles are phenomenol and wet. Rock and roll history happened here. In fact still happens here. So many story's abiyt this place. Make tthis place a stop the next time you hit LA

Reviews.Author: Sharon Y.
Reviews.Content: Old school deli.  If you want deli to go at the counter, be prepared to wait.  If you have the time, sit down and stay a while.  The drinks are cheap and the food is great.  Best matzo ball soup in town, stuffed cabbage to die for, and a fabulous pastrami sandwich.  Don't forget to pick up some rugelah on the way out.  They're open 24 hours and serve breakfast all day.  You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Author: Kym B.
Reviews.Content: The Matzo Ball Soup and Pastrami sandwich . . . nuff said.  It's reputation speaks for itself.

Reviews.Author: A H.
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I order from Canter's from time to time and have to finally write a review, not based on the food (even tho it is good), but because of the delivery guy, Fernando!  He is Awesome!!!  SO nice, had all the extra's that a driver should have when you ask for it, and fast!!!  He needs recognition because most delivery people go unnoticed.....give this guy a raise, cuz now I'm ordering just for the friendly face!

Reviews.Author: Frank V.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have been here several times. The place would have recieved five stars but the place and some of its waiters are a little run down. These issues are not bad enough to keep me from going again.  I have tried several items on the menu over the course of my several visits and my favorite would have to be the beef brisket melt.  Depending on the time of day you go you see some pretty interesting people. Also keep in mind during their busiest times if the parking lot is full you may have a difficult time finding parking nearby.  Twice we have had to park at a lot 2 1/2 blocks away. Canter's is one of those places in L.A. you have to try at least once just to say you have been there.

Reviews.Author: Julie D.
Reviews.Content: I've been here at least three times, so a review is due.I love coming here because their menu is HUGE!  Some of my favorite things to get are the pickles (a bit "stinky" but it's unique if you've never tried it), latkes, and matzo ball noodles and soup.  The food usually comes out pretty quickly, and it's open late.I will usually make a stop at the bakery up front on the way out -- their rugalas (sp?) are plentiful in varieties (apricot, raspberry, chocolate, coconut, etc.) and are spot-on what you'd hope one would taste.Parking is challenging... there are two small parking lots nearby that require a nominal fee, but sometimes they get full.

Reviews.Author: Rob A.
Reviews.Content: Patty melt and french fries. That is all. Oh, I'm sure everything else -- including those famous desserts -- is great, but when I come here it's for the patty melt and french fries. Don't talk to me, I'm eating.

Reviews.Author: Andrew L.
Reviews.Content: Horrible pick-up service. The man taking our order didn't know the menu and made ordering two sandwiches feel like pulling teeth. Then when we arrived to pick up the order, it was wrong. We ordered sweet potato fries instead of kettle chips and they gave us French Fries. Instead of fixing it, the man behind the counter (the same person who took our order), told us we were wrong and proceeded to argue with us. The good was mediocre. Deli pickle was gross. One bite and into the trash. The sandwich was average at best. I've been to good delis all my life. I know what a good deli experience should be. This was a bad one. I will not be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Kurt K.
Reviews.Content: I remember coming here 20 years ago after being out partying - and just thinking what an odd place.Fast forward to today.  This place is great - it is a place from a different time.   It is old school deli at the top of its game.I had a corn beef sandwich that I think was just about perfect -  the corn beef melts in you mouth.  I haven't had corn beef this good in years.  The rye bread had a great rye taste with a perfect hardness to the crust.  The waitress was great - she looked like she worked there from when this place first opened.  I do think this place is an LA institution.

Reviews.Author: Simply M.
Reviews.Content: Spent most of my 20's at this Hollywood staple after a heavy night of drinking.  Stoppped by after a meeting late night.   For Breakfast I order the Matzo Ball and a bagel w/the lox and cheese a cup of joe and a side of cottage cheese.  For lunch I always ordered a sandwhich, either pastrami on rye, french dip with the aujou sauce and a order of fries.  Good place to watch the old and the new may even spot a few celebs on occasion.

Reviews.Author: Ricardo R.
Reviews.Content: Food is good but very dirty establishment!! Felt weird eating anything!

Reviews.Author: MandA R.
Reviews.Content: Ok let's start by saying I know deli food.  I've lived in Miami, eaten at most of the big names in NYC and always skip it in the South & Southwest.So I wanted to try the premier deli in LA.  On Monday 2/1 I got my chance as we drove there and found free parking. (in their own lot !) Got seated wth my wife in a far back 2 seater booth overlooking this need of refurbishment establishment.  Has anyone noticed the different shades / colors of orange vinyl from the many decades of booth re-covering ?  It's pretty sad.  Or retro maybe.Handed 2 menu's by a very professional old school type of waiter and asked for some pickles while we perused the huge menu.  In pure M.O.T. fashion, we ordered :1 Bowl of Matzoh Ball soup  $6.251 1/2 Corned Beef Sandwich $6.001 Lean Pastrami Sandwich $11.501 Dr. Browns Diet Black Cherry $2.50The soup was ok.  The broth was light with a light chicken flavor, but the balls were quite firm.  Forget fluffy, think "B" actress boobs.Our sandwiches tasted good, though that's definitely a LA version of Rye bread.  Typical hard crust, but a kind of chewy bread.... Plenty of meat, I suspect  2/3 a pound, but certainly less than the Carnegie Deli's 1lb belly busters.My wifes Corned Beef was lean and she liked it fine.  My pastrami was tasty, yet had an unusual hickory flavor coming from the meat.  Good, but not customary.Tried the free Green Pickles, which are the sour variety and not the tart green ones you usually get.  Almost got an egg cream but you can't go wrong with a Dr. Brown's Diet Black Cherry.Though the prices are 10-15% less than the #1 rated Carnegie Deli, but so is the quality.  As usual, I'll pay more for real NYC experience !Worth going to if you can't be in NYC or Miami anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: D H.
Reviews.Content: Another overpriced, over hyped LA  eatery. I used to be a big fan but the price and quality of food kept wearing on me.I give it 3 stars because the bakery. Otherwise it's a 2.

Reviews.Author: Andrew G.
Reviews.Content: Went here for the first time and I gotta say, I'm a believer. The got some of the best pastrami around, not to mention a fine assortment of mustards. Now as for the bakery...it's simply a revelation. You can't go wrong with whatever they are baking behind their counter.

Reviews.Author: Adam S.
Reviews.Content: Simply the best deli in the city.  Great at any time of day or night.  The pastrami is amazing.  In my opinion, better than Langer's or anywhere else.  The lox... I don't know where they get this stuff, but it's pure manna from heaven.  Some of my favorite stuff at Canter's is the stuff you wouldn't expect.  The fruit cup for instance.  Just the most delicious bites of fruit you've ever had, all in one dish.  I'm not alone in noticing this-- last time I was there, I saw an article they had on the wall from Los Angeles magazine talking about how they pick their fruit for the fruit cup.  The french fries are another one- not greasy, and the perfect mix between crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Dip it in a side of russian dressing and you've got my favorite meal.

Reviews.Author: Moose A.
Reviews.Content: Well, I tried going here again. Figures it would be again on a Late Saturday night, and again some horrid band was playing their really bad version of 80's rock and some 70's rock.But the food came out really quick this time and the Waitress my wife and I had was not only pleasant and helpful, but she was hustling to take care of everyone else around us and keeping my drink filled (usually my biggest peve is when I am thirsty and I have nothing to drink).So Canters gets an additional star cus they seem to be stepping up their game!Good for you guys.... now, get rid of the crappy bands or put in some sound proof glass or seal off the pub you have there, then you might get a full 5 stars plus I would eat there more often.

Reviews.Author: Feras H.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is the best late-night treat you can possibly find in LA (so far). I was introduced to this gem by one of my friends, and one bite out of the Matzo Ball soup and Reuben Pastrami and Sauerkraut sandwich totally won me over. However, I wouldn't recommend ordering more than one item, because the portions are very filling.What's also cool, is that there's a local band that plays next door, and of course we dipped in once done with our meal. It's pretty cool to see a delicatessen that actually does good by promoting local talents!

Reviews.Author: Victor M.
Reviews.Content: Had the bacon cheddar burger w fries here w my bro. burger was a-ok NOT the best burger ive had but NOT the worst i can say its better then dennys or norms LOL but yeah im not CRAZY for it.anyway, good size buger w decent taste, bacon was yum came with some steak fries that my bro stold most of *doh!* service was goodtoosat in the bar and had fun with the juke box before my meal came. *pretty good music selection!*not a bad place to eat at but theres alot of good places to eat in the surrounding area.

Reviews.Author: Debora A.
Reviews.Content: For anyone who misses the cooking of their old Yiddish Mama, this is the place to be.  They are always generous with their portions and one feels right at home whenever they enter here. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Author: Shelley C.
Reviews.Content: I had long heard about the glory of Canter's, but because I don't frequent these parts, I had not yet experienced it for myself--until this past week. Boyfriend and I were starving after a concert at the Wiltern and he suggested Canter's. I had the pastrami sandwich, he had cornbeef hash with eggs and we ordered sweet potato fries as well. I ordered the fries because the sandwich came alone; prepared to eat my weight in food, I foolishly thought the sandwich wouldn't be enough. The sandwich was FAT. And delicious.Overall, the boyfriend and I left very satisfied; the food is really good and the huge portions are almost worth the price tag. It's not unreasonably priced but perhaps a bit more expensive than I would have liked. Again, though, there's no chance of you leaving remotely hungry. The only other thing I would note is that the service was mixed; our waitress was very nice and attentive, though the hostess and cashier didn't smile once and seemed aggravated by our existence. It was midnight, though, so I suppose I wouldn't be too thrilled to be working then, either.

Reviews.Author: Mr. W.
Reviews.Content: I ate here a month ago. My sandwich (salmon lox) arrived quickly. Unfortunately that's the only good thing I can say about the meal. The bagel was untoasted, the sandwich came with no sides, the onion slice was like a half-inch thick, and with a soda I ended up paying $20. Bottom line, this place is resting on its bygone laurels from the days when it served late-night meals to drunken Guns n Roses groupies and, on occasion, the band itself. Go here when you're drunk and don't care about the quality of food. Otherwise, you might be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Barbara W.
Reviews.Content: It is what it is - an old time "kosher-style" deli.  We had 9 people at 7 pm on a Thursday night.   The restaurant was selected by another in our party.Service was excellent.  The food was just ok.  My husband was disappointed that a corned beef sandwich consists of nothing but corned beef and bread.  Lots of corned beef, and he liked that it was lean, but couldn't they provide just a little side of coleslaw?  I had eggs, onions and lox, with a bagel and potato pancakes.  It was fine, though the potato pancakes taste like they are made from mashed rather than grated potatoes.  Others in our group seemed reasonably happy with their food.  I wouldn't go again.

Reviews.Author: J C.
Reviews.Content: This is CANTER'S.  You don't mess around with Canter's.  In fact, if you come here, like, to visit, consider yourself lucky.  : )  THANKSGIVING DINNER EVERYDAY!  WHAT!?!  That's freakin' awesome and I don't even eat meat.On the real though, this may not be your mom's homemade chicken soup and stuff, but it's SOMEbody's mom's recipe.  One bite and you almost feel like you're at that lovably-grumpy-lady-who-took-your-order's house.  (I just wanna giver her a big kiss on the cheek.)

Reviews.Author: Bridgette R.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. I can't believe it has an average rating. The best thing to purchase is the pesto garlic pasta along with pastrami on rye. Barley soup is quite awesome as well.Most the deserts, of the delicatessen, are made on the premise. Apple streudel crumbles in your mouth. New York style cheesecake is freshly made.This place has been around forever; I believe this is a testament to the food quality.

Reviews.Author: Ziad A.
Reviews.Content: I thought LA had some of the best Jewish Deli's...in this particular case, I was dead wrong.I decided to give Canter's a try after friends would rave about the Jewish deli's they visit in LA. I got the French dip, which is a roast beef sandwich complete with a dipping soup/sauce. The sandwich was okay but the soup/dip didn't taste like anything. You can do without it. We also got a side of hummus because I have to get hummus everywhere I go. What a huge letdown. It wasn't as much as I expected and the pita bread it came with was way below par. At the very least you should toast the bread even for half a minute before you bring it out of the fridge! The food came out to be around 25 bux for me which is pricey for a sandwich, fries, hummus and a tip. The atmosphere was nice and the waiter was EXTREMELY friendly which is why I awarded this place an extra star.BOTTOM LINE: If you're ever in LA and you want to eat at a Jewish Deli, just skip this place. I'm sure you'll find waaaay better for waaaaay less.

Reviews.Author: Robert S.
Reviews.Content: Terrible food.  $12.00 Pastrami last time I went and it was served cold.  Canters monitors the Yelp reviews like a hawk, so don't even believe the 3.5 stars.  They were so furious about my review after my meal last time that they demanded to Yelp that they take my review down.  Yelp unfortunately for their own credibility complied.Canters isn't a good delicatesson.  In the past they have had so many health code violations that it was a reporter back in the 1990's writing about Canter's violations that spurred Los Angeles to create the "A through D" ratings.  Thank god.Look, I love deli food and this place in my opinion is not a good choice for someones money.  I hope this helps.

Reviews.Author: Patty O.
Reviews.Content: To explain 4 stars, the prices.  That is why they don't get 5 stars.  I do not like the idea of not giving 5 stars, but COME AWN with the prices.They have bakery stuffs, deserts, breads, bagels.The main attraction are the brisket sandwiches, pastrami sandwiches, and corned beef sandwiches.  They offer great rye bread (I hate rye, but like theirs) and rolls for a buck extra.  They keep three types of mustard on the table.The menu is large, but most offerings are the same cut of beef prepared or plated differently.  This one with swiss, this one with pepper, this one with mustard, this one with fries, etc.Potato knish was good and warm.The sea of thick framed glasses upon arrival was snort worthy.

Reviews.Author: Heather W.
Reviews.Content: Canters Deli, is a long time, Los Angeles- land mark in the heart of the Jewish hub of Los Angeles. The deli food is always fresh, always served with a smile and they are open until all hours of the night and am. It is the place to go for many who work in the entertainment industry. Service is great and always packed! The staff is used to serving large groups of people and the food, again? Excellent!Thank you!

Reviews.Author: Tessa M.
Reviews.Content: i liked this place a lot more than i thought i would. you walk in to see a bakery on one side, walk a little further and there's a dining room ahead and a bar to the other side.i expected mediocre deli-style food, hopefully for only a mediocre price.our server was friendly, but very slow, so that was disconcerting also.however, i ordered a turkey sandwich on jalapeño bread (i don't remember what it was officially called) and when it came, my whole view turned around. first of all, the sandwich was HUGE and secondly it was DELICIOUS. it was creative and i couldn't even finish the whole thing!

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: Not quite as good as I remember, but the desserts where great.

Reviews.Author: Destiny C.
Reviews.Content: Ordered lunch for me and a coworker. SUPER FAST delivery. Delicious sandwiches. I didn't like the pickles, but whatever. Will order from again!

Reviews.Author: Heather F.
Reviews.Content: I go to Canter's Deli often, not only because it's open late but because they make the best vegetable beef soup!  I like it better than the matzo ball, and the barley.  They also have exceptionally good dill pickles, and pastrami.  Giving it 3 stars because the beer battered onion rings kind of suck, and they charge for condiments on your sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Anthony D.
Reviews.Content: Pam, the manager and bitch, gave me attitude when confronted about charging me for rotten food.

Reviews.Author: Marjorie U.
Reviews.Content: Love their Pastrami and Matzo Ball soup! Perfect cure for a bad hangover. Open very late at night. They have a bakery when u walk in and a deli counter. You can't go wrong with their sandwiches. Their servers will even recommend you their favorite so don't be shy, ask. ;P

Reviews.Author: Jonathan C.
Reviews.Content: If I could give it more stars I would. They have something for everyone to enjoy. I came here with 7 of my friends and everyone enjoyed their food. I couldn't stop staring at my panini because I fell in love with it. If the food doesn't make me come back (which won't be a problem) the service definitely will. Awesome experience recommend it to everyone

Reviews.Author: Dave T.
Reviews.Content: My wife raves about this place, but I wouldn't say it was the best place in the world. They have good food but the staff aren't all that friendly and the food was often greasy. Nice to have a free (validated) parking lot next door though.

Reviews.Author: JD R.
Reviews.Content: Best 24 hour joint in the universe. I had the Pot of Chicken and it was absolutely fantastic. Huge! Brought home the leftovers and had 3 extra meals. At $16, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Author: r m.
Reviews.Content: I used to go to Canter's after a night of clubbing and it was consistently great.  You'd see lots of cool people just eating at 4 in the morning, and I even met Prince on the staircase to the bathroom.  But I went there last weekend after a several year hiatus and boy, was I disappointed.  Gone are the beehived waitresses who call you "hon" and who you know have worked there forever.  The pastrami sandwich and matzo ball soup were good enough, but my friend who had a vegetarian sandwich had to pay $5.75 for her matzo ball soup.  What a ripoff!  Mine was only $1.50 with the 1/2 pastrami.  Our waitress was a sullen young girl, no personality, and pretty bad service.  We practically had to beg for water.  I certainly would not go back.  And the parking is a nightmare.  But we did see Rodney Bingenheimer as we left.  At least some things don't change.

Reviews.Author: Sean J.
Reviews.Content: I have loved Canter's since my grandfather brought me there as a little boy about a million years ago. I have been probably a hundred times after drunken Hollywood adventures. Now, I always stop in whenever I am in town and always leave with some great bake goods. Normally the cheesecake, the racetrack cake and some other selections. Always great. Well, I just got back from LA and bit into my racetrack and I just have to say...THIS CAKE COULD ONLY BE MADE BY THE HANDS OF AN ANGELIC BEING. Seriously. Everyone in my office takes a bite, stops and just says "WOW." I always knew the racetrack was great, but for some reason I just had a Jewish deli religious experience.

Reviews.Author: Luis C.
Reviews.Content: I believe that atmosphere can help a restaurant overcome its culinary shortcomings, and this place has atmosphere in droves. It's open 24 hours, almost always filled with characters (check out the waiter rocking the Kramer), and the adjacent bar is always rocking. The food is what one might call "expensive", but for an L.A. landmark, I'd say it's decently priced. As far as taste/flavor are concerned, it's what you'd expect from a diner that's open 24 hours. Oh yeah, grab a pastry/cookie/sweet from the bakery on your way out. Check it out

Reviews.Author: Scratch B.
Reviews.Content: I love Canter's! Matzo ball soup is the best.Always interesting people and always an event.Not as greasy as Katz in NYC and not as noisy.

Reviews.Author: jessica g.
Reviews.Content: I ordered eggs Benedict. the whole thing was very wet and  sloppy. I am very sure that the holandese sauce was made from corn starch rather then eggs and olive oil. Service was fast and friendly. Nice atmosphere  for a late night snack. Boy friend wanted a Steak, but no steaks on the menu. I AM NOT SURE IF ITS A JEWISH KOSHER THING OR NOT.

Reviews.Author: Ricky Y.
Reviews.Content: GREAT place to stop by and get (what else ?) but a delicious Pastrami, Corned-beef, or Pastrami n' Corned-beef, on rye, with chicken matzoh-ball soup, ANY time of day !My suggestion:  stick with the signature Pastrami and Corned-beef and forget the mish-mash combo-whiches that can be a bit overbearing.  Couple your sandwich delight with a bowl of Chicken + somethin' soup, and wash it all down with a Dr. Brown's Cel-ray or Black Cherry soda.Oh yeah -- Breakfasts are perfect at Canter's, also ANY time of day!Eat n' Enjoy!  I sure have, for about 45 years now --

Reviews.Author: Peter B.
Reviews.Content: That's right, you saw it correctly, only 2 stars. I don't know... this place might have been great once upong a time, but now it is a relic from the long gone glory days.Fairfax... yeah, dirty, grimy, dingy.You walk into this place and promptly greeted. We happen to have been ushered into the other room. Felt like "yeah, for those who don't know any better" and seated right next to the wait staff area. The place was practically empty so you seat us in Steve's section cause he could not catch a break all day?Kreplach soup - a disaster! Grimey looking broth with what?! Kreplach stuffed with chicken?! Who ever heard such a thing? Kreplach are large, puffy pillows of pasty filled with groud beef, not chicken! Not only that, I swear to you it had maybe a quarter of a teaspoon of filling, the rest was this thick, chewey dough, WTF?!Yeah, I know, you don't go there for the soup right?Had me a half sandwich of pastrami. The waiter actually asked me if I wanted it with rye, like there is any other way to eat a pastrami sandwich. That's right I am a puris, this is my review so go write your own if you don't like it.The pastrami was OK, and by OK I mean it was just that. It had a nice bark on it, but the meat itself left much to be desired. And the side of coleslaw had a hair in it. I was so over this place before I was done eating that it wasn't even worth the effort to complain. Honestly, Langers has this one beat with one hand tied behind their back.Go to Canter's for the nostalgia effect, don't go there to eat.

Reviews.Author: Arrick S.
Reviews.Content: Don't expect great service, you won't get it. Don't expect a cool place to chill, this ain't it. The tables and seats suck.You shouldn't even expect them to get your order correct. They will likely forget pickles, cheese or a requested condiment.What makes Canter's win for me comes down to the corned beef and pastrami. Oooooh redic! That's it. That's what they do well. If you are having a meat craving, this is a good place to address it. Just don't come in here expecting much else. Parking generally sucks and you're sure to get hit up for spare change walking in or out.

Reviews.Author: Tara M.
Reviews.Content: Canters is not for everyone. It is a traditional place that either you grew up with, or grows on you. The staff is not going to kiss your butt, or pull your seat out for you. Your not going to get fancy dishes, or cloth napkins. What you will get is good, solid deli style food. I recommend the Fresser, the knish (w/gravy), sweet potato fries, or any other "traditional' deli food. This is not the place to order spaghetti, or any other off topic food. It's a bit pricey, but in line with other LA deli's. The bakery is awesome and surprisingly reasonable. Make sure you get a number before getting in line at the bakery or deli counter. It is best to have some cash on hand as the process will go smoother. You can use a debit/credit card, but you will have to get your bakery slip, go to the register, pay and then go back to the bakery...kind of a pain. If you have a big order, it is best to call ahead. Over all, it is an LA staple and worth at least one trip!

Reviews.Author: Lane K.
Reviews.Content: Another legend of Los Angeles, this 24 hour Jewish deli is simply the best.  You must have the matzo ball soup, you must eat a pastrami sandwich and you must eat plates and plates of pickles. You must.

Reviews.Author: Alex S.
Reviews.Content: Horrible. Dirty. Old. Stay away

Reviews.Author: Richard K.
Reviews.Content: Good service and the hot pastrami was good. I will comeback only if they have a groupon deal. A little to pricey for me.

Reviews.Author: Carlos M.
Reviews.Content: Had dinner there tonight.  Had the roasted chicken dinner, with corn, mashed potatoes, salad, and chocolate ice cream.The chicken was dry.  Potatoes came without butter or gravy.  When I asked for gravy, they only had a beef gravy.  Sorry, mashed potatoes require the correct gravy.  Salad was okay.  No choice of dinner rolls, so got stuck w/ 2 pieces of wheat bread.  They served a tiny scoop of ice cream.  Corn seemed to be fresh off the cob.I've been to similar restaurants as CANTER'S and have had better.  It's good in a historical sense, but you're better off going to JERRY'S DELI instead.

Reviews.Author: Mitch C.
Reviews.Content: Love it

Reviews.Author: Khalid N.
Reviews.Content: Doesn't get much better for corned beef sammie. Friendly and open all night to boot.

Reviews.Author: Jillian T.
Reviews.Content: Canters is my favorite place. They're open 24 hours. Check. Breakfast served all day. Check. Food is awesome and the service is wonderful. Check check. Thank you I love you!!

Reviews.Author: T L.
Reviews.Content: Ooh, yeah I don't know about this place...The onion cheese bread--that was yummers. But the eggplant parmesan and spaghetti? Highly suspect. The eggplant was rubbery and submerged in a runny marinara sauce. The spaghetti was undercooked and lying in a puddle of that same runny marinara sauce. I thought it was just my dish, but Paul's breakfast wasn't looking too cute either.Perhaps nothing looked appetizing because of the awful yellow lighting? It was around 3am and I was half asleep, but I remember thinking, "I want to open my eyes... but why is it so fucking yellow in here?!" You'd be surprised at how difficult it is to eat and squint at the same time.

Reviews.Author: George T.
Reviews.Content: Cannot beat the pastrami sandwich anywhere in Las Vegas.   It is delicious.   The potato pancakes could use a little more crunch.   The soups are wonderful.   Overall I recommend this place especially if you feel like a pastrami sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite spots in LA. It is to me another Los Angeles landmark. With a huge selection of sandwiches, salads and deli specialties, you can find something for everyone at Canter's They make some decent breakfast dishes, but I always get a sandwich, it is hard to resist. If you are in a hurry, call ahead and pick up something from the deli counter. Wanna just grab something sweet, check out the bakery counter and take something home. If you are coming here for some late night dining, you may even want to pop into the Kibbitz Room next door for a drink and some live local music. Overall, this is my go to place when I want a good sandwich or simply when I cannot figure out what I want to eat!

Reviews.Author: Karey R.
Reviews.Content: Pastrami. This is why you go to Canter's. You do not come here for a F'ing turkey sandwich and then give them 3 stars. Pastrami. Canter's has mouthwatering pastrami and it is THE best pastrami sandwich anywhere. Yeah....I said it. I've been to Katz pastrami and I still say Canter's is better. So anytime we are in the area, my husband and I call up Canter's and get 2 sandwiches and an order of fries (the thick ones....yeah baby) and we take it home. You can put half of it in the fridge and the next day you are golden! It never fails that I am the one to jump out and go to the counter to pick it up and some schmucks are ahead of me debating what to get, "I don't know Bob...how 'bout the turkey?" "Well Jim I was thinking Matzo Ball soup" GIMMIE A FRIGGIN BREAK. Pastrami.

Reviews.Author: fran d.
Reviews.Content: oh canter's you thought you could escape the reviewing clutches of the franmeister, didn't you? well no!i don't get you. i don't particularly think is an east coast slash cultural thing. are you trying to achieve the rudeness of a new yorker? cause you certainly do succed at it let me tell you. how about vying to tip the price per goodness ratio in your favor? you certainly achieve that as well.your food isn't good. it has no soul. your place is crappy looking. no ambiance whatsoever. your prices are too high and frankly, your pickles aren't all that good.so there, i said it. get over yourself. your only saving grace is that you're open late and my taste buds are numb as my defenses are down when i visit, so i am able to eat anything you serve and withstand the crappy service you provide.

Reviews.Author: Brian I.
Reviews.Content: Canters is a landmark, a famous Jewish delicatessen, and it is worth the visit.   My first visit was on November 01, 2009 and I've been there about 5 times by now.  Last night I went with a friend, who I've been to Canters with twice.  Last night we had a really cool server who paid attention to us, who joked with us, who made good suggestions, who gave us a little history on the place, etc.  He was very kind, personable, and funny.  Some days I've had so-so service, but he was so good to us that we tipped him about 25-30%.  It made up for the table of two who didn't tip because they probably came from a country where tip is included in the bill.  You get a side of pickles to snack on. I never get excited about pickles until I got to Canters!  Last night I debated on a Reuben sandwich and Corned Beef with Cabbage.  Reubens are my favourite sandwiches and I went with it; I"ll have to try the other one the next time.  He suggested I try the pastrami and that was an excellent choice because I usually have corned beef and that's my standard.  The Reuben at Canters is excellent and of all the ones I've tried, this is the best.  The rye bread is nice and firm.  It has a lot of meat and for $13.50 it better have a lot!  I liked the Reuben with corned beef, and this Pastrami is really good.  I'm glad our server recommended I try it instead.  The sauerkraut seems to have been drained, so it's not wet.  Also the sandwich held together really well--bread and all the contents--(bread usually gets so soggy it falls apart, but this one...is a great sandwich!).  Instead of potato chips, I paid $1 extra for the fries.  Their sweet potato fries are good, too, but that's $2 extra.  I had to take my other half home because I was so full!  The atmosphere is great.  The ceiling has a glass kaleidoscope-autumn tree tile pattern going on, which is really pretty.  I'm not sure how I feel about the fake plants that I'm sure doesn't get cleaned too often.  I joked with our server that the plants looked thirsty so I threw my water in it (since he refilled my water many times).  They have pictures and old newspapers up on the wall.  There's plenty of seating.  I wonder if I'd see someone famous here.  Oh I forgot to mention this place is open 24 hours!  That's awesome.  They have a large menu and most of their items are medium priced.  They do take credit cards.  They record transactions in a book by hand.  And they have a bakery!  I try new things and yeah, I have a sweet-tooth.  Canters has been a good experience for me each time, and what topped it off last night was the service.  5 out of 5 Stars.

Reviews.Author: Holly W.
Reviews.Content: Conceptually, Canter's is, quite possibly, the best restaurant ever.  24 Hours a day / 7 days a week, it serves 7 major purposes for those living in Los Angeles, and serves them well.  And for that, it earns a coveted 5th star.  Purposes are as follows.1. Bakery2. Breakfast3. Lunch4. Dinner5. Dive Bar (the Kibitz Room)6. Drunk snacking7. Sobering up (due to blinding fluorescent lights)At any hour of the day, you must try the Pastrami Reuben, and you must get an extra side of Russian dressing.  A 3-inch thick brick toasted on Rye, this sandwich is just chock-full of pastrami goodness.  On your hungrier days, wash it down with a cup of Matzo Ball Soup.  You cannot get much better than this combo at Canter's.  Start your night at the Kibitz Room (#5 above) and end on this note.  You will not be disappointed.And speaking of the Kibitz Room -  watch out if you show up to Canter's already drunk, as the bartenders don't take kindly to this, as expected.  Apparently, there was this one night some friends and I showed up at about 1:35am and one of my friends tried to order a Heineken.  Not surprisingly, the old bartender told my friend to screw off.  However, being that my overly sensitive friend was extremely buzzed AND a burgeoning part time hairdresser, he thought that old bartender had called him ugly.  Of course, that didn't bode well with my friend at his current state, who really prided himself on those sorts of things.  Despite being dragged, no one could stop that middle finger nor a few choice words and name calling, in which I believe went to the absurdity of "Rip Van Winkle" or "Ebenezer Scrooge"...who knows, all I remember is being cast out of Canter's and without my Pastrami Reuben, forcing us to go to Mel's Diner.Oh well.  Canter's remains one of the places that had always made me happy AND kept me at least a little bit sane for those 4 years I lived, worked, and went to school in Lala land.

Reviews.Author: Dave A.
Reviews.Content: Ok it's all been said right?  Wrong.  No one (at least in the first 20 reviews I read mentioned two things.  ONE: The most obvious one is the Kibbutz Room.  How could this section be ignored?  First off, it's the BAR and no I don't mean Bar as in Bar Mitvah.  Alcoholic drinks's people, AND late night music.  They have bands sometimes (at least the last time I checked).  It's a dark little area attached to the back room.  You can belly up to the bar or choose a booth. TWO:  Here is the dirty secret: Everyone talks about the ceiling, the leaves etc... Now look up, look hard, see where the branches intersect every four tiles?  Now do you see the swastikas!  I promise you they are there.  Freaky, especially crazy in a Jewish deli.  Ok, the secret is out, don't blame the messenger. Oh, and they do have a cheap breakfast: Egg white omelet with mushrooms, hash browns and coffee, and bread or bagel for something like six bucks. And please get a chocolate chip danish (heated of course) with a cup of tea, the coffee is wretched. You won't regret it.  In fact, get a potato knish while your at it and get it to go. Why five stars?  It's the first restaurant I ever remember eating at (egg cream + little kid = happy memory), and I went to Fairfax High so it was a great ditch spot.  The place is kind of like Saturday Night Live, it sucks sometimes but it's always there late at night when you might be in need of some comfort.

Reviews.Author: Tara C.
Reviews.Content: From time to time, the (imaginary) Jewish side of me gets a hankering for matzo ball soup.  Canter's does me one better with their amazing Mishmosh Soup.  This is a giant bowl of chicken noodle soup with matzo ball, kreplach, and rice, and served with delicious bagel chips.  Sooo good.  It's generous enough to have leftovers and they can bag your bagel chips to go as well.  I've had their corned beef Reuben too, but it doesn't stand out in my memory so oh well.  So if you are in need of some delicious comfort food, stop by here any time, day or night!

Reviews.Author: Israeli Soldier Z.
Reviews.Content: Growing up as an Israeli Jewish guy eating real "Jewish food" all of my life I can assure you that Canters has nothing to do with Jewish gourmet!!!It is the same as olive garden calling itself a real Italian restaurant, what a joke!It is a wanna be Jewish Deli which thrives on the business of many dumb people who has no idea what a real deli is all about!Those are ignorant people who has no clue, the same crowed who gets excited like a group of baboons!They are the reason bad restaurants with bad costumer service are still in business!!Don't be fooled and follow the LA monkyhood which pretend being something their not while primitively can not see the difference between authentic & fake!Listen to the reviews which are bashing this place, they know what they are talking about!I tried this place 4 times (few times too many - but I got invited)Each experience was worst than the previous one.:)  - Not that I can think of.:( - - Food is mediocre. Runny eggs, tasteless matzaball soup.- Decor: Sad, stuck in the 60's. Not vintage, just lame.- Menu: Too big, old, dirty. unnecessary!- Prices: HIGH - Tries making people believe it's fancy.- Check out: Weired lines for old S registers.
