Time consuming.- Service: NONE!  Oh boy I got some stories for ya:This would not pass as a service even in central Africa!We got invited by friends to this atrocity for a late night dinner (after swearing do not go there ever again).We joined our friends who already ordered. It was 5 of us & the booth was not big enough so we added 2 more chairs to the front of the booth (which was located far in the corner).As our old S nasty, rude server showed up to take our order, she rudely snapped saying:old server: Y'all can not sit like that!us: Ok, what do you want us to do? There is not enough space.old server: I don't know - but you can not sit this way! us:  we sit very close to the table, There is no other tables behind so we're clearly not interrupting anyone...old server: Do not argue with me, I said!us: Ma'am, what should we do????!old server: !Part of your group should move to a different table!Us: What? We came to dine together, not separately! May we speak to your manager please?!- Old server went to bring her manager who was even nastier! Manager: You can not seat like that, it is against "fire department regulations"!!  (Oy Vay!)us: We got only 2 chairs attached to the booth, what's the big deal? Food is getten cold, Let us eat already!!!! Heres the punch line! :Old Server Grab on my friends chair from behind while dragging it violently on the floor away from the table so my friend would loose balance and get up!!! And that's exactly what happened!We were all appealed, shocked and speechless! Never in my life had such a rude & embarrassing situation! If I would see that B I would B slap her so bad up her face, she would swallow her plastic teeth and learn her lesson!!!We left that nasty horrible place, with food & drinks spilled all over the table, without paying a dime!You old nasty hag, if you had some brains in your lil head you would switch us to a bigger table momentarily, apologize for the inconvenience, get a nice tip & save everybody in the resturant this kind of drama that you created in your own hands!You will have a better service in the Gaza strip! (not that you will find a Jewish deli over there...)Canters! You lost me as a customer a while back, but now you lost 4 more of my friends as loyal customers and now when online you probably loose dozens more!!!Shame on you canters. You are far away from being anything resemble a Jewish Deli!Fix your morals before even using the word Jewish!Bottom line: Avoid this place at all costs!If you want a real good Jewish food go to Shula & Ester few blocks away or drive up to Pico and try some real quality food like Haifa restaurant, Jeff's gourmet sausage factory and many more, If you come from the Valley, try the Humus Bar! It is very good!you will thank me for this tip!All the best,Yalla Bye!

Reviews.Author: Bill N.
Reviews.Content: Dreadful food and service. What should have been an easy breakfast order turned into a baffling exercise in futility. Can't I have a short stack with eggs and bacon for less than $15.00?..and cold eggs at that! It's no wonder the place is deserted most of the time, it just plain sucks now a days.Stay away you've been warned.

Reviews.Author: Christina S.
Reviews.Content: I am bummed to give this place a lower rating than originally.. Actually, I really want to give them 3.5*.....  After we watched a film at the Archlight my friend and I headed back towards Echo Park we were a little hungry and wanted to get a bite. I then came up with the brilliant idea of going to Canters for some Matzo Ball soup.....  I love Canters and I love the Matzo Ball soup here. Last night we both ordered the Mishmosh. (i may be spelling it wrong).. It's Matzo ball with noodles and rice and some good dough thing in there and it was not the matzo.... Anyhow we both were digging it until I came across a strand of hair in my soup.. I was so grossed out that I of course lost my appetite. I didn't say anything about it..  It was past 1AM and I just wanted to leave... So, that is my disappointing story slash update of my beloved Canters...

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: Best pastrami Reuben ever! And the people who work there are very friendly

Reviews.Author: Darren Y.
Reviews.Content: Pickles with a smack of garlic and psychedelic ceilings 24 hours a day? It was about midnight as I sat down among whatever crowd Thursday night brought this total throwback to the mid-1900s. 1930-something to be exact, and I was THERE, last night! So glad I didn't need those 1.21 jigowatts[sic].But I did need food. I realized something about Canter's on Yelp: no ones gonna read all 42 reviews! Here's a checklist for you skimmers:1) Toasted rye Reuben with pastrami, sub chips with fries2) Free pickles with garlic flava3) If you dig it, Matzo ball soup 4) Some crazy lady swears by the grilled cheese5) Parking doesn't exist during peak hours6) The ceiling7) People watching for white after Labor Day. Faux pas!This is worth a visit or four, and many more for those late nights. Enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Author: Lilian M.
Reviews.Content: Was here last week with my sister-in-law. When we walked in, we were immediately struck by the beauty of all the delicious desserts at the front of the restaurant, so of course, we were excited!! We both had the eggs benedict for breakfast, and honestly, it was nothing special. We were hoping the desserts would have made up for the "ok" breakfast. We tried about 5 or 6 things, and not a single dessert was anything amazing. It all just looks really good, but thats about it. Totally bummed. Wont go back there again for sure. Boo.

Reviews.Author: billy l.
Reviews.Content: after spending sometime in New York, the deli's in california don't seem to compare.  I've eaten at Canter's many times because its open late and its close by, i always stick to the corn beef hash, open face sandwich, french dip, or a BLT, however their pickles are good! over all i had way better....

Reviews.Author: Jeremy M.
Reviews.Content: The turkey pesto sandwich I had was a little dry, but aside from that, this is a cool little place.

Reviews.Author: Chris P.
Reviews.Content: This place is good, not great.  It's an institution-so fun to go to.  Definitely needs an update inside.  Hot pastrami and fries are a safe order.

Reviews.Author: Jenn L.
Reviews.Content: If you roll in after the bars close, this place turns into a twisted game of who has the worst pick-up line EVA. if you want to play a joke on a female friend leave her alone at the table and observe what happens from around the corner. if she's drunk the fun factor is multiplied by ten. Canter's-bo-Banter's, you and ur bakery have been good to me. the whole Reuben/matzo ball soup is lost on a vegetarian such as myself but your avocado melts and egg-salad sammiches always blow my mind. Cheap drinks can be had at the bar next door or brought to ur table (thumbs up!!).  my friends like the reubens, and turkey dinners. Nobody looks good in the fluorescent lighting here but revel in it, its part of the experience. Prices are a wee 'spensive for a deli type place but this bad-boy is open 24 hours and portions are GIGANTIC. Ok now for Jenn L's list on what to get at the deli/bakery:dill pickles rugalach (cinnamon, coconut, raspberry - they're all good)bagel chips (later in the night they sell out)jalapeno/cheese bagels macaroons

Reviews.Author: Geraldine C.
Reviews.Content: Love the feel of this place. Love their burgers, pastrami, and the abundance of baked goods at their bakery. We ate here and went to the Kibitz room next door after very very small place with a full bar and good music. Overall a great place to go to after a night out.... it's open 24hours!

Reviews.Author: Ayelet I.
Reviews.Content: Hi. My name is Ayelet. I am officially the very last native Los Angeleno to try Canter's. Why this abomination you ask? I have a problem with bread. That is, I refuse to eat it. And Canter's, a place where sandwiches, old fashioned Yiddish style baked goods, and matsa ball soup reign supreme, was thus scary for all its lore and old school charm. Well, fuck it. Sometimes a girl just needs to bow down to the power of carbs. Especially on a freezing cold night when comfort food doesn't include a salad. So I dragged my Moobs on over and partook. The atmosphere was well, stogy...in the best sense of the word. Hipsters sitting along side crusty cute old folks and families, and all with giant plates of food before them. Moobs was ill so we got out quick, but the food was good while I shoveled it down and my experience worth the potential belly bulge. I had the half sandwich and cup of soup combo with barley bean soup that was tasty and soooo what I wanted with my toes still half frozen from walking outside, and a brisket sandwich. The meat wasn't too fatty, which is a big plus for me and with the spicy mustard and pickles made my tummy full and happy. Moobs had a chicken caesar salad in a bowl so ginormous it must have been used as a punch bowl in it's past life. Holy crap was it massive. So while he wasn't up to eating it there it fed him the entire next day. Imposter L.A. native no longer! Success.

Reviews.Author: Rhonda S.
Reviews.Content: Run, don't walk far away from this place. Not only does it reek of old grease but they can be pretty unsanitary there. Went with a girlfriend of mine and ordered the grilled cheese sandwich. To my dismay there was a long, stringy strand of brown hair in it that I noticed AFTER a few bites.  At that point I saw the grimy-looking cook at the grill. Ick! Granted accidents can happen but they weren't even apologetic about it! Steer clear of this place.

Reviews.Author: tri n.
Reviews.Content: Be careful with paying the bill. My experience at the deli was similar to tutoring a special needs child in math.   When my group of seven was presented with the hand written bill, I just gave her my credit card (guess that's my fault) and was quckly asked how much more tip do I want to add to the bill, not notifying me that tip was already included.  After telling the others of the total charge, my friend flipped, and asked if she could see the bill itemized.  We were presented with a written itemized bill that did not add up to what we ordered.  We were charged for 6 sandwhiches when there were just 5, but it was hard to tell from the scribble on the bill.  So my friend (who is a brilliant mathmatician) explained to the waitress the miscalculation, who (instead of apologizing) kept defensively shooting miscellenous charges for cheese.  Fine, charge for the cheese, but how the hell does cheese for one sandwhich add up to 40 dollars?  The waitress brought out her 80s calculator and started punching numbers really fast as if she thought a group of drunken asians couldn't follow her.  After carefully breaking down the bill and tediously teaching a third grader basic math, we asked to just void the entire charge on the credit card and to start over, especially since we were tricked into tipping the waitress twice.  Throughout the entire transaction, there was no apology, only glares and stares as if the entire mess was our fault.  The voiding process took forever.  It almost seemed as if it was standard operation to try to upcharge any group that seems slightly inebriated that comes in late a night for a quick bite.   Do not dine in.

Reviews.Author: Gunzal G.
Reviews.Content: One word..rugglah!! The raspberry rugglah is the best here, every time I go to Canter's I got to get me some rugglah. Oh yea, recently tried the Poppy Seed rugglah..I know sounds really weird and some guy in line told that I should try some, I must have made a weird face cuz he was all just try it and I did and I love it..So take my advice and that guy in line's advice and just try it or play it safe and get the raspberry ones, either way you'll be glad you did :) As for the food, too many choices for me..have tried a bunch of different things..yea I'm a libra and its hard to make choices man..

Reviews.Author: Jessica F.
Reviews.Content: Came here a month ago on a random Sunday. My girlfriends were around the corner from me and told me to meet up with them for Happy Hour. I heard Happy Hour and I was all game, right who would pass that up on a sunny Sunday? So they have me meet them here at Canter's. Huge sign in the front about their Happy Hour we walk inside and its a Restaurant. They lead us to the bar and it's completely empty. We all looked at each other and laughed out of desperation and just seated ourselves. Long story short the Happy Hour was alright 2-3 for a beer and they had food on the Happy Hour menu. Personally I don't like drinking while I eat so I did a pass. Maybe next time I'll go and eat instead of being a alcoholic and hitting the boring Happy Hour.

Reviews.Author: Matt S.
Reviews.Content: I very much recommend the pastrami sandwich! I'm a vegetarian but when I get a meat craving its for this sandwich. The bakery is also spot on as well. A lot of yummy choices. Plus you might run into a celebrity. We saw Richard Lewis in there once. It was pretty cool. I had never seen a celeb in person before.

Reviews.Author: Anthony L.
Reviews.Content: A little pricey but the knishes are ridiculously good. Good mac and cheese too. The staff is always nice and the hours are unbeatable. Plus the history of the place always adds to the enjoyment of being there. I can never leave without a few black and white cookies for home. The lot is a little small so during peak hours parking is a little tricky. I'm eager to try their food truck next time I see it too.

Reviews.Author: Dave G.
Reviews.Content: Canter's Deli was one of the first places I had to eat at when I moved here. Having come from South Florida, Home of the Rascal House, it had a lot to prove, but it held up quite well, and every trip since, has been pretty darn good. Let's start out with what makes Canter's unique. The rye bread is amazing. They have the best rye bread I've ever had at any deli anywhere. A golden tasty crust encircling a soft seeded rye is the backbone of all their sandwiches for me. Any time I go there, I get a loaf to take home. I tend to favor their pastrami over their corned beef a bit. Sometimes when it's busy, they get a little lazy and let the pastrami and corned beef sit on the slicer too long between sandwiches. It needs to keep going back in the steamer to keep it warm and juicy. There are usually several pieces of pastrami and corned beef in the steamer, and they should alternate between them, so they are always warm. When it's busy they just keep slicing the same one, and if you aren't the first on that particular pastrami or corned beef, it might not be at it's peak when it gets to your table. I also love Canter's mustard. They use Beaver Brand Deli Mustard, which I have never had until I was at Canter's. It has a slight horseradish taste to it, which makes it unique. Even though they don't make their mustard, I still associate that flavor with Canter's. I'm pretty sure they do have other mustards available. But it's so good with the Pastrami and Corned Beef, you don't need anything else. I wasn't that big of a fan of their Ruben, but I have rectified that. Canter's puts their corned beef on the grill before putting it in the sandwich. This dries out the corned beef a bit, so now I ask them not to grill the corned beef. And it's perfectly steamy and moist in my grilled Ruben. I've never had a problem ordering it this way, they seem very accommodating. Also of note, Canter's has the best potato knish, I've ever had. The mashed potato filling is so full of flavor, and the outside is always perfectly done. You can get them hot or cold, go with hot, but watch out they are pipping hot. Just to prove you are in a real Jewish Deli (as if the neighborhood doesn't give it away) you can get a kasha knish. Kasha is made from buckwheat oats and can either be real lame or very tasty depending on where you order it. Canter's does it right. Next time when you go with a friend order one potato and one kasha knish and split them. I recommend dipping the kasha knish in a little mustard. Now the down side to Canter's and why they lose a star. The desserts are pretty bad for deli standards. I don't know how or why this is. One of the first times I went to the dessert take out side, I "Won" a bag full of a dozen hamantaschen (those triangle pastries) and other pastries. I guess they give away a free bag for every Nth customer. Well I'm guessing all the little old Jewish ladies knew it was coming up because there was a loud groan, followed by a bunch of kvetching to management and anyone that would listen. Now these weren't day olds, they told me to pick 12 fresh pastries out from the display. I made a nice diverse selection and held my trophy up for all to see in my large clear plastic bag. Parted the sea of angry onlookers and made to the car. Well I tasted everyone of those dry, not very sweet things, and the only thing it made me think of was the 4 day old "gifts" my grandmother used to give me from her pocketbook. The only thing missing was the bits of Kleenex stuck to them. These things were awful. I have tried to warn other friends and family that have gone to Canter's, but we still end up getting something for dessert. And it hasn't been better the 2nd time, or 3rd,4th,... For desserts, stay to the counter on the right and get a nice piece of smoked whitefish or sable to go.

Reviews.Author: Stephen K.
Reviews.Content: the only place in so cal to get an authentic hot pastrami sandwich and matzo ball soup...being originally from nyc, this place reminds me a lot like the 2nd st deli...

Reviews.Author: Teresa W.
Reviews.Content: Canter's may be my favorite restaurant in Los Angeles. Sometimes you just have to have matzoh ball soup. Admittedly overpriced, Canter's will be your Jewish mother if you feel a cold coming on. Why is matzoh ball soup univiersally expensive? It's just chicken stock and cracker meal; two of the cheapest ingredients possible. But I digress. They have yummy borscht too. Latkes with sour cream. Now I'm getting hungry.Don't forget to ask for a pickle tray. Oh yummy, crunchy pickles! Your tangy sourness makes my tastebuds sing. There are crunchy bagel chips too.I usually get the pastrami reuben. Veggies take note: veggie reubens are delicious and a nice change of pace. The fries are average; not always hot which is a big no-no.I guess Canter's easily get two stars from me because I can pretend I'm in NYC. You can even extend the fantasy by going across the street to Damiano's, the pizza joint. Not that you'll be hungry but I guess you could have an unusual beer. I digress again. Canter's marries an East Coast vibe with old school Hollywood gumshoe, tragic romance. The bar is tits. You can practically see Bukowski on a bar stool at 2 p.m. on a Tuesday. They pour 'em stiff and the price is right. Wander in on any given random day and you will definitely see some characters. There may only be three, two, or one person but I guarantee your curiosity will be aroused. They book the weirdest bands (you never know what you will get) and it's not really recommended on a Friday or Saturday night (amateur hipsters, crowded, smoky sidewalk). Please order only respectable drinks like whiskey or scotch. The "Sex and the City" movie may be hot but Cosmos went out YEARS ago (and they are gross). The fact that you can order a real drink in the restaurant contributes to the stars above as well. It was quite dangerous when I lived around the corner. A great neighborhood. That stretch of Fairfax from approximately Wilshire to Melrose being one of the very few reminding me of NYC (where else? maybe Downtown?).I probably haven't eaten that many different things at Canter's but it doesn't matter. I just love the whole scene. The people watching cannot be beat and you will see an occasional celeb. I once saw Mike Myers outside. I'm the farthest thing from a star-f*cker but I had to holler to him how great he is. He and his wife smiled. Yay.Let's not forget the bakery. Authentic bagels-poppy, onion, everything-and some not-so-authentic bagels-pizza-are winners. You will become lost in a world of cookies, cheesecakes, rugala (recommended!), and marble ryes. A very wide selection of breads baked on the premises are available. A sweet-tooth fiend's (like me!) heaven!Canter's is also a good place to go hang out and have a casual meeting or get some work done. Their large center room is not always open (if not crowded) but they will let you spread out and work there, and, obviously, order something. The service can be inattentive and even verge on the border of being rude or hostile. While I normally cannot tolerate that, this only adds a little more East Coast zing in the mix. I have also had cut-and-dry competency which is my favorite type of service. Get it right, get it quick, no smarmy small talk. Canter's you make me misty-eyed for the Big Apple but you offer a little slice to keep me going.

Reviews.Author: Kimquyen L.
Reviews.Content: Good pastrami sandwiches! =)

Reviews.Author: Anthony A.
Reviews.Content: There are currently 958 reviews for Canter's as I type this, so chances are anyone who even bothers reading my words is looking for nothing more than a recommendation on what's worth spending a sizeable chunk of your hard-earned cash on. I'm denoting a "sizeable chunk" because if there's one thing you can count on at Canter's, it's spending way more than you're anticipating. You want to know how they've survived all these years? It's because a ham sandwich costs $11.95 and looks every bit as much like something you'd find in a cafeteria. This is endemic to most of L.A.'s most famous eateries, however. (See: Pink's). I know full well that I'm not walking out of Canter's without spending less than $35 on a meal for two. I could get a nicer dinner at a better restaurant for that kind of skrilla, but I come to Canter's for one thing and one thing only: the For Dedicated Fressers special w/ potato salad. And pickles. I love the pickles here, even if they do have a weird, can't-quite-figure-it-out, briney taste. The Dedicated Fressers plate is no frills - a mountainous stack of corned beef and pastrami sandwiched between two soft, pillowy slices of rye bread. That's it. No sauces, no condiments - just you and a thick stack of MEAT. They also give you a bowl of cole slaw, but I've never been a fan; it always tastes rancid to me. I have a love/hate relationship with the potato salad. I love the taste, but they don't go German on its ass, so the mixture is typically very wet and mayo-y. I usually pick out the big potato chunks, lest I ingest a mouthful of the goop residing in between. On your way out, be sure to grab a black & white cookie and drop your change off in the black homeless dude's cup in front. Some woman tried to get him to agree to go to the homeless shelter down the street for some food/shelter (it was raining), but he told her he "don't want to mess around with none of them people". Bitch, can't you see this brutha has a good racket going? I've been seeing him fishing for cash our front for ages - he knows how to work it.

Reviews.Author: Gabe G.
Reviews.Content: Missed a NY style deli and this is it! 4pm or 4am canter's piled high doesn't disappoint

Reviews.Author: Jenn S.
Reviews.Content: My Bubbe, may she rest in peace, frowns down upon me from the Great Kosher Kitchen In The Sky.  Why?  Because I'm a vegan, which means if she were alive today, and placed a bowl of her famous Matzo Ball Soup in front of me, I'd have to politely decline.  I'd then get swatted with a newspaper and verbally assaulted with a slew of choice Yiddish phrases.  She'd pinch my cheeks, tell me I was too skinny, and try to spoon-feed me chicken grease.  The Jew Guilt would last for weeks.Thankfully, Canter's waitresses don't take it so personally.  Sure, they've surpassed the average age of most L.A. wait staff, and some could even fall into the "crotchety" category, but that's what makes it feel like home.  Factor in the burnt-orange late 70s decor, and you've got a full on "I don't think we're in Los Angeles anymore" experience.The food's OK...not much there I can eat, but I don't really go to Canter's for the cuisine.  Great drunk, high or sober.  Great for breakfast or after the bars.  Great because it's a frickin' institution.

Reviews.Author: Tude L.
Reviews.Content: Ever faithful Canters always has your back when you don't want to be crowded in over at swingers .....I had the roast tongue topped with onion gravy and it was ....well actually I didn't have the tongue, but its on the menu and yes if you wanted it....or pickled herring or a simple pastrami on rye you could have it ......excellent extensive menu.....v good coffee and bottomless cup.....the attached bar is a dive but reliable and last call for booze in the restaurant is 1.40am.  Insomniacs, drunks and night owls abound....free parking with validation and as I said, right around the corner from swingers. Cheers!

Reviews.Author: Edward L.
Reviews.Content: Great place to hang out late at night after the clubs. The corned beef sandwich was good enough to cause a flavor explosion to my alcohol soaked tastebuds. Lots of action, great price and good eats.

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: Completely underwhelming: run down, dirty and the matzo brey wasn't even hot.

Reviews.Author: Kyle W.
Reviews.Content: Once a year or so, someone who doesn't know better talks me into going to this place...against my experience and better judgement.  The food is bad, but expensive. The portions diminish, but the prices rise. The staff is hit and miss, and the managers are as lifeless and offensive as the food.  Try to pay with a credit card, and they treat you as if you are trying to leave without paying...literally, they talked to me like a criminal when I whipped out my check-card.  Seriously, step into the 20th century, and ditch the archaic registers, rude waiters, and lousy food with it's only redemption being a conveyor for the watered down ranch dressing.  Eek, methinks not!Maybe this place was cute and clever at some point in history but now it is just gross, old, and offensive.  The food is priced in inverse proportion to the quality.

Reviews.Author: Juliette N.
Reviews.Content: This just in - Girl Finds Love in LA Jewish deli!(based on a true story)Girl relocates from New England (Land of ample Jewish Delis) and finds herself lost on the west coast without a 'real bagel' in sight. After sometimes heart wrenching encounters with the close-but-no-cigar Einsteins and Breuggers Bagels she wanders up to LA and stumbles upon Canter's Delicatessen and Restaurant at about 2 am on  a Saturday. And, there, bursting from the page on the menu are the words, "the Lil-New Yorker" and a simply worded description of a bagel sandwich with lox. She orders, anticipates, and sips a hot chocolate with whipped cream. And then... it arrives. A perfectly toasted onion bagel with a mountain of cream cheese and a towering heap of invitingly orange smoked lox. She melts like the cream cheese on the top of the bagel with that first bite - sinking into bliss and muttering something incoherent to her friends about moving into the deli in the morning. Luckily for the deli staff this plan is reconsidered when she realizes her sandwich is large enough to take home leftovers for breakfast that morning instead. The girl swears true love, and to one day soon return to Canter's and appease her inner-starving-for-real-bagels-Jew.

Reviews.Author: J J.
Reviews.Content: This is the most gruesome place to eat in Los Angeles. Run as far away from.here as you can!! I need a STD test and every other test the hospital can give me after eating in this shit hole. I WILL NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN!! EVER!!! Even if they pay me!!! Never!!! ((Weeping))

Reviews.Author: Jeanny J.
Reviews.Content: We just purchased Coupons for CANTER'S DELI............From Groupon !!!!!!!!!!!!I have ordered from Groupon many times...But this time I should have not !!!!!!!Once you Purchase Coupons for CANTER'S they decided to make their OWN RULES !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!They will not let me order from the BAKERYThey will not let me take my Food to go..WTHWhy?Is it now your BusinessAre they now going to tell me HOW TO EAT AS WELL !!!!!!!!!!!!So we talked with the MANAGER & she agreed we were RIGHT..But she told US to sit at the table Order your FoodThen ask for a BOX TO GO !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!DOES THIS MAKE ANY F-SENSE?NEVERNEVER EVER GO TO THIS PLACE EVER !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!They suck.....

Reviews.Author: Jennifer J.
Reviews.Content: The french dip is like jangjorim on a bun. I was disappointed in the pastrami...have yet to try anything else but def willing to come back~ Tripped out looking up at the ceiling in the main dining area.

Reviews.Author: Joanna F.
Reviews.Content: Been coming to Canter's for over 25 years now. The Matzo Ball soup is THE BEST and as big as a Softball! The Corned Beef is absolute Heaven and the Potato Knish with gravy is so comforting and yummy! They are open 24/7 and over the years I have staggered and dined at all hours of the day and night. Even saw Nicholas Cage and Patricia Arquette at a table next to me once in the late 80's. The wait staff are always friendly and attentive. I LOVE CANTER"S ! It's the ONLY place I will pay $15.00 for a Corned Beef Sandwich! If you have never been here, you are missing out on some great food, and awesome history!

Reviews.Author: Jessica R.
Reviews.Content: Good when sober.  Amazing when drunk.

Reviews.Author: Trissia W.
Reviews.Content: although I had been here before, I've become a lot more picky about good bargains so here goes . . .food we had was great, but overpriced (or maybe just L.A. priced).We had Canters sandwich- corned beef, pastrami thinly sliced(which was a normal sized sandwich I probably could have finished alone), and served with a very small side of coleslaw for $13.50.A dinner salad which was actually very large, but plain- for $4.95(ok deal)a bowl of split pea soup which my husband said was very plain $5and a potato knish with gravy $5. oh yeah free pickles and bagel chips.with 2 drinks it came up to $36 before tip. 3 stars because our server was great.Now I've had similar meals at Katella deli and couldn't finish and always have to take it home. I was really glad we went because we were in the neighborhood. The dessert counter looked great but no prices showing. I would recommend only if you've never been there, and maybe if you wanted to show some out of towners a bit of L.A. history.

Reviews.Author: Jim L.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the classic Southern California jewish diner delis! (haha, are there more than one?)  I love the old school vinyl booths, the little, dimly lit barfly backroom and all the old photos tacked on the walls of jazz and R&B artists who have frequented the joint in the wee morning (and late late night) hours.  The food is really good kosher-style deli too; I usually go for the pastrami or corned beef on rye.  Nice bakery too.  A true LA institution on the old Jewish side of town.

Reviews.Author: Jim U.
Reviews.Content: This is my girlfriend's go-to bakery in Los Angeles.  Being that we were both in town, it was quite obvious that we would both have to try it, especially since I have never been here before.  Apparently the brownies are the must-buy item here.  I have to agree -- these brownies are absolutely delicious!  They are so moist, and they are topped with an impressive amount of chocolate fudge.  That thick layer of sensual sweetness really elevates the brownie.  Now I have a dilemma.  When I come back here again (and yes I will be back here again) do I really have a choice to get anything but the brownies, knowing just how good they really are?  Damn you Canter's!

Reviews.Author: Paul H.
Reviews.Content: It's about the novelty, not the food.   Bubby Esther would not approve!

Reviews.Author: Daniel C.
Reviews.Content: The bakery up front has black and white cookies. This is one of the first things I check when I go to Jewish Deli's. The decor is old school. I had corned beef on rye, not much of a pastrami guy so I don't know. The corned beef seemed like it was boiled a bit too long and so it didn't have that meaty texture, but maybe it was an off night. I almost always get a corned beef on rye and a potato pancake when I go to these places. I liked the corned beef at Junior's better.

Reviews.Author: Linda N.
Reviews.Content: I've always heard of Canter's and their supposed great reviews. I saw Larry David dine there on Curb Your Enthusiasm but after my experience I rather feast on on a dirty baby diaper, No Joke. I was forced to dine here as it was my friend's birthday wish to try a pastrami sandwich. After growing up on Johnnie's Pastrami's I don't think anything can compare to a mediocre chuckle of a sandwich. My friend listened to our other friend who is of the Jewish persuasion. Maybe in the old days when many Deli's did not exist this provided a great atmosphere for the stars.... The place was empty so how could the service suck? Canter's is over rated and I hope to never torment my stomach again! The only reason I gave it two stars is because their Black and White Cookie was decent enough to boost their rating.

Reviews.Author: YuckFelp G.
Reviews.Content: Any place with liquor gets an extra star.

Reviews.Author: Jim A.
Reviews.Content: Here is the beef on a place with pretty good food. I wanted to give this classic place 4 stars, but I just got back from there,and I've been reminded how run down they let the place go. The waitress that sat us was as old as the decor, not that its a bad thing, but she was just spent. She had the "been there done that" attude and just didn't seem like she wanted to be there. Ok, on to the food. I loved my midnight Ruben sandwich and the food itself gets 4 1/2 stars, but I just don't like walking into the place anymore. The bright and stark lighting gave me a headache, but once again, the food might be worth it for most. Oh and the pastries are excellent. Ok, ok... let me upgrade this to 3 1/2 stars. Damn, I just cant decide can I?

Reviews.Author: FoodLover B.
Reviews.Content: The only thing good I can say about this place is that it's open late.Hey, I'm not a meat eater, so maybe their ham sandwich is to die for-but EVERYTHING I had in the vegetable family (salad, fries, pasta even, if i remember correctly...i've been a few times & it's always been forgettable)  has been BLAND BLAND BLAND, not fresh, not crisp, not vibrant or memorable. Even though open late, at this point, I'd rather go hungry. :(

Reviews.Author: Nathan W.
Reviews.Content: I love the Jewalicious Canter's mainly for nostalgic reasons and its bakery is very good. Everybody should try the challah and the black and white cookie. The matzah ball soup is good, and the sandwiches are nice too. I think people mainly go because it's open all the time and you can usually spot a C-leb. Jonah Hill walked past me once and I didn't realize right away cuz he is a short fellow. On a different, extremely late night a bunch of "So You Think You Can Dance?" peeps were there being loud and Broadway. Hawk stared right at me, and my heart soared like one.

Reviews.Author: Caroline K.
Reviews.Content: We went to Cantor's recently after not having been in several years.  Everyone at my table ordered from the panini menu which is towards the back of the menu.  I think this is a newer addition.  The food was great!  The corned beef was lean and not dry at all.  My friend enjoyed his roast beef as well.  I ordered the sweet potato fries with mine,which were served nice and hot.  The service is terrific, my coffee was refilled three times in the hour we were there.  The restaurant is still a little on the dumpy side but the people are friendly and the space feels clean.  The size of the panini sandwiches are much more manageable but we were still too full for dessert.  Next time we may share a sandwich and save room for the cheese cake.

Reviews.Author: Sam Y.
Reviews.Content: its open 24 hours i believe. when you are in the mood for deli food, this is a good place. Its not the best food I have ever had though but its convenient.

Reviews.Author: Evan J.
Reviews.Content: Canter's was one of my late night haunts back in the day.  Free pickles and a mysterious telephone at every table were just the thing to get me in the door.  But let's face it, it's the waffle sundae that keeps you coming back.  Ooh, the waffle sundae!  The Kibitz Room is fun too, but that's another review...

Reviews.Author: Stephen M.
Reviews.Content: You don't need to bring your Kirlian camera to detect the special aura inside Canter's, a square-acre deli haunted in the daytime by ghosts in worship clothes and after midnight by unquiet souls fending off the 80 proof afterworld. The immutable decor is practically a museum of oddball diner bric-a-brac of yesteryear, and most of the employees have clearly paid their dues and earned the right to be really unimpressed by that "I'm starving and could use a sandwich right fucking NOW" vibe you're giving off. The menu is pointlessly big - there are only a handful of things you should be ordering from a place like this. The Reuben is just about perfect. Think of the cost as inclusive of an L.A. landmark surcharge.

Reviews.Author: E'stormae S.
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes about a jewish deli coffee shop.  They're usually SO good! I tried to order something like a plate lunch.  I was warned by the waitress about the things I was asking about.  She warned me they werent that great.  She said they really excelled at the sandwich and breakfasts.  I decided on a meat loaf... figured even average.. could not be that bad.  how bad can you mess up meatloaf?.. let me tell ya... pretty bad... you can make it like they do and its like ground beef with some canned brown gravy on top.  I had to put half a bottle of ketchup on there to choke it back.  The mashed potatoes were bland, bu really good.  I dont even remember what the side veggies was.. that forgettable.  I got a side of kasha and noodles... plain... this was just so sad.. that I ... a NON JEW.. can make better jew food than these people.. just sad sad sad.   My parents drug me here when they were in town.  My mom was having matzo ball cravings.  I'll say they do a mean ball of matzo ball soup, but not worth the price.  I mean heck even I ( a non-jew)can make matzo ball soup. I could make 10 bowls of soup for $6.  The Matzo Ball is VERY large (think softball size or larger) and very very light.  They must either add flour or grind the matzo meal finely to get it this light.  When I make mine, they're never this light (but then I make my the size of mandarine oranges) The corned beef sandwich was ok.. your average good sandwich.  again not worth the price though.  Mom took the rest of her soup home..I didnt bring home leftovers as the food was just THAT bad   I tipped my waitress well though.. she DID try to warn me.  Not her fault that the food sucks.  The cook staff doesnt cook,, they just assemble food..  I have no idea why they do such a good business... but they do.. more power to them... I guess some people just dont know any better.  Could be the good wait staff?  Seems like a nice place to drink coffee after hard night of drinking (in the old days LOL)

Reviews.Author: Teddy A.
Reviews.Content: Another Los Angeles/Hollywood Landmark. The place is filled with Movie and Rockstar Photos and newspaper clippings. Really cool & busy ambiance.  Hands down, probably the best pastrami sandwich place in Los Angeles. Don't hate me loyal fans, but it comes in 2nd, only to Kats Deli in New York.  But lets save you the time Pastrami Fans because once you get here, the menu is crazy.  Get the CANTERS FAIRFAX Sandwich on rye with a side of Canters Russian Dressing. The Canters Fairfax is a mix of hot sliced corned beef and pastrami.  The combo is outstanding.  You really do not need the Russian Dressing because the meat is that good, but the dressing is interesting in itself.  Get a side of coleslaw and steak fries and you are set. THE END!

Reviews.Author: Itai B.
Reviews.Content: The best

Reviews.Author: Eric M.
Reviews.Content: Five stars for the best pastrami sandwich in Los Angeles!

Reviews.Author: Cassie P.
Reviews.Content: Can I just say that Canter's has the best Matzo Ball soup?  There I just did.  Oh and the best rye bread.  I wish I went more often!  YUM!

Reviews.Author: Mahesh S.
Reviews.Content: I can be talked into doing lot of things when I am drunk that I normally dont do otherwise. Canters was one of those nights. I have been meaning to go here after hearing from friends how cool this place is and the food and cheese cake and other baked goods are. and when I was out in Weho and left around 3:30, my friend Tony wanted to go here, since they are open 24 hours. Driving through fairfax(shit I still have my drivers license!!!!), it wasnt that hard to find the place. it has the old style deli feel to it, and i hear there is lot of history to this place, but i was here for the yummy carbs! the menu covers pretty much everything. Breakfast food, fried food, soul food, meat loaf, fish and what not. I felt like I wanted meat loaf, but to keep it healthy i ordered the fresh vegetables. the meat loaf was pretty good, nothing i would go head over heals, but it was honestly really good meatloaf, given the fact that i can get it at 3:30am. My friend ordered some meat hash thingy which was really tasty, so was the eggs and everything else on his plate, so i might try the breakfast stuff next time!!!the baked goods and other items looked soo good ,as I walked out, but I am just one person, who eat to live, not live to eat, so I might save this for the next trip whenever that is!People were pretty down to earth, friendly and prompt. I can really appreciate how cool this place was, and with no attitude, and a home style atomosphere!!! I dont even know why I would stand in line at pinks to get their random hot dogs, when I can easily get here and sit down and have a meal any time of the night or day!!!

Reviews.Author: Caroline Y.
Reviews.Content: This place has decent food but the service here is so inconsistent. I had good and bad experiences with the servers here. But honestly I think one time I had a racist server. It took her an hour to bring me a cup of matzo ball soup. But before that it took her 20 minutes to take our order. Good pickles though.

Reviews.Author: Dottie D.
Reviews.Content: i love canter's.  i feel guilty about it but i absolutely love canter's.  now, i try to eat healthy and so i try to avoid canter's as much as possible but i am always, always, always happy when i eat there.  the matzoh ball soup is good (not your bubbie's matzoh ball good but good).  this turkey melt that i once had totally rocked my world.  the portions are enormous - i have had a hard time finishing and i can eat.  what i really love about canter's is the deli cookies.  i have a soft spot for deli cookies.  my all time favorites?  chocolate chip rugaluch.  they have the best chocolate chip rugaluch.  their poppy seed hamantaschen?  delish.  their florentines are just ok and i would skip the brownie cookies alltogether but those other little deli cookies are all pretty tasty.  i could go to town on that deli case.parking is a monster.  yes, they have a lot.  no, i've almost never gotten parking in it b/c it holds almost no cars.  you can find parking in the streets west of fairfax but it isn't easy.  now i'm totally craving a big, greasy sandwich and a poppy seed humantaschen.  thankfully, i can go get that despite it being 7 am.  thank you, canter's!

Reviews.Author: Julie S.
Reviews.Content: After catching a show at the Wiltern I was feeling a chill that could only be cured by a bowl of soup.  Parking wasn't that easy on a Thursday night at 10 pm.  I finally found a street spot a couple blocks away.  Lots of homeless folks around the restaurant hoping for some change.  Once I made it in, I had the matzo ball soup which hit the SPOT!  I also had a grilled cheese with chips.  The bread on my sandwich had shared the grill with something that didn't taste to good.  I would never get that again.  My bf had the philly steak sandwich with fries. He loved it!  I had no idea but there is a bar connected to Canter's as well where a band was playing.  We didn't peep in but we could hear them loud and clear.  This was a great place to people watch for sure!

Reviews.Author: Mae S.
Reviews.Content: So far the BEST Rueben sandwich I've ever had!!!!! The pastrami is superb and stack high, cheese melted perfectly, bread is crunchy and perfectly buttered and the service we received was amazing!!! definitely we will be coming back and it is worth the drive from Huntington Beach.

Reviews.Author: Shane H.
Reviews.Content: I'm gonna concur with the general consensus here - Canter's is a great restaurant and one of its main bonuses is that it's open 24 hours. Canter's is perfect for those late night post-dancing need-something-to-absorb-alcohol dinner/breakfasts. The sandwiches are tasty and thick, the soups are the same and they have a great bakery where you can bring home treats for that oh-why-did-I-drink-so-much hangover that's sure to hit you the next morning. Highly recommended, especially because this place is an LA institution.

Reviews.Author: carlos h.
Reviews.Content: There is a debate between Deli's in New York and LA.   just went to Canters recently and must say.. wow.. The pastrami/corned beef on rye was perfectly balanced . not too salty.. not too greasy,   the rye bread crunchy on the edges and tasty.   There will always be people touting that the old 2nd ave deli or Katz etc to be better.   I tip my hat to the Canters.  I did not expect much.. but for some reason. everything I ordered just tasted great.

Reviews.Author: Andrew D.
Reviews.Content: Actually, Canter's deserves two separate ratings, one for breakfast (3 stars) and one for lunch or dinner (2 stars), though I'll average the two (and give it the benefit of the doubt) and give Canter's 3 stars.  Breakfast here is pretty good for traditional fare.  As long as you don't expect anything spectacular, you should be okay.  Unfortunately, the prices are way too high for the quality of food, and it isn't like other places (Denny's) where they compensate by giving you huge portions.  But I've never had bad service--my coffee cup never goes wanting--which kind of makes up for the mediocre food.Other meals are a different story . . . actually, I've only been for dinner once (and never been for lunch), so take my review with a grain of salt if you must.  I ordered a Monte Cristo sandwich, and it was pretty bland.  And $14.  Now, I don't expect everyone to make a Monte Cristo like they do at the Blue Bayou in Disneyland (mmmm . . . salivating at the thought), but I've tried it at a few restaurants, and Canter's was by far the least impressive.  My friend, Zack, told me I can't judge Canter's based on a Monte Cristo since it's a deli, and he said I should've ordered a pastrami sandwich.  Maybe so.  But I saw a few pastrami sandwiches on other tables, and they weren't anything to write home about either.Final thought?  Good place for a quick bite at breakfast (I've never had a wait), but there are plenty of better (and cheaper) options.

Reviews.Author: JD M.
Reviews.Content: Serously???!!  This place is so much hype.  Yes I give it high accolades for being there for so long and STILL using the same equipment!  including the cashier up front... I can't even describe it.   The food was bleh!  The service was, well, the girls that got too old to keep working at Mel's Diner.. so you can imagine the bitterness they have when pouring your coffee.  Str8 gnarly.   but whatever, 2 stars for having a successful restaurant in LA for so long.

Reviews.Author: Eleanor M.
Reviews.Content: I been coming here since since i was a baby. My mother use to ask for a high chair to sit me in, and I would order the "MONSTER BALL SOUP". Im 40 now and I take my kids and my son takes his son. My whole family grew up eating from here and we never had to send anything back. ITs always a good time. The mattza ball soup is so good the brisket, potato salad. Its all good and I'm a fan of canters. It might be a little run down looking but thats what I love about it cause brings back childhood memorys. For California its the #1 best. You gotta love the waitress's they all been there 30 plus years. It might not be fancy or new age but its a landmark.  Ok its ugly! But the pastrami on rye or the brisket on a kaiser roll is delishish. The little baby chochlate chip rugalas are awsome.

Reviews.Author: Robyn J.
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Canter's was an interesting view into a real "Jewish Deli". I'd been to both Jerry's Famous Deli and Solley's as well as a few deli's that will remain nameless.Canters I located on Fairfax which is the perfect place; it is close to everything good and bad at the same time.The place is homogeneous; everything in the place is a tired white; walls, bowls as well as the waitress's uniform.We were greeted by a waitress who was at least 6 feet tall and towered over our table. The menu was vast in choices; I was overwhelmed by it all.  She was very gruff and took out order as if we were interrupting her night.My adopted Grammy Esther opened my world to all things Jewish. She never put anything special or odd emphasis of being a Jew and eating the goodness. She just cooked and I ate and was happy. She never taught me to cook she just taught me to eat. So here goes. ..I ordered the Matzo Ball Soup; a clear broth with a GIANT Matzo Ball floating in it. I had never had one this large. Wow, crazier than what I had expected from my years of little dumplings of matzo. We also ordered the Pastrami on Rye and it was to die for; all that yummy meat which was warm, moist and the bread was without question the best I had ever had. Who knew that this somewhat grey place had such good food hidden within? Then we had two more wonderful experiences...Dr. Browns Black Cherry Soda....goodness what more....then there it was, the best chocolate rugelach.So the place is not a pretty site and the waitress seemed to be bothered by our being there; I have returned over and over and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Author: Maureen C.
Reviews.Content: It's been awhile since I've been here say 2004 and back then I would have rated this joint a 4.  Came back and got seated right away.  The host was fine, the waitress was nice, the food came at an appropriate time, Alex L ate his reuben and ordered cookies.  I was going to rate this place at a 3-4 because I liked the history this place had and the guys behind the pastry counter were nice and accomodating.  Come time to pay and we tell the guy how to split the bill. Oh my goodness I have never met such an ornery cashier!  He was so cantankerous and made a fuss and even blamed my friend for him being unable to comprehend how the bill was being split!!  (When in honesty, the frickin cashier was the one having problems comprehending what we wanted. )Really????Honestly this is the last time I'm going to recommend this place because there are other people who need a job and could do better.    Are you having a bad day, buddy?  Take a break, have a snack so your blood sugar won't be low and you won't be cranky.  Respect your customers please, cause they bring in the word of mouth and honestly I'm disappointed.I'm disappointed because I was looking forward to eating something good and introducing my friend to this joint. But honestly, not even the best meal can wipe the taste of crap from bad customer service.What an embarrassment it is when you pick this kind of employee to represent your business!

Reviews.Author: Kellis L.
Reviews.Content: This is as legit a place as you can get in southern cali. I was hanging out late here one night waiting for my friend band to start and a waitress (not my waitress thankfully) is refilling the sugar pourers. She accidentally dumps sugar all over the table while talking to me about her kids. Then she scoops the sugar off the edge of the table back into the big container of sugar with her bare hands, all without ever breaking the talk about her kids. Dispite this, I still eat here and so does Rodney Bingenhimer. It's that good, plus it's open 24/7.

Reviews.Author: Leigh M.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is fantastic, if for nothing else than for the decor, which has to be original. It's like stepping into a time warp in a very fun way. Plus, it's open 24-hours and has validated parking. Pretty good divey-diner sort of food -- matzo ball soup, grilled cheese and fries, and such. Definitely a great late-night spot.

Reviews.Author: Jaxon K.
Reviews.Content: Canters is a second home to me. Ever since I can remember it he moment I walked in the door an overwhelming sense of comfort came over me. I love canters it's the place to be. Go get yourself a Brooklyn ave. and a bowl of mosh mosh.

Reviews.Author: andrya h.
Reviews.Content: I have been here four times.....All though the menu has a lot of amazing options, I have gotten the same thing every time....A stacked turkey sandwich on Rye Bread. I HATE rye bread....Yet for some reason, every time I walk out the door, I find myself missing it.....Oh my God...Im dating a sandwich...

Reviews.Author: Yoning Y.
Reviews.Content: I don't know much about Jewish deli but it looked dirty, service was not great, and though now I think I should have ordered something like, corned beef or something, the food was not good at all. I tried their cake and it was dry. Hard to come up with good things to say about this place. Oh yeah and overpriced. I didn't realize this place was so famous. I feel I am missing something, yet don't care to figure out what.

Reviews.Author: Patrick H.
Reviews.Content: ewwwwwwwwww. Why does this place have four stars when it tasted like Dennys?1: The first time I came here, it was pretty late and we already had dinner, so we just wanted dessert. When the waiter found out that 3/4 of us wanted dessert, he openly showed how aggravated he was, closed his book, and said "alright" and walked away rudely. if you don't like that, then don't work at a 24 hour deli. The dessert I had was highly bland and not memorable.2: So, after finally coming here for dinner, it wasn't that much better. First, we tried to order dinner entrees, but we were told the kitchen stops making them at 11. It was 11:02. Okay, fine no big deal. After going through the menu, which was expensive, huge, and highly unorganized, we ordered. I got the Tuna Salad sandwich, to which my server asked me, "Just lettuce?"....and that made me go..."ummm...i guess"... Apparently, to get other stuff on it, its extra. I also got it with potatoe salad, which looked like cole slaw and tasted like death. Sandwich was okay, but I've had a much better one at subway. Sadddd!!!!The pickles they serve here are good, but you can get them anywhere. Everything was old, except their menu prices. My friend had the eggs florentine, which he said tasted really bad but he ate it anyways. My other friend got a bagel with his breakfast, and when he asked for cream cheese, they told him it would cost extra.

Reviews.Author: Bryan C.
Reviews.Content: Had a 2am visit here one night... went with the mushroom, avocado and swiss burger... let's just say my drunk ass was satisfied.

Reviews.Author: Dave L.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  Always come by here when I'm in LA.  They have the best apple turnovers I have ever eaten.  They have a very good bakery and deli but the food from the kitchen can be only described as mediocre.  Still five stars because the bakery and deli rocks, theres nothing comparable to Canter's in Hawaii.

Reviews.Author: Frank M.
Reviews.Content: Hey you! Are you lookin' for a cup of coffee and a selection of comfort foods or maybe a delicious sandwich or pastry to get your drunk ass home after 2 A.M.? Or you might want to be served by a cute, surly, little old lady who doesn't like your haircut and is possibly pissed she has to work the overnight shift? If so then this may be your place. I mean seriously this place is an icon. It has so much history and a legacy of great food and good times to uphold. I would give this place 4 stars just on the amount of fun I have had here and the things and people I have seen over the years. People watching here is A+ and adds to the nostalgia. Plus it's 24 hours. You have to appreciate having anything this great available to you at all hours of the day. And if Max's across the street is crowded you can always hit the Kibitz Room. Sit in Rodney's booth if he isn't...Or join him.

Reviews.Author: Patrick T.
Reviews.Content: It's hard to say anything bad about Cantor's. I love Canter's and it's strata of architectural history visible in the upper level fifties-era time capsule dining room that's enclosed in a forties building shell. I also love the naugahyde couchettes, the historic framed photos of the restaurant on the walls, the surrounding, local Jewish culture, the celebs, and quasi celebs, the wide-eyed tourists, the L.A.natives, the deli, the brusque, impatient waitress'--but, I'm NOT in love with the not one, but two occasions where I was served scrambled eggs that had a curious palatal note of Windex brand window cleaner! It's not just me! My girlfriend agreed, and she has a friend who agreed.  The first time it occurred, I counted my losses and considered it a possible anomaly. Then, on a later visit, I gave the scrambled eggs a second try and got the same Windex special again! This time though, I complained and asked the waitress to send the meal back and replace it--something you learn you don't want to do at Cantor's. The waitress' incredulous stare alone, told me I was completely nuts! She issued the standard Canter's waitress "heavy huff" as she snatched up my plate. While I waited for my new eggs to appear, I sat there waiting in mortal fear they might be the same, and what would I do if they were! I couldn't bear to face the same hostility again.The eggs returned with the eggs, I waited for her to leave out of sight, and timidly tasted the new ones: WINDEX AGAIN! She shortly returned to ask how the new eggs were, to which I lied and reported that they were "great". I had already resigned to eating the bacon and toast only, and I artfully messed-up the eggs to create the illusion that I at least ate some portion of them. To further the deception, I left my used  napkin on the "finished plate". Forgetting the Windex for a moment, I recall hearing that not "cleaning" your plate alone can inspire the Jewish mother wrath inside the Cantor's waitress. They might ask if you're aware of the children starving in [fill in the current starving third world country]?   Many years ago, I had another, more personal encounter with a Cantor's waitress, where she disallowed to order a dinner for the reason that I'd already had my desert (a vanilla shake) and stormed away from my table.In spite of all the hidden Jewish Mother protocall and politics involved in Cantor's dining, I still love the place, but, beside not eating desert before supper, and clearing my plate, I've made a personal vow to never order the scrambled eggs again...on the other hand, if I'm ever in the Fairfax District and need to clean my car windows in a pinch.....--papa tango

Reviews.Author: Grace T.
Reviews.Content: This is a total LA hipsters hang out, which makes for amusing people watching.  I've eaten at Katella Deli and at Carnegie Deli, and thought that Canter was pretty average.  I got half a pastrami and cup of vegetable soup and he got the grilled cheese and chicken noodle.  The pastrami was sliced thin, I just wish the bread was a bit warmer.  I got a few cookies to go, the guy working at the counter was not the most helpful.

Reviews.Author: Jesse B.
Reviews.Content: open 24 hours and known as LA's classic jewish deli, canter's is as delightful and great and grand as you all heard. sure, the service can be a bit dodgy at times and the menu is hit and miss (well, there's lyke a million things so its bound to be) but Canter's is an experience no matter what.The french dip is supreme as well as the matzo ball soup that's just as good as grandma's.Canter's is a spot that you keep coming back again and again and again. . . .Beautiful People Ranking:9/10Ritz Status:6/10Crave Rating:9/10BIG FAT SAMMICHES!

Reviews.Author: Irwin M.
Reviews.Content: Was Jonesing for a pastrami Reuben and Canters rarely disappoints.  I had a couple of requests: well done fries and please, please serve the sandwich HOT.  Our wonderful waitress, Robin, could NOT disappoint.  After bringing us a plate of pickles and explaining the difference of the two types (New vs. Dill--I told her I was a New Man), she brought our sandwiches Hot and perfect.  She brought more new pickles and replaced our coffee with by spilling out the remaining coffee in our cups with a fresh cup altogether.  Little things mean a lot.  I could only eat half the Reuben, mouthwatering leftover for later/tomorrow.  Finished our visit with a prune Hamentashen to take home for later.  Wonderful experience that Robin made extra memorable.  She set the waitperson  standard at Canter's.

Reviews.Author: George M.
Reviews.Content: Canter's makes a good hamburger. The secret is the bread and the pickles. However their french fries are a fried void of tastelessness. Order the bagel chips instead. Yes baglechips and a hamburger, yes its a lot of carbs, but if you are feeling guilty about your carb intake you really shouldn't be at Canter's anyway.

Reviews.Author: Hank K.
Reviews.Content: Best thing going in L.A. as far as a Jewish deli goes. This is the place to go for a hot pastrami sandwich in the area with Langer's a close second. I won't bother going into prices as the full menu can be seen on their website. For the cost, I would like some more pastrami in the sandwich but I get the rest of the wife's so I leave satisfied. The bakery also has a nice selection of sweets. They have Black & White cookies but are made with lemon cake. The place is clean and so is the restroom. Service is good day or night 24/7.

Reviews.Author: Rubina H.
Reviews.Content: Here is another historical LA diner, but the years that have passed have not been kind to the aesthetic appeal of this place. It's rather dingy inside and the food is mediocre. Their bakery is pretty amazing though. If anything, you should come in and peruse the bakery and go no further because you won't be missing out on much. Granted, I appreciate this place for it's long standing existence in LA. Angelyne frequents this joint often and has some of her favorite confections in that bakery. Unless you see her legendary pink Corvette out front, this one's okay to pass. Don't get me wrong, though - I'm going to show some love (all 3 stars worth) to Canter's just cause.

Reviews.Author: Liza L.
Reviews.Content: I'm not Jewish. And i'm not from L.A. (okay L.A. "area" but not L.A.). But i f'ing LOVE this place, and places like this. I'm a nostalgic, sentimental fool. and when my ex brought me here, i instantly loved it. It made me wish i lived in L.A. and could come to this cute little deli all the time and buy a black and white cookie or rugula, or those good crispy light cookies, i don't know the name but they're good! It was really late the first time i came here, and they didn't seem to mind that the other guy with us was basically passed out in his seat. We didn't pay much attention to him either. I had an awesome pastrami and my ex (he wasn't my ex at the time) had a matzo ball soup, which i had never had, it was like a huge ball in a bowl of soup, but it was way tastier than i thought it was gonna be.They also have a bar there, the Kibbitz room, where all these famous people have played. It's really super small and hard to find a seat, it gets packed.

Reviews.Author: Jin H.
Reviews.Content: ROACHES!  while we were eating, a roach crawled out of the wall and hung out, like a puppy begging for scraps.  told the waiter, and he was like, "oh...sorry."  guess it's a common occurance. *BARF*

Reviews.Author: Kimiyo I.
Reviews.Content: Hmmm...I have mixed emotions on Canter's.  My dilemna is that I want to give it  4 stars, but can't just because it's pricey, the service here is a little iffy, and the food ranges from ok to good, but not worth the price.  It's cool that it's a landmark and all, but I really think you pay for the experience of sitting in this landmark.    I ordered the Fressers- pastrami/corned beef sandwich with potato salad and cole slaw.  The sandwich was delicious, although can't say that it was leaps and bounds better than the same sandwich I get from another Southbay deli (which is twice the size and almost half the price!)  The potato salad was tasty- really heavy handed on the celery seed, but I didn't mind it.  Cole slaw oddly enough, reminded me of watermelon...go figure!  My dining buddy had the beef dip which was decent, but his fries are what stole the show.  Almost wedge cut, crispy/golden on the outside and soft and fluffy on the inside.  My favorite kinda frie. To finish it off picked-up some kinda chocolate danish-y pastry to go. Which ended up being dry and a little flavorless.  So final assessment.  Canter's is a good place to go in the wee hours of the night when nothing else is open, but a bit uneven in value, taste, and price.

Reviews.Author: Bean K.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is ok, best for late night food after the bars close. The Kibbitz Room is fun if you're drunk enough. I love me some matzoh ball soup and the last time I had theirs it was completely tasteless. I grew up on this soup so I was super disappointed and vowed never to eat from here again until the weekend rolled around and it was 4am and I was starving.

Reviews.Author: Alex H.
Reviews.Content: The food here is friggin awesome, if you can deal with some downright nasty people at the front desk. The corned beef or Pastrami are my favorite sandwich's with a SUPER fresh and exciting fruit cup! I mean really how often have you ordered fruit at a restaurant and gotten the usual half ripe melon with thawed out grapes? Canters fruit cups have all sorts of cool things in them like grapefruit, Mango and strawberries...all fresh! And dont forget the Cheesecake (Which can be ordered by the POUND.)  As far as the service...id say the wait staff are ok,  nothing spectacular.Now for the fun part... its a whole other story when you get the counter to pay your bill. I was with my partner and another couple. We wanted to split the bill so each couple had thier own...The old woman at the counter rolled her eyes, and proceeded to yell at us out on how we should have done this when we ordered, and how it was going to cause a huge problem...Yes yes we are bad people..we should have thought about that before we ordered. They don't seem to have any electronic order system in place like most restaurants do, so the woman was going to have to write a new ticket...SUCH WORK.To avoid causing another "blitz" and not to keep the poor people behind us waiting, we just threw one of our credit cards at the old troll and left.  Its too bad, because they have been around for so long and have legendary food.  I would have given this place at least 4 stars but this experience ruined it. In Los Angeles there are SO MANY places to eat..and this isn't the only deli.. I hope someone in management is reading these reviews because there are quite a few pissed off people. For a much better experience try the one at Treasure Island in Las Vegas is just as good, minus the bitchy people!!

Reviews.Author: Christian Q.
Reviews.Content: Great late night spot for breakfast, coffee and pastries. I  would avoid ordering anything outside of the breakfast realm, due to fact that they specialize in breakfast. One time I ordered a chicken Milanese (Breaded Chicken) and it wasn't to bad, but it was obvious the chefs deep fried the chicken which made it taste like a giant chicken nugget. Stick to simple plates.

Reviews.Author: jay p.
Reviews.Content: My all time favorite deli! I love the fact that it is family run and managed! Gary Canter is my all time favorite. This place is the perfect combination of great food, fast service and a "how ya doing" attitude. They have been using the family secret of the twice baked rye bread for the thicker crust- which really makes for a great sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Daniel P.
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful, I always come here after the club whenever I come down.

Reviews.Author: Super G.
Reviews.Content: If you like paying 5.50 for a bowl of instant chicken soup with hard matzoh balls go there!, / also my girlfriend ordered the Tuna Melt, not what i expected for  11.50 , sorry to pinpoint the expensive price..but they are a Jewish Deli, and I'm Jewish!! yuck...never..for about the same if not LESS $$, i will go and push Factors deli on pico, much better value/ food! also parking is nasty at canters, though the crazy bum chanting loudly ' down with the white house was a nice touch'

Reviews.Author: Andrew C.
Reviews.Content: Went here late last night and got the corned beef and hash with eggs. Canter's has the appeal of a very expansive menu and is open 24 hours. And my party was seated quickly, not bad considering how busy the parking lot was. However, the food itself is not that good, ranging from just okay to bad. Also, my waitress was slow to give me the check and also forgot my toast until reminded. But the expectations for the place...it's one of those delis with almost everything on it, it pretty much fit. I am not keen to go back, but I'm not going to be kicking and screaming if someone wants to. I do feel like it is overpriced, but I knew that going in. Really, I should have done drive-thru at McDonald's or something.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A.
Reviews.Content: The most overrated place in LA. Dirty, average taste, meh.

Reviews.Author: Sarah B.
Reviews.Content: Pastrami melts in your mouth. Huge portions. Free parking lot on the corner of Fairfax, easy to get in and out of. Delicious pickles. The best coffee I've ever had. Everything from the bakery is out of this world.  Not trendy at all- although there is the occasional LA yuppy on their cell phone. Usually encounter homeless people on the way to the parking lot- but they've always been nice.  Waitstaff has always been excellent. Easy checkout- don't forget to validate your parking stub!

Reviews.Author: jason h.
Reviews.Content: The canters of my youth is gone.  The food tastes the same, service same too.  What's different? The last two times I went (including my birthday) however there were fruit flies in the bakery corner.  I told the staff and they seemed to shrug it off.  How do you say ewww in Yiddish?

Reviews.Author: Nonnie T.
Reviews.Content: I am a Filipino, and our friend from Beverly Hills who also stays at the LaBrea (apt) community introduced us to Canters in 1997 where I first tasted Lox & Bagels and this one special borcsht soup.  We've been regular visitors since.  We used to live 35 miles away; but we would drive to Canters even after 9pm just to be fed - whatever is on the menu, although I'd always have the Lox-&-Bagels and pastries from the bakeshop.  Now that we live in the desert, every opportunity to drive to Los Angeles MUST include a trip to Canters otherwise, the visit will be incomplete.  I forgot the names of some of the wonderful servers there; but I hope they recognize us when we visit again because I will never forget them.  My next order will be the Matzo Ball.

Reviews.Author: Ray R.
Reviews.Content: my coworker took me here the last time i was in lala land.  traditional jewish deli, and apparently pretty popular down there.first thing i noticed when we walked in was the variety of meats in the deli section.  i had the matzo ball soup, which was good.  the matzo ball was squishy and creamy almost.  i had their famous pastrami sandwich.  i swear, it was enough to feed two.  the amount of meat they fit into the sandwich was amazing.  they had this huge dessert section to, with lots of pastries and cakes.i definitely have to find my way back here next time i'm down there.

Reviews.Author: Kristine H.
Reviews.Content: Many years ago, I was visiting friends in Santa Monica.  After a few long nights that inevitably turned into early mornings, I was beginning to feel under the weather.  I mentioned this to my friend who proclaimed that I needed a bowl of matzo ball soup.  Not one to argue about a good bowl of soup or its restorative powers, I agreed to this proposition and off we went to this venerable L.A. deli.Gruff waitresses, old school booths with table side phone jacks and a cool stained glass ceiling made me think that I stepped back in time when we entered the dining area.  This place has been open since the mid 20s and it has an extensive menu for breakfast, lunch or dinner and anytime in between 24 hours a day!  They close only for Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur.  We have visited during the night though when they are cleaning the kitchen and grill but you'll be informed by your server once you sit down.  The menu is just a little more limited unless you're willing to wait.Back to my fond memory... my first meal here was a bowl of Mishmosh with matzo ball, kreplach, rice and noodles.  I was urged to add the chicken and the carrots to further round out the flavour and I did.  Over ten bucks for a bowl of soup?  Okay.  It was going to make me feel better right?  Okay... go big or go home, right?  I added a cherry phosphate (ended up having two before we left) and we noshed on free kosher pickles until our food arrived.  My grumpy waitress gave my friend his blintzes which looked absolutely wonderful.  She then returned to place an overflowing bowl of beautifully shimmering chicken broth in front of me and its aroma immediately filled my nostrils.  There was only one matzo ball but what a matzo it was!  The damned thing was the size of a frakking baseball!  The kreplach (meat-filled dumplings) were hand-formed and there was plenty of rice, noodles, fat slices of carrots and shredded chicken.  From the first bite into the gorgeously fat matzo to the last slurp of the broth, I was pleased.  If you are lucky, they will bring you bagel chips from the day old bagels.  Take care though, sometimes a cinnamon raisin slice will work its way in and that doesn't taste too good dipped in chicken stock.  If you are unfortunate and they are out, tough.  They are just out.  They'll bring you bread and butter for a small charge but it's just not the same.  The bagel chips are perfect for dipping!Since that fateful night, I've had quite a few breakfasts here and too many late night meals to count.  I can extol the virtues of their pastrami on rye and sing the praises of their Monte Cristos with strawberry jam.  Yes the corn and the fruit cocktail are from a can but they serve squares of gelatin and kick-ass apple strudel!  And seriously?  Is that a SMALL chef's salad?  Look at all the meats... the cheeses... and wow!  There's enough lettuce to choke a goat!  Why do I keep coming back in this city with so many dining choices?  I might flirt with other menu options but my heart belongs to that hearty bowl of mishmosh with carrots and chicken.  One cherry phosphate to start and keep 'em coming!Quick notes:  I'm unsure if this has changed but their toilets are upstairs.  I don't know how they accommodate those who cannot use stairs so I marked "no" for Wheelchair Accessible.  Street parking is sometimes available but you'd do better to park in the adjoining lot.  On their busier nights, they validate with a minimum purchase.  I can't remember what the minimum is but if you can't make it with your food tab, just stop by the bakery before leaving and grab some black + white cookies, rugelach or those little marzipan cookies that are like crack.  You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Phil W.
Reviews.Content: I haven't tried the food here, but I can say with absolute certainty that the bakery is phenomenal!  The cheesecakes, the cookies, and the macaroons were all fantastic.  Each item had its own unique textures and flavors, and they were all delightful.  The highlight of my Canter's experience, though was the Hungarian cheesecake...  This smooth, slightly tart, and decadently rich concoction was probably the best cheesecake I've ever had.  Each bite was a little piece of joy to be savored.  To top it all off, our waitress was very down to earth, helpful, and attentive, Canter's validates parking for the small lot next door, and they're open 24 hours!

Reviews.Author: Sam P.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best deli in LA.  The parking lot is free for those who eat at the deli.  They start you off with complimentary pickles and I had the barley bean soup, delicious.  The Monte Cristo sandwich is the only one I've ever had that was done the way it was supposed to be served.  It's French toast meets sandwich with syrup, cinnamon, powdered sugar and jelly.  It's always happening there and the decor is old school 60's style.  Bring a big appetite and enjoy.

Reviews.Author: CJ C.
Reviews.Content: Food was decent and wait staff took a while the night I went...but I guess that is not typical. Cool atmosphere and nice bakery/deli counters to buy goodies to take home. Definately worth a try.

Reviews.Author: ben c.
Reviews.Content: I think this is the best deli in LA. The Brooklyn Ave. is my favorite deli sandwich. Its huge so you never really have to wait. The down sides are some of the servers are gross looking. The biggest problem is paying. If you have to split the bill in any shape or form they freak out so watch out for that.

Reviews.Author: Brianne C.
Reviews.Content: Sassy waitresses, enormous bowls of matzo ball soup, sweet German potato salad, and savory corned beef sandwiches. What's not to love?

Reviews.Author: Laura P.
Reviews.Content: This is a really old school diner and deli and it is great that you can eat in or pick up food for take-away.  I ordered a pastrami breakfast sandwich (breakfast is served all day). The prices are reasonable and the servers are friendly.  I asked for tomatoes but they brought me potatoes instead but handled the error well by bringing me tomatoes in addition to the potatoes I'd already received.   Just a note that you pay the cashier at the front, not your waitress.  I will definitely be back, especially since they are open 24 hours!

Reviews.Author: Denny B.
Reviews.Content: I came here due to watching a recent episode of the Steve Harvey show.  I had the Canter's Fairfax which is their corned beef and pastrami sandwich on rye bread.  The sandwich was excellent and the server was just as good. It also comes with the option of potato salad or cole slaw, I chose the potato salad.  The potato salad is on the sweet side, which I'm not too fond of, but it was still good.  Also had the matzo ball soup. Can't really compare it to anything, but it was good.  I really recommend this place. Definitely would eat here again.

Reviews.Author: A W.
