Reviews.Content: Canter's, Oh Canter's!  Everytime I see you on TV in my Burlingame living room, I shed a little tear.  You have to drives miles and miles here to get a decent bagel, and then in LA they are everywhere.  Dang it!  Canter's is the rock n' roll deli of all deli experiences.  Open 24/7, complete with 1960's - 1970's renovated decor, they have been in the Fairfax district for years.  Grumpy bus boys, surly, matzo-ball slingy waitresses, this place has it all.  The Kibbutz room is not one to miss with friends out late on the weekends.  It wasn't that long ago that this place was full of smoke and drinks late, late into the wee hours of the mornings.   The food is divine, the deli case reliable.  DO NOT MISS!! The Bakery on the way out.  You just cannot do better than Canter's for deli in LA.

Reviews.Author: Sonny D.
Reviews.Content: I went to this place with my friends Steve, Mika and Tyler. Thanks for the pickles! I even ate the mustard by the spoonful, to the dismay of my friends. I got the pastrami and loaded it with the sweet mustard. Though the service was slow, I still give my waitress a 20% tip because I left that satisfied.

Reviews.Author: John S.
Reviews.Content: I have a T-shirt from this place that I wear occasionally, so I can't really hate on it, but why does everything cost $7382?  I'm used to L.A. restaurants being expensive, especially the famous ones, I really am, but man.  This place kinda makes you want to be depressed that you're not rich.

Reviews.Author: Gerry K.
Reviews.Content: Update!  I had a good meal at Canter's!! Holy sh*t!  Their kreplach soup- horrible.  Their pastrami- a shonda (French for shame). But this Monday night, I ordered the turkey pastrami on toasted rye with avocado, lettuce, tomato and sweet potato fries and it hit the spot.  Plus, the cool server, Danlel, was nice and attentive.  FInally.

Reviews.Author: Rachel M.
Reviews.Content: canters is expensive!!!!!! i used to come here a lot in highschool... i had a goal, to sit at canters for 24 hours. just drinking coffee with a couple people. taking smoking shifts. that never happened. probably because it was a dumb waste of time idea. anyway, i had a bagel with lox last time i was here. it was really.... thick. 13 bucks. i dunno. too much cream cheese, and the bagel was not toasted as i had asked for it. i did. however taste my bfs reuben (12 bucks?) which was yumyumyummmmycakes. and as i recall, the bagel chips and hummus are delicious, and the matzoh ball soup is outta this worrrrllld!anywhere open 24 hrs is cool, too. but whatever you do, dont go to the fake canters in planet hollywood in vegas!! its lame!

Reviews.Author: Kathy S.
Reviews.Content: Menu has so much to choose from...it made my head spin. I went with the Tuna Melt on Rye.. It was truly amazing. I loved the bread so much I went over to the bakery side and got myself a loaf along with a piece of the best cheese cake I have ever tasted...really. Very friendly staff as well.

Reviews.Author: Kimmy T.
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this place is so popular.  Food was gross and way overpriced.  Maybe we ordered the wrong things.  The bakery items in the display case do look good though.

Reviews.Author: Roxana K.
Reviews.Content: One word: Mothaeffindeliciousness! I usually go to Canter's for their baked goods.  Goodness gracious they have a variety of treats I have tried and so far, SO GOOD.  I have yet to try several other options which I'm sure I'll eventually get to.  I have ordered food to go and it was good: I believe it was a melt---LOVELY!  They also have a parking lot with validated parking.  Lastly, open TWENTY-FOUR-SEVEN baby!

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I'm honered to be the 140th person to review Canter's.  A friend suggested I try Canter's when I told them that I was on a quest to find the ultimate Bagel+Lox+Cream Cheese sandwich.  I should mention that I'm sure I was a Jew in a previous life or two or three.  This place really feels like home to me.  Besides a great lox sandwich (make sure you order a side of capers and get the cream cheese on the side 'cause they're really too generous!), ya gotta try the potato knish (oy!)  I always get 2 to-go.  Even though I like the lox sandwich a bit more at Nate and Al's, I just love the way this place makes me feel.  I do love Artie's deli in NYC, but Canter's will always have a special place in my heart!  Shabbat Shalom y'all!

Reviews.Author: Z. R.
Reviews.Content: yeah... no. I understand you're full of yourself, Canter's. Everyone has to go to Canter's at least once when they live in LA. So pat yourself on the back for being such an institution, or whatever.But, landmark or not, when you've got an overpriced menu, at least the food should be really good. And if it's not really good, in fact it's just mediocre, then at least it should come out within, oh, I don't know, 45 minutes.And if the food takes a really long time, then the service should at least be kinda friendly. And when the servers actually roll their eyes at you for asking for a check at the end of your meal (well, way past the end of your meal), that's not good service. So I don't see the allure of Canter's, other than it's historical.Yeah, I DO have to go to Canter's, once, because I live in LA. But after that? I don't have to go back.

Reviews.Author: Michelle Y.
Reviews.Content: thanks to groupon, i only paid 6 bucks for a meal for two. we ordered a potato knish with gravy on the side and a beef dip. ok first the knish, it's good and is a huge ball of basically mashed potatoes with a bread coating. dipping it into the gravy it tastes like thanksgiving potatoes. it's good, but i mean, it's just potatoes and gravy. my bf says it's his favorite thing to get and was ranting and raving about how good it is. the beef dip was ok. it was dry as hell even with the dip. i am not a fan. i wanted to try the pastrami and maybe thats where we went wrong because that looked a little better than the beef dip we had. the fries are good though. they were the highlight of our meal.free parking in a lot on the side of the building, which is another plus. if we ever go back i'll have to try the matzo ball soup or the pastrami to see what the hype is all about.

Reviews.Author: Mary W.
Reviews.Content: The pickles, ye gods, the pickles!  And the pastrami, and the matzo ball soup, and the pastries and I've heard, the music.  Oh my gosh... the PICKLES!!

Reviews.Author: Max P.
Reviews.Content: I've only had the strawberry cheesecake here, but I was not impressed.  The cheesecake itself was kinda dry, and the strawberries were underripe and looked like they had maybe had colors added.  I ate it, and it was sugary and fatty, but I expected more.

Reviews.Author: Sue B.
Reviews.Content: I went here one early morning (like 4am) with some friends and we got the worse service. There was nobody in the place at the time and I wanted to try it after being out all night. Well we had the oldest meanest looking waitress who looked like she would have rather took off her wig and left then serve us. Maybe because my party was not considered desirable in her generation of 1910. Me myself being black, my friend was gay and my other friend was kinda punk rock. anyhoo i ordered some scrambled eggs and bacon and believe me when I say our food took FOREVER...Did I mention no one was there!! I cant really comment on the taste of anyone else's food. But my eggs were disgusting. I really didn't like this place, decor or otherwise...Now I WOULD rather take off my wig than go back, and since I dont wear one I will never be back.

Reviews.Author: HaileyTIffany M.
Reviews.Content: This food is so good that I'm afraid to eat there too often or I'll get really fat. There! Can you tell I lived in LA for a long time? That oughta do it. So sad.Particularly of concern for me was the delicious pastry spread, which was as yummy as the rockers who are a regular clientele here. Ew. Gross. I can't believe I just said that. Uck. I always picked up a variety of strudel when the little German fat girl in me just couldn't take it anymore.Anyway, I used to play here a lot, and in fact, it's where I met the people who knew the people who gave me my first big break. Yay! Playing here is really sort of horrible, yet wonderful: you play mostly for other musicians who don't care, or for drunk people who shout at you. Then you sit down and watch people more talented then you play. Or you watch people much worse than you play, and feel better. Then you go home and eat, or sit down and eat. Sometimes, people say wonderful things, and all is right with the world. The drinks are always extremely strong, if you are female, and there is a male bartending. If you're drinking beer, you get shots, for free, too. If there is the grumpy old lady bartender, then the drinks suck. If you're a guy, sorry, I got nothing. The walk home is a little weird-ish, as you pray not to get mugged on the way back to the horrid parking situation. I don't know why some enterprising creep doesn't just build a huge parking garage in the middle of WeHo (besides the Beverly Center). Maybe it's the zoning.

Reviews.Author: Matthew K.
Reviews.Content: I have a friend who travels to LA a lot, he always stops here every time he's in town. Now I can understand why. Canters is a great place for breakfast, lunch or dinner. This was our first stop after he picked me up from LAX. I had the Ruben and the potato salad, it was really good, not just because I was jet-legged. The service was good and wait times for our food wasn't bad either. Even the pickles were good! I'm sure next time were in town, we will be stopping there again, I look forward to it.

Reviews.Author: Adam F.
Reviews.Content: Burgers on challah buns: brilliant. And it was a tasty burger, too. Their sweet potato fries were some of the best I've had, their coleslaw probably *was* the best I've had, and the pastrami was also extremely good. Service was helpful, quick and super friendly. And yes, we did stop by the bakery on the way out to take stuff home. It was also tasty (though their macaroni salad wasn't as good as it looked... it was a bit too salty.)

Reviews.Author: Janelle R.
Reviews.Content: Pricey? Yes, but everything I have ordered has been worth the price. Delicious. Make sure you get a black and white cookie from the bakery on your way out!

Reviews.Author: Rebecca F.
Reviews.Content: When I lived in LA, I came here ONCE. I was completely drunk, and had only enough money for a shot of espresso and a pickle. It was divine!

Reviews.Author: diana y.
Reviews.Content: "after a hollywood bowl concert, my uncle suggested we "late night dine" at canter's - open 24hrs. this would be my first time and it was OK. parking was difficult because the lot fills up so quickly! there was an attendant but wasn't of much help because we had my elderly aunt with us and needed a handicap space and there wasn't any available. we ended up getting dropped off at the front while my uncle looks for a place to park. we go inside. there are cases of cookies and desserts and the aroma off mixed cuisines, delicatessens and meat. after we were reunited with my uncle, the host seated us in the back dining room. this was connected to a bar with very loud music and i could hardly hear what my group was saying half the time. i guess you have to be in the mood for loud music ... i wasn't. the menu - there are a bahgillion items to choose from. i was too tired to look at all the possible vegetarian options and apparently so was my group. we ended up getting some dessert. everyone seemed to enjoy their choices, but i went with the strawberry cheesecake. yeah, i wasn't a fan. but hey, i didn't order anything from the menu of substance so i can be wrong about it (since it clearly receives great reviews). hopefully i get a chance to return and order a "meal" to give a better analysis. but it seems like they have a spot at Dodger Stadium. we're planning to catch a few more games this season, so i'm sure we'll check that out too."

Reviews.Author: Kali C.
Reviews.Content: Man oh MAN.  I'm not Jewish, but I always love having some  Jewish meat in me. A 2 am corned beef sammich is the ultimate food orgasm.

Reviews.Author: Miles H.
Reviews.Content: One of the things that makes people fiercely loyal to a restaurant is history. If the place grows along with the people, it can start to take on a life of its own. But this is only one half of the equation- to have real staying power, an establishment needs to serve food that people are compelled to eat- food that stands the test of time. Enter Canter's Jewish Delicatessen, a genuine LA landmark that is as famous for its celebrity clientele as it is for its Reubens and house-made pickles. It started in Jersey City in 1924 and then came west. Canter's proceeded to grow with LA, and establish itself as an institution.  We wet our whistles with a couple of cream sodas to start, and quickly dug in to our fat sandwiches. The Canter's Special was corned beef with saurkraut, and it lived up to its name, and then some. We also enjoyed pastrami that was hot and savory, and about five different varieties of mustard that really made each bite unique. Matza ball soup is a must, and the crispy bagel chips accompanying it gave a nice crunchy contrast. The menu is huge here, and with so much to try, you'll be coming back again and again. The world famous pickles were crisp and tangy, with just the right balance of salt and spice. The huge selection of pastries and sweets in the bakery seems to go on and on. Cupcakes, scones, bagels, loaves of bread, pies, muffins, rolls, tarts...it really is endless. As numerous rock stars and actors have found, there's a lot more to appreciate at Canter's than just late hours!

Reviews.Author: Don K.
Reviews.Content: For years, I've said that you can't get a decent corned beef sandwich, or pizza, west of Chicago. There used to be two delis in Long Beach that were, at best OK, but alas they are both gone. When my son Ed and his wife moved to back Hollywood from Brooklyn, they wanted to hook-up at Canter's. Fairfax is a long haul from Long Beach, but if you grew up on good,real corned beef as I did, it is worth the drive. A real Jewish deli right here in LaLa Land. Who knew? It's great and it's huge. Not only are the Knishes, Blintzes, Corned Beef & Pastrami top notch, but the Matzo Ball soup takes you back East. It's all comfort food Deja Vu. Lastly, but not leastly, there is an in-house bakery that has all of those yummy ethnic pastries that I scarfed as a kid and never learned the names of.

Reviews.Author: Harry E.
Reviews.Content: My good friend Alison lives right by Canters and it is always a plus to go here when I am in town.  I love this place.  It is soo good.  The Matzah Ball soup is the bomb.  Pastrami melt is soo good and regular pastarami sandwich is great also. The Sandos are enormous.   The brisket is very good and the cookies are awesome especially the Black and white cookies.  Also the pickles are very solid especially the cuccumber pickles.  This place is great and have never had a bad meal here.  I cannot wait to get back here.

Reviews.Author: Alena B.
Reviews.Content: Corned beef too sweet pastrami tastes like a hot dog gave me the wrong bread and the potato salad tastes like a bowl of sugar. The best thing was my over priced dr browns I went back with my sister a bit later And the Matzah Ball was delicious but the soup (the one with rice and carrots and chicken) I wouldn't get the chicken in it. Dried out and gross. The service sucked the first time and this second trip and stay away from the deserts.... If you can tell the difference between good and crap. Don't get the Cheesecake... It's... .Not cheesecake.

Reviews.Author: Garrett L.
Reviews.Content: It is what it is.  Go, if you like it then you get to go back--if you don't like it, don't go back because they won't miss you.  :)

Reviews.Author: Carmen M.
Reviews.Content: Must try the black and blue burger on a gluten free bun!

Reviews.Author: Jess D.
Reviews.Content: Eddie Canters Delight is a man's sandwich for sure, and always try the pickles there strong and tart at the same time. This place can get a little pricey but, the quality of the food is what your paying for and best thing about this place is its OPEN 24 HRS are you kidding me!! no more late night greasy tacos or burgers for me, give me a fresh made deli sandwich please!! Oh! the Matzo Ball soup is good.

Reviews.Author: Joni W.
Reviews.Content: The food is marked up so high. Low quality ingredients, not done well. Their reputation and star-spotting can't make up for nasty food.

Reviews.Author: Alex S.
Reviews.Content: In the neighborhood with a friend of mine for an early evening dinner.  Two grilled cheese sandwiches that came with a handful potato chips thrown on each plate, one diet Pepsi, one cup of tea with lemon + the usual complimentary dill pickles, came to $23.00.  Seriously.  Apparently the attitude the girl at the cash register gave me for no reason was free of charge.  The girl who served our table was nice, 1 star for that.

Reviews.Author: Amy J.
Reviews.Content: This is a great 24 hour place.  Not like Denny's, but they have a variety of food for any time of the day.  It was a favourite for many celebrities past and present.  Visit any time of the night, and you're bound to see a bunch of people recovering from club visits.

Reviews.Author: Adriana M.
Reviews.Content: I've only been once after going to a movie at The Grove, but I'm dying to go back.  Their dessert/pastry case looks incredible.  We had a burger and a tuna melt that were classic deli fare and quite delish.  The only thing I didn't like was the pickle I ordered, but I think that's just a personal taste thing.  I'll update the review once I go back.

Reviews.Author: Lina O.
Reviews.Content: my friend who works in the hollywood area, says that canters is a "hollywood must-do" place so she took me there after watching a movie at the grove, just down the street. its an old school retro feel of a deli and bakery with yummy looking pastries. service was good. the ceiling is crazy, its like youre sitting under a huge tree in the fall... i got the sandwich special, half a sandwich and a soup. i got half of a canters corned beef sandwich and a bowl of matzo ball soup. o... m.... g.... the corned beef sandwich was so freakin good! it is so thinly sliced (think of pastrami sandwich at the hat) so delicious. i also got the matzo ball soup, because i hear its a common favorite. it was pretty good, very simple. a little doughy but im not sure if thats how its suppose to be. it was good though.theres a small parking next to the restaurant for customers only. might as well wait because good luck finding a spot on the street. you can get the parking validated though. its open 24 hours, but theres a wooden sign on the light post in the parking lot that says "please be quiet, our neighbors are sleeping" i wonder if they take that sign down when it becomes day light...?

Reviews.Author: Mark S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience.   Wait staff is top notch  - the west coast version of the rude NYC deli waiters but with sunny Cali personalities.   The Mish Mash is the BEST, don't miss it.  Knish was only average.   All specialty sandwiches terrific.

Reviews.Author: Lori K.
Reviews.Content: I love Canter's. I love it. it is awesome. first time coming here was a loooong time ago when some friends and i would go to 'scream' it was one of those underground kind of clubs pre goth days when we'd wear white makeup and be kind of vampire-ish but in a pretty way....so anyway we went to canter's at about 4am i was thinking denny's but we came here and i couldn't believe i haven't been here sooner.  have been going ever since and my kids had the best bologna sandwich ever when they just little things!   love canters love canters love canters!

Reviews.Author: Galaxy P.
Reviews.Content: Canters is a must stop deli/late night craving spot for me. I have never had a bad experience here and the food is always good. My favorite is the Matzo Ball soup with extra chicken. I also love their potato pancakes and burgers! The staff is really friendly and they always check on you when they walk by.

Reviews.Author: Steph Y.
Reviews.Content: Of the great delis in Los Angeles area, this is probably a middle of the road place. The food tasted fine, but nothing was special about it. The restaurant is also very very dated. Considering its location, price, and decor, I wouldn't choose to come back here.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca H.
Reviews.Content: I brought my four old Jewish relatives who were visiting from out of town to Canter's because they wanted deli food. My aunt took one bite of the matzo ball soup and spit it out proclaiming that the soup was an insult to the Jewish people. That seems a little extreme, but I am not that much of a fan of the soup either. It's too salty and the matzo balls leave something to be desired. The food is basically mediocre and a little overpriced. However, this place is open 24 hours, has good steak fries, and a delicious bakery (the bakery alone is worth 2 stars). I don't eat Rubens, but I remember coming here with my grandpa when I was a kid and he swore by them, so they might be a safe bet too.

Reviews.Author: Wendy L.
Reviews.Content: I'm thinking people like this place and give it a lot more stars when they go at 3 AM, drunk off their asses. And I wish I could too--but I don't roll like that. Sooo, truthfully, I thought this place was ridiculously expensive. I liked that it was a cute diner atmosphere (hard to find in Denny's dominated LA). I liked the good service that kept the water glasses filled. I liked that the pickles were FAB with a nice little spicy touch to them. I liked the perfection that was my Reuben sandwich, tons of pastrami loaded with sauerkraut. BUT!!! How can one sandwich + chips + one potato knish + no drinks = $20.00 plus tip? Too much.

Reviews.Author: Genevieve A.
Reviews.Content: It's a staple. A Los Angeles landmark. Yes, there are old mean women that wait on you sometimes, but it adds to what is already magical. Start off with a plate of pickles... follow it up with potato pancakes or matzo ball soup... AH-MAZING. I get the DOWNTOWNER [WITH PASTRAMI] amazing. You can't forget to add the Russian dressing and Sweet&Hot Mustard. As you leave, you've gotta pick up some chocolate chip & apricot rugalas. I drive a good 45 minutes from my house to eat here maybe once a week, if I have time, twice. Go at 1 AM on Friday night and listen to the band, sit back- take in the vast array of odd balls coming in and out. Amazing food, will ALWAYS have you coming back for more.

Reviews.Author: Champ M.
Reviews.Content: I love Canter's. I love the ceiling. I love their font. And the food, well, of course. I'd only come here afterdark, it's just one of those things.

Reviews.Author: Leslie J.
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, and just mediocre.  This is why East coasters say there is no deli here.

Reviews.Author: Rachel D.
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Canter's customer and fan of the food I was disappointed with my experience tonight with delivery. My hungry husband and I ordered food at 5:40 and were told that it would take 45 minutes. Flash forward to 2 hours later, still no food and no phone call. We called to see what was taking so long and were told " the delivery man is on his way". We asked what took so long and were told " he is on his way", no apologies for taking so long or offers to give us a discount. When the man finally arrived the only compensation we got was a reduction of the delivery charge which amounted to a few dollars. I felt horrible because I didn't want to stiff the delivery man I simply wanted some decent customer service as a weekly patron. My husband and I still love the food and we enjoyed our meal once it came but we wish the customer service matched the yummy food.

Reviews.Author: maiko h.
Reviews.Content: My favorite matzo ball soup comes from Canter's.  It's obscenely gigantic, and the soup tastes like something a quintessential grandma would make.  Their dinner combos are a good deal:  you get a soup (including the matzo ball soup) or appetizer, an entree, dessert, and a soft drink for a decent price.  I also like their garlicky pickles, too.  The restaurant is very, very spacious with several big rooms, and it has a bar where bands play regularly.  Definitely stock up on baked goods at the bakery on your way out.  They have adorable miniature marzipan fruits.  There is a Canter's outpost at the Treasure Island in Las Vegas.  The decor is out of control in a Jetsons sort of way, but the pastrami there, for some reason, tastes better than in LA and the matzo balls taste more garlicky.

Reviews.Author: Dale K.
Reviews.Content: "...I'm bringing it back to the Ol' School, cause I'm so cool...".  This Korean boy doesn't know much of the Jewish culture but good food from any walk of life I can appreciate...  whether it's late (late) night or at a respectable breakfast-eating hour, this deli has it all.  I can honestly say that even the egg-white omelette here tastes deelish.

Reviews.Author: Scott S.
Reviews.Content: good pastrami....and for the girl that does not like to bit into inches of meat....that is what a jewish deli sandwich is........deal with it!!!and their bakery is pretty damn good best macaroon that I have ever had.......esp at 3am:)

Reviews.Author: Amber M.
Reviews.Content: You know the noise Homer SImpson makes when he likes.. anything? That's the one I make  when I think about a Corned Beef on sourdough (don't like rye), with gobs of mayo & swiss. This is the ultimate extend a good date place late at night. Trust me!

Reviews.Author: Marie T.
Reviews.Content: why do i love this place so much? 1. the decor, i love the fact that it looks old fashioned and so welcoming. gives me something to look at while eating. =)2. the service is impeccable. everyone is so nice and welcoming and all smiles =)3. their breakfast is amazing! love the spinach, portabello mushroom omelet. i havent tried the other dishes that this place has to offer since im a fan of their breakfast food, and every single time i've gotten the same thing. love this place!

Reviews.Author: Meghan R.
Reviews.Content: it is 2 am christmas eve, you've been out drinking away any thoughts of impending dysfunctional family times and you feel like a creep for spending your holiday  in such a debaucherous fashion..where do you go? Canter's! The great: - Matzah Ball Soup WITH carrots!- Ordering Fries with your crispy reuben sandwich (skip the weird chips) - A BOWL full of dill pickles waiting for you- The fact that there are LOADS of people in the same boat as you coming together for fried greatness in the middle of the night- The ever so patient servers dealing with a bunch of hungry drunks shouting things like "I'm not gonna puke, i'm a PROFESSIONAL"The bad: - $75 for 4 people to eat a midnight snack

Reviews.Author: Rachael S.
Reviews.Content: this review is for the bakery and deli counter only. i picked up six mini black and whites, three hamentashen (poppy, chocolate, and apricot), and 1/2 lb. of pickled herring for a family gathering.$16.89i was a little skeptical of this place because they always have such a full bakery counter that i worried the goods might not be so fresh. on the drive to said family gathering, i was pleasantly surprised when i bit into the perfectly cakey black and white (you know, just to make sure it wasn't poisoned) with gooey chocolate and lemon icing that was not the least bit stale. the cookie wasn't too sweet - it was just right. the poppy hamentash was also divine - again, not too sweet and with PERFECT short bread.oh, and the pickled herring, that put a HUGE smile on my 91-year-old grandfather's face. i think mastercard would call this "priceless."

Reviews.Author: Susannah B.
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC! We drove nearly 50 miles to try this place out and we were not disappointed. It is in a nice part of town, and there is free parking next door (when validated). We were greeted by the sweetest hostess who was so kind to us and even kinder to our children. She even brought us free pastries. Our server was just as nice. He doted on us, played with the kids, sang a birthday song to my Mother-in-law, and made our experience so memorable (my husband better have tipped him well!). And the food was beyond belief good! We all had pastrami & corned beef on rye and it was Facebook post worthy. DELICIOUS! The best I've ever tasted. On our way out, we stopped at the bakery and purchased pastries to take home. We can't stop raving about Canter's Deli. A big thank you to them for feeding us and treating us so well!

Reviews.Author: Matt R.
Reviews.Content: The food isn't the best I've had.  The prices aren't amazing.  The service doesn't really knock my socks off.But.There's something about this place.  The decor is well documented, and truly is fantastic.  There's just something about ordering some traditional Jewish food from an old Jewish woman at 3 in the morning, if you so desire, that makes my heart warm.I am in LA on business quite a bit, and I always swing by Canters to get a Matzoh Brei and some Latkes on the last day I am there.  That way I can get some delicious bakery treats for the ride home.The cookies and other treats are amazing.  Parking is easy, food is good, but the whole experience is really what you go for.  If you haven't been there, give it a shot, maybe after a night of drinking.

Reviews.Author: Melissa K.
Reviews.Content: It was alright - I liked my food okay but the parking isn't very convenient and the atmosphere can get so loud that it gets overbearing.  Most likely wouldn't seek it out again.

Reviews.Author: George G.
Reviews.Content: Man, its greasy. No wonder I hadnt been here in almost ten years. I can't handle the heaviness. My other half and I split a pastrami sandwich with a side of coleslaw and TONS of pickles and a soda a piece. Jesus CHRIST was it heavy.  I could not finish my half, I got filled up on pickles and coleslaw.  My other half had moctezuma's revenge and kept having to pull over after the sandwich was done. Shoulda had something else. Poop.

Reviews.Author: Len S.
Reviews.Content: I know this is like an LA institution, as integral as say hollywood, to the fair functioning of the fairfax neighborhood but its just ok. Perhaps I'm spoiled after having eaten at the shangra-la that is Katz's in NYC and Shwartz's in Montreal I feel like I've eaten at the table of the corned beef gods. Canter's corned beef is a nice effort but it seems to lack the love or tradition that goes into Katz's super fatty juicy corned beef, or Schwart'z smoked meat which sticks as much to your clothing as it does to your bones. Still when craving a mount off meat on rye with saurkraut this does satisfy and is blissfully open quite late...

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I were spending the day in LA and needed somewhere to hit up for lunch.  When she found out I had never been to Canter's she immediately suggested we go here.  Upon her recommendation I ordered their famous Hot Pastrami Sandwich.  So okay the sandwich was piled high with meat, and its a good sandwich and all, but I wasn't super impressed.  Maybe cause I'm not a meat person but I just didn't feel the love for it that so many others seem too.  I'm glad I tried such a popular spot but I probably won't be seeking this place out or ordering this particular sandwich here again.

Reviews.Author: Rachelle A.
Reviews.Content: this place is one of my favorite late night hang out spots in los angeles. the atmosphere is charming and the people-watching is one of the best things about canters. the food here is so delicious that i find myself craving canters at least once a month.my recommendations: a side order of fries (if you're low on cash, this large portion will definitely fill you up), mish mosh, tuna melt, avocado melt (my personal favorite), and for you carnivores i suggest the pastrami on rye and the corned beef sandwich.some other awesome things about canters: pickles. with everything. bagel chips. and if you have a sweet tooth, stop by the bakery on your way out and pick up a black & white cookie or a handful of raspberry rugalas!my only complaint? pricing could be a little less. especially when all you want to do is sober up after a long evening of drinking and dancing, but aren't in the right state of mind to consider the price of what your stomach is craving until you ask for the bill. ouch. ;)

Reviews.Author: Courtney E.
Reviews.Content: After a good night of comedy and music at Largo, I headed over to Canter's Deli where I saw, Adam Brody. Ah, he's Jewish, isn't he. Thought I'd invite him over to eat delicious Matzah Ball Soup with me, but alas, girl groupies put the damper on that idea. Oh well, forget the bars and go to Canter's for a late night snack and a possible celebrity sighting.

Reviews.Author: Tony P.
Reviews.Content: I don't care where in southern California I am if I'm within 100 miles I'm going to Canters. I have rented cars delayed flights and travel plans of Friends and family to eat at this jewel of deli delights. Softball sized matzo's and mile high corned beef sandwiches are just the beginning of this places legend. Just thinking of eating here is causing me to think of excuses why I need to head to southern California. I feel lucky that this place is just a 45 minute flight and a half hour ride by car for me. For the rest of you not lucky enough to live even this close all I can say is "It Sucks To Be You".

Reviews.Author: Kathy F.
Reviews.Content: Great for take out. If ur gonna sit down and wait it's gonna take forever. Pastrami sandwich is the best. Great food and open late. Perfect for after dancing at a club and ur stomach is growling burning with alcohol.

Reviews.Author: Kim P.
Reviews.Content: I am giving 3 stars for the food but 0 stars for the gentleman,and I use this term loosely,for the cashier. Mean is an understatement. Unfriendly and rude...do not try and be friendly to him...no hope. Don't know what his problem is but either he should be told to be nice or go home. Ruined a good experience!!  I hope Canter's will read this!!!!

Reviews.Author: Ro L.
Reviews.Content: From the sassy grannies that show you to your booth (order when they first ask you b/c its hard to get their attention again!) to the wanna-be autumn foliage glass ceiling, this place is a small piece of "Jewish-Deli NY-style" here in L.A. Everyone loves the Matzo ball soup (splurge a little for the veggies) and pickles, but you go here for the meat. Great Pastrami sandwiches, Corned Beef & Cabbage, even the beef tongue is good. Its not NY, but its a start, and just how many 24 hour places are there in LA?

Reviews.Author: avant de mourir ..
Reviews.Content: I like the dated atmosphere, and the fact that they are open 24 hours. The last time I came here, it stunk like salted meat really bad from the entrance on. I can tolerate the smell of meat generally, but it didn't smell good. The food isn't amazing, but you have a decent amount of choices late at night, so it's not at all bad.

Reviews.Author: Brian m.
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Had the assorted fish. service was fine. It was packed at 2 on a saterday afternoon. Its open 24 hours!

Reviews.Author: Garrett N.
Reviews.Content: I love going here. I love getting the fairfax sandwich stacked high corned beef and their rye bread is great too. I love all the different kinds of mustard they have as well. I love getting the little pastries at the end at the bakery and load up on bread and little cakes. Canters is a great little place and gas a little piece of unique inside.

Reviews.Author: Julee H.
Reviews.Content: Eaten here twice now. And once for takeout fries. Very happy with the pastrami on gluten free bread both times. The fries were also very good. Prices are a bit high, but this is LA. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Michael Z.
Reviews.Content: If not for it being in my neighborhood and open all the time, I would probably never go here. However, it's always there for you and frankly there are plenty of worse places to go in the wee hours of the night.The deli fare is average. I've had most of the standard meats and all are pretty reliable. The Matzo Ball Soup is probably my favorite thing there and one of the best I've had. The full bakery is a nice touch and for people watching, it's a pretty good spot. It will always hold a special place in my heart as a stop on my annual Jewish Christmas when it is the place to be.However, I've been all over the country and been to plenty of Jewish Delis. L.A. has some of the best, most notably Langer's and Brent's. Canter's is just the most central and the most open and for that it's always reliable.

Reviews.Author: amanda n.
Reviews.Content: I'll always have fond memories of Canter's.  Ah, the late late nights -- or early early mornings -- during college.  A great place to just pick up and go to at 2AM.   Favorite things about Canter's: - the pickles w mustard - cheese blintzes - potato pancakes - matzah ball soup - the corned beef reuben or hot pastrami sandwich - sharing a napoleon for dessert - running into my high school chorus teacher's ex-brother-in-law from Massachusetts - service staff who've been there since it opened - murals on the parking lot wallDefinitely a place to go for the cool casual ambience and good times with friends at any hour.

Reviews.Author: Cass R.
Reviews.Content: Favorite all time deli. The food & bakery all very good!

Reviews.Author: David B.
Reviews.Content: The Best

Reviews.Author: Big G.
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing! We were looking forward to eat @ Canters finally, But, ...... what a disappointment, I can not get over this! Here is a place, which was also on the Food Network, was the crew smoking some sh.. that they had the munchies and everything was good? The Pastrami on cold Rye was total joke for $11.95 (i think, anyway close to it!) The Patty melt, another Joke for $10.95 + $1.00 for awful fries! Best thing of the whole meal were the four half cut Pickles! We walked out of there with almost $40.00 for Lunch, and BAD lunch! One of the waiters, had an Afro, he was even sitting down at the serving area with his 2 girls, our waitress, after serving the sandwiches, came over and asked how everything is, I just looked at her and nodded an A OK, she came THREE times again and again to ask the same questions, FOR CRYING OUT LOUD, nothing changed 2 minutes ago, the world is still here and LET US TRY TO EAT THE STUFF you served us! She was in a hurry to get us out! After we paid and walked to the Bakery, we thought we stop by at the Bakery dept. ..... WHAAAAAT, a FLY sucking on the sweets :[ I took a picture with my phone, don't wanna uploaded, I feel bad, BUT Canters, you suck and smell bad with bad food! Looks good on pictures, but we got served which was not even close to what we've seen! Sorry, this is a no no for us! If you enjoy going there, have fun and don't forget your Tums or make sure that you have a backup plan! By the way, Ebiss Esse is good (says on the menu) but EBISS means a small thing (in which case this was) And if you look at the bottom, it says for the FRESSER (for the big eater) who wants to pay double of bad food???? Anyway..... Its all about the Name, not the Quality at Canters!

Reviews.Author: Mary Anne D.
Reviews.Content: I really love a good sandwich with fresh bread, tasty toppings, and good deli meat.  I can say that Canters succeeds in only one of these things. At my last visit to Canters the bread was mushy and tasteless.  Although the meat was fresh and a good cut, they put about a pound of meat on the sandwich without any additional toppings.  The result was a bland, forgettable sandwich.  The best part of the meal was the pickle, which was spicy and delicious.  If I ever find myself back at Canters I will ask for a sandwich with a pickle, minus the sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Dorothy L.
Reviews.Content: This place is an L.A. staple not so much for the food, but for the fun environment... specifically around midnight! There is such good people watching, and you accompany that a pecan roll and some coffee! It's what gives Los Angeles its character. :)

Reviews.Author: Lisa Z.
Reviews.Content: Ahhh... New York Cheesecake from their bakery.  Zwieback crust, sour cream topping.  Smooth, expertly balanced sour-sweet cream cheese filling with silky texture. Perfection!  Canters, your parking situation gives me the sads, but I still love you.

Reviews.Author: lonni f.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in for lunch during a weekend in LA, to try out this legend.  This place is amazing, and the food was phenomenal.  It brought back so many memories of NYC deli's growing up.  My wife got the open faced brisket sandwich, I got the "Bronx" (1 pastrami + 1 chopped liver sandwich) plus a bowl of matzah ball soup.  Their kosher pickles are great (nice & garlicy).  I'd love to go back next time I'm in LA.

Reviews.Author: Herbert N.
Reviews.Content: an old school classic go to joint  in my 20'swhere i  spent many a night throwing them back that the kibitz room bar and had my fair share of late night deli nosh at canters.  never really saw the place as being super impressive with the food, but it was more a place to be than a place to eat...  hadn't been back in a while when last week i snuck in for a corned beef reuben to go.... wow.... amazing how much better something tastes when you're sober.  i may have underestimated this place all of these years.  that said, the reputation of la landmark has left  quite an impression on the prices.... my reuben, though perfectly tasty wasn't the stacked high version and still ran me $16 bucks.  ouch.i guess if price is not issue canters is worth an occassional sojurn, but few bank accounts could afford to have it be a regular lunch or dinner joint...

Reviews.Author: Rochelle R.
Reviews.Content: Before I came to Canter's I really didn't understand the hype behind deli sandwiches.  After all, it's just bread and meat, right?  I've had Jerry's Deli and Nate n' Al's, so I really wasn't expecting much from Canter's.  Perhaps, the best delis are back east.  Well, my viewpoint has changed since eating at Canter's.  I have had the pastrami sandwich on rye with thousand dressing.  The meat is juicy and the bread is soft.  The coleslaw just enhances the flavors.  The ambience is very throwback, which adds the to charm.  There are definitely characters in that joint as well as outside.  Parking can suck since their parking lot is very small and street parking can be limited even at night.  This place is a good alternative to Denny's for late night eats.

Reviews.Author: Emily R.
Reviews.Content: Matzo Balls, pastrami, and pickles..oh my!  I came here with some friends after a show and I was in heaven.  I love the nostalgia of the place.!  My boyfriend and I split the matzo ball soup and reuben sandwich, so delish!  My only complaint is service, definitely had to wait a LONG time to order and to get the check, but the food made up for it.  I believe there was a Curb Your Enthusiasm episode based on a Canters sandwich that was named Larry David?  Canters has been around since the 30s and the tradition continues, definitely an LA landmark.  And I hear that stars are known to frequent Canters.  I had my first celeb siting in LA here, so it will always be near and dear to my heart. :)

Reviews.Author: Kat S.
Reviews.Content: First of all, I love Canter's! I'm a pastrami girl so I love to come here for that and of course an additonal matzoball soup. Ok, you know what. Throw in a dessert too. I wished I lived closer so I could come more often. One con: my waitress. I don't know if it was her time of the month or she was mad at the world but she was extremely rude and had no personality at all. One of the people I was with wanted something else instead of the pesto pasta they got( i don't know why you would want to get pasta there but anyways) but she made a big deal after we said we would pay for it. Anyways, not knockin' but go. :)

Reviews.Author: Ivana I.
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with Maiko M.'s feelings about the matzo ball soup here... and dare I say I believe it to be better than the Jerry's Famous Deli matzo ball soup?  Dare I say?  It is.  And the bakery side of the restaurant reminds me of a bakery in the Midwest... like my uncle Pticek's in southside Chicago.  That said, the brownies here are v.v.good.  Don't believe me?  Try one.  Call me in the morning.  A little too noisy for my taste, but hey, that's Canter's for ya.

Reviews.Author: Donny N.
Reviews.Content: All three stars are for the bakery! I've come here countless late nights to pick up some yummy pastries and cookies for late night munching and next day chowdowns :) If you have 2-3 people, I HIGHLY recommend buying their 6" cheesecake! One of the best! Unfortunately, I don't really care for the food in the restaurant.... I've been for breakfast + dinner, and have always left disappointed. Luckily they have that bakery, which rocks! :)

Reviews.Author: Aaron L.
Reviews.Content: Been coming here for ages, ever since I was a wee lad, coming down to LA from (gasp) Fresno for a taste of real Kosher deli. Yes, this was the promised land for a real corned beef sandwich. More than 20 years later, the place still doesn't fail to make my mouth water (especially after 2 am, which is when I usually go now). The staff is a little less surly than before, which anywhere else would be a plus. The more friendly side of Canter's lacks the certain bite you can still find in the pickles, but in little else. Then again, at 2 am, it's nice just get a sandwich, hold the 'tude. At any rate, that corned beef will keep me coming back until the ceiling collapses.

Reviews.Author: Jeannette P.
Reviews.Content: Not that Canters really needs another review, but I do wonder, why are Jewish delis so incredibly BLAND and EXPENSIVE?  The only reason I am giving Canters two stars is for their delicious potato salad (the only thing I've found that I like there... although it costs $6 for a medium sized to-go container of it)... and they are OPEN 24 HOURS, so I had to give them something for that.  Cool to hang out at, but only if you don't mind spending too much money on so-so food.

Reviews.Author: Tim M.
Reviews.Content: Well i finally made it to this place. It was as I expected, huge menu, lots of meats. I got the turkey and it was good. Nothing special though. I got the same thing at Weiler's in my area. The waitress (worked there for YEARS, im sure) had a bit of an attitude, but it was cool. Like you knew she was kidding, or was she? haha. Anyway, its open 24 hours, so that is RAD! More places need to be open 24 hours!!

Reviews.Author: Lauren V.
Reviews.Content: im not a deli expert! so if you're a deli-hound, you'll probably say im being charitable. if you're like me, just read on!Ive heard a lot about this place and one night finally decided to go for it. It has a big name and i had hoped that there would be a standout dish that justifies its standing...i guess we just didnt get it.So I went on a Monday night and just as I had suspected, no wait. usually when i drive by, its pretty crowded. The dining room is a throwback to the 60s, but its suppose to be, its been here since the 30s. Our waiter was a bit...odd. His hair was this wild combination of emo and combover. He was decent, not rude but he wasnt about to sit down and trade stories with us. There was 4 of us and we all got our own thing but shared everything. I got the bagel and lox platter, someone got the pastrami, another corned beef/pastrami sandwich, another got the montecristo and hummus(?)  The pickles here were good. The other delis ive been to (Carnegie and Stage deli) do serve a MUCH MUCH better thing of pickles, but the ones at Canters are fine. Pickle fiends may not be impressed at all.My bagel and lox were fine. You cant really screw that up toooo much. its not as good as places that specialize in bagels but its still good. The pastrami was...ok. We finished it, but by no means was it the best ever. My pastrami-loving nephew wasnt impressed. He felt it was too dry or salty. The corned beef one was a little better but still uninspired. The montecristo....really? It sounded like a good idea, it definitely was not. When i think montecristo, i think golden-brown, fried, crusted sandwich. This was a normal looking sandwich (with lettuce, tomato?) with slightly browned bread. Not good. We shouldve just got a normal sandwich. I also got an egg-creme to drink. (No, it doesnt contain egg) not the greatest, it had more of a chocolate milk taste, no soda quality.  For dessert we shared a neopolitan. It was decent, again, nothing to "write home about"For what we paid, it wasnt the most satisfying meal. However, i know theres a history and nostalgia here so i might come back when i have a reason to do so, like with a guest or something. As of now, dont know if ill be back too soon to spend more of my disappearing money here.

Reviews.Author: esther s.
Reviews.Content: They are open 24 hours, there is good parking and its easy to find. Service is mediocre, but I adore the interior of this restaurant because it reminds me of New York City Jewish diners with the stale 70s furniture, yellowing white look combined with some conceptual design elements like the photo glass mosaic ceiling far back. Thier pastrami and corned beef sandwiches are famous.  I much prefer the corned beef which is made to perfection, as well as thier large and not too sour pickles. There is much I have yet to try, and I anticipate my next visit.

Reviews.Author: M P.
Reviews.Content: LOVE the Mish Mosh and fries w/ranch. Way too expensive. Also, might encounter the pleasure of seeing a "celebrity" but to my displeasure I got to feast my eyes on Atreyu BUT I do however think that I saw Jason Alexander ("George Costanza") on his way out (At least, that's what I'm telling myself) with his perfect balding head.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: Canter's:  Home of the $18 Reuben Sandwich!  That's right; I actually paid a little over $18 for one (1) single turkey reuben sandwich!  (that included the 18% mandatory tip; charged for groups of 8 or more).  The place has a lot of attitude as far as I was concerned, although our waiter was quite nice.  The lady behind the cash register was another story; while I tried to snap a photo of the place she got very huffy; saying people paid "millions" for the right to take photos.  When I tried to explain that I was going to use them on YELP, she said "We don't need any publicity; we're already famous!"  Looking around the mostly empty dining room at 12:30 p.m. I wandered to myself what alternate universe she was living in.  Now that I am probably 86-ed from the place I guess I won't be going back anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Beth F.
Reviews.Content: An L.A. landmark and a fun place to visit just to say you've gone.  I don't think much of the food in general, but I'm not a real deli kind of girl.  I can't stomach all that meat.  But they have very very good potato pancakes, and yummy egg salad, and they're open late.  The bakery is so incredibly cute, and everything looks and is so delicious, but for some reason it all has generally the same flavor, like it's made with the same base dough.  A pretty good L.A. black and white cookie if you're craving one, but once again, it all kind of tastes similar.  Try it at least once.

Reviews.Author: Jamie D.
Reviews.Content: all the years i've been growing up in los angeles, i've always heard about the glory of canter's deli...but i never seen/experience it for myself until yesterday.  when my friend and i were visiting the mid-wilshire area and was prompt with the question as to where to eat for dinner, i couldn't resist but suggest canter's.  both of us have never been to one of these famous delicatessens, e.g. langer's, jerry's.  i kept my fingers crossed as we drove on fairfax - i didn't have the address with me but i vaguely remember it was on fairfax.  luckily, we didn't get lost and luckily, we even found a parking spot on the street.  outside this place, you could immediately sense the history behind it.  it's just one of those undeniable things.  inside, the place is a completely homey diner atmosphere.  it's dimly lit in there and as i started staring at the ceiling, i couldn't help but trip out a bit - this must be how i'd feel on lsd.we decided to order what most people go to delis for...so canter's fairfax (pastrami and corned beef piled high together on rye bread) and matzo ball soup for the both of us to share.  it's a lot of food (and meat) for two people.  we ended up having to push some of the meat off and packed it in a doggy bag to take home.  at the end of the meal, while we were completely and utterly full, both my friend and i agreed that it wasn't all that.  it was definitely a place we'd come to try out but probably wouldn't come back to.for me, i still prefer the pastrami/roast beef sandwiches at eastside deli in chinatown.  it's still the only sandwich that makes me salivate and slobber  like my pet american bulldog!  eastside, sorry for cheating on you - nothing (not even canter's) can take you away from me!

Reviews.Author: R P.
Reviews.Content: Convenient parking. Very helpful waiters and waitress's

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth H.
Reviews.Content: Has a weird smell to it, but I love that it's open 24/7. As college students we would go at 3 am, no traffic, no waiting. Amazing.

Reviews.Author: Melissa M.
Reviews.Content: The BBQ chicken sandwich hit the spot.  Two nice size chicken breast on an open face roll with just enough BBQ to give flavor but not overwhelm the chicken.  Added the sweet potato fries and was in heaven.  Great little deli!!!!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly M.
Reviews.Content: It's debatable whether anything can prevent a killer hangover quite like a pastrami sandwich from Canter's. Everyone knows this famous deli is open all night, and the constant stream of diners proves it. There's also live music in the Kibitz Room, which means you can have your knish and eat it too.

Reviews.Author: Sonia J.
Reviews.Content: I like the bakery, I always buy my Challah there for leek bread pudding at Thanksgiving.  I hadn't eaten here in years, but I've moved into the hood, so I tried it again lately.  I gotta say, the deli guy was nice, but maybe retarded.  I ordered pastrami/corned beef with swiss and cold slaw on seeded rye.  I got the cold slaw on the side, which sucked.  I guess next time, I'm back to Greenblatt's.  I gotta say, the soups here suck, considering it's a jewish deli.

Reviews.Author: Mahdroo M.
Reviews.Content: Every item on the menu is mediocre to poor.  EVERY ITEM!  Why can't they make ANY food that tastes good?

Reviews.Author: S C.
Reviews.Content: Why the low rating? Well, it's actually because of their deli service. I had a good time in the restaurant part; the waiter was friendly and actually warned us we might be ordering too much to finish. Food wasn't so great though. The (homey) potato pancakes were good with apple sauce and the matzo ball soup was very good. We weren't such a fan of the pastrami/corned beef sandwiches. The meat was a bit dry and not as tasty as I'm used to at The Hat. Also, the brisket was average. For dessert: good cheesecake, the beehive (a pecan topped apple turnover) was blah. The food is pricey for the quality I got (the only things I liked was the matzo soup and potato pancakes, but they were so not worth what was being charged). WAY OVERPRICED.Ok, other than average overpriced food, it's still not the kiss of death, right? Now time to go to the delicatessan part. I decided to get some chopped liver to go. First, the deli workers ignored me. Then after I finally got someone, and ordered my chopped liver, the deli worker gave me a slip to pay at the cashier's. After I paid, I turned around back to the deli counter, and the deli worker was gone! I tried to get the attention of another deli worker, but they ignored me. AND THERE WERE NO OTHER CUSTOMERS THERE. So I tried to get the help of the greeter who greeted people into the restaurant section (she stands *right next to the deli counter*). She told me she couldn't help, that I should get the deli guys to help. Basically, dismissed me and told me it was my problem. Only problem is, THE DELI GUYS KEPT IGNORING ME.When I finally got one of them to talk to me, they told me I should get my bag from the deli worker who served me. When I protested that he'd been gone for 10 MINUTES, they said, he'll come back. WTF?It took another 5 minutes for the guy to come back. The punchline? The damned food was packed in a paper bag on the counter the whole time; all the other workers had to do would have been to hand it to me. But no, I had to be "taken care of" by the guy who served me originally. So time between when I paid, and when I got my already bagged, weighed, prepared food? 15 freaking minutes, when all the workers had to do was hand me the damn bag sitting on their counter. Canters has the RUDEST deli workers I have EVER met. And the other employees are indifferent. They totally ruined the experience. I will never go back there.AVOID THIS PLACE. They SUCK!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly K.
Reviews.Content: it is a landmark but the service this time was borderline/ non-existent I only ordered matzaball soup with bread and a pickle and I was there over 45 minutes and everytime I asked for something the server would disapear.  I just got frustrated and basically stood up until she realized I was waiting for a check.

Reviews.Author: Anthony W.
Reviews.Content: I get that this place is a landmark, but the food is overpriced and bland. The pastrami is decent, but that's about it. Maybe I didn't order the right thing. My wife ordered the Monte Cristo and it was awful.  I guess you don't go for the food. I've checked it off my list and don't need to return.

Reviews.Author: Jojo H.
Reviews.Content: I ordered chicken noodle soup.  It was small, and bland and had no chicken.  It took me twenty minutes to call the waiter over to find out what happened to my chicken.  Apparently, the chicken noodle soup comes without pieces of chicken; it's in a chicken broth, which is what gives it its name.  For a cup sized bowl of noodles and random cube of carrot, I wasn't expecting to pay $4.50. The pastrami on reuben was ok.

Reviews.Author: Ilene Y.
Reviews.Content: It's still one of my favorite places in LA... gotta get a big  pickle. I heart the Matzo Ball soup and the area is pretty cool. I hate their parking lot though, it seriously blows. If you want great Jewish desserts, this is your spot. I love their bakery and the service is pretty fair. Prices are fair, too.

Reviews.Author: S B.
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Canter's since I was in a sassy seat.  If you want a good quality Jewish deli style sandwich, this is the place for you.  The bread is fresh and the pickles are bitter, just like a good jewish dill should be. I've been to Stage, Carnegie, and Katz's in New York and it doesn't matter where you go, you need to know how to order properly.  My favorite at Canter's is the Brooklyn Ave. with smoked turkey, Russian dressing and Cole slaw, very moist and the bread is always super fresh and soft.  I used to get the same sandwich with Pastrami until I stopped eating beef, but oh boy do I miss it!  You have to ask for the pastrami and corned beef moist, but not with bits of fat.  Get to know your waitress so that when you go in you can ask for one of her tables.  Ask about their grandkids and families and show that you're not just some schmuck who stops by once in a while. We used to know all of them and they really can be very personable.  And then you'll always get your sandwich the way that you want it!One last note, my parents have this great story that they always tell out-of towners about Canter's: my parents hail from Lower Penn/Upper Del and moved out to LA in the mid 70's. My dad's 70 year old aunt and uncle came to visit and his aunt could talk your ear off for hours and hours. After a day of sightseeing, my uncle pulled my dad aside and said "GET ME A GOOD DELI SANDWICH NOW!" My parents took them to Canter's and his uncle ate two entire Fesser's and thought it was as good as anything he had eaten in the old country!!!  Sure, Canter's has changed as almost everything has in LA over the past 30 years, but these sandwiches are still delish.

Reviews.Author: Leah P.
Reviews.Content: I'm sure you have heard it all before... but this place has the best pickles. Seriously. I love the atmosphere, and the food is down-home good. Parking is EZ, and the attached bakery is sweet!

Reviews.Author: Dave C.
Reviews.Content: This is where I go when I want great deli food.   The Fresser sandwich with a side of thousand island is piled high with pastrami and I always have the dill pickles for starters. Never had bad service and my food is on the table within a few minutes.  This place has been around for a long time for good reason.   I usually pay about $25 a piece and I leave full!

Reviews.Author: Chris S.
Reviews.Content: I am a very loyal Langer's patron, and I once doubted I would ever visit enemy territory. Well, I found myself craving pastrami on a Sunday. With Langer's closed I decided to make the trip. I arrived during breakfast hours, and decided on scrambled eggs and pastrami. I was hoping to find it far inferior to Langer's. Well, I found them to be almost evenly matched. Canter's pastrami is machine-sliced, while Langer's is hand-sliced, the superior cutting technique. However, the flavor was comparable, I felt. I also appreciated the "old school" decor, along with Langer's, not having been redone in years. Also, bonus points for being open 24/7 and having a bar connected to the main dining room. I may continue to visit on Sundays and evenings, only when Langer's is closed to minimize my guilt.

Reviews.Author: Crystal S.
Reviews.Content: OK, Now I know everyone is all into the history of this place but i could really give two butt cheeks about that. Don't get me wrong I love and respect the history of cultures and historical landmarks. But If there is one thing in this world that Really gets to me it's Rude People and Terrible Service, AND THIS PLACE HAD BOTH. I had been here once before and can't say the service was all that spectacular than either but it was decent.  There were a couple different things that happen with this place but here is just one example..A couple of friends, my dude and I decided to go here and We were sat promptly by A chick who hated her life( that's how she came off), in the back next to the coffee station, there was Hardly anyone there so I found this placement to be weird but whatever I was Hungry. After 10 mins we were asked if we wanted something to drink, She took our drink order and came back 15 mins later with 3 waters and one coke and one unsweetened ice tea. Which on a very busy day at canter's 10 mins i would understand but 15....No! And as I mentioned before there wasn't that many people there. So at this point i am starting to get irritated. She drops the drinks off and doesn't ask if we were ready to order, she just left..  didn't come back at all. I tried to get the attention of another staff member but No go, waited another 5 and nothing.  It's like they were refusing to serve us.  So frek'n weird!  We ended up leaving. no one said anything to us. I know people are thinking, why did you wait so long... It was late, we were hungry, and some of our friends had a long drive home that wanted to eat.Never Again!

Reviews.Author: chris p.
Reviews.Content: Probably the best pastrami I have ever had! My waitress was old, ugly and obnoxious we bonded instantly...

Reviews.Author: Michael N.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely horrible service - every time I've eaten there. I've eaten here at least 5 times in the past 2 years and each time I swear against it. I love Jewish deli, and it's the only one that's 24 hours and close by so I end up repeating, but hopefully this time I stick to my guns. The food is bland and I think the owners thought it would be funny to take fair prices and quadruple them to see how dumb people could be. The joke is on us. Perhaps they're also trying to figure out how much worse they can make their food and still have people come out of nostalgia for culture or the movie Swingers.Last time I came there at 4am and they informed me that there would be no sandwiches. The one guy that works the deli had to take his 30 minute break. Absolutely ridiculous. A 24 hour deli and no sandwiches. Unreal. Don't waste your time or money. $25 for soup and a sandwich ...

Reviews.Author: omega k.
Reviews.Content: An L.A. landmark.Huge place and great food. They give you free pickle appetizers and the sandwiches are amazing and fairly big. The prices aren't dirt cheap though. It's definitely worth a visit if you're in L.A.

Reviews.Author: James P.
Reviews.Content: I don't know why I've been here more than once. The first time wasn't good, and this was only reinforced by subsequent visits.The food is tremendously overpriced. First, it's expensive to begin with for diner food. Second, it's not good, even by diner food standards. You might as well go to Norm's, which also sucks, but at least it's cheap.I really don't understand why anyone could rate this place as anything other than a piece of crap.

Reviews.Author: A. J.
Reviews.Content: Cut to the chase--I'm a transplanted NYer.  I KNOW my deli food.Matzo ball soup--flavorful w/o being overly rich.  Great large matzo ball in middle.The Fairfax--corned beef and pastrami sandwich w/a side of very fine-tasting cole slawFor home--2 each of the 5 types of traditional-style rugula, not the twisty ones, because I was browsing and she offered me an apple taste--perfection!I will now be a regular, especially since it has 24/7 service AND a late night music scene.

Reviews.Author: Clarence E.
Reviews.Content: I've heard a lot of great things about this place so my girlfriend and I decided to check it out.Horrible. The service in the front of the restaurant was great, people were really nice. But once you get to the back half everyone is extremely old and annoying. The food was dry and bland. Even my brownie with chocolate frosting (how could you mess that up?) tasted horrible. I couldn't even finish it.This is one of those places everyone says is good because everyone else said it was good. Seriously skip it.

Reviews.Author: Lawrence V.
Reviews.Content: Potato fries and onion rings are awesome!  So is the Canter's Club Sandwich!  Parking is very stressful when there's a crowd of cars and traffic here is not any nicer, especially all the road-rage around this part of town. Overall decent but overly-priced.  It has a very spacious campus but out-dated, however it has that charm for this side of town.  Try it out if you don't mind all the bustling around here.

Reviews.Author: Sammy H.
Reviews.Content: Went to Canter's for lunch today it's been a while since I've been here. And just because it's been around along time doen't mean it's good. They probably own the land and the block. The thing that hasn't changed are the Ancient Rude waitresses. Yes there some that are absolutely wonderful but all it takes is 1 ROTTEN crabapple to ruin it for all. It's amazing to see  people like this with jobs in the service industry.  I guess Canter's family must have alot of relatives and friends that need to work even though they should have been fired long ago. Food isn't great and isn't bad 13.00 for a beef dip with fries.If i do return I'll probably be back late at night when the younger crowd is working

Reviews.Author: Nicole L.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is a staple of LA. great for Late night. Less crowded. But the food every time we go is wonderful. We always over stuff ourselves and there is tons of leftovers. Love this place

Reviews.Author: Heejin L.
Reviews.Content: im all for landmark restaurants.the pastrami is decent.but the food i think is a liitle pricey for what it is.they have a pastry section with a lot of variety.it's like jerry's famous deli, but just old school.

Reviews.Author: Mimi P.
Reviews.Content: Aw the last couple times that we took a trip to Lala land on our last day after shopping at Turntable Lab, my boyfriend and I headed across the street to Canters Deli. And what do I get? Pastrami sandwich, with choke pastrami! I love it! Its so yummy! Try the Beaver Russian Mustard. YEOW!   SPICY! I always wanted to buy something from their bakery but I never know what to get and they don't have n e placecards to tell you what it is. Everything looks too good. I love Canters. I love the old coffee shop decor, the pastrami, the bakery filled to the brim with goodies, and it has its own parking lot too. See you next year pastrami sandwich. I miss you already.

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: I made my first yelp list today for pastrami and realized that I neglected to review Canter's. I've only been there once, about six months ago, even though I pass their bench ads on Wilshire everyday on the way to work. Anyway, from what I recall, my general impression was good pastrami but not NY. Surprise, surprise. I've given up on the idea of finding NY grade pastrami on the west coast. Once I came to terms with that, I was able to appreciate Canter's for what it was. However, I recall the sandwich was rather small, especially considering the price. The complimentary pickles where nice. A very middle of the road affair.

Reviews.Author: Nadia R.
Reviews.Content: The food here is AMAZING. We went in with a groupon, and ended up ordering twice the amount the groupon was for, just because the menu is so extensive and EVERYTHING looks delicious! We ordered the 3 potato pancakes, which came with both sour cream and apple sauce, and the sweet and sour stuff cabbage rolls. OMG, IT'S JUST ALL SO GOOD! The meat in the cabbage rolls was reminiscent of a meat loaf, but the sweet and sour element was just perfect- it wasn't like sweet and sour sauce you get at asian restaurants. We also got the hot pressed  little russian sandwich with coleslaw in it, as well as swiss, corn beef  and Russian sauce on rye bread with the kettle chips- AMAZING. My husband ordered the hot pastrami dip with steak fries, and it was YUM. That sandwich also came with spiced pickles for the table, which were great, but I couldn't tell what it was spiced with aside rom the bay leaf that came on the plate, very unique flavored pickles. We are going to HAVE to come back because there is just sooo many things to try. The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is because our waitress came to our table probably 5 times in the span of 10 minutes and just kept saying " SO, whats THAT enough time to decide?" , even though we were clearly still looking at our menus and the second to last time she said it, I was like "No, it's a really big menu, we still need some time"-- then she came back less than 3 minutes later and said the same thing again, and I was like "LOOK, I'm going to need like 5 minutes, because this is a REALLY BIG menu." and then she backed off long enough to let us actually decide what we wanted. After that she seemed to normal out, but it was a really off-putting way to start the meal. Aside from that, the atmosphere is great, it has a yummy looking bakery inside and upstairs near the bathrooms there's an old 1950's menu where you can see all the old menu items and prices. Very cool!

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: Love their Pastrami. I love their Corned Beef. I can never decide so I get the Fairfax Sandwhich. It has BOTH!!! It always delicious and the Rye bread goes with it so very well. The Matzo Ball soup is always good too. The breakfast looks great too, but I always get the same thing here. Maybe one day I will get some breakfast. The place has great character and I have always had great service. The Kibitz room next door is a great little watering hole attached to the joint. I love this place. Plus, ITS OPEN ALL NIGHT!!! Go there!

Reviews.Author: Leslie A.
Reviews.Content: Go because it is late.  Stay because Shoshana or Jason are waiting on you.  Talk about quality service.  baaaa.  Best

Reviews.Author: Kira B.
Reviews.Content: I enjoy Canter's pretty much soley for the experience. This place is huge inside and the people watching is very entertaining. I feel at home here in a way. I can't say much for the food.. it's standard deli fare that's kind of pricey.. but I think most people frequent this place just because it's legendary. I can't wait to return, it's been too long.

Reviews.Author: Cam H.
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to go when I am in LA- I always pig out on matzo ball soup, huge sandwiches, and desserts. Stays open 24 hrs.  I like the ceiling too...

Reviews.Author: Sirinda S.
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by their large menu.  I had the monte cristo sandwich because I had never had one before.  It was OK.  There wasn't much distinct taste to it, except for the powdered sugar that I sprinkled on top of the bread.  The pickles are great though and added a needed zip to my sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Teri B.
Reviews.Content: All I'm going to say is...don't miss it...really...you haven't experienced LA until you've visited Canter's

Reviews.Author: Lorine B.
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Canter's since the early 70's (since I was born). I love their Matzo ball soup, pastrami, corned beef, and all their pastry from the bakery. The interior has not changed at all since the 35 years plus that I have been going there. It still reminds me of when my Mom would walk my brother and I over there. We used to live a few blocks away from Canter's and it was our usual hang out. To me, it's nostalgia...

Reviews.Author: Engracia A.
Reviews.Content: Three words:  Matzo Ball Soup.

Reviews.Author: Helen C.
Reviews.Content: YUM!  Dare I say, I thought the pastrami on rye was better than the one at Langers.  Granted, I was beyond drunk when I came here, but the next morning the sandwich was still excellent.

Reviews.Author: H.F. B.
Reviews.Content: Great spot!  Amazing selection.  Sandwhiches are amazing.  Meat stacked high on rye bread.  I had the pastrami w/ corned beef and surprisingly i was able to finish it.  Didnt think i could because it was stacked about 6inches high.  Meat also didnt fall off and each bite was great!

Reviews.Author: Josh H.
Reviews.Content: Ah, the jewish deli mecca of the west. I got total respect for this place, its a landmark, good food, comfortable atmosphere, its open 24 hrs isint it? but nothing beats Katz's Deli of New York City for a pastrami sandwich on rye. This place does it great for L.A. but in the big picture it doesint cut it in comparison with east coast delis. I'll always go there after a late night in Hollywood I like the pickles and the soups the borscht isint too bad and you cant go wrong with matzo ball soup!

Reviews.Author: Pamela s.
Reviews.Content: came here a couple weekends ago. late saturday night, around 2am-ish. first time there, and it was nice. if you don't want to get horded by drunk ass people, don't come sober at this time, haha.the meatloaf was pretty good. it comes with mashed potatoes and corn. one of my favorite combos! the gravy had good flavor. the pickles, i have to say, have a different taste than other dill pickles i've had. but that still didn't stop me from finishing them, haha.reason for just 3 stars and not more: it wasn't anything exciting that blew me out of my mind. don't get me wrong, it was good food. i guess i need to go back and try more options. after all, i only had one meal out of their huge ass menu.

Reviews.Author: Bon V.
Reviews.Content: OK, I know backlash will ensue...but I have to say that this is one of those places in LA that people go to based on (dubious) distinction rather than actual quality, taste, value, cleanliness and all the other things you would normally judge a restaurant on.  Canter's is overpriced and seriously overrated.  Been here several times in a pinch and its always a drag.  There are several other jewish delis and/or late night options in LA, try those.  If you possess any of the 5 senses don't go here...and going here buzzed at 3AM only makes it worse.

Reviews.Author: Max P.
Reviews.Content: The food is very good.   I really liked to eat it

Reviews.Author: Bree J.
Reviews.Content: Potato Kinish and gravy.....that is allll I have to say. Mmmmmmm

Reviews.Author: Steve M.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is SOOOO good. It's also an LA legend. They have had tons of celebrities eat there. I was recently watching a TV show called Clark and Michael and they were sitting in Canter's talking about plans for a new TV series they were gonna make. This place is a money restaurant and features a bar with a live band. If your in LA this place is a MUST and if it's your first time going, get the Reuben.....enough said.

Reviews.Author: A T.
Reviews.Content: Okay. Langer's yesterday, Canter's today. Down Fairfax we go, attended parking lot, around the corner, seems de rigueur for kosher deli's in L.A.   Canter's pastrami is cut thinner and piled high, leaner and less of a clove flavour then Langer's.  Although with it being a leaner cut, not as moist.  We order the exact same items we did at Langers. Diet Cokes and dos pastrami sandwiches, russian dressing and slaw on the side.  Man I can't make a decision which one I like more.  I love phatty pastrami because that's how it is in NY NY.  But the thinner cut is more of what I am accustomed too.   On a personal note, the slaw at Canter's was much sweeter then Langer's.  The pickles at Canter's had more flavor but not as crisp and fresh.  I guess it's all about  proximity.  Whichever you can make it too, it's well worth the short wait

Reviews.Author: Warren M.
Reviews.Content: I've been going there for over 50 years and the quality continues to go down and the prices continue to go up.  I'm not going to elaborate other than I paid over $30.00 for a bowl of Chicken Kreplach Soup, a Corned Beef on Rye Sandwich, Order of Fries and a Dr. Brown's Black Cherry.  The meal was marginal and the price was unacceptable.  Thank goodness I had a Groupon Coupon to assuage some of my misery.  I won't be going back soon and it is a shame that such an institution has suffered so....The service attendant was great BTW.

Reviews.Author: Alexandre Romeo d.
Reviews.Content: Canter's--I really want to like you. You've been in LA for decades. You've even been on "Curb Your Enthusiasm". Unfortunately, I've eaten with you dozens of times: sometimes drunk; sometimes sober. Yet, every time you seem to disappoint me. Your food is uninspiring, boring, and your meats are always dry. I know it may be hard, but please improve! I really, really want to like you!

Reviews.Author: Tracy A.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good considering my meal scared the crap out of  me by being so big - I had the corned beef and cabbage. The four slices of corned beef were fine, but the cabbage was an actual head of cabbage... almost jumped in my lap! Very good eatery in the Fairfax District which is mostly Jewish, though the owner made sure the waitresses reported their tips to the desk for income tax purposes... oy-vay!

Reviews.Author: Brittney N.
