Reviews.Content: Canter;s has 80 years of history behind it, so i'll keep it short.Food is Tasty and not too expensiveThe wait staff is friendly and attentiveThe place itself is clean and has an old, jewish, hollywood charm to it.It's open 24 hours and you get the same great experience no matter what time of day you choose to go.One thing to make a note of, if you're a dessert person, Try their Cream Cheesecake. Seriously the Best cheesecake I have ever had. Ever.Summary: Go to Canter's once and you'll be hooked.

Reviews.Author: Michael N.
Reviews.Content: Love the bakery section. Canter's pastries and baked goods are delicious, so moist and sweet! A perfect treat after listening to some band playing next door at the kibbutz room. The crowd is a bit on the older side though, but then again, the older the wiser! Makes for some great conversation.

Reviews.Author: Valerie D.
Reviews.Content: Ok, but I am so tired of LA and all it's little suburban enclaves having so called "better" places...this is why I am moving back to San Francisco!!

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: Yesterday, I came to Canter's Delicatessen and Restaurant for the first time.  Canter's is open 24 X 7.  There is a small parking lot staffed with an attendant right next to the restaurant, and parking is free for an hour and a half with validation from Canter's.I had a late lunch.  Even though it was around 2:30 pm, the restaurant area was just about full.  The noise level wasn't loud, and there were many busy servers working throughout the restaurant.  I didn't have to wait for a table.  Yay!If you're the type of person that needs to read the entire menu before making a decision of what you want to eat, I suggest that you get familiar with the online menu before you even go to the restaurant.  There are so many selections on Canter's menu that the thorough reader could take a long time just to come up with a short list of what he/she would like to eat.  I decided on the Canter's Fairfax, a combination of hot corned beef and pastrami piled high on rye bread, and served with cole slaw.  The sandwich was PERFECT!  The bread wasn't soggy, like it often is at other restaurants because of the extra juicy corned beef or pastrami.  The meat was piled high, but, even though there was a lot of meat on the sandwich, I wasn't uncomfortably full after I ate my meal.  I didn't care much for the cole slaw.  I like mine "wetter" with more flavor.  The Canter's cole slaw is on the dry side and doesn't have that much flavor.Canter's serves up a small plate of dill pickles for each group of diners to share.  The pickles are the crunchy type, and taste delicious.I had an older gentleman who was a perfect server.  He made sure that my water glass was constantly refilled, returned to the table a few times to see if I needed anything else, was quick and efficient, and I never felt like he was trying to rush me out of the restaurant toward the end of my meal.I will definitely come back if I'm in the Fairfax district!

Reviews.Author: Cherie C.
Reviews.Content: Good soup, good tuna melts, good deli.  AMAZING pickles.  Sometimes, after an evening at Largo, I'll stop in to pick up a bag of pickles to keep at home.  So-o-o good.  The Kibitz room is a good place for a cocktail.  Skip the desserts.  The bagels are good.  The crowd is eclectic and interesting: old rockers, young hipsters, elderly locals, and the occasional celebrity (I recently saw Jason Alexander).

Reviews.Author: Andrew K.
Reviews.Content: I love this authentic place. My chocolate egg cream, rugalach, lox and bagel w/ smear, and latkes were all DELICIOUS! The prices were fair and good.

Reviews.Author: Tina M.
Reviews.Content: This famous Deli is okay... nothing really popped for me... I thought it was on par with Jerry's (in Westwood)...

Reviews.Author: Jonathan G.
Reviews.Content: The food can be awful at times, the ancient staff downright hostile, and with so many other options for deli in town it's hard to see why this institution keeps packing them in. But Canter's is like the Denny's of delis: no one actually plans on going there, you just end up there around 3am after a night out. I usually come in to order from the counter, as it's one of the few places where you can get BBQ cod.

Reviews.Author: Pete S.
Reviews.Content: Came here with my foodie friend Martin this weekend. He is always the one who introduces me to these oldies but goodies restaurants. We came here Sunday afternoon for lunch. The place was a little dated, feels a bit nostalgic. Got seated right away in a booth and ordered their specialties. (pastrami on rye, matzo ball soup, pickled herring). I have to say everything here was good, not great, but good.  The prices here are slightly higher than what I'm used to paying. Though it was good, $5.95 for a matzo ball soup is a bit high. (See pictures). I heard their pastries were really good but we were a bit stuffed to try it.

Reviews.Author: pauline c.
Reviews.Content: yumtried the brooklyn style (pastrami on rye with coleslaw) pretty yummy, but could have done without the coleslawalso tried the one with swiss cheese, could have done without the swiss.  definitely love the pastrami, very very tasty and flavorful.  the pickles were yum and the potato salad was pretty delish too.  i'd recommend just the regular hot pastrami on rye...

Reviews.Author: Tawny A.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for atmosphere, not food quality. its a basic old-school deli. lots and lots of old people eating fruit cups and soup. the food is dependably good, but no, not winning any gourmet awards- but hey, you know this when you come here, and honestly, i rather eat here than try some hit or miss trendy spot. also, buying a box of cookies is a great gift parties, holidays and especially the days when you need to sit on your couch watching brigit jones' diary and cry.

Reviews.Author: Tim S.
Reviews.Content: I finally went to the OG one in LA the other day and it was very good.  I got the Canters Fairfax which is corned beef and pastrami on rye.  Just a great overall sandwich.  I have also been to the location in Vegas at TI and have got the Canters Delight.  This may be one of the best sandwiches ever.  Ham, Turkey, Pastrami and Swiss Cheese in a triple decker formation.  That sandwich is fantastic!   Its not the cheapest food ever but you do get what you pay for and its well worth it.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: This place has alot of advertisements all over LA and is supposed to be pretty famous. It also has a pretty good rating here on yelp. For these reasons, I gave it a try. My friend and I ordered a matzo ball soup, a rueben sandwich and a mocha cappuccino. Everything we ordered was good and my friend especially enjoyed the matzo ball soup. I'm giving it only 3 stars because the meal was extremely expensive. I can get a sandwich at other places in LA for a lot less. On top of that, I am almost certain the chips that came with the sandwich are Ruffles. Why did I pay $14 for a handful of Ruffles?

Reviews.Author: Jen W.
Reviews.Content: we went to canter's at least over 6 months ago and i still can't get the matzo ball soup out of my head.  i could still taste it. i could still picture it in my mind.  folks...it is just THAT good.  we tried making the stuff at home and it just wasn't the same.   we also shared the pastrami and corned beef sandwich which was way more than enough to feed the both of us.  it was huge, very fresh, and extremely tasty.  i'm also a pickle freak so you could only imagine how excited i was to eat homemade pickles.  oh...and the service is also fantastic.  this place will defnitely be one of my stops when i head back to socal.

Reviews.Author: Alison M.
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of Canters day or night. I used to frequent this place a lot back when I lived in LA. Matza-ball soup, potato pancakes, corned beef sandwiches its all good. I will say that Canters is a little on the pricey side, but its actually better priced than a lot of the Jewish delis in LA and is my favorite.  Another plus is the adjacent Kibitz room next door... good times.

Reviews.Author: Grand C.
Reviews.Content: Langer's Pastrami is still better than Canters!

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: They say Los Angeles Zoo is incomparable to the one of San Diego because San Diego Zoo holds more wild life than LA zoo. Coming into Canter's at 1 in the morning somehow proves that hypothesis wrong. When you walk into Canter's on a weekend at midnight, you'll notice that this Delicatessen somehow transforms into a sub-branch of the LA zoo. You see the drunks kicking chairs and lol'ing. You see the hungries whining or chowing down like no other. You see the big herds, small herds. The louds, the quiets. The socialables that barks loud. The sailor with blings than fity cent and flava flav combined. The pantless, short skirted on the talls or shorts. This place is like a safari of its own. But they all have one thing in common. To calm the @%%$ down from a wild night out and grub because they were either too damn busy earlier or burnt a crap load of energy earlier doing who knows what for the past million hours.The food here does its job. They're fillers. My hot pastrami is nothing comparing to that of Langer's. Too salty, should I say? Too thinly sliced, can I mention? But hey, it fulfilled my hunger and did the job. Canter's will gladly rejuvenate you hungry herds 24 hrs a day, 7 days a week. That is essential at a weekend midnight in LA. Perhaps, that is another reason to why Canter's is a landmark of LA.

Reviews.Author: Eddy P.
Reviews.Content: I'm still struggling to decide on an appropriate number of stars... I thoroughly enjoyed my no-frills, no-BS pastrami: piles and piles of beef on two slices of rye. Simple, classic, delicious. But worth $12? Eh, I really don't know. I mean, kudos for being available 24 hours most days of the year and for being such an institution, but definitely not a go-to unless you're out late. Another one of this instances where I wish I could give half a star. I guess I'll up the star count for the waiter with the crazy hair. Yeah.

Reviews.Author: Christine H.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good. I got the $14+ Las Vegas sandwich on a french roll. The canter's dressing is basically thousand island dressing and I thought it'll be IN the sandwich but it wasn't. Then I thought the coleslaw would be IN the sandwich and it wasn't. Free homemade pickles, thank gawd. I listened to the yelpers here and got the cherry soda... pretty good but it wasn't like WOW. What was a WOW was their bakery! Lots of great looking goods on that side. I ordered a mix of goodies to take home. So far I tried the eclair and it was killer! Thee best eclair I've ever had. I'ma raise this to 4 just because of their desserts. It saved them big time! I'll be back for a bowl of chicken soup and bagel chips in winter. :)

Reviews.Author: Kelly K.
Reviews.Content: The food here is very bland. Only perk is that it is open 24 hours. They do have a very dingy, Fear and Loathing-esque bar in the back that is kinda hidden, I kinda like it. Other than those two things, I can't really recommend anything here. Doesn't help that the waiters are either A) never to be found or B) come up to your table every 10 seconds for your payment when you're chatting or trying to figure out who owes what.

Reviews.Author: Rich B.
Reviews.Content: We didn't have food here, but came for a quick cocktail. At least on the night we were there (a Sunday) it was pretty quiet. We got a table and enjoyed the view of the restaurant through the battered windows that divides it from the bar. People might classify it as a dive bar.

Reviews.Author: lisa N.
Reviews.Content: Edible but not delicious. Both pastrami and corner beef were pretty flavorless. The best thing was the steak fries which were okay. Disappointing.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany L.
Reviews.Content: Been here twice now. I had the turkey dinner the first time. Yum! Then had the french dip the second time. Double yum! Vincent was our waiter the second time and he was super awesome. He was so nice and friendly! Vincent made the experience perfect!

Reviews.Author: Orville C.
Reviews.Content: Apparently this is Guns n' Roses old stomping ground, they sell all sorts of memorabilia the inside is an absolute trip it has the décor straight out of the 70's, I think... the matzo ball soup is amazing the balls are massive and oh so good. I think my favorite has been the corn beef on rye, but then again I am a sucker for corn beef on rye.

Reviews.Author: Richard L.
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I ate lunch here. It was not busy at the time so we were seated right away. I ordered a cup of soup as an appetizer and a corned beef with cheese. The Barley soup was OK not great. Problem was it came about 2 minutes before the sandwich. The corned beef sandwich meat was luke warm and fairly dry. About 15 minutes goes by and we need water ( the glasses are about 5 ounces). No waiter to be found when you need him. Finally we get the attention of the bus person ( really a poor attitude ) and he refills our glasses. Basically the service lacks and the food is mediocre.  The one good thing is if parking available in the lot it is easy and free.

Reviews.Author: Eugi H.
Reviews.Content: Courtesy of groupon, my bf and I came here for dinner last night. It's one of his favorite places for reubens and I was too lazy to cook. :p Parking is kinda difficult in this area, though they do have a parking lot it's awfully small for the deli. Luckily, we found a spot yesterday and were seated immediately. He ended up getting the Fesser that day and I got the canters burger. Our food came quickly and we also got their free pickles too. PERFECT with my burger. I like their pickles a lot. Could be more sour, but love the crunch! Our server was very nice and fast too. I'm not the biggest fan here cuz I'm not a huge carnivore, but I can see how ppl would love the the place if I was.

Reviews.Author: Claudia B.
Reviews.Content: I much prefer other delis' food to this place, (better quality and bigger portions for the prices charged) BUT it's an institution, and when in the area, esp. late at night, I'm going to be at this place.  It is the quintissential kitschy deli, complete with waitresses with attitude, and they continue to serve reliable food.....I get sandwiches when I come here......from pastrami to turkey......and sometimes both.  What I like even better is their BAKERY section.  They have really good bakery items, which I usually buy as take-out.

Reviews.Author: Wolfy W.
Reviews.Content: This is "Old School" type of Jewish Deli, bakery and old fashion booth seat restaurant. Since this is on my to-eat list while in LA, I had the super size matzo ball soup and it was very delicious. The matzo ball was a softball size and the broth was very good hot, thou i didn't had any noodle with it. I had to try my favorite custard napoleon pastry dessert, and was larger then the regular Napoleon i had in the past. Had a quick eat here because this was my second stop within 3 hrs in LA.

Reviews.Author: Leah D.
Reviews.Content: Like the Carnegie Deli in NYC, I find this place a little overrated. It's cruising by on nostalgia more than anything now. Seriously. Greek diner food like an old-school east coast Greek diner, which has its charms, but damn! Expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Author: Rissa R.
Reviews.Content: For being such an LA staple, I was disappointed here!  I thought the food was not good and expensive.  I ordered the half roasted brisket sandwich, cup of vegetable soup, and coleslaw.  For $12, my meal tasted like canned soup and flavorless meat on dry bread.  I hate to be so harsh, but I didn't enjoy it.  And it seems so old inside.  Perhaps part of the appeal for nostalgia, but didn't add to my experience.

Reviews.Author: Jessie M.
Reviews.Content: After living here all my life, finally went to this place. Underwhelmed, as expected. The pastrami was just ok, fries, sweet potato fries and onion rings were fine. Nothing special except it's been here forever and you can order chopped liver at 3am.

Reviews.Author: Daryl C.
Reviews.Content: Went there specifically because coworkers have raved about the Pastrami.  My sandwich was created from the small pieces discarded from other sandiwiches, all was clumped in the middle, and it was very dry.  I won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Ralph O.
Reviews.Content: We came here as our $20 Groupon was about expire, which apparently we were not the only Groupon users.  We saw at least 4 other Groupon users for the hour we were there.  This was our first time here.  I ordered the special, For Dedicated Fressers Only, which consist of corned beef and pastrami sandwich with a full side of cole slaw and potato salad.  The wife ordered the corned beef with cabbage and boiled potato entree.  We both enjoyed our dishes.  The meat was lean and moist, but was a bit bland.  I was constantly adding mustard to the sandwich with a bite of cole slaw.  They give generous portions.  Be prepared for their prices as they are higher than your typical sandwich price, about $10.  Our waiter was attentive but was slow on a couple of items.  The place tries to keep its original look as best as it can.  They take credit card but I got the feeling that cash is preferred.

Reviews.Author: Eric R.
Reviews.Content: Great place for sandwiches. Always reminds me of NY.

Reviews.Author: JoAnn H.
Reviews.Content: Came here to celebrate with the rest of my crew after the Asian Pacific Festival!!  Food was bomb and the service was bomb.  It was the perfect place to share a few drinks and have a good meal. ;)

Reviews.Author: Char L.
Reviews.Content: Finally, I've visited this LA institution. Got the pastrami sandwich and it's way better,  and less fatty than Jerry's or Fromin's. Kinda annoying that the sandwich literally is only a sandwich with no sides and you have to add $1 for cole slaw. Service was friendly and we really enjoyed our meal. For some reason, the pickles were just way sour. Maybe my taste buds were having an off day, but I didn't really enjoy the pickles. There's a parking lot adjacent to the restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Sean N.
Reviews.Content: A must if you are in the area!!  Great food and  service!  It is like a time machine that takes you back to the 1940s!  You'll love it!!

Reviews.Author: Andrea T.
Reviews.Content: Poor service. Requested toasted bagel and they brought it untoasted. My daughter ordered an onion bagel and it had one piece of onion and tons of poppy seeds. This is an LA landmark but it's not keeping up with the times.

Reviews.Author: Renee W.
Reviews.Content: Mediocre and overpriced! Though I love the large menu and number of vegetarian options, the all-night hours, and want to go back to try a dessert sometime.

Reviews.Author: Tin-Tin M.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the reuben with corned beef on rye. It was fantastic and the meat was piled high. I also tried the kreplach soup. The broth was nice and flavorful. And the kreplach was kreplach-ey. I wouldn't get the black and white cookie at the bakery again. It looks like it would be good, but it just tasted like an old closet.

Reviews.Author: Eric M.
Reviews.Content: I love delis (as I have said in every one of my previous deli reviews) and this is a good deli.  Nice, hearty sandwiches are prepared with tasty meats and breads.  Meat is piled high, justifying the $10-15 cost for a deli sandwich.  Pickles are tasty too.  Certainly an added benefit that they are open at all hours, since so many delis seem to close at 4pm.

Reviews.Author: Howie G.
Reviews.Content: This. Is.  Home.  Best diner ever.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: This is Canters. If you're from Mid-city (which I'm not), this is a point of reference and as the locals say, "has been around for a million years." You just go here. It's huge inside and many don't know about the bar. There are great portions (as delis are known for) and the food is great. Service is good. It's not mind-blowingly amazing, but you go because it's basically a historic landmark and you want deli food. Place looks a little run down and the bathroom was kinda interesting, but that's what you get for a place that's been open for a million years. It's bound to wear out.

Reviews.Author: Nicole D.
Reviews.Content: Hooray for Jewish food at midnight! I've only been here once, but I got way more food than I could eat, and I got to stare at a crazy stained-glass ceiling. Oh, and the busboy was wearing one of those "I -heart- Canters" shirts. Freakin awesome

Reviews.Author: Mike F.
Reviews.Content: i'm new to la, but i'm not new to jewish delis.  and this is one of the best.dare i say it: i like this place better than new york's second ave deli.service is amazingly fast, although not always friendly.  food is generally pretty good (try the chopped liver!  the mishmosh soup!).  only major downside to this place is the price.oh, did i mention that the pickles are great?  and it's open late.only real competition, as far as i'm concerned, is brent's deli in northridge.

Reviews.Author: Robert F.
Reviews.Content: I am all for a Jewish deli or a diner to have some old school character.  I like vintage Hollywood spots.  But this place has become a bit geriatric.  The pastrami sandwich is good for sure....but there are places that I think have a better vibe and just as good a sandwich.  The matzo ball soup is also good, but overall it seems like it could use an updating and cleaning.

Reviews.Author: Monica S.
Reviews.Content: love this place, such a casual, old school vibe to it. Amazing matza ball soup and hummus wraps. Its open 24 hours...a good old fashion jewish delicatessen. Lovely place....

Reviews.Author: Abby L.
Reviews.Content: Went to Canter's on a recent trip to LA. It's not in the league of Carnegie Deli in NYC, but it's very good. The menu was massive. Both sandwiches we ordered were really good. The mashed potatoes side was clearly made with a mix. A lot was right. I agree with the reviewer Theodore O that it was all about the bakery. The bread used in our sandwiches was delish, as were all the bakery items we got on the way out. The black & white cookie was RIDICULOUS! So yummy. Definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: melissa e.
Reviews.Content: I grew up eating here, my grandmother lived down just the street. When I moved on my own to Hollywood, I went here quite often, and the food was so great! Love, the bagel crisps they serve as a complimentary appetizer. The decor is old and funky, it hasn't been updated since the 50's, and I've spotted many celebritys there, including a drunken Anna Nicole Smith! Go there, get a bagel and cream cheese, and matzo ball soap and you're in heaven. :)

Reviews.Author: Adam B.
Reviews.Content: I have dreamt about the sandwich I had here... seriously. 4 years ago I ate here and had the best sandwich I had ever tasted.... I had a pastrami on rye with potato salad.  The sandwich was piled high, literally about  2 and a half inches of pastrami on delicious homemade bread;.  The potato salad was also delicious, perfect balance of salty sweet with uniform pieces of potato. That was then and this is now. I have been strictly vegetarian for the past 3 years, but when recently in Hollywood, I knew I had to have another taste of heaven. First good thing... free parking just beside canters on fairfax ( free with validation), good thing as parking on fairfax is hell. We stepped inside, it was about 2 pm and the place was bustling. We were promptly seated (4 of us). When our server came over, she suggested we sit at a bigger table for more room which was considerate so we moved to the big table. Our servers name was Mary, no nonsense, older and fun. She has worked there for 30 years and knows the menu inside out. I took her recommendation and had the reuben with potato salad. She plunked down a bowl of kosher dills...HEAVEN...crunchy and delicious.... then the sandwich arrived...toasted golden with melted swiss, sauerkraut and pastrami....DELICIOUS.   The portion once again was huge but I ate it all... hell, it could be four years till my next one. What can I say?  Service here is no nonsense, fast and kitchy...older waiters who know thier stuff, and do it well. The interior of this place remains unchanged from years ago and that is a huge part of the appeal, right down to the cash register that is manually operated... remember the kind? Chunky metal buttons etc.. :)This place has an amazing history of celebrity visits.... our server told us she served Elliot Gould the day before and also talked about serving Shelly Winters ( who ate there every day) and also Barbara Streisand....other famous diners were Marilyn Monroe and Elvis Presley to name a few. The prices are excellent for the food quality. Canters is a true star in Hollywood...and shines brightly. Yum.

Reviews.Author: Heina D.
Reviews.Content: As noted by others, don't get anything except traditional deli food. The pastrami is to die for, no matter how you get in prepped. A friend of mine had the salmon and said it was tasty. The pickles that come for free are quite nice to snack on.

Reviews.Author: Leslie D.
Reviews.Content: Meh. Describes it completely. My friends adore this place but even with a massive menu... The dish I selected was nothing to rave about. I got the breakfast dish with links and eggs with toast. The service was slow... and my food didn't make it up for that. My links were a little rubbery and eggs ( i got egg whites) were buttery and saturated with fat or something. I tried to eat a little healthy with the eggs but they made it fattening and it didn't taste good. I had 10 times better experience at Dennys. The reason I actually didn't give it one star coz my friends love it and it's not like I will not go here again because frankly they love it here. however, they ran out of matzo ball soup. A jewish deli ran out of the best dish... And this was the second time. And then lo and behold two minutes later we saw another waiter bringing soup to the other table. Our waitress said Oh, I guess we did but shouldn't have anymore. Wow. I mean it's pretty bad for me... but I will give it a second chance. Maybe I ordered the wrong dish.... But avoid the breakfast food!

Reviews.Author: Mindy S.
Reviews.Content: There is a reason that this place has been an institution in LA for Jewish deli fare since the 1930's. It's just good. The bakery items are to die for, the sandwiches (while pricey) are HUGE and fresh, anything made from potato is a sure win, and even the items that don't have to be good in a Jewish deli (like Greek salads and chili) still are. This place's food deserves 5 stars, but the service... honestly, I've felt more than once that the servers are basically taking advantage of the fact that people will come here whether they are providing good service or not. Other than that, Canter's is one of the best late-night dining options in LA!

Reviews.Author: Heather V.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is as good as it gets.  The pastrami sandwich is wonderful, their pickles are some of the most delicious I've ever had and the matzo ball soup is perfect.  The atmosphere is a step back into time and I have a love affair with the tree tiles in the back ceiling.  I know they place could be considered tacky because it hasn't be updated since the mid-20th c.  but I don't care.  I always stop by the deli counter on the way out to buy pickles and a black and white cookie for later.

Reviews.Author: Steven C.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is one of the only reasons to hazard the evils of Los Angeles, as I see it. I have actually witnessed total asswipes become less opportunistic and superficial after sitting down to a huge bowl of Canter's matzo ball soup. It's rumored that the Reuben there completely averted the impending collapse of the Fox network in '95. Our waitress opened for Tower of Power in the 70's, no shit. The decor is very lived in and comfortable. My friend was asked by some guy if he could dance "enthusiastically" for a Vines video, so that kind of ruined everything. The bakery is top notch...the Rugalach was fantastic. Friends of mine base their trips to L.A. around a visit to Canter's.

Reviews.Author: Trent M.
Reviews.Content: My friend insisted on going to Canter's even though I was sort of full and not feeling my best, thankfully his descion paid off.  Although my french dip was a little dry, all it took was a little aus ju and it was tasty as can be.  The real treat was the decor, crazy ceilings, dividers, everything about this screams kitschy 60s.  Our waitress was great, sassy and sweet at the same time and all of the stuff to impluse buy around the register was great.

Reviews.Author: June B.
Reviews.Content: Yes this place is awesome.  The Reuben is amazing, the bagel and lox plate rocks, and the matzo is good too.  The sandwiches can be pricey..but you can walk over to the kibitz room after and enjoy some cheap drinks and figure out who in the bar is coked up.  I like that game.  I met a crazy Australian bloke at Kibitz once...he was high out of his mind.  I wanted to make out with him but my guy friend unintentionally c-blocked.  damnit it all to hell.

Reviews.Author: Callie B.
Reviews.Content: I hate this place. The menu is ginormous but I can still never find anything that sounds good to me. You either get a server that thinks they are a rock star or an old-as-Egypt granny or gramp that can't be bothered to remember your order or swing by the table to check on you.  Last time I just ordered a banana split. It was super old school with strawberry jelly-ish sauce and pineapple.  The only thing I like about this place is the trippy ceiling. Everything else sucks.

Reviews.Author: .James A.
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT! Everytime I come down to LA I try to make it to Canter's and Barneys New York on Wilshire, the Union Square locale just isn't the same! I digress the only thing I order is the pastrami on rye with spicy mustard and it never disappoints. On the way out I always get something from the bakery usually schnecken which is great or a loaf of sour rye for my dad. I love to say the word "schnecken!"

Reviews.Author: Penn T.
Reviews.Content: okay... warning, walk PAST the bakery section and have your meal first because if you don't, you'll end up buying everything on display.that being said... here's what to order:  potato pancake (trust me on this one, its GOOD), any of their mile-high stacked sandwiches... hell, everything I've had there is good.  Good for breakfast, lunch, dinner and late night!!!

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: Sky high piles of lox on my bagel!

Reviews.Author: danny n.
Reviews.Content: WOW! This place is open 24 hrs and it's the spot for a real pastrami, ruben, or corned-beef sandwich! This place has a lot of history in LA and it's part of its charm. Pick up some baked goods for the trip back home.

Reviews.Author: Tania m.
Reviews.Content: blah! the food did nothing for me. i ordered cheese blintzes and they were ok. had a bite of my sons pastrami and it wasn't that great. the cheese cake looked like it was bought at a local market .the service could of been better. the waitress took long to get out drink order and twice as long to serve our food. the only positive thing about canters is that its opened 24/7 and its a good place to sit down, relax and people watch. also the bakery counter isn't all that. my bagels were dry and hard and so were the rugulahs.

Reviews.Author: Christina F.
Reviews.Content: It was good....pastrami sandwich has enough pastrami for 6 sandwiches (I actually just ate its residue on the bread, but thats more my issue than yours) Potato salad is good, could use some black pepper...Had some little pastries that were good too...Highlight of my visit, looking in the bakery case and seeing apple strudels just like my mother used to make when she still liked to cook, and realizing that  they did SOMETHING culturally jewish with me.

Reviews.Author: Frank Q.
Reviews.Content: had the Fairfax sandwich at Dodgers stadium and wow was it awesome, it was nice to have pastrami without all of the fat and oil dripping down my face. I can't wait to check out the real place.

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: We were in the Fairfax area and we were early for our reservations at Animal, so we went into canters for a tea.  The interior is huge, and their is such a mix of different types of customers.  There were people who have probably been cmg since they were kids, and then there were a a lot of cool university kids (not the Hipster type though, thank god).  I cant really comment on the tea too much, it was pretty straight forward, but the restaurant just had a cool vibe.

Reviews.Author: Heather B.
Reviews.Content: It's a good place to come since it's open 24 hrs and they got the bar going on with live music. The place is huge with so many different areas to sit in. I love their corn beef sandwich! Their bakery's good too..pick up some cookies or pastries on the way out.  I love the 60's vibe of the place.

Reviews.Author: Toni A.
Reviews.Content: I have been to a lot of Jewish delis around L.A. and Canter's is hands down my favorite. My usual is a brisket sandwich on rye with Russian hot mustard and plenty of pickle. The matzo ball soup is also superb.

Reviews.Author: Brian H.
Reviews.Content: A very old-fashioned Jewish Style Deli in the Heart of the Fairfax district of West LA. Service is prompt and efficient, not real chatty and a bit brusque at times. A full service deli counter and bakery counter tempt you as you walk in and wait in line to be seated. The line moves quickly, even for Sunday Brunch. MY dining companions in West LA have thoroughly enjoyed the comfort food and large portions served at this place. They are open 24/7, so as you are coming off your night of partying up and down Santa Monica, enjoying all that WeHo has to offer, stop in here at 2am and have coffee and an early breakfast to stave off those room spins you are sure to have later.

Reviews.Author: Max K.
Reviews.Content: Kind of a dump these days, but always a great late-night place with a huge menu and lots to gnosh on.   Try the corned beef or pastrami - both are excellent.

Reviews.Author: Matt B.
Reviews.Content: The Legendary Canter's Deli! What MORE needs to be said???

Reviews.Author: Cory P.
Reviews.Content: Had a mac and cheese panini, it was excellent!  Its definitely and LA landmark, so I would recommend going just to check it out if nothing else.  The bakery is excellent as well.

Reviews.Author: jen d.
Reviews.Content: The bay area needs a place like this for sure. Open all night, some kind of music room that was still hoppin' when we were there at 2:30 am the other night, and delicious pickles on the house!!  The food seemed all right, I had a cheeseburger fries and coke but I wished I would've gotten the pastrami in retrospect. Great late night place!

Reviews.Author: Derek T.
Reviews.Content: I love Canters!  Its an LA classic!  Its like a theme restaurant without really trying, which is why its awesome.   Its great for just about any occasion, meeting friends, after drinking food, weekend lunches, whatever.The patrami is awesome here and the rye bread is always fresh.  I gotta be honest and say I've only eaten like 2 things in the dozen or so times i've been here.  Thats usually the Ruben, and the stuffed cabbage.  So thats all im going to recommend, even though they have a huge menu, probably full of awesome stuff.  The only thing that gets me is i think the sandwiches cost more than they did 5 years ago, it seemed like a lot more, but i probably just forgot how much it was then.  Also, I saw the dad from "friends" here once, which was kind of cool.

Reviews.Author: Alison R.
Reviews.Content: hard salami sandwich & potato salad. best combination ever.this is not a place for a vegetarian. the waiters are not super cool, but the service is quick and delicious.also, the kibitz room is next door if you want to make a classy night of it.i have only ordered sandwiches from here, never a salad (terrible drunk food) or egg dish, etc. the meat is where its at.

Reviews.Author: Rosa C.
Reviews.Content: I love Canters!The token place to go after a drunken night out. Maybe that's why I love it so much!I don't understand the kvetching about the bitter hosts/waiters since that's what makes this place so kitchy and lovely. The food. The food that's what we're here for, right? The menu can be overwhelming there's hundreds of items. I usually get the avocado melt. Mmmm. They come with fat steak fries. My ex used to get the tuna melt which is also very tasty. I'm not a fan of Italian meats, but I've heard that they are very good here and he's a fan of them. They say the upstairs bathroom is haunted. I didn't know this until a friend told me. I always attributed the moving shadows to being drunk. The bathrooms are scary though. The one upstairs because of the creepiness factor, the one downstairs in the kibitz room because it's tiny. So tiny you can't open the door all the way if someone is washing their hands.All in all Canter's is a classic Los Angeles Landmark and they should be forgiven for most of their flaws as long as they have an A in the window. It's definitely worth a try if you've never been here before. Just keep in mind the quirky characteristics that makes Canter's, Canter's.

Reviews.Author: D H.
Reviews.Content: haha.it kinda makes me chuckle to read the negative and positive reviews for this place. it seems most of the positives are for the "jewish" food.well, i'm not jewish, so here's how my experience went.the waitress looked to be in her 50's, and didn't give a crap. the table had food remnants on it and the water glasses had smears.they give you a plate of dill pickles. we got 3 on ours, only one was edible as the other two were discolored. i ordered a side salad with bleu cheese. what i got was a bowl filled with ONLY lettuce. there was ONE carrot slice at the bottom. the bleu cheese dressing tasted like that kind you get from mixing a powder with water, really gross. i've never had a side salad like this before.next was the chili cheese fries. the fries were soggy, and the chili tasted like they'd opened a can of Hormel and just poured it over. the cheese was the only normal part. i ate two bites and was done. the lady ordered macaroni and cheese. if it could possibly get any worse, this would be it. i think those instant mac and cheese microwavable meals tasted better. the lady ate a few bites and was done. then, since our waitress had disappeared, i went to the front desk to pay. this was actually the most enjoyable part. there was this really old jewish guy and a really old woman. oddly enough, the guy was painting his fingernails pink and buffing them. i stood there as they talked to each other about random gossip and completely ignored me. after they finally acknowledged me, i thanked them for the poor service as they rolled their eyes and i walked away.this place is an utter craphole. everything is dirty and it smells bad. most of the patrons i witnessed looked as if they had one foot in the grave. it's nice that guns n' roses and other prominent bands once performed there. i can appreciate that. it must have been a kick ass place back in the day. but now, now it's just disgusting. i'd recommend NOVA EXPRESS, conveniently located right across the street. the food and service is 100% better.i didn't try the bakery. frankly, it looked really ghetto as if the cookies and bread may have been there for a couple days or so. i suppose if you're into lox, potato pancakes, pastrami, matzo ball soup, or other things i find inedible, than this is your 24 hour place.

Reviews.Author: Liz L.
Reviews.Content: This place is an institution. It's been around since the glamor days of Claudette Colbert and Clark Gable and is still serving up a mean bowl of matzo ball soup and towering pastrami onto rye. Every time I catch a film at LACMA that gets out around midnight I head over to Canter's on Fairfax which is open 24 hours a day. When I can't eat a whole sandwich I just get their stuffed potato and a side of sauerkraut. Most of the waitresses seem like they've worked there since the '50s, hairnets and all, and can be surly at times but they only add to the character of the place. Past midnight some nights there is live music in the back at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Epiphanie D.
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was in another era...that said my friend and I had a pleasant enough lunch at Canters for the first time.  She ordered the chicken tostada salad and I had the avocado melt. The portions were huge and so were the crunchy pickles. The waitresses were also friendly and I like that they have a large menu.  Can't say it's the best deli but it's homey and welcoming so I'll come back again.

Reviews.Author: Amanda M.
Reviews.Content: Great late night spot to hang out. But the sandwiches are ridiculously overpriced. What is with places in Los Angeles thinking it's acceptable to charge over $10 for an egg and cheese on a roll. I always seem to miss order and order something inedible every time I come here.

Reviews.Author: phill c.
Reviews.Content: A comedy skit i saw suggested that Chinese are the Jewish of the east because we're so cheap and frugal.  For me, it must be my palette too because i really like this place.  (mmk that worked in my head)  but yah this place is pretty good.  Matsah ball soup, pastrami on rye, and macaroons.... mmm.  I have to admit, i don't go there often.  Actually, i haven't been there in a long time.  But from what i remember it's really good and the price isn't too bad.  Also it's open 24/7.  Total comfort food in my book.

Reviews.Author: AJ V.
Reviews.Content: I was only a take-out customer twice here.  And I only came back because the everthing bagel + cream cheese with chives is really good.  But the staff is so rude that I don't think I will come back any time soon.  They should improve their customer service.

Reviews.Author: Kat G.
Reviews.Content: My friends and i dropped by for dinner tonight. I have been hearing about Canters FOREVER.. and ive seen at least a couple dozen ads on bus benches inviting you to give Canter's a try. I think my friends have been there at least once or twice but this was my first time. When we came in, the lady at the front took us to a  half-donut shaped booth. I though "hmmm not bad... the decor kinda resembles Langer's."      We sat around and a short little man walked up to our table and presented us with huge menus.. and when i say huge... i mean HUGE. These menus are about the size of two sheets of paper taped together. After spending what seemed like an eternity trying to figure out what to order, I finally settled on "Matzo Ball soup." I mean its like the one dish that i know. My friend tried the pastrami on rye and my other buddy didnt really eat.       When i got the soup i was a bit shocked. Instead of getting a bowl of soup flavorful broth and little matzo balls, i got a bowl of tasteless broth with one GIANT matzo ball the size of my fist in it :( . oh well.. i made the best of it and chopped it up in little pieces and ate it... it made me miss my friend Joshua's grannys soup. She made KILLER matzo ball soup. In order to cheer myself up, I ended up buying these AMAZING raspberry cookies from the counter on our way out. I got a couple and they rang up to about 4 bucks.... not bad for heavenly cookies! :) I could totally see myself jogging here every morning for one of those cookies.  Canters.... i might not like your soup but i think i am in love with your pastries. :)

Reviews.Author: Irene C.
Reviews.Content: I totally ordered the wrong things :(  The matzo ball soup was good, but dry in the middle.  The chili was so salty I couldn't eat any of it.  Bleh.  It had a great late-night atmosphere, but for the prices, I can't really afford experimenting on ordering the right things.

Reviews.Author: Ryan K.
Reviews.Content: what would i say that has not been said? The first time i came here i was a little disappointed figured this was all hype. The second time i returned late at night after a concert and ordering a RUBIN, i changed my opinion. ROCK THE RUBIN is Yummers

Reviews.Author: Lap L.
Reviews.Content: I ordered a Canter's Reuben with corned beef. It was gigantic, delicious, and beefy. I spread thousand island dressing all over it, making it even more scrumptious. The potato salad was sweet and just right. I wanted to get something from the bakery but didn't get a chance to. I will next time, though. A little bit pricey, but you get what you paid for. I highly highly recommend this place for good eats :D

Reviews.Author: M T.
Reviews.Content: The pastrami on rye was delicious.  Add some mustard and a few of the kosher pickles, and it is perfection.  They put a ton of pastrami on it too - I ended up taking some of it off and eating it separate (shared some of it with my other diners too).  The other food seemed pretty good to - I sampled from other peoples plates :-)The prices are a little high, but it isn't horrible.  The decor is certainly outdated, but it adds to the charm.  The service was pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia V.
Reviews.Content: Like most angelinos, I feel that Canter's is a major part of our city's history. My nana still tells me stories about Canters, back when it was in Boyle heights on Brooklyn ave. There is something strangely comforting about the place, and the food is diner at it's best. I love the brisket sandwich on rye. The rye is so good, I usually wrap it up in napkins and take it home in my purse. Ahh, just like bubbe. To this day, my favorite Canter's companion is my grandma. She always orders the matzo ball soup with rice, and a corned beef sandwich on a kaiser roll. Fran is the best waitress ever. She is no nonsense and gives us plenty of pickles and bagel chips. I highly recommend trying the chocolate chip and apricot danishes available in the bakery. Serious noshing....

Reviews.Author: Nadia M.
Reviews.Content: yes, I am a fan.  By far, the BEST lox you can get in LA. Ask the server to slice it thin and enjoy! Great pastrami sandwiches also:) One of my favorite places to go for Sunday's breakfast!

Reviews.Author: Soy Y.
Reviews.Content: i'm from LA and know a lot of LA.. and well only had the opportunity to stop at canter's recently because we couldn't get into a party due to ID issues and had to kill some time to meet up with the rest of our party after driving around hollywood burning unnecessary gas and i really needed to get food and out of the car.i guess i wasn't really thinking and i expected the food to be like jerry's deli and i ordered the matzo ball chicken soup.. i have to say i was thoroughly disappointed. it's overpriced and well just a small bowl of chicken broth and a big matzo ball.. not like the one you would get from jerry's deli. my mistake but still not a win for canter's.. i looked around to see what their ordeal was and basically it was somewhere for people to hang to recover from their drinking.. or to meet up with their group.. or just try to be tourists and look for stars.. there was some lounge area for drinks and live music but i didn't want to spare any of my lacking energy to try to discover it.you have to pay at the cashier at the front. the service is very friendly but i think it comes with the territory and also their endurance level of being open all night.i wish i was coherent enough to see what was available in their bakery section to take home with me but i'll just have to keep it in mind for the next time i need to find sanctuary from the streets of hollywood.

Reviews.Author: Bey O.
Reviews.Content: As close to NY Jewish deli as you can get.LA isn't exactly known for it's deli selections but this place truly hits the mark. From the service that looks and acts like it has been there since Canter's doors first opened to the negligent style deli bar, you truly feel like you are at a NY deli shouting your order into the cook.What keeps me coming back is the truly great food. Canter's is consistently good food and predictable service. All the menu items are delicious. From the corned beef to the lox to the pastrami, the preperation and choices are excellent. The real debate comes from it's competition from the east, Langer's, in it's debate between thinner cut or thick cut pastrami. Regardless of what you put with your pastrami you will know that this is absolutely heaven. The price might take you back until you taste the food and realize this is an indulgence you just can't pass up.If you are like me and can't decide which you like best, the best choice is to keep eating both.

Reviews.Author: Ocee D.
Reviews.Content: 1 StarHOLY S%#*.....this has to be the WORST late night food I've had in at least 10 years!!!!This place is supposed to be famous, and we were down the street at 4am, so we came to check it out. Waters came in cups as small as ihops small oj cups and tasted like unfiltered tap water. I ordered a 1/2 sandwich combo w/ a roast turkey sandwich w/ matzo ball soup and a side of fries and my friend ordered the bbq burger.This was the first time I actually started choking on food because it was so dry........the sandwich was the dryest food i've ever eaten....I've had beef jerky that's juicier! The coleslaw was forgettable and tasteless.This was my first time eating matzo ball soup, so I have nothing to compare it to, but it was basically canned chicken broth w/ a matzo ball dropped in it and neither tasted good at all. i had maybe 4 bites before throwing in the towel. Fortunately, the service was nice and the fries were good....but it's hard to mess up heating frozen fries that you get at costco. My friend, who can eat like a 300 pounder didn't even finish his burger...said it was one of the worst things he's had!In case you're wondering why there's so much Guns n Roses posters up, the owner used to manage GnR and wrote a book about it.....So the basic summary is that this place was WAY overpriced, food was terrible, and I've gotten food poisoning from food that tasted a lot better than this C#*%!

Reviews.Author: Bev M.
Reviews.Content: it's a good ole no frills jewish deli/restaurantthe food is awesome! had the Philly Cheesesteak with mushrooms and onions and french friesmy BF's 1st time, had the #14 Corned Beef and Pastrami on Rye sandwich with potato salad and cole slawFood had the right amount of goodness and such huge portions.We were only able to eat 1/2 of our mealour waiter was pulled everywhere, but, still managed to be there when needed.  their bakery section is 5/5 is the Yumm-OH rating :)they have their own validated parking

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: It's much better than any Jewish chain (like Jerry's) it may not be the best but it comes damn close!

Reviews.Author: Hana A.
Reviews.Content: Double baked potato - five stars (Yum!!! I highly recommend this)Pastrami sandwich on rye - three stars (Don't know what the fuss is about)Service- three starsPrice- three starsOverall, I think this is an average establishment and I'd rather wait until I go to Santa Barbara to fix my pastrami cravings.

Reviews.Author: Barbara E.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Canter's. Been coming here for more years than most of you have been on this planet. They have the best barley soup anywhere and great briske tMOSTof the time. I once got a bad one so I deducted one star. They are open 24/7 and the bakery is AWESOME and the prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Ang H.
Reviews.Content: So many different choices on greasy food, it's a heavenly oasis if you stop by here after a round at a few bars.  They have so many types of breakfasts, dinners and lunches served throughout the night, trust me you will eat something that will tickle your fancy.  I was definitely surprised to find out they have a full bar, so if you feel the need to have just one more night cap with your meal you can do that here to.

Reviews.Author: Bonnie P.
Reviews.Content: Definitely not the best deli I have been to. Not only was it expensive, but it left me with an "eh" feeling about the whole experience. I'm not even sure if this place is better than Langer's, so it'll probably take a side-by-side comparison. On a high note, the restaurant is pretty big and there was no wait for a table.

Reviews.Author: Natali M.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is a LA staple and definitely somewhere you should check out if you're into the whole deli scene. I'm not necessarily a huge fan of deli type food in general, but Canter's is an experience and the menu is so huge, surely you will be able to find something you might like. Menu highlights for me are the potato pancakes, AWESOME fruit cup, and the hugest cobb salad you will ever encounter. I have a soft spot for the bakery on the way out. The cupcakes surely are duncan hines from the box... but they are topped with those little rainbow ball sprinkles, and I just can't ever seem to resist them!

Reviews.Author: Chandra W.
Reviews.Content: The menu is huge! The place is outdated, as it should be. Two dining rooms and a second floor? Why so big? I had the hard salami on delicious rye bread. So good. Coleslaw was soso. I want to come back to try more on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Bianca W.
Reviews.Content: elephant ears, butterfly cookies, palmers, whatever you want to call them, they're scrummy here! nice and sugary :)that's all i got, but i'd go back just for those.

Reviews.Author: Daniel R.
Reviews.Content: This is the best Rueben in Los Angeles and thankfully it's open all night long. I've been coming here forever and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Rachael D.
Reviews.Content: Through out everything good and bad meals. I will still love Canter's it is just one of those staple always there places. But yes. The food is not the best. After club food at best but the Bakery. Now that is where they get down best ;-) Trust me.

Reviews.Author: Irene W.
Reviews.Content: LA is full of amazing restaurants...you can go from white table cloth to chicken and waffles in the same block. In an ocean of culinary deliciousness I have to say that Canter's is my favorite restaurant in LA!!  The pickles are perfect...sensational sandwiches...delicious desserts...marvelous matzo balls...excellent EVERYTHING!  They even offer Coke AND Pepsi!  It's open 24 hours a day and offers free parking. It's the first and last meal for me every time I travel to Los Angeles!!!!

Reviews.Author: Junsu H.
Reviews.Content: I had the pastrami on rye for a quick bite. Came with three juicy pickle slices. Yum! It's very simple, but does the simple job very well.

Reviews.Author: Andrew S.
Reviews.Content: Came here and had the corned beef on rye. The decor is 70s and the ambience is fine/normal. It's open late which is realllly nice but the food was just meh. I think that Johnnie's Pastrami in Culver City is a lot better in terms of quality and is on par in terms of price. The sandwich was dry and I didn't particularly enjoy the rye bread. Cool bread/bakery display/store in the front. Private parking lot nearby.

Reviews.Author: Mark V.
Reviews.Content: I can't quite put my finger on what exactly it is that endears Canter's Deli in my lil' Filipino heart, but I can certainly say that the place simply exudes a very quintessential Los Angeles feel from top to bottom. My first visit to Canter's took place during an all-nighter campout mission at the nearby Supreme store; a friend and I were going to the extreme to make sure that we both picked up one of Supreme's recently released and highly coveted Kate Moss t-shirts. Nevertheless, we were both starving, and being that Canter's was both the closest restaurant and the nearest 24/7 food spot, the choice was pretty simple. Stepping into Canter's, one overbearing thought popped into my head: my first impressions of the place had me thinking, "hey, so this is that kind of all-American, temporary-solace-from-the-outside-world kind of feel that Denny's and all those other late night drunchies chain restaurants strive (and fail) to emulate...". In short, at Canter's, one immediately finds his/herself feeling very much welcome and at ease. The old-school cash register, plethora of deli items and baked goods on display in glass cases, and warmly lit environment all help to create an atmosphere of genuine graciousness - you certainly feel as though you're at home, or you're a welcome guest in the Canter home, at the very least. This sense of warmth continues in the establishment's service (yes, even at 1 in the morning); upon being presented with the rather extensive menu (ranging from sandwiches aplenty to American classics like meatloaf and New York steak), my buddy and I found ourselves pretty impressed with the helpful demeanor of our server, who swiftly brought us a complimentary plate of juicy pickles with a grin on his face. I'm not much of a pickle person, but there was something about the Canter's style of quaint, throwback charm that had me mobbing the plate as soon as it was delivered - delicious, juicy, and that right amount of pickle crunch.The price for a typical meal at Canter's is certainly higher than that of your average diner or cafe; I ordered an open-faced hot roast beef sandwich (which comes with a side of mashed potatoes and gravy). In the interest of appeasing my inner fatass, I also ordered a side of cheesey fries to split with my amigo. He ordered a cold roast beef 'wich on rye, and got a bowl of coleslaw to go along with his entree selection. The dishes we ordered were delivered quickly and without hassle, and to be perfectly honest, I believe that Canter's is justified in its slightly heightened menu prices - in that their portion sizes are pretty damn hefty. A mountain of beef gravy covered mashed potatoes and tender, juicy roast beef was just what I needed to accompany my order of crispy, gooey cheese fries. My carbtastic feast hit the spot, and the freshness of the ingredients really did shine through (especially in comparison to the vast majority of cafe joints that I have tried in my nineteen short years of life). However, my homie's dinner really did upstage mine; I should've known to order authentic deli food when dining at a JEWISH DELI!His roast beef sandwich was served on rye that had the perfect amount of crunch, and the dish was piled high with precisely-shredded meat pieces that perfectly complemented the coleslaw (which was refreshingly a little on the sweeter side). I found myself begging for extra bites and thanked the heavens above when my friend offered the remainder of his meal to me - call me Adam Richman? My buddy and I decided to end our meal with two slices of Canter's acclaimed Carrot Cake, and I shit you not when I say that this dish would be capable of satisfying even Willy Wonka's sweet tooth. Slathered in fresh cream cheese icing and packed with layer upon layer of moist cakey goodness, our desserts were the perfect conclusion to our very memorable meal. My three items (the sandwich, fries, and dessert) totaled in at about $18-20, which is a little steep, but not unbearable. I'd conclude my review here by saying that if you've got the bit of extra cash for Canter's, and you're in the area, it wouldn't hurt to give the place a shot. Canter's provides diners with a little bit of LA history and a well-prepared, most certainly filling meal, all in your own backyard - and at any time of the day/night, at that!  (Upon finishing our dinner, my brodinski and I waddled our way back to our spots in line at Supreme, where we had a grand ol' time meeting some other fashion enthusiasts - and yes, I did end up getting the Kate Moss shirt, although this was after nearly 14 hours of arduous waiting. But that's a whole 'nother story altogether.)

Reviews.Author: Carly F.
Reviews.Content: Considering I don't eat meat, you'd think I would never hit up a place like Canter's. But with a Jewish husband I find myself here quite often. Especially when we have friends in town. Particularly of the NY Jew variety. So we go. I get a grilled cheese and fries. I always want to love their pickles. But I just don't. It bums me out every time. But I keep going back. It's for the ambiance. And the Atomic Horseradish.

Reviews.Author: Paul R.
Reviews.Content: I have always wondered why I love pastrami so much.  And now I understand why........Since my childhood, my father has many times brought the delicious food of Canters home to south Orange County.  When you are bringing home food that is almost an hour to an hour and a half away from home.  Then you know that this place is legit. My father and I decided to hit this establishment up before the Roger Waters concert that we went to this past weekend and it brought back many memories of all the great meals that I have had from Canters.  My father ordered the Pastrami Platter and I decided to go with the French Dip sandwich.  Both were great and worth the extra calories that I consumed during this feast.  The pastrami platter comes out with just a plate of pastrami meat that is heated up and you get the bread on the side.  They will give you whatever type of bread you would like with it.  My father went with sourdough and rye.  We also ordered a side of pickles which apparently use to be free years ago according to my pops but now cost $2.50 for the appetizer.  The french dip sandwich was one of the best that I have had.  I truly think that it is better than Philippe's since the last time I went to Philippe I got food poisoning.  But that is just my personal opinion.  But the wait at Philippe is ridiculous.  But to add to my love of Canters.  All of the awesome pastries and bakery items that they have.  I ended up bringing home the "Nut Roll" which was this delicious roll with walnuts and brown sugar wrapped in a delicious type of roll.  My father brought home another pastry but I cant seem to remember what it is called but it is awesome as well.  I cant wait to go back to Canters and try something new!And to add to the history of Canters.  Apparently G'N'R use to frequent this place.  They have books at the front that chronicles it.  But who really wants to read about Axl after the letter he wrote to the Rock N' Roll Hall of Fame.

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: The pastrami is fine but man. Their baked goods section is INSANE. They have coffee cake and three kinds of strudel and the biggest hamantaschen of all time. It's a great place to have coffee and dessert.

Reviews.Author: Mike E.
Reviews.Content: We finished our meal to 88 Chinese and Sushi last night at around midnight.  After our below average meal there (please see my review), we wanted some dessert.  We were looking up where to go so late at night, when one of us happened to look out of the window directly across the street and saw Canter's was open 24 hours and had a bakery.  So we crossed the street and went inside, where we immediately looked upon a feast of lovely desserts behind the glass.  We were then seated and noticed the place was pretty crowded, especially for that type of night.   We shared some desserts.  I tried something with marzipan, which was very good.  However, it paled in comparison to the chocolate Russian coffee cake a la mode.  It was chocolatey, warm, gooey, and was excellently complimented by the vanilla ice cream.  The service was fast, helpful, and very polite.  The atmosphere was old-fashioned, but in a good way-it took you back to a simpler time.  They have a large selection of other food as well that you can eat for lunch and dinner.  They also serve breakfast 24 hours a day, which is awesome!  I would highly recommend Canter's to anyone looking for delicious baked dessert goods at any time of day, or even if you want some some nice deli and diner-type food at any time.

Reviews.Author: Van C H.
Reviews.Content: After eating at Canter's for over 40 years I finally got my wife to go with me for lunch. We live 30 plus miles from them and we are retired and were in the area.  She loved everything, we got combination sandwich with corned beef and pastrami with 2 sides plus pickles. The pickles are the best I have ever had and no matter what time of day I have pickles, they are open 24 hours per day and I have been there at 4am and had pickles with bagels, lox and cream cheese. When the managers found out my wife had never been there they gave her some deserts to take home. Needless to say she is now a big fan of Canter's like so many others all over Southern California. Thanks for not changing the quality of the food and the great service.

Reviews.Author: Jeff W.
Reviews.Content: Where the old folks come to dine Sunday afternoon.   Smells funny. Maybe it's the restaurant but maybe it's the old folks.

Reviews.Author: Jon L.
Reviews.Content: Bland, forgettable food. Why aren't there any great delis in Los Angeles?? And do NOT say Langer's. For great pastrami look no further than Plan Check's pastrami nosh! Also Eastside Market.

Reviews.Author: Jeff B.
Reviews.Content: Canter's just doesn't do it for me.  The food is passable but very, very salty as if to compensate for bland food.  Service is dicey at best.    Breakfast is decent but nothing great.  Only if you are truly desperate late at night.  Even then, Jerry's Deli has a slight edge.

Reviews.Author: Emily O.
Reviews.Content: Never leave this place without a bag of baked goods. Get a table, order some potato pancakes from the slightly grumpy old lady waitress, and then stop in the bakery on your way out.

Reviews.Author: Christopher L.
Reviews.Content: Their watermelon slice is HUGE! Get that!!  Their drinks are ok and their food is ok.  This place has an old diner feel that I love and I had a great time.  It's close to Largo so eat and prepartay here before going to Largo.

Reviews.Author: Peter C.
Reviews.Content: I like their Matzoh Ball Soup and lox and bagel. This is one of those places that's a "landmark" in the LA landscape that one *must* visit.

Reviews.Author: Rick P.
Reviews.Content: Where else can you get a monte cristo?

Reviews.Author: Grant H.
Reviews.Content: The Club House sandwich is great, as is the Canter burger. The service leaves a lot to be desired, but that's part of the Canters charm.

Reviews.Author: Brett T.
Reviews.Content: very good deli food.  i got the french dip and my girlfriend got the pastrami sandwich and barley soup.  All were very excellent and this is the best of the jewish deli's i've been to and isn't as overpriced as factors/  portions are excellent and the meat is very juicy.  yumm.

Reviews.Author: Sarah W.
Reviews.Content: Instant points in my book for all the free pickles and bagel chips (!) you can eat. Obviously I got a cup of matzoh ball soup and half a hot pastrami on rye. Excellent! Pastrami was piled high and even though I usually like my my matzoh ball soup with a few more fixins (veggies, noodles), it was a damn tasty (and might I add giant) ball. It was kind of depressing to look at the menu from 1955 near the door and see that the same meal that cost me $15 with tip cost about $1.25 back then, but hey, I'm willing to cough it up for quality. Was too full for the baked goods this time around but I will certainly be back, they looked awesome.

Reviews.Author: Andrei O.
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to having a pastrami and corned beef , aka For Fressers Only, but at DS, the Fairfax sandwich.  They were out, so I had the corned beef.  For $11, they didn't skimp on the meat.  Unfortunately, the beef  was dry, like the heat lamp had sucked all the juices out of the meat.  Maybe it was just the timing, I did get the sandwich in the 8th inning.  But still....Oh well, I guess that's what I get for abandoning the Dodger Dog for one night.

Reviews.Author: Kim P.
Reviews.Content: Here's where you go in LA for the best matzo-ball soup and 27-ft-tall sandwiches if you don't mind a chaotic atmosphere with Hooters-like noise levels.

Reviews.Author: Patrick K.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is great for what it is: an old fashioned delicatessen, complete with blue-haired waitresses and 1950s decor. Must haves: the pastrami or roast beef sandwiches. You should also try a dessert from the bakery - some of the best pastries in town. Open 24 hours, this place is bopping at night and slow during the day. Spicy pickles served with every meal.

Reviews.Author: Belle l.
Reviews.Content: canter's is a jewish deli that serves just about everything at all times of the day/night. there are a few rules that I have about delis they must sell GOOD bagels and they must have crunchy pickles. Canter's has both AND a dive bar on the side. So if you were going for the pastrami why not stay for the band playing old 50's hits in the bar? why not?

Reviews.Author: Paul F.
Reviews.Content: It's Canters.  It's 24/7.  It's a Jewish restaurant thats been open for ages.  It reminds me of a trip home to my Grandmothers.  Huge reubens and a great bakery and deli for all your Jewish food needs.

Reviews.Author: PJ M.
Reviews.Content: Once again, I am frightened that anyone thinks this place is anything other than a cool looking, old school LA type place.    OK, all I had was the brisket sandwich, chips, and  pop (Dr. Brown's Cel-Ray- what else?) BUT BUT BUT    NO SELF RESPECTING JEWISH DELI would ever put out a plate containing that flavorless, dry, sawdust sandwich on grocery store quality rye bread in front of any human being, charge them ANY money at all, and then think they would EVER EVER return to try the "best pastrami sandwich ever" as purported by my fellow yelpers....     I simply and absolutely cannot, will not believe that ANYTHING they serve can be halfway decent AT ALL. Chalk it up to another case of these poor, poor, LA people who have NO IDEA of what a real brisket (or meat) sandwich could and should taste like. SO, SO SAD! I love California, but you all need to get out and about a little...there's a whole world of food out there just waiting for you- in New York, Chicago, London, Ann Arbor, Detroit, Travers CIty (Tapawingo), Dearborn, San Francisco can whup on Southern Cal cuisine with one arm tied behind their backs. You all have no idea...I miss ZIngerman's (which I used to swear was overrated!), Miki's, Shalimar (which I used to complain was overpriced!), Thai Bistro, Amer's even! Hell, Kosmo's Deli at Kerrytown, that new Japanese French place on Liberty, any hole in the wall or Burmese restaurant in San Francisco, various great cheap places in New York, any Indian food in London...Sigh.....

Reviews.Author: Steve L.
Reviews.Content: Great little restaurant, for great big breakfasts.... our waitress was quick to pick up on us staring at the ceilings and phones, to tell us the trivia behind their history.  I don't remember her name, but apparently she has people who will ONLY sit in her section when she goes... She's definitely right on top of every need.  Parking can be a bit tougher, but not bad if you're willing to wait a few minutes at the most.

Reviews.Author: Selina Y.
Reviews.Content: A Los Angeles landmark! This place is like... an old fashion diner-ish looking place. A 'feel good like you're almost at home' place when you walk in. When you walk in... you'll see this whole aisle of home made bakery goods like their cheesecakes. On your right, is the deli area which you can buy to- go if you like. Then you're kindly introduced and get a seat. The place is mainly booths where your group of 4 can sit down and be ready to chow down. The waitress was this nice, old lady who served us. I got the steak sandwich with fries and colslaw on the side. Their colslaw is awesome! The steak was perfecto, and the fries were crispy. My friends got the Tuna Melt which she thought was a no-no, and the other got pesto __ pasta, which was nicely flavored. But I liked my sandwich a lot! The prices here are pretty decent, & if you buy their 'dinners' on the back of their menu, they give you a ice cream serbert on the houseeee. This place is pretty laid back restaurant where you can just walk in and chow down since their service is pretty fast.Also, this place is open 24 hrs!

Reviews.Author: Kate M.
Reviews.Content: My pastrami on rye was good enough, but it was no Katz's.

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: By L.A. deli standards they are near the top...  Brent's in the Valley is better. Good brisket and corned beef, decent pickles, good bakery. Very funky in a good way. You could do a lot worse. the soups are salty, and the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Author: Neal F.
Reviews.Content: Loved the classic deli vibe. Everything in the place reminded me of my grandparents. Definitely a place with a lot of character. The corned beef was great, the service was efficient and the waitress was 70 years old and crabby. It was exactly what I expected.

Reviews.Author: Bruce K.
Reviews.Content: Okay, fair is fair - I was recently at Canter's with a very large party (I'm really quite popular) and I had my very first really good meal here.  I had the pastrami with Russian dressing and cole slaw and it was terrific.  Ranch dressing is the worst I've ever had (on the fries) but the sandwich was first-rate.

Reviews.Author: Stan F.
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect for me.  Corned Beef sandwich piled high on fresh corn rye.  You can get coleslaw, swiss and russian dressing too if you like.  They also have my favorite poppy seed roll and danishes.  The kosher pickles are good too.  You can also get a side of kishka, which is like jewish stuffing.

Reviews.Author: Dave S.
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for a week and ate at Katz deli.  The pastrami meat at Katz was great, but the rye bread was dry and broke apart during the eating of it.  Canters pastrami meat isn't as good as Katz because it's sliced thinner.  About two slices of Canter is one slice of Katz.  The meat at Canter was still tender and flavorful and you get about the same amount of meat. I just like the thicker cut.  The rye bread at Canter's is made on the premise, so it's very fresh and has more rye seeds and flavor than Katz.  This fresh rye bread made the sandwich manageable and the bread held together with every bite.  I also had to try the Matza Ball soup.  I've never had it before.  The broth is a good chicken broth and the Matza was soft.  Easily cut it with the spoon.  Matza is bland, but with the broth, it's okay.  Friendly service and a good size parking lot makes Canters a definite return for me.

Reviews.Author: Noel C.
Reviews.Content: I can only give this place four stars because I only have had the pastries, cakes and desserts at Canters. I have never ate a meal here so this review is only for the bakery goods, which are AWESOME.... I love the chocolate cake here, hands down its one of the best chocolates cakes I have ever had in LA. I took my group of friends one night after going out and the females in our group are very picky with food but I recommended we order the cake and they loved it. Besides the cake they also offer many other choices, too many to list but you wont be disappointed with anything you order. Its also reasonably priced, not like $4 sprinkles cupcakes that are all sugar.  So if you are in the mood for good pastries Canters is a place to go, especially at night when most places are closed.

Reviews.Author: Ed M.
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the best  New York Jewish styled deli and bakery in LA. I love this place. When I need that gritty deli experience, this is were I fall into at 2 pm or 4 am on any given day!

Reviews.Author: L C.
Reviews.Content: Yummy! Everything on their menu is awesome. Give me a pickle and some potato salad, on the side, and you're set. They are open 24 hours so you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Author: Brian P.
Reviews.Content: This place is really a LA landmark.  I love the food, the old school service and the overall atmosphere.  The portions are ridiculous and food is great.  I have been here for lunch many times and look forward to my next visit as I am walking out the door.  Pastrami and beef dips are my clinchers but I haven't had anything that I didn't love.

Reviews.Author: William Y.
Reviews.Content: Just had a great dining experience at Canter's.  Great service and the turkey dinner sandwich is really good.  Canter's also makes a great ruben with corn beef.  I highly recommend this place for a quick meal on the west side of town.

Reviews.Author: Zoe D.
Reviews.Content: Don't know about most of the food served there, but they have the best tune melt ever, it's about $12, but it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Clara B.
Reviews.Content: I love their desserts and delicious deli salads.  They get really busy at times, but the service is always very good and friendly as well.  They have been there for ages, but they love their customers.

Reviews.Author: Bella C.
Reviews.Content: This place has that great we-never-close vibe that manages to mix less-than-stellar waitresses with somewhat blah food and still comes up on everyone's must-try list.  The best thing is that it's open 24/7.  And they serve decent coffee.  And there are tasty desserts up front.  The food is nothing special at all -- My grandma can totally make everything on the menu here, and my mom can actually make it even better, but neither my grandma nor my mom are willing to cook for me at 3am like Canter's.  Besides, you can't claim to have lived in LA without stopping by here, so hop in the car and park 4 blocks away and get yourself excited for a subpar meal served by crotchety old waitresses.  The overall dining experience is better than the food   ;)

Reviews.Author: Ian L.
Reviews.Content: Got the patrami ruben, which was very good. Good amount of meat in the sandwich. And the french fries were perfect. Big steak fries that were crispy on the outside and steamy soft on the inside.I tried a few of their cookies in the bakery - those were ok. I prefer bea's bakery instead. Next time i'll try some of their breads instead.The only complaint i had was this was the first deli i've gone to that didn't have half-sour pickles. And the guy who was talking our order was very attentive as well - never had our drinks go empty.

Reviews.Author: Mathias S.
Reviews.Content: Went here to cash in a groupon. I like the atmosphere and the fact that it's open 24/7. Service was nice. Corned beef hash was really good but the Combo plate with pastrami and brisket was too thin and too dry. Definitely prefer Langer's thicker and juicier pastrami... especially if I'm paying $10+ for a sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Jacky F.
Reviews.Content: Delicious sandwiches and they're steak fries are awesome! Has a great old Hollywood/Cafeteria feel.  Their desserts are to die for. If you're in LA and it's late and want to hang out somewhere loud and fun. This is the place!

Reviews.Author: Daniel C.
Reviews.Content: I am not always one that loves and writes reviews for deli food, but come on, this is Canter's!  Deli perfection.  Pastrami FTW! My friend has a funny story about staring into space while at Cantors and the next thing you know, the person that he was staring towards with flipping him off.  It happened to be Mollie Ringwald!  Haha!

Reviews.Author: Caroline J.
Reviews.Content: ooh canters. I use to frequent canters a lot when I was in college because they were always open. I believe you go here more for convenience than the actual food. although I will say egg salad on rye is pretty good (but then again, I will like any egg salad sandwich from anywhere). and I use to love that there would be loud live music while I ate my meal.

Reviews.Author: Anthony A.
