Reviews.Content: Never disappointed. Granted, I've only had sammiches (reuben, corned beef and pastrami, chicken liver and pastrami, some giant 3-tiered  monstrosity that also had pastrami) and various goodies from the bakery (great napoleons!). Friendly service. Love that it's always open. Lot of history in those walls. Ever wondered what real deli food you were missing out on? Me too--until I came here.

Reviews.Author: Colleen B.
Reviews.Content: WOW! My family and I came for a late lunch and the owner was there and treated my daughters like royalty. After the yummy lunch, the owner gave us a complimentary plate of rugelach, which was the perfect end to a filling lunch. I started with a knish, which 3 of us shared and then moved onto The Brooklyn... which is pastrami on rye with coleslaw on top of the pastrami. It was fantastic. We ordered some corn beef to go and stopped at the bakery on the way out. again, more complimentary cookies. I love that none of the homemade breads/sweets have any perservatives... so eat it within a few days! The only draw back... my girls' had stomach aches on the way home!

Reviews.Author: Carlos M.
Reviews.Content: My first visit here.  I was vry happy with the quality and the service.  Try the pastrami for sure.

Reviews.Author: Mario G.
Reviews.Content: Best late night Rueben in LA!!! This deli will never disapoint at 3am on a saturday morning, food is always good... For the price it's great actually!!! Go here!! Staff is very friendly and never a long wait after midnight!

Reviews.Author: Kat B.
Reviews.Content: There are A LOT of things to choose from on the menu. Mostly I've only just eaten here because I was in the area, but I'm always glad when I stay because I love pickles! I think they make their own pickles & the always seem to be really fresh. Sometimes the staff is really brief, but it's usually because they've got a lot of other customers & their just trying to get to everyone in a timely manner. . . which I can understand. Overall though, this place is delightful when you're drunk/buzzed and you just want to eat without a huge line & then go home and pass out.

Reviews.Author: Teresa E.
Reviews.Content: Just been there a couple of times, both times we had the Reuben & cornbeef sandwich which we enjoyed. The only thing I didn't enjoy was the customer service. The waiters were a bit rude and when we pointed out they got our order wrong they fixed it but charged it on our bill. Too bad, had heard good things about it but that experience left me not wanting to go back.

Reviews.Author: H. P.
Reviews.Content: Ooh... The Canter's Fairfax is delicious! That, plus the thick steal fries and matzo soup, makes for an absolutely filling and tasty lunch.

Reviews.Author: Don T.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite for a pastrami sandwich!

Reviews.Author: Mike W.
Reviews.Content: The best pastrami, corned beef, pickles and ambience in town. Light years beyond that faux deli junk at Jerry's. I love getting the Corned Beef Reuben, fries, cole slaw and a good old PBR.  This place has old school street cred. I hope they never upgrade the decor or staff. Angelenos are never happy with anything older than the 80's. Too bad. Love this joint.

Reviews.Author: Erick L.
Reviews.Content: good stuff.  Love their tuna sandwich and barley bean soup.

Reviews.Author: Mariyam M.
Reviews.Content: I heard rave reviews about this place and had a hankering for a rueben so my bf and I decided to go on a weekday night. Its definitely old school deli style inside and the faux autumn leaves on the ceiling just kept cracking me up for some reason. The rueben was huge and greasy, loved the pickles it came with. We didn't have space for the desserts on display. This place didn't blow me away and I probably won't go out of my way to eat here again. Le Sigh...still on the search for that perfect reuben...

Reviews.Author: Selly K.
Reviews.Content: Pastrami sandwich, yum

Reviews.Author: Darla D.
Reviews.Content: Mmm, This is an old school place that has been around forever. It is a Kosher Jewish Deli that everytime i go the pastrami is Oooo sooo yummy. The fresh deserts are the best. Still all in its origonal atmosphere it makes the deli what it is. I love the fact that it is also around the conor from my fav bar, lol... Makes it awesome for a late evening snack right after the bar.

Reviews.Author: Billy D.
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Canter's is I live nearby. I wouldn't cross town to come here. Mediocre bakery and the staff is totally random/hit or miss.  I would say the best thing they have going for them is the Kibitz room.

Reviews.Author: Dick R.
Reviews.Content: What was I thinking when my original review only gave 4 stars.  O man this place is great.

Reviews.Author: Jo T.
Reviews.Content: Food is okay!  Service sucked ass!  But freakin LA people like!  I guess its the trendy and cool LA thing to do, "Go to Canters".

Reviews.Author: Steve G.
Reviews.Content: Yea, there's really no topping this place in overall character.. One of my favorite places to eat... I have to not get the ruebens though, cause I force down the whole thing, and TWICE now have had to stop at a Ralphs on the way back down to PV cause it just couldn't wait to get out.

Reviews.Author: George R.
Reviews.Content: i like big sandwichesi like matzo ball soupi like having a decades old phone jack conveniently placed in my booth.i love LA landmarks (too many get torn down).i love me some canter's.oh, and the ceiling is rad, too.

Reviews.Author: Brianne S.
Reviews.Content: Very, very Jewish. But damn good.

Reviews.Author: Jill B.
Reviews.Content: Trust me, this place may not offer the glamour from the interior, it may lack some curb appeal but I consider it a Hollywood historical diner. I get good vibes from this place and it has left a mark in my late night dinings. In addition to great service, great memories i've shared with friends and delicious classic Jewish cuisine, the pastries are a must have to take home. It is located in Fairfax just a few blocks from ethiopian town.. definitely attracts diverse crowd. And, I have seen Adrien Garner here. And no i won't pick up the name I just dropped. ;-)

Reviews.Author: Lesa T.
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to trying this place, but I was very dissapointed.  1st off the prices are pretty steep for an old dingy jewish deli.  I know, its a throwback kinda thing, and thats its charm and bla bla bla, but if the food doesn't cut it....I orderd mazo ball soup, and it was very good, huge portion, and 6.00 for chicken broth and a ball, it really couldn't be cheaper to make (rip-off) but at least that was good.I then ordered the Cheese Steak Sandwich, thinking it would be like this amazing quality monstrosity like all the other sandwiches you see come out.  Keep in mind it was 14.95, I asked if the steak was lean he says "very".  I get it, and there is truly 1 inch cubes of fat chopped up with the giant cubes of steak, thats not what its supposed to look like! And it just didn't taste good.. I sent it back for a Grilled Cheese thinking that they coulnt possibly mess that up, and it was extremely mediocre, and pretty expensive and came with no fries or anything!  My husband also was very unimpressed with his "thanksgiving dinner".  We might return for the soup, but I can probably get it some other Jewish deli just as good and cheaper!!!

Reviews.Author: Kim C.
Reviews.Content: The parking is awesome. You have to pay but HELLO securely monitored and worth it! What is a buck an hour anyway? The workers all seem like family and enjoy being with each other and serving their guests. The food is amazing, booths are comfy and private. I enjoyed the Reuben sandwich it was awesome with the corned beef, wow. The avocado sandwich with sprouts is rad too! Definitely a plus to go to.

Reviews.Author: Ryan R.
Reviews.Content: for a $15 dollar sandwich i would expect EXTRAVAGANTLY SPECTACULAR!  I'd much rather go to Ralph's and have them make me a far better sandwich for $5!

Reviews.Author: Mike A.
Reviews.Content: Truly a classic deli worthy of standing among the finest delis found on the East Coast, but located about as far West as you can get.  Try the egg cream for a classic beverage.  The corned beef and pastrami is tender and fatty (as it should be).  The pickles are the real thing (kosher half/full sour). The potato salad and coleslaw are superb.  The rye bread is a TRUE deli rye, with a fabulous crust.

Reviews.Author: Alan L.
Reviews.Content: Overall, the food was great. The restaurant surroundings isn't a safe community at all. I felt I was about to get rob anytime. When I first step in to the restaurant I realize it wasn't really that clean. Even though the food itself was good, I thought it was somewhat over priced. Will not visit it again.

Reviews.Author: Ely K.
Reviews.Content: a delicious, no frills, classic bakery shop and restaurant.only tried the deli/bakery items.great bagels.the pizza bagel was so light and filling it almost didn't taste like a bagel; almost like a bread...bagel. the jalapeno one was also delicious! would definitely go back and get more.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy C.
Reviews.Content: Not bad of a place.  The place opens late and the food isn't too bad at all.  Good place to go after hanging out at the clubs.

Reviews.Author: Daniel G.
Reviews.Content: My uncle took me there and I've been hooked ever since. The sandwiches are orgasmic. I get the Pastrami on rye. It's the best I've ever had although this is coming from someone who has not had the chance to visit the big apple. My girlfriend cannot have beef so she was recommended the turkey on rye. It was just as good as the pastrami!!! ... And the service .... it rocks!!! If your not stuffed try a piece of cheese cake or some of the fresh baked goods!!

Reviews.Author: Anna A.
Reviews.Content: Old school retro breakfast diner restaurant deli bakery. it was a total accident that we found this place but oh so worth it. Its too cool. On our stay in LA we had brekkie here twice! Its solid good breakfast and the waitress lady was friendly. Good place to people watch!

Reviews.Author: Jake D.
Reviews.Content: Horrible greasy expensive food with bad service and a dirty floor.  Not somewhere I'll ever go again I don't care how late.  Had the Reuben which was dripping with so much grease.  Ordered sweet potatoes fries for 2 dollars more that were cold.  Friend had a dry french toast with packaged maple syrup.  Go to Jerry's.  At least there are big portions to compensate for being so overpriced.

Reviews.Author: Alex F.
Reviews.Content: this place is open all night long which is very cool. its got a great bakery and the sandwhiches are good.great vibes and the kibbitz room is great for live music on friday nights. pastrami. fuck yeah.

Reviews.Author: Annie C.
Reviews.Content: Came here after dinner for dessert and some place for me and my girlfriends to chat without feeling guilty for taking up a table for a few hours.  It was my first time at this restaurant and their menu was huge!  Lots to choose from.  I wish I was there to try the sandwiches they're famous for, but alas, we were there for our sugar rush.  I had the chocolate Napoleon cuz it sounded good on paper, but it was just okay.  It was a large piece with a slab of chocolate frosting on top - yuck!  I'm not a thick frosting fan.  Scraped away the chocolate and just ate the Napoleon itself.  I've never had a napoleon with custard, usually it's some sort of whipped cream, but it was good, kinda thick.  Had a bite of my friend's warm strudel with ice cream.  That was good.  I think my other friend had a chocolate malt shake, it was alright.  I'm not a malt person though.  I was surprised that the foods and drinks weren't cheap though, but I guess part of that has to do with the history of the place.  Anyway, I've never had matzo ball soup before, so maybe I'll go back one day to try that and their pastrami sandwich cuz their service was good.

Reviews.Author: paul b.
Reviews.Content: canter's is like that uncle who always seems to drop by when you have new friends over. is it horrible... no is it good... not reallyi can't quite give it three stars b/c of how overpriced it is for the average-below average food.to put this in perspective...there are many other deli's where you can have a much better meal for the same moneythere are many other diners where you can have an average breakfast for half the price.if you are reading this save your tourist money and go to someplace else,but if you are drunk and have money to burn at 2am then canters is for you!

Reviews.Author: Carina D.
Reviews.Content: Given that I get off late for work (typically like 11 pm), my bf and I run into quite the dilemma for late night dining that pleases us both... but Canter's has pulled through many late nights when this native California girl and this NY deli born and raised boy find compromise. I love their array of sandwiches and late night live music and terribly poured drinks. My bf loves up on anything turkey and pastrami and raves about the corn beef. We both weren't extremely pleased with the sweet potato fries, but we've made a recent quest for the best sweet potato fries. The atmosphere is that of the quintessential LA deli environment complete with an old school cash register,convenient pay-to-park specific parking lot, and an AMAZING pastry counter. I'll admit the main reason I love revisiting this LA Fox Hotlist 2010 restaurant winner is for the to die for black and white cookies!!

Reviews.Author: Ryan P.
Reviews.Content: Canters is an LA institution and its BOMB. A little pricey for a kosher sandwich, but they're so good. Everytime I'm in town I go. The pickles are killer, the beef is spectacular. Really cant beat Canters.

Reviews.Author: Audrey S.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a friend late one night and found it was not as good as Yelpers had said.  Still prefer (and am perhaps spoiled by) Nate 'n Al's in Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Author: Sophia N.
Reviews.Content: I had the mish mash soup and it was pretty good! I had it on a rainy day with my friend. But it's not something I would eat on a normal day... definitely looks like the soup I would get if I was down with a cold. The service was definitely so good! She was an elderly lady who was very cheery and patient with me being a noob at the restaurant. Bagel chips were awesome! I dipped them into the soup (which made it much easier to eat) and it was good. :]

Reviews.Author: SSS K.
Reviews.Content: canter's has a very nice, homely feel to it. the waitress that served us, has worked there for 55 years. how beautiful - this is how a regional, cultural institution is built. the breakfast food here is quite affordable and very much reasonable, but i give this place a high mark for its classic, irreplaceable atmosphere.the bakery is also quite nice as well. the sweets are gently sweet, without being offensive (unlike the abominable ones found at pavillions or albertsons). very reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Jenna B.
Reviews.Content: I live in the Park La Brea area which is very close to Canter's which i drive by constantly, so I had been wanting to go there for a late night 4th meal. I was not impressed. I got the matzo ball soup which was so basic. It was literally broth and one matzo ball. Usually when you order matzo ball soup it comes with carrots, celery, noodles.... I also had a tuna melt which was good- it hit the spot for a 4th meal. The service was nothing exceptional, you could tell our waitress could care less about our table. Overall, I would not come back.... if i want a late night deli experience, I'd go to Jerry's Famous Deli- it might be a tad bit more expensive but i enjoy their food more than Canter's. However, their pastries and desserts looked amazing, so maybe I'd go back to try their baked goods.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy D.
Reviews.Content: Very good deli with out the silly sized food. Tuna was fresh and the service was good. They also are open 24-7 and have a full bar!  G&R got their start there as well...

Reviews.Author: KJ D.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Canter's too many times to count in the last 30 years. Hubs introduced me to it shortly after we got married and there was no going back. The (HUGE!) pastrami sandwich is what I order every time (good thing I know what I want because the menu is MONSTROUS and would probably take an hour or two to peruse).  It's by far the best pastrami I've ever had and the rye bread is the ONLY rye bread I've ever liked. It's soft and simply wonderful, just like the pastrami. Melts in your mouth.Hubs ordered lox and eggs this time. Sometimes he orders a corned beef sandwich. He always enjoys everything he eats at Canter's, but sometimes I think he goes there mainly for the atmosphere. Being from Philly, it makes him feel a little bit like he's back home.I don't care for the pickles here. I love pickles, but not these. About once a year I try a bite to see if maybe I was wrong about them, but nope, still don't like them. I'll just stick with the huge pastrami sandwich, no sides.The service. I have to admit the waitresses (and occasional waiter) can be pretty... well... testy? If one smiles I feel like she's out of place. But! I also have to admit that I LOVE the attitudes they exude; reminds me of east coast waitresses I've encountered in the past. They are also the component that makes hubs feel like he's back in Philly... he loves the attitudes, too. "What can I get you?" No smile. Right to the point. Gotta love it. Don't ever change! The first time hubs took me there, the waitress came over and told us how bad her feet hurt. Hahaha, Great gal. On the way out we always stop at the bakery. Yummmm. Hamantaschen, rugala, nut cake, bread... we load up on enough to last a week. This time the bakery bill came to just over $17 and worth every penny. We'll be back in a few months, Canter's! Excuse me now while I go have a cherry hamantaschen.

Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: Reuben sandwich with chips, or pay a little more for fries.  Pickles of course.  Diet coke.  Maybe you see a celebrity.   If I had to choose a last meal this could quite possibly be it.  There are so many fun places to eat and hang out in Hollywood, Farmer's Market is just a little bit down the street, but this is where I usually end up.  And it is always great, delicious, satisfying.  One of my very favorite places.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: The corned beef is really good but, the star is the pastrami. It is so tender and flavorful. Lots of pepper and spices stuck to the edges of the pastrami ribbons. I just wish they were closer to home!!

Reviews.Author: Carrie B.
Reviews.Content: A long drive to LA from the OC, but a great beef brisket sandwich and a bowl of matzoh ball soup was worth it. Free parking for the first hour and half. I love the old style and decor too. Service was just ok.

Reviews.Author: Rachelle A.
Reviews.Content: Worst service I have ever seen! When we went to pay the guy looked at us and said, "do you have a card?!!??" the entire experience from the moment we walked in was awful. I don't know how the food was because I didn't eat but they definitely weren't focused on customer service.

Reviews.Author: Jolene L.
Reviews.Content: Yeah buddy! I LOVE CANTERS, LIKE LOVE THEM. Being from the east coast this is the closest thing you will get to the real deal, I love the mish mosh with carrots and chicken! I also love the Rueben and the cookie selection in the bakery!

Reviews.Author: Ken F.
Reviews.Content: A Los Angles tradition. This place has been here since the 1930's and very little has changed except for the prices. A great place for some NY Style Deli and the best part is it is open 24/7. The food is always good and you can get some interesting people waiting on you and great for people watching. A must if you like Great Deli.

Reviews.Author: Labrador B.
Reviews.Content: Between Langers and Canters.  Langers is better but they are not open late and on sundays.  Canters is always filthy and smelly and the staff is all attitude here.  Place make so much money it's time for a remodel and Fairfax needs a clean up.  The Fairfax Business improvement district in this area needs to step it up.  Come on canters stop being cheap....

Reviews.Author: Juan G.
Reviews.Content: I went to this place last Friday fir the first time and loved it. The service was great and the food was very tasty. I had one of the best omelets I have ever had. I will definitely be coming back here.

Reviews.Author: Ellie O.
Reviews.Content: I ate at Canter's for the first time today and was very disappointed. First of all, I was expecting a New York style deli with a long line at the counter waiting to order sandwiches, commotion, hustle and bustle. There was none of that here. It is a sit-down restaurant. OK, fine, no big deal. So I got seated and then waited over 5 minutes to be approached by the waiter and given water. Even though it was a Friday afternoon, they weren't very busy. The place was about 1/3 full and very quiet. The waiter finally takes my order and brings me some pickles. The pickles were tasty. I ordered the quintessential deli sandwich - the corned beef on rye. Boy, was I surprised when I bit into it. The rye bread was good, but the corned beef wasn't very salty, and it was SHREDDED, which made it a mess to eat. I'm a pretty neat eater, and there were corned beef bits all over the table and my lap by the time I was done with the sandwich. The sandwich was also quite dry - I added some mustard to it and that helped a little. My waiter never asked if I enjoyed myself, was the food OK, was it my first time here, etc. Nothing. He brought the check and I paid and left. I will never go back. Not sure what the hype is about.

Reviews.Author: Patrick C.
Reviews.Content: The place is huge and probably good for really late night crowd; however, it's my guess that this place gets a lot of stars based on how long it has been there and who it serves... rather than the food. I was extremely excited to try the corned beef hash with some scrambled eggs and bacon. The hash was like a brick, both in shape and texture. It was dry and lacking any real flavor. My fiance's sandwich was decent, but neither of us were impressed.

Reviews.Author: Nikcole G.
Reviews.Content: Use to love the pastrami but,it's lost it's magic since I discovered The New York Deli.I still love the bagels&cream cheese& I'm sure I'll still stop if I'm in the area.The sweets are still pretty sweet.Especially the brownies&cheese cake.

Reviews.Author: K R.
Reviews.Content: Kind of overpriced and i ended getting food poisoning this time around. But you can't beat the quirky crowd and history.

Reviews.Author: J Smith A.
Reviews.Content: Ok sandwiches. I don't think I'd actually go out of my way to come here. The service was nice.

Reviews.Author: marc l.
Reviews.Content: Great Deli, and open 24 hours a day.  Wonderful sandwhiches, but stick with the sandwhiches, their other menu items aren't as great...but you're their cause it's a great deli anyway.  Also, their Rugulach is great...take some home.

Reviews.Author: Houston H.
Reviews.Content: Great deli. May not be quite as good as Nate n Al's, but much better atmosphere. The waitresses are pretty rude, but it's kind of charming. The prices are a little steep, but that's LA.

Reviews.Author: carol s.
Reviews.Content: just doen't get any better . . .perfectly-seasoned, tender corned beef on toasted-yet-soft PERFECT crusty rye bread . . .there just isnt any better.  Period.  Order Canter's carrot cake to fall in love . . . and chase it down witha coconut macaroon for good measuer - just the BEST!Slurp on PERFECT matzo ball soup to accompany.  It doesn't get any better than this.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer F.
Reviews.Content: We try to eat at Canter's whenever we're in LA.  This time I had breakfast--scrambled eggs with lox & onions--and it was perfect.  Lots of fish, lots of onions, and the eggs were done perfectly.  The half-sour pickles are my favorite, even at breakfast.  My husband had pastrami and cole slaw, which he loved.  The staff is lovely--efficient and pleasant.  The other reason I love Canter's is that there's a lot to look at.  The decor is a throwback--how did I forget the weird 70's photo panels on most of the ceiling?  And what about the phone jack in every booth?!  But most of all I love looking at the people.  We sat across from a table of cops, who were next to a table of construction workers.  Across the aisle from us were two skinny little grunge rockers, and boy could they put it away.  Best of all:  everyone seems to be having a great time, and that makes every meal better!

Reviews.Author: Cinde M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst bagels I ever had in my entire life!  What else can I say...The Mazzaball Soup was not bad.  The few times that I have been there, I found the place to be all that is described above: interesting people, grumpy waitresses, etc....but lets face it, there was a big 'C' on the door for a reason.  Nuf said.

Reviews.Author: Christy S.
Reviews.Content: Sincerely wacky experience--dining after-hours on very tasty under-done, garlicky pickles and a grilled-bread pastrami rueben, my friends and I were serenaded by the earnest musical stylings of an overly-sincere (and overly-amplified) college-rock band in the bar.  Music: 1 star.  But Canter's kitschy style and delish knishes made up for it.

Reviews.Author: Matthew R.
Reviews.Content: I meet with a group of friends every Monday that insist on going here....why???? I get sick EVERY time I eat the food...everything is loaded with salt. Now I'm just reduced to eating the fries or the blintzes...BUT I still feel like crap afterwards. I gave it two stars only because of the service and because it has parking.

Reviews.Author: Erin M.
Reviews.Content: Rainbow cookies O how i love you.

Reviews.Author: Edmund L.
Reviews.Content: I have been here quite alot of times when I came to Los Angeles for vacation getaways and nealy every time I came for their pastries at the front bakery. OH MY GOODNESS THEIR PASTRIES ARE SUCH GOODY GOODNESS IT IS SO NICE. I am a very picky eater and very health conscious about what ingredients are in my food but when I come here, I could care less about everything except what I eat. PROS-All the turnovers are so absolutely blissful goodness (get the Apple!)-All their cookies (especially chocolate coated)-all their pastries-Got a custom 3 meat sandwich. Rye bread with pastrami, corned beef, and salami. Comes with sauerkraut, coleslaw, and a pickle. THe sandwich was so big with gigantic portions of meat the sandwich was literally about 3 inches thick of meat. I nearly would get lockjaw from trying to open my mouth to bite into the sandwich. THat sandwich has got me craving for those sandwiches all the time since I came back home to HAwaii. -Friendly workers. THe old guy at the bakery front can take a joke well and answer your questions in a nice manner and the deli dudes were very patient with my inconsistency on what to order and my indecisiveness. WHen I got takeout in the daytime, they let me sit in and eat my order in the bar.-Turnover + pastrami/corn beef/salami sandwich is the bomb-matzo ball soup is ok-huge portions. I mean HUGECOns-Dont get the spaghetti plates as they dont seem to compare with the other stuff-Can be expensive on the wallet

Reviews.Author: Jason J.
Reviews.Content: Whatever you get...make sure it has pastrami on it. Incredible. The service was awkward/poor, but the brooklyn st. Sandwich with pastrami more than made up for it.

Reviews.Author: Vaska R.
Reviews.Content: While most restaurants that become 'institutions' enter a downward spiral of relying on history rather then substance this old place defies the odds. The menu has a crowded and byzantine layout that can be confusing at first but it is the gateway to old-fashioned and fantastic food. Sandwich portions seemed to be scaled for mythical giants and the meat cuts are both good and plentiful. The appetizers and side-dishes are also quite good and you'll never grumble about value, especially when going by the delicious pastry selections at the front.

Reviews.Author: Bonnie C.
Reviews.Content: The menu is huge and diverse. Unfortunately, I got an egg salad sandwich, which was only ok. My friend's pastrami sandwich looked incredible (and she confirmed that it was), but being a vegetarian, I didn't sample it. I guess they're famous for their pickles, but I wasn't super impressed with those either. The service was pretty good, the atmosphere was nice (they have an incredible ceiling), and the deserts looked amazing- especially the strawberry cheesecake. They are open 24 hours so we had planned to return for desert, but unfortunately, never made it. I would go back again, but I'll definitely avoid the egg salad in favor of something a little more exciting.

Reviews.Author: I Be E.
Reviews.Content: like i said, i love delis and old time coffee shops.  this is a combination of both.pastrami was decent.  service was decent.  serves beer so you can get your drink on.  i had the monte cristo and although not as large as some cristos ive had, it was still tasty and less oily than the deep fried versions at other places.nothing extraordinary, but the reason i love delis and coffee shops is because you feel like youre a kid again, and all is safe in the world.  you can be one here.

Reviews.Author: Markito M.
Reviews.Content: The best thing is the scenery. The food is not so great - leaden latkes and such. The bakery counter is impressive and the waitresses are old school and the place is packed with old "landsmen."

Reviews.Author: Henry S.
Reviews.Content: I was first turned onto Canter's in the late 1980's because of Rodney Bingenheimer (LA icon and D.J.)...local teen-fans would commonly stalk him at this location because he has his own booth and would arrive multiple nights of the week to have a bite with his legendary punk and alternative rock star friends. Eventually, I end-up living in the neighborhood and along the way I fell in love with the food and brash service that came the history.... This place is great anytime you want to get your deli food fix! There are a variety of options to try that are especially good after late night drinks or the morning after ;) I highly recommend the cobb salad...it's massive and very tasty! The leafy ceiling always holds my attention.

Reviews.Author: belinda n.
Reviews.Content: pointless in reviewing this place;however..........you will not find a monte cristo sandwhich anywhere in l.a that is this delicious and this delicious.actually.. you might not find a monte cristo sanddy anywhere!i eat here prob twice a yr..for that monte cristo.& i drench it in smuckers preserve.hmmmmmmm hmmmmmmmmmmmmmm

Reviews.Author: Derek R.
Reviews.Content: There's a reason people are willing to add a shirt that says "I 'heart' Canters" onto their (probably considerable) tab at the end of a meal here. It's not exactly budget fare, but I can't complain about the value. The food is excellent and the portions are gargantuan. Recommendations: The fairfax ruben, the french dip (best i've ever had), the corned beef hash and eggs, and the pickled green tomatoes.

Reviews.Author: Daniel P.
Reviews.Content: Canter's makes the worst Bloody Mary I have ever had. It tasted sweet like ketchup. I had to add horseradish, tabasco, salt, and pepper and it was still terrible.

Reviews.Author: Sam G.
Reviews.Content: Great pickles, great sandwich great bakery. The price was fine was a new York style deli like this and the sandwiches were piled high with fresh sliced meet I could see them slicing. Top it all off with a black and white cookie!

Reviews.Author: Seichan G.
Reviews.Content: Much better pastrami than Oinkster. You can really taste the meat, very savory. The rolls (i opted for the french bread, not rye) and was very happy with it. The bread is crusty  on the outside but have a nice soft texture in the inside. The matzo ball soup was very good.The broth is better than most chicken noodle broth i've had. I will want this soup if I get sick. Very comforting. The only thing I didn't like was for $6.95, it did not include vegetables in the soup. The vegetables I think were extra 50 cents. I am sure it is worth it though. The soup's portion is quite generous.

Reviews.Author: Jay A.
Reviews.Content: A Los Angeles institution. I agree they do make good sandwiches and blintzes here.  I just wish they would remodel the interior.  eh, from my experience a lot of restaurants, in LA are like this anyways.

Reviews.Author: Carolina O.
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this place is that its open 24hrs while i was there i had the displeasure of meeting one of the managers Jacqueline. And ive never been one to say anything like this before but she was just soooooo rude and unprofessional to me i will never ever go into this dining facility again...i do not want to run into this devil woman again who didnt even have any patience to understand or explain anything. I cant imagine what a woman like this is even allowed to work anywhere and i just A) wonder about the real quality of the joint and B)wonder what the rest of the employees putting my food together are like.

Reviews.Author: Dth S.
Reviews.Content: it's canters...it's always there...it's always open....&there's that loud bar rite next door! there's tons on the menu....the servers are all old&friendly people who've been there forever (whereas at jerry's it's all 'actors') who kno the menu inside out&backwards&if they like u they comp u a lotta times on stuff u didn't even ask for! i rest my case. i always have the corned beef&pastrami combo. soooo consistent!!  (oh, except they have no cannolis whereas jerry's does)

Reviews.Author: Isaac M.
Reviews.Content: Good food! It's definitely worth a stop at the deli to grab a quick sandwich/pastry, or you can dine in if you have more time. I love the vintage look in the place. Be sure to check it out if you're in the area.

Reviews.Author: Brooke B.
Reviews.Content: open 24 hours = love.pastrami is great!the perfect meal here is half pastrami samich on challah bread & matzo ball soup - BAM!their pancakes are really good too.my friend is in love with their cheesecake, of which you can get as big or small of a slice as you want.the place is really big, so there's rarely much of a wait.the ceiling in the main room is RAD, don't forget to look up!

Reviews.Author: Dave C.
Reviews.Content: I don't plan on coming to Canter's each time I visit LA, but I nevertheless always find myself here at some point! It has some sort of weird magnetic pull over my fressing habits. I love being bathed in the smell of garlicky, steamed meat as I walk in. On my latest visit I split the assorted meat plate (pastrami, corned beef, brisket) with a friend and had a side of latkes. It's not Langer's or Carnegie, but it's good as always. Naturally, I top it off with some of their great chocolate rugelach and a black and white for dessert. Their bakery is unbelievable, as many other posters will attest.This place gets extra points for the vibe, and its status as a 24-hour temple of cured meats.It was even a Guns 'N' Roses hangout in the 80s! (I wonder what they ordered? Hopefully nothing on white bread, although I wouldn't put that past Axl) I've had some great times here. This was the first Jewish deli I visited in LA during my numerous forays into the city, and I'm a little sentimental about it. One time late at night I tried ordering a gefilte fish/tongue sandwich. The waitress wisely refused my request and brought me an open-faced roast beef instead.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan F.
Reviews.Content: Matt Special. Done. eat it. Ridiculously good. Despite the price, it will fill you up.

Reviews.Author: mOe J.
Reviews.Content: Fessers pastrami and corn beef samich. Fricken awsome! Makeing the 2 hour drive out here again!

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: Oh I how miss Canter's now that I live in Vancouver BC.  A can't miss meal whenever we visit LA, today's lunch convinced me that Canter's on Fairfax is great deli.  (On the other hand if Canter's in Las Vegas still remains, don't bother.)   We had the usuals- chopped liver and pastrami on rye for my partner and Dedicated Fresser for me (pastrami and corned beef on rye with sides fo cole slaw and potato salad.)  while in Manhattan a month ago we ate at Katz's and Sarge's.  Canter's beat them both on all counts, including service and ambiance.  Plus free parking.  Massive portions, fair prices.  who cares that the MDR branch of Jerry's is walking distance form our hotel.  It's Canter's for deli or eat Mexican instead.  One star off for the traffic if you live or stay at the beach.

Reviews.Author: Simone F.
Reviews.Content: A classic. The pastrami is like no other. And the pickles are sublime. That is all.

Reviews.Author: Leigh J.
Reviews.Content: This place is a little taste of history...even the interior and dishes- for better or worse. The food isn't great but the black and white cookie and peanut butter cookie both are spectacular!

Reviews.Author: Karlyn F.
Reviews.Content: I  love it because it stays open late, but I don't think the food or the service is very good.

Reviews.Author: Richard R.
Reviews.Content: Quite simply the best Jew pastries I've ever had. Everything else here is overrated. If they would invest in some seasoning, it'd be great.

Reviews.Author: Thomas S.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Sweet aesthetics, jovial atmosphere. We came here on a visit to stay in LA after the Aids Life Cycle. Since my boyfriend had cycled all the way from SF, he was one hungry boy. Great selection of classic dishes and sandwiches with huge portions. Fairly priced and very clean. Our waitress, Fale, was very sweet and attentive. We were greeted with a warm smile by the hostess, promptly seated. Diner style restaurants can be hit or miss, but coupled with the great service from Fale, and the quality of the food, we were confused by the negative reviews here. Our experience was top notch and we'll be back next year!

Reviews.Author: A j B.
Reviews.Content: Been coming here since I was a kid and this is as old school as it gets but still keeps it up to date at the same time. They keep up and just don't rest on their reputation. The service has not changed and maybe because we have come to know most if not all the staff and cashiers it makes for the best comfort food as one could ask for and service that we think is top notch. For breakfast love The Little New Yorker, bagel, lox and cream cheese with tomatoes, onions capers, its got it all and filling. Love The Beverly sandwich. 3 different meats polled high on rye bread and it's enough to take home for a second meal. Can't complain about anything. Every choice is a good one and with early bird breakfast specials till 11am you really can't go wrong with the choices or price. A must visit if in LA.

Reviews.Author: Tracy B.
Reviews.Content: Great pastrami with no fat and a decent portion.  Onion rings are great also.  Service is great.  Long wait but it seems longer because you're standing in line versus putting your name on a list and having a seat.  I would give the food 4 stars but the reason this place gets 3 stars from me is because it's a bit pricey.  So, if there were 3.5 stars, that's what I'd give it.

Reviews.Author: James M.
Reviews.Content: The bakery is great. I was looking for some baked goods like back in the east and was coming up short, then went to Canters having no clue they had a bakery and boy do they. It has huge Chinese cookies, huge linzer tarts, huge black and white cookies, rainbow cookies; all fresh, delicious and stuff I cant find since I left 4 years ago. I am going back (deli stuff is pretty good as well, great potatoe salad).

Reviews.Author: Doug B.
Reviews.Content: thought I would give a shout out to my neighborhood deli...i live across the street and get food to go there often.  food is always good, thought you might have to wait at the deli to get it!...worth checking out!!

Reviews.Author: Michael W.
Reviews.Content: Going to Canter's is like taking a step back in time to the 1960s. The food is fine if you're looking for a midnight snack. And even if you order something that's bad, at least you're not paying much for it! I've always thought that the service here was great too: they know what matters to the just-left-the-bar crowd...keep the glasses of water full!

Reviews.Author: Gregory G.
Reviews.Content: Vermin infested.

Reviews.Author: Rodney w.
Reviews.Content: its the ceiling, that warm autumn sky overhead, the waitress calling you sweetheart. Cheese blintzes are divine, also the Beet Borscht with a dollop of sour cream is  just fine!

Reviews.Author: James R.
Reviews.Content: I just had the best date of my life today at Canters. We laughed over the Matzo ball soup, and bonded over the corned beef. Maybe I'm a weirdo, but I really liked the atmosphere retro 50's deli.

Reviews.Author: Christine T.
Reviews.Content: I will put up with a lot for good food--driving to LA, crazy bums, gloomy decor, inconsistent service, noisy bands, etc.  Luckily, Canter's has great food (if you know what to order), so the rest is inconsequential.Favorites include matzah ball soup, potato pancakes, PASTRAMI REUBEN, and a chocolate eclair for the ride home.I only give this place four stars instead of five, because it really does depend on if you know what to order.  (Also, just as a side note, I love pickles but think their pickles are really gross.)

Reviews.Author: Unknown
Reviews.Content: The place as much as it had that old NY's style deli look. To be fair and honest, it reminded me of my local coffee shop. There's not much of a difference except for the hype and unnecessary nostalgia for this place. It only gets the weird characters out at night to make a real difference. You can get anything here that you can get at your local Denny's restaurant anyways. Not much of a big difference for me. I don't get the cultural phenomenon or the historical significance of this place at all. Personally I think the food is nasty. The service is not bad, but overall the food was a total pit. The French toast I got was soggy and the egg was almost inedible. Our dining companion in the table, took a bite of each item and decided he had enough. Plus the Chicken noodle soup was very bland. Even though the food was not good, I should have been more classier than this. Once we walked out of the place, I redeposited the food in front of the place. That I do need to apologize. It was midnight and I just had a few drinks too many. However your food just didn't sit well in my stomach. I just can't stopped it. So sorry!

Reviews.Author: miss c.
Reviews.Content: Right next to my sister's old house. Haven't been in forever, but they have really good matzo ball soup.  The guy that helped me last time spoke little English and has hella rude for no apparent reason. BUT the halva and matzo ball soup (not together, of course) are great, even if they are served by rude hispanic men.

Reviews.Author: Dan C.
Reviews.Content: In the 3 weeks I was in LA I went here twice and came out both times satisfied and full. They served me up a perfect reuben that was good enough for two meals (it was still excellent 4 hours later). The second time I had an excellent mishmosh soup. I love how huuuuge their matzoh balls are! My mom's were never that huge. I wish their prices weren't quite so steep, but hey us Jews gotta paid too. If I ever get to go here again I'm going to buy some of that delicious looking rugelach!

Reviews.Author: pontaine b.
Reviews.Content: Extremely overpriced jewish food.  Never again!  haha

Reviews.Author: edward t.
Reviews.Content: Food is ok, but wth is up with their prices!?!!  $14.00 for a SANDWICH , let me repeat that for you, FOUR-TEEN-DOLLARS-FOR-A-SANDWICH!WTF!Screw that, I'd rather buy 3 foot longs from subway with MORE toppings and better bread in my opinion.  There pastries are good, but man, that's asinine to pay $14 for a sandwich.. The more you people go and support that place the further it enables them to charge insane prices.. No more Canter's for me.

Reviews.Author: Sheldon W.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is an amazing place to go after the clubs. It's walking distance from my apartment. I am the type that always gets the same thing at a restaurant, but at canter's I am open to a few different options. I LOVE the corn beef, pickles are good but they don't have the neon green garlic one's factor's does. This may not be an issue to most, but to my pregnant sister this was a major factor on whether or not canter's was worth a second visit. I also love the matzoh brie when I don't feel like meat. The matzoh ball soup is pretty pimp as well. I was discussing this place with my boss and she was telling me about how she ate here once and had her meal in front of her; it was late night and she was drunk. Her boyfriend pointed out a roach on the floor crawling towards her and she ignored it. Is it bad that I would have done the same thing?

Reviews.Author: Lindsay R.
Reviews.Content: The service is not fast. The staff are not polite. The food is excellent. I got engaged here. And I see Rodney on the Roq fairly frequently. I've come here after the bars closed and stayed until 6 in the morning.  You have to have the matzo ball soup. I also recommend the Reuben, and the egg salad. The hummus is pretty good as well.

Reviews.Author: Cat T.
Reviews.Content: I grew up on deli food so this is definitely a place for all the comforts I need--a good pastrami sandwich, great pickles, and a delicious egg cream!  The food has been consistently good when visiting.  It is a bit pricey-especially the matzah ball soup, however since we live in OC, we splurge since we deprived of good delis.  We usually stop at the bakery area and get some rugelach for the ride home.  Service is usually pretty good but it just depends on your waiter.

Reviews.Author: Abraham C.
Reviews.Content: Ive been going to Canters since I was 10 years old. The older I became, the later I went because canter is a true Night Spot. Back in the days, On Tuesday nights, there would be people overflowing into the street, thanks to late night pastrami sandwiches and their bar called the Kibitz room. People from Janis Joplin to Bob Dylan, his son (wall Flowers which i took the pleasure of jamming on the mic with once lol) tonic and the list goes on. Back in the day, they were rated as the worst food in town, but they have since cleaned up their act. Their sandwiches are huge and fresh (known for their pastrami sandwiches) best fruit cups ever(they use a special refrigeration process to bring out the sweetness in the fruit) and the best bean and barley soup ever. Great memories, cool people, Come to Canters.

Reviews.Author: Joshua D.
Reviews.Content: A must for any visit to L.A. The food is excellent. It's a bit pricey but the portions are huge. Take someone with you and split an entree.

Reviews.Author: Brian T.
Reviews.Content: The potato pancakes are pretty amazing!  Chicken soup was literally brooth soup, so I wasn't impressed at all.   It has the cafeteria setting feeling and the food taste like caferteria-ish.  I thought it was just okay, and not sure what all the hype was about.

Reviews.Author: Kurtis S.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love Canters. Their pastrami is consistently delicious. Never had a bad experience - in the restaurant or take out. I love their potato salad too - great recipe. And you can't ignore the history. So fun!

Reviews.Author: Kristen L.
Reviews.Content: YUM.  What else do I need to say?!  This place is a local, old time favorite.  It is famous for a reason guys.  Delicious Jewish bakery, foods, and nice friendly, family service.  Open 24/7, so go!  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Svetlana ..
Reviews.Content: A real New York deli hidden in Los Angeles! The food and the decor are amazing! Ultimate comfort food. Huge menu it can be overwhelming, but it's kind of exciting. Makes it easy to always change it up!  And FREE PICKLES!! They also have a cool little bar in the back so you can get super wasted and sober up at 2am with a giant bowl of matza ball soup. The bakery is also great! So many incredible cookies and cheesecakes! If you are looking for a high end 5 star dining experience canter's is not for you it is a DELI!

Reviews.Author: Mark S.
Reviews.Content: Their pastrami is really good and you get a lot.  Definitely a filling lunch!  Really neat look inside, very old restaurant/diner feel.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan M.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is what it is, a cultural destination, a taste of old LA.  The food is alright, but that's not really why you go to Canter's.  You go for the old, frumpy waitresses, the garish decor, and the awesome atmosphere.  And the sandwiches are good, though I think Langer's are better, and the deserts are rich, but you go to Canter's for the fun of it, and it's worth it. It's also open late, which is a bonus in LA.

Reviews.Author: Andrew M.
Reviews.Content: Always a classic. I like anything thats on the border of the menu. The best part is coming in at 4 am.

Reviews.Author: Bacon M.
Reviews.Content: Their Matzah Ball Soup is good and that's about it. I love the atmosphere and waitresses, so i go back- but only when people make me. I always kind of feel gross after eating anything else here.

Reviews.Author: Zack W.
Reviews.Content: first off, the server i had was an older gentleman and he was sneaking and on top of his stuff. i didn't even realize that my drinks kept getting refilled. he was pleasant knowledgeable and not overbearing. the food was pretty spectacular. my friend and i ordered the brisket sandwich was juicy and yummy. And also got an omelette that i cannot remember the name of, but it was just right! the vibe is pretty cool, you can tell and feel that generations have enjoyed this spot. it feels a bit historic.  I wasn't crazy about the potatoes that came with the omelette but whatevs, i don't need to be eating a half plate of potatoes anyways. they sport the guns n' roses memorabilia with pride, which is interesting. definitely a spot you must go to if you are in LA and wanna experience LA.  and it's open late!! didn't know that, i went for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Gfiddy F.
Reviews.Content: Very good food, excellent service in a stunningly beautiful room.

Reviews.Author: Freddy R.
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid I have to comment more on the service than the food. Let me say that the food, as always, is soooooo delicious. We've never had a bad meal there. The meats, soups, salads, and especially the baked goods, are off the hook good! Our waitress was also the best, very attentive.Now, when I mean service, I mean the service of the cashiers. An absolute joke! It's like they do all they can to inconvenience the customer. There is one line for cash and one line for credit cards. Of course the line for the cards is always longer. I waited 15 minutes in line to pay for my meal!!! Ridiculous! This is 2011, most people use their debit and credit cards so there is a long line. Only once in a while someone would walk up and pay cash. So the cash cashier was rarely busy while the credit card cashier was like a mad woman. Taking the card, writing the transaction on a log, what is this 1948? Swipe the card and move on! So it's a misuse of the cash cashier, paying for the manpower when they're hardly busy. After I paid I went to the bakery, ordered $15 worth of pastries pulled out my card only to be told I had to go back to the credit card cashier and wait in line to pay for the pastries!! WTH?! Are you freakin kidding me???? There should be a credit card cashier behind the bakery AS WELL as two cashiers for the restaurant, both taking cash and cards, this way the line wont be so long. Needless to say I told them nevermind to the baked goods and walked out. Whats with the strict rule of only having one credit card cashier? A 100% TOTAL inconvenience. I wont be using the bakery again. GET WITH THE PROGRAM PEOPLE!!!!

Reviews.Author: Dan K.
Reviews.Content: A Hollywod classic.LOVE IT!A must stop for everyone.

Reviews.Author: Vivian P.
Reviews.Content: If u are in the mood for awesome kosher deli food this is it. The pastrami on rye is to die for. Make sure to use their mustard..the one with no label...beats all else. I love their half sandwhich special..add a bowl of matzaball soup and u are set. Also share a side of their steakfries....warm, fresh, crisp...ultimate comfort food. Family friendly, kids love it. Relaxing atmosphere, great place to relax and enjoy LA. Top off your meal with a brownie from their baker. So good and worth every cent. Want a taste of LA culture at its best...this is it.

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this 4-stars although I was a bit intoxicated at the time of my visit and everything tastes good when you're trying to sober up.  If you're starving for breakfast at 3am, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Author: David R.
Reviews.Content: Good food.

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: canter's will be canter's! accept it and move on because no matter what you say people will keep flocking to this place and have been for a very long time, moi included.food - ok to goodservice - greatenuf said...

Reviews.Author: Ed L.
Reviews.Content: Cantor's is a Los Angeles institution.  True Jewish-style deli that makes this East Coast Ex-pat wax nostalgic for the Lower East Side of New York. The matzoh ball soup is true Jewish soul food.  The ambiance is that of a bus station, but that's what one expects from a deli-style restaurant like Cantor's.  The wait staff is prompt and courteous and, unlike some delis in NYC (Hello, Ratner's?), they don't try to chase you from your table if they think you've lingered there too long!

Reviews.Author: elvira g.
Reviews.Content: 1. OVERPRICED... I bought a Pepper Beef Sandwich. It came with mayo, mustard and the beef (on dry sourdough bread) for 11.75. It was pretty bad .. i had to give it away to the homeless guy. I took 2 bites and was disgusted.

Reviews.Author: Honoria P.
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I miss New York, on those days I head over to Canters and have a little nosh. Love the Liverwurst and the corned beef. The potato salad always makes me happy too. It is always busy but the tables turn over fast so the wait is usually not that long and you get to llok at the deli case to excit your tastebuds while waiting. The service is fairly friendly and fast. Get the pickles!!!

Reviews.Author: Kansas C.
Reviews.Content: Good eats for a fair price.  We got good service as well.  We had the matza ball soup (sp?) and pastrami sandwich  both were great.  Most pastrami sandwiches are stringy and hard to eat or are soaking in juices that make them sloppy and flavorless.  This was neither.  Solid.

Reviews.Author: Deirdre K.
Reviews.Content: Great food, not so great service....Went with husband and two kids and all the food was great, but the service was horrible!  For such a busy, established place you would think there service would be routine...NOPE..   We were seated quickly, but once we sat we were given menus and then sat for about 15 minutes before someone came over to us asking if anyone had been to our table...Hello??  Don't you have sections that you are responsible for?  So the waiter took our order.  He was a very nice guy, just clueless!  We waited and waited for our drinks that we ordered, but our food came out and the clueless waiter didn't even realize we hadn't gotten our drinks.  "Do you need anything else?"  Just our drinks to go with our lunch would be great!The food....I got the tuna sandwich.  The Rye bread is amazing and the tuna was one of the better tuna salads I have had.  My husband had the corned beef with Swiss which he said was really good, very lean meat and again, the rye bread is amazing!!  The kids both had kids meals....chicken fingers and a hamburger.  Hamburger was standard, but my husband tried the chicken fingers and said they were really good!!Overall, a great place that helps bring me "home" to NY, but definitely wouldn't make a trek up to LA to go back.  Lots of NY things there, but I will keep to my making them at home and visit Canter's if I am in the area,

Reviews.Author: Gordon L.
Reviews.Content: One of the great delicatessen's in Los Angeles, Canter's has never disappointed me. It's a great spot to grab deli soul food; I love going here for brunches on the weekends. Their pastrami sandwich is excellent and packed with flavorful pastrami. You can get a half sandwich/half salad which is nice if you want to get a variety of flavors on the cheap. I've also had their matzo ball soup which is really hearty (I always order it with chicken). The restaurant is in a nice location as well, it's never hard to find parking. If you're in the mood for some old school deli eats, you've got to check out Canter's.

Reviews.Author: Adrian V.
Reviews.Content: Pastrami....mmmmmmmmmm

Reviews.Author: Rick A.
Reviews.Content: Really good sandwich spot. Great pickles! The pan dulce is great and addictive. Been there twice and will be swinging by soon.

Reviews.Author: Lauren C.
Reviews.Content: I've heard so much about this place that I had to try it out when I was in LA last weekend. It was a mixed bag. So if you go upstairs (where the restrooms are), read all the articles on the place. Much of old Hollywood has been there which gives it that very cool feeling at you sit in the booths. I had the corned beef sandwhich. It was a decent sandwhich after I put the sauces on it. The mustard they have their is very good!! But the meat itself was SO plain and dry. UGH! Nothing special what-so-ever. BUT the stuffed cabbage was delicious and the pickles were fantastic---some of the best. the lady at the pastery counter was really rude. I asked her what she recommended---something that could travel well in the car (as we were driving back to the Bay Area). I wanted something other than bread. a pastry. and she just got so annoyed at me. I was not asking much and I didn't want to hold up the line....I just left. which I've never done before. Look, I'm sorry if this lady has been shlepping matzah balls all her life and doesn't give a damn anymore but there was no need to be rude. then again it is LA. Now, I definitely will be back to catch some music and drinks next door at the Kibbitz Room. Now that looks cool.

Reviews.Author: Kris P.
Reviews.Content: I like Canter's. It feels like eating food from people who're from the "Old World". They have a way of preparing and putting ingredients together that just makes them taste like an Old World experience. I'm sure a bbq beef burger prepared by an old cowboy who's lived out in the desert most of his life from the 19th century, is different from one you would get at Carl's Jr. or Barn Burner in Pasadena, CA. It just has a care and sensibility passed down from generations put into it, and it's not the typical eatery that's after the hype of taste (all these weird new distinctive tastes with no history to it) and faked nostalgia. This is the real deal, prepared old school. Very old school. All the people who appreciate history, and can seperate a McDonald's soft yogurt from one that's been churned over a brick oven in a massive iron kettle will agree. I always have friends who want to make a stop here and get something from the bakery for someone out of town or bring them here if they're from out of town. Definitely one of those must do things for people who don't live here. I just got a pastry cake with light and flakey layers with custard in between topped with a think layer of the most decadent dark chocolate icing I've ever tasted. Tell me you wouldn't drive an extra 5 or 10 miles for that? Even with gas prices these days, I would! (and do)The Original Canter's is a great experience and definitely a place to be. Las Vegas one, as well as other chain spin offs, probably lacks that. I've spent some years in New York City, and if you want to experience a New York City Deli without flying out there, I think this is as close as it gets out here in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Author: Dan C.
Reviews.Content: Pastrami Ruben is Great with MatzoBall and noodle soup. Potaoe salad and Dill Pickels are nice compliments.The is a old but clean.Try the kinsih

Reviews.Author: Najmah B.
Reviews.Content: What can I say? They have the best sandwiches in Los Angeles and I am not exaggerating. This is not your subway or quizznos. If you are looking for a fresh sliced meat sandwich on rye bread, then you would love Canters. They pile the meat on very thick, so you can make an extra sandwich. My favorite is the Corned Beef on Rye...... I go here atleast once every two to three months. I would go more but I have to watch my figure. :) Open 24hours, so it doesn't get any better than this.

Reviews.Author: Frank Y.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a late dinner Saturday night. It was great. Service was amazing and the food was awesome!

Reviews.Author: Tanya J.
Reviews.Content: I first tried the lox and bagel a little over a week ago and it was de-lish!!! Absolutely wonderful. When I got back into town I had to go back for more and boy was I DISAPPOINTED... the salmon was now a very pale pink and I could smell a strong fishy odor before the bagel ever reached my mouth. The taste wasn't any better. Ick. To top it off the waitress and the manager stood by the bacteria infused plate and were quite rude saying, "We've served it to others today, it's just that YOU don't like it." Well, I loved it the first time... amazing... but clearly you're bagel and lox service is like playing Russian roulette!The corned beef on rye is fantastic!!!

Reviews.Author: Lil F.
Reviews.Content: I visit Canter's at least 2 times a month. The food is ok depending what you like. They have an array of pasteries, which are really good. The one thing I dislike is...as soon as you walk in there's this strong smell of who knows what. It's like a viniger, garlic, sour, bitter something!, which is not cool at all. Then again they sell pickled tongue!!!! Yuck!

Reviews.Author: christine h.
Reviews.Content: There is much debate in Los Angeles over the best Jewish deli.  I have always been Team Canter's.  They make their own pickles, their matzo ball soup is no frills perfection, and their bakery items are old-school just like I want them.  I love the decor that hasn't changed in decades, the service with or without a smile is always as entertaining as it is thorough, and they are open all day and night, every day of the week.  Don't visit Los Angeles without checking this place out.Extra shout out for the Kibitz Room bar too.  Never change. You are perfect.

Reviews.Author: gwen t.
Reviews.Content: the pastrami is incomparable to other places.i dont like pastrami but this place is the best

Reviews.Author: Morgan P.
Reviews.Content: NY style diner, yummy food, go there when you're drunk. Or sober.

Reviews.Author: Tim M.
Reviews.Content: Simply the best Deli on the West Coast.....Period.....

Reviews.Author: Enrique P.
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with Canter's. Great traditional deli food. Great corned beef sandwich. Great baked goods. ....and it's open 24/7.

Reviews.Author: Steve L.
Reviews.Content: I was originally introduced to Canter's on a late-night date after a movie, and was told to try the pickles. They were SO good!After visiting Canter's a couple more times, I decided I was in love with it. Being from the New Jersey/New York area and coming from a Jewish household, this place felt like home to me.I have since been back multiple times and always get the same thing -- matzoh ball soup (a large bowl and one of the best I've had), stuffed cabbage with potato pancakes (also one of the best I've ever had) and a cream soda (can't really go wrong here).The atmosphere of Canter's is no BS -- very New York -- but fits exactly with what the place should be. Anything different would not feel authentic. This place rivals most other delis, and is on par with any classic New York Deli.After finally getting my parents out to LA this year, I told them they would love Canter's. They both didn't believe me, and figured that any deli, or really any food, in LA, would never be comparable to the East Coast. After they left Canter's, their feelings on that changed.The rainbow cookies and black and white cookies are probably the BEST I have ever had anywhere. The rainbow cookies are soft like cake with a hard top. I recommend this place highly -- especially on a cold, rainy LA day.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: FIRST: AMAZING!Growing up on the East Coast I was used to the many amazing bakery's and delis. Since I moved to the West Coast I have been in search of a great place to have some good baked good and sandwiches like back home. The other day I was introduced to Canter's via my friends when we were dinning out in downtown LA for the evening. I was informed that we had to go to Canters for after dinner dessert without question.We walked into Canter's and I felt as though I stepped into the East Coast all over again: the deli counters were packed with so many different pastries and goodies that I almost lost it.The service was great, fast, and very friendly! the lady that assisted me was fully of suggestions and was very knowledgeable about everything. It will now be my food stop to go to when I am feeling home sick and need some great tasting carrot cake or out of this world sandwich. I was told when I go next time to order the massive pastrami sandwich! SECOND: Can't Wait!

Reviews.Author: Barnabus J.
Reviews.Content: What can be said about Canters that isnt already known by most Angelenos ?!?!Heres my tale :First off, I'm a night owl and a picky eater so you'd think finding a decent place to get my grub on after midnight would be a difficult task to say the least. (IT used to be until i discovered the above!) After growing tired of the typical Dennys-Ihop  / Del Taco (drug dealers and transvestites galore ) experience it was time for me to venture into unknown territory. After seeing Canters bumpers stickers around towne and a billboard near a favorite thrift shop it was a sure sign from God that I at least give Canters a shot.Walking in and seeing a Guns N Roses poster on the wall immediately struck a chord within me (this place is down for Rock N Roll). A bakerey with pastries galore is already a plus.. though let me continue.The nice server guided us to a large area of the resteraunt where we were sitted in a boothe known to be a favorite of Guns N Roses (there we go again!) where they were photographed some 25 years prior.Friendly service, cool decor and a menu with enough variety to please even the most bi-polared eater out there.. hmm so far Canters = RAD!Because of a strict diet I stayed away from a heavy meal and opted for a Greek Salad instead with a side of Fries. Before my meal could get to our table we were given a plate of PICKLES!!Ten short minutes later our food was brought over and much like I'd hoped for it was delicious. The friendly staff provided us with a Canters history lesson which made for an even more exicting experience and left a heavy impression on my whole entourage and I.Since then whenever that late night hunger creeps in and my stomach starts sounding like the cookie monster it's an instant run over to Canters.

Reviews.Author: Alexandria B.
Reviews.Content: Very good restaurantYummy sweets and great motzoball soup.Nice old school place :D

Reviews.Author: Beatriz S.
Reviews.Content: I got the turkey pastrami sandwich on rye bread. It was soo good!!! The coffee sucked...Our server (older lady) was good and attentive, but the cashier (young guy) was weird.

Reviews.Author: Lizette G.
Reviews.Content: Not so great.The service was not good at all.  The waitress rushed us, the pickles they served us before the meal tasted weird.  The food was not so great for a "historic deli." I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Author: LaCreatia W.
Reviews.Content: I love this place, though at times the service may be a bit slow. It has the "home town diner" feel even though it is in the heart of L.A. The food is amazing, kosher, probably the largest menu I have ever seen and you never know who you may run into after 2am=)  They also offer a wide variety of desserts (my fav). Oh and they have Thanksgiving dinner available everyday of the year!!!

Reviews.Author: Kristen E.
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here for years and drive all the way up from Orange County for a real sandwich. When I want a sandwich I always come here. I love there pastries and pastrami sandwich. It is soo HUGE and I always split it with my sister. The turkey sandwich is always good as well. ALWAYS get the bread toasted. Perfect place to come any hour.

Reviews.Author: Matan B.
Reviews.Content: the restaurant and food is amazing. best hot pastrami ever. But it is a little expensive compaired to other delis and i dont know if i came on a bad day but the waiter was kind of rude.

Reviews.Author: B S.
Reviews.Content: Decent pastrami, pickles and baked goods.  A classic!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth W.
Reviews.Content: Canter's - my favorite late night spot, this place is an institution. I love the old school decor, the older waitresses that look like they've been serving up food for decades (unlike models and actors the wait staff look like they take their careers seriously, lol). The menu is extensive. My faves are the classic matzo ball soup with bagel chips & the pastrami. The food is decent, solid food (not excellent, but I've never had a bad meal here) & I've consistently had friendly service. I've only been here late at night, so I can't say what the service is like during the day.

Reviews.Author: Trisha J.
Reviews.Content: I figured an establishment that had been open so long would be great...not so much! We ordered three different items (tuna salad, egg salad and beef dip) and each were tasteless. We figured the cheesecake would save the meal but we should have known better. My recommendation...skip Canter's.

Reviews.Author: Sean H.
Reviews.Content: Whenever I'm in L.A., I have to stop by Canters for their delicious rainbow bars--easy to find in NY, but challenging in Cali! Each time I bite into their chocolate-raspberry-marzipan lusciousness, I'm taken back to my childhood when Dad stopped on his way home to pick up a pink box of baked delights from this old gem of a deli. Great black-and-whites and top-notch rugelach, that'll make you want to slap your mama!

Reviews.Author: dom f.
Reviews.Content: I was visiting LA so I had lunch here simply because it has been featured in an episode of Entourage and Curb Your Enthusiasm. It turns out I got the wrong episode of Curb, as I thought it was from the one where the deli makes the Larry David sandwich which is really disgusting. That should have set sirens off in my head but I stayed.I'll cut to the chase, it isn't that great of a place. I ordered a burger and it was below par. It wasn't cooked very well and looks like something from a kebab shop.

Reviews.Author: Courtney M.
Reviews.Content: This is a late not hot spot in the restaurant, the bakery is packed during the day and the baked goods are delicious! (I used to work in the bakery 20 years ago - full disclosure) Always a star sighting and a hub of activity!

Reviews.Author: Brad M.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Canters many times over the years and the experience is usually the same.  The food is good but the prices are steep.  The parking is limited and decor is very dated.  However, all is this is not big deal. What bothers me about this place is the food servers range from below average to simply horrible.  The bakery is great and prices are decent here but the service at the bakery is HORRIBLE.  I'm sorry to say this but staff working here has been here for years (decades?) and are completely burnt out and basically rude.  Remember I have been here numerous times over the years so this review is not from a one time event.   The experience at the bakery sort of reminds me of the soup nazi skit from Seinfeld.   The exception is the staff at the deli counter is the exact opposite - very courteous.   My recommendation is get the food to go.  Be sure to double check everything in your order.   So I give this joint a 3 stars.  The food is good and its always open but the service is consistently piss poor.  When I go out and drop $50 on a meal the service is part of the experience for me so this usually dampers my Canters experience.

Reviews.Author: Ryan K.
Reviews.Content: Canter's is a good place for the money, but it won't blow your mind as far as quality of food. You're paying for an LA landmark/large version of a greasy spoon and for that, I love it. The people have always been nice when I go in there, though I have only been there for food, haven't made it to the Kibitz room for drinks yet.

Reviews.Author: Nael M.
Reviews.Content: Its not better than KATZ of NYC. For the price, I was not impressed.

Reviews.Author: Dominic D.
Reviews.Content: My favorite deli in LA.  Great Corned Beef and Rye. Matzo Ball Soup also a must order even if you don't like Matzo Ball soup.

Reviews.Author: Sammi-Jo S.
Reviews.Content: My friends LOVE this place. They've been before, but this was my first time. I understand that this place is famous, but as soon as I saw the prices on the menu I was disappointed (as a bit of reference, I wanted to go to Pink's).I finally chose the BBQ Beef dip and substituted onion rings for my fries. The onion rings were pretty good. My sandwich was standard for being priced $12.95. It was good... but not $13 good. After tax and tip (or something... not sure exactly how this all worked out) my total was nearly $18.Food was alright, and the service was quick... but definitely not worth the price.I recommend going for the glamor and the experience of eating somewhere Marilyn Monroe and Arthur Miller dined, but don't have high expectations.

Reviews.Author: James V.
Reviews.Content: Great selection and value. Came with a few hungry friends and we all left super satisfied.  The corn and roast beef sandwiches were awesome, wish I should of tried some of those bakery items and the pastrami..but not to worry, they're open 24 hours; will definitely be back sometime :)Service and wait time were good; all the fix-ens of a superb jewish deli.

Reviews.Author: Andrew G.
Reviews.Content: Where can you get an amazing rueben sandwich at two in the morning... RIGHT HERE!

Reviews.Author: K O.
Reviews.Content: Nothing exciting. Just straight up food. Huge menu. A safe choice at a random hour.

Reviews.Author: Dwayne W.
Reviews.Content: Great reuben. In fairness you can probably find a better sandwich at Greenblatt's or Art's, but neither of them are the LA institution that Canter's is. Open 24/7. Cool dive bar in the back. Good bakery in the front. Great spot.

Reviews.Author: M. S.
Reviews.Content: Don't forget to visit The Kibitz Room

Reviews.Author: sean f.
Reviews.Content: This is a definite "go-to" spot when I'm in the aera. Menu is huge as well as the portions that you order off it. Anyone who complains about the food simply doesn't get it. It's about the place and everything that comes with it. If you are looking for fine cuisine, don't go to a deli. If you are looking for a chill place to eat lots of cheap food and have a good conversation under and amazing lit ceiling, head here.

Reviews.Author: Joshua S.
Reviews.Content: It isn't the Stage, Ratners, Katz or even the Rascal House (RIP), but it is a dam good deli and the best one on the west coast. Nothing like it in the Bay Area. Good for star watching after last call.

Reviews.Author: Sara M.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Canters! Get anything with rye bread, potato pancakes, and egg cream. Mmmm! Open 24 hours and they are the home of the best pickles on earth. No joke.

Reviews.Author: David B.
Reviews.Content: Corned beef was nice and lean. Little old fashion and the bakery was e pensive

Reviews.Author: Nancy S.
Reviews.Content: Have been here many times.  Have to agree with most of these reviews...It's old and dingy and the food is ok but nothing as great as a few would like you to believe.  If you want to see the menu, don't bother to look a it here on Yelp because they really don't have THE menu.  Cantor's menu is huge...and all they mention here is a few items.  If you like soup, this is a good place to try it...but everything else is just so-so.  Pastrami /corned beef is not really thin sliced...it's rather thick, but you may like it that way and the sandwiches are very dry.  All but a few of the bakery items are very dry...if you like coconut, I recommend the coconut custard breakfast rolls.  This place needs Robert Irvine of Restaurant Impossible...

Reviews.Author: P B.
Reviews.Content: Horrible Service, VILE food - an 11 year old could have done a better job cooking.

Reviews.Author: Phil R.
Reviews.Content: they have herring herebut I'd go with the fish platethe food of the gods

Reviews.Author: Beanie C.
Reviews.Content: We usually get this food to go when we are going on a plane.  I'm not eating meat anymore, but I must say, when I was..these were the best damn pastrami sandwiches I had ever tasted.  We stuck to the same fare, 2 pastrami sandwiches, 2 diet dr. brown's cream soda and some cookies (I love the bakery)...We did however, go here at 1am one night cuz we were starving.  I had the matzoh ball soup and I thought it was just okay...But 5 stars for the pastrami..

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: Great pastrami on rye!!! Perfect heap of warm Pastrami on fresh rye. Also loved the garlicky pickles served  prior to the meals. We went at 5pm on a Saturday and parking was easy and free with validation and the crowd was small. Perfect ending to a day on Hollywood blvd and the El Capitan. The menu is huge and it looks like they have some good breakfast selections. Will be back very soon!!

Reviews.Author: Elena P.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so like Pink's Hot Dogs and Phillipe's, this place is an LA instituition. Go here to say that you have gone but don't go with high expectations. I will vouch for the pastrami. Delicious. The french fries aren't bad either. Haven't had the matzo ball soup. Fried chicken is so so. Coleslaw is alright. Service wasn't that great each time i've gone. The homemade pickles are awesome though, the best i've had. I will go back again because going makes me feel all LA cool and all that, plus they will fill your stomach for not too much money. Oh, i've had a few desserts/pastries from the bakery side and none were worth the money so don't bother. Also, be prepared with Febreze after your exit because YOU WILL smell like the place long after your leave.

Reviews.Author: lee w.
Reviews.Content: Been coming here since 1978...and will continue! Actually, food has always been as close to genuine NY deli food as LA has to offer but, as with all eateries, Canter's has suffered a bum rap over the years. There have beensome variable food quality issues over the years but I am happy to say that food and SERVICE has actually improved since many of the old-school waitstaff has either moved on or passed on!

Reviews.Author: Hannah M.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good, ate there like three times during my stay. Its a lil' dirty but if you can see past that, the food is good, hot - made to order - pickles are the best thing there.

Reviews.Author: Heather K.
