Reviews.Content: The very best pastrami - been ordering their pastrami plate for over 20 years!

Reviews.Author: Maria M.
Reviews.Content: I love Canter's, but not this one, the one in Las Vegas! We drove a great distance to have lunch here. It used to be great, but what a disappointment. I'm not a picky eater. Far from it. So if you are picky, don't even waste your time!Soups: we ordered bowl of chicken, cup of noodle, and cup of cabbage. All three tasteless. All left unfinished. Came without any bread OR crackers. You have to buy those for an extra charge. When they say cup of soup, they mean it. It's literally the size of a measuring cup, price - $5.95. I wouldn't mind paying $15 if it was good, but for this quality it took them a lot of nerve to charge $6. Bagel that we added to our soup was about 3" in diameter - not exactly the size you expect from a bakery/deli.Herring in cream sauce - sauce had way too much vinegar - almost hurtful to eat - unfinished. Mashed potatoes - I don't know how you can mess that up. Tasted like mashed potatoes out of the box. Couldn't eat more than 3 spoonfuls.Our friend ordered potato pancakes - so-so. Drinks: Tea - the cheapest teabag you can possibly find, cherry soda - factory made, so we were happy about that :)The only two tasty things were: potato salad (a very small scoop) and cookies, 3 pieces. The total for 3 people for LUNCH is $60 + tax + tip. Does it worth it? No way! We will be back to Canter's, but back home in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Stuart K.
Reviews.Content: Of course, the meals are good.  Nowadays though, I come for the bread and goodies in the front window.  The various loaves and marble cake are musts

Reviews.Author: Dave W.
Reviews.Content: I love it, ever since I moved here to LA.  The food is great, the decor is amazing, it's a landmark.  I love Scotty the bartender in the Kibitz room.  He's one of the coolest and friendliest people in nightlife.  My only issue is delivery is a bit pricey for what it is.  However, you can't turn down a great Corned Beef when you body craves it.

Reviews.Author: Andy S.
Reviews.Content: Went for first time last night, food was bland and overpriced.  Don't go unless you plan on getting a deli sandwich, their other offerings leave much to be desired.  Waiter was a jerk.  Won't be back.

Reviews.Author: mike b.
Reviews.Content: I love this place for the history. It's not all that clean but I turn a blind eye to it.

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: I love Canter's. I would make a special trip to L.A. (from San Francisco) for Canter's. It's the next best thing to going to a New York deli restaurant. The matzoh balls are firm and substantial, which I prefer to light, fluffy kind. The deli sandwiches are ample; the bakery treats are delicious (my favorites: black and white cookies and rugelach). The people-watching here is also entertaining. And I enjoy the servers, who in my experience have ranged from chatty to amiably crusty.

Reviews.Author: Katy P.
Reviews.Content: I love love LOVE Canter's!!!The food is amazing. I highly recommend the Matt Special. It's the most amazing thing you can put in your mouth. Yes, it's like $15. Get over it and split it with someone you love.And the wait staff has always been perfect. They have always been helpful, and they make great suggestions. Never a bad moment. Most waiters and waitresses I kinda feel sorry for, but I've always thought that the wait staff at Canter's were really cool, just because they work here. So why not five stars? Because a lot of their bakery stuff is...gross.I can't tell what's inside of their eclair. It tastes kind of sour and is the exact same color as Vaseline. It bears almost no resemblance to what you would expect inside of your eclair.The cheesecake has a funny texture.The frosting on the cheesecake is just regular frosting, not cream cheese frosting.What's so disappointing is that the food is absolutely amazing. I know that there are great cooks working behind the scenes to make this all happen. So I keep getting my hopes up, thinking that maybe "this time" the bakery stuff will be good too. But alas, you shouldn't really have to make your gross face when you bite into any baked good. What a crime.PS. It's not ALL gross. Their cookies are alright! Just skip all the regular dessert stuff and get yourself a baggie of cookies.

Reviews.Author: Leah B.
Reviews.Content: Best cheese bagels on earth, hands down!!  My great aunt and  uncle used to bring them to us when they would visit us in San Diego.  Finally discovered where they bought them today.  Will be back soon for more and maybe a bite in the restaurant.

Reviews.Author: larry g.
Reviews.Content: Saw a negative review on Canters and I had to refute post haste! This is an awesome place to stop in and have a corned beef on rye anytime. In fact anytime I'm on Fairfax it better be an important and urgent destination or else I'm going to stop into Canters for something tasty.  Love their potato salad too! give it a try.

Reviews.Author: Alex A.
Reviews.Content: LA staple!!!! Love this place. How many deli's can you go and have a screwdriver or a beer with reuben sammich? The staff is awesome food portions are huge. What more can you say.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan H.
Reviews.Content: Not the best food- but there open late, and always a good place for people watching... its a melting pot of Hollywood.

Reviews.Author: Tris M.
Reviews.Content: This place is lame. I am not a star-f'er so I don't care who eats here or who I may see. What I do care about is good food and good value. $6.55 for a large coffee and a bagel with cream cheese is ridiculous. No idea why people like this place.

Reviews.Author: CHARMIAN S.
Reviews.Content: I used to go here in the "old days" for after gig food at 2am and it was a fine, quirky place with great corned beef hash and eggs.I went to pick up some pastries,( sullen man who saw me and walked away pretending he had not seen me, finally returned and after he had ungraciously served me turned his back and mumbled the price, twice as I had to ask him again) and a coffee the other morning 11am. Everyone but the overworked waiter who graciously got me my to go coffee was unbelievably rude. I mean really rude. The last insult was when I asked if I could pay at one of the cash registers, as I had been shuttled around from counter to counter, the old bag replied mockingly (between gossiping with a co worker)  "This is a cash register isn't it" There are so many bakeries on Fairfax. There is no reason to go to Canters ever again!

Reviews.Author: Thomas C.
Reviews.Content: It's a staple.  open 24 hours a day. A Los Angeles landmark. Yes, YES. Start off with a plate of pickles... follow it up with potato pancakes or matzo ball soup... AH-MAZING. I get the DOWNTOWNER [WITH PASTRAMI] amazing. You can't forget to add the Russian dressing and Sweet&Hot Mustard. As you leave, you've gotta pick up some chocolate chip & apricot rugalas. I

Reviews.Author: Danny J.
Reviews.Content: Oy vey! What''s not to like? I've been patronizing Canter's since before my Bar Mitzvah. Love the Reuben. Love the Kibitz Room. Love the hard-as-nails waitresses. Don't be a chazzer!

Reviews.Author: Marina C.
Reviews.Content: A little overpriced. Not a bad restaurant, but the "waitresses" can be a little scary... and bearded. The pickles are quite delicious, but overall I've been to better Jewish delis.

Reviews.Author: It Takes Skill Z.
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! The pastrami and corned beef sandwich was off the chain!! The service is a bit slow but that's only because it's the same waiters and waitresses since the place opened(j/k), But really, this place is great! I would definately go back. Thanks to all at Canter's.

Reviews.Author: Mandarin Y.
Reviews.Content: Love this place for it's deli and restaurant food. I always have to order a matzo ball soup when I go. It's massive and it comes with a side of bagel chips. They carry typical diner/delicatessen fair such as pastrami sandwiches, rubens, chopped chicken liver, knishes, potato pancakes, etc. This place is huge and service can be a little slow at times but all in all it's a great casual place to hang with friends. I sometimes also pick up  a few apricot or cream cheese filled rugelachs.

Reviews.Author: Shawn B.
Reviews.Content: Here's the deal about Canters.It's a deli, you go there for a sandwich, not pasta or meatloaf. I've been reading the negative reviews and I think people don't get the point of a place like Canters.I'm 50 and can remember going there as a kid. It was the place we used to go to early in the morning after a great punk show in Hollywood. It's one of the first places I go to after living away from L.A. for a while. Guess what? I go there for a SANDWICH! I've been to the other deli's mentioned(tomatoe and lettuce on a corned beef on rye?) and I always go back to Canters.From NY? You probably won't like it. Want your places cool, trendy and sleek? You won't like it.The only changes I've seen to canters in many years is the removal of the pay phones at the tables. The last big decor change was in the 70's.It's a little dark, you will have to wait for a table often and the coffee IS pretty awfull. So don't get coffee, get an egg cream. Get a huge pastrami or corned beef on rye (be sure to get a side of the house dressing) get a big bowl of the beef and barly soup, and DON'T hit the bakery until you've eaten.Awesome pickles, my daughters favorite, great sandwiches, awesome potatoe salad and the bakery is a sugar junkies wet dream.Remeber also ther are different crowds here. Daytime you can relax, bring the kids. A lot of older local folk, a much quieter crowd. Night can be loud and full of the after club crowd so be prepared to wait and shout sometimes.BTW, this has become our place on Xmass day. After presents. a little nosh at Canters and then a movie or something. I think I hear my Irish Catholic ancestors spiining in their graves.

Reviews.Author: Matthew V.
Reviews.Content: When I worked at a day job in Miracle Mile, my coworkers loved to do birthday lunches here. But when time rolled around for mine, I'd request, "Please, no Canter's."  Even if one is an aficionado of deli food (I'm not), better can be had (Jerry's in Studio City). And parking here (or lack thereof) is almost comedic. The food is nursing-home bland and overpriced -- and some of it (like the onion rings I once sampled from a coworker's plate) is so greasy that it borders on inedible. I've have better onion rings at fast-food places in Middle America. The matzo ball soup is a salty, watery concoction with a diminutive, gloppy ball or two bobbing around and a hint of vegetable. And then there is the tortellini: Kraft mac 'n' cheese has more flavor (and less of a glue-like consistency). So even though I'm not much of a sandwich person, I learned after a few coworker outings to stick to the sandwich menu. Pity that whole grain bread usually isn't an option here.I'll admit that having been enticed by the bakery/dessert cases near the checkout area: some very yummy-looking pastry. I did buy a chocolate-chip cookie once, and it was rich and delicious. But then after the next Canter's luncheon I noticed two flies buzzing about inside a case above a row of coffee cake and strudel-like pastry, and I quickly lost interest in buying any more sugary wares.If my old employer had remained in the Miracle Mile location, some of my former coworkers would still be frequenting Canter's almost religiously. It definitely has a certain come-as-you-are ambience that has become rare in the La Brea/Fairfax corridor. And then there is the faded glamour of dining in a place that has seen its share of celebs (though you'd hardly know from the absence of any defining decor).

Reviews.Author: J M.
Reviews.Content: Yes good food but they make little effort to  make it or the restaurant anything special. Considering it's around the corner from Rodeo Drive amidst million dollar retail installations as well as the Bentleys and Ferraris, I was disappointed that they charge a Beverly Hills price in a place Jed Clampitt(of the Beverly Hillbillies) probably would still recognize. Noodle soup is just plain broth and noodles.  Sandwiches are delish but look lonely.   Chin Chkn Salad very plain. Advice: go when you are craving good deli and stick to the pastrami.  Don't bring anyone here unless you set their expectations properly.

Reviews.Author: tom e.
Reviews.Content: The Mister and I took Mom out to Canter's on Sunday.  Mom had the pastrami sand, the Mister had the philly cheese steak and I had a patty melt.  All were good.  We finished up with dessert:  Mom cherry pie ala mode, the Mister Cinnamon Nut Danish ala mode and me the apple streudel.  All were quite good.  The service was a bit spotty but passable.  Although Mom has lived in So Cal for nearly six decades she hadn't been ta Canter's before.  So it was a treat.I rarely get to the Fairfax district anymore so I would probably try other places before going back, but aI wouldn't fight it if someone else wants to hit of the deli.

Reviews.Author: P J.
Reviews.Content: This place has been around for over 80 years so it doesn't need much of an endorsement.  It's a legendary LA landmark and lives up to the hype.  Good food, large portions, always open.  Large menu, so plenty to choose from.  You won't leave hungry.  The prices are a little high, but cheaper than most of the other jewish style delis in LA.  You can get a dinner that includes the sides, drink, and dessert for under $20.  The waitstaff are usually quick and not the friendliest, but that's part of their charm.  As long as the food is good and it gets to you quickly, what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Author: Allie H.
Reviews.Content: Overrated and overpriced. I find most of the food to be bland, especially the stuffed potato. The strawberry cheesecake was downright offensive. Its convenient because its open 24 hours, but some of the late night servers are quite rude and rush us. I do love the pickles though!

Reviews.Author: Jim W.
Reviews.Content: I live far away from Canters but when in the neighborhood I buy stuff from the bakery, and have for many years.  One thing I regularly buy is almond horns.  I bought a couple of them earlier this week and was disappointed.  Almond horns are supposed to be made mostly with just almond paste, an expensive ingredient, and egg whites as the dough.  Canters has now substituted wheat flour for most of the almond paste, and the product is no good anymore.  It's so bad that the second of my two almond horns remains uneaten.  (Usually it would have been gone the same day.) One other thing:  Rather than posting a derogatory review online, I thought I would be nice, and phone the owners to let them know of my concern about the quality.  When I asked for the owner, I was told, "She doesn't come to the phone."  What a way to run a business!

Reviews.Author: Jesse O.
Reviews.Content: Horrible food, slow service and an incredibly mean cashier. I didn't think you could really screw up fried chicken or apple pie, but somehow they did. Even at 3am this diner wouldn't be worth it.

Reviews.Author: Barry T.
Reviews.Content: Classic NY Deli fare

Reviews.Author: Lisa L.
Reviews.Content: # 50 was saved for an oldie but a goodie.. you walk in and are greeted by the lovely smell of pasteries to your left and the deli case on the right. its my favorite pastrami sandwich in so cal.. cant wait to go back soon ;D

Reviews.Author: Nancy Y.
Reviews.Content: I had the pastrami sandwich, quite plain.  Not much too it. The Hat in Alhambra or in Pasadena is a jillion times better.  It had a decent stack of pastrami on regular slices of oval loaf type of bread, but the sandwich is small for $11.  No sides, if it wasn't for the pickles that they had on the table comp, it would have totally been not worthwhile.  I asked if there was a dip or anything and the waiter said no, just mustard and that's the way they make it.  I had the matzo ball soup here a while back and the matzo ball was like tasteless white bread dunked into clear chicken broth.  My friends had the tuna melt and the turkey sandwich, both $10. For some reason, their sandwiches came with cold slaw on the side.  Both of them only ate half of their sandwiches.  My friend and I agreed that the floor is slipperly in certain spots.  I wouldn't come back here - this is a historical LA restaurant with mediocre food, outdated interior and updated prices.  Open 24/7.

Reviews.Author: Alan S.
Reviews.Content: It's 2013 in trend-setting, Southern California, Canter's.  You really ought to incorporate more vegan options into your menu already.  --And the following boastful statements of animals being used in your menu items is just plain sad: "Over the years Canter's has sold over: 2 Million Pounds of Lox, 10 Million Pounds of Corned Beef, 7 Million Pounds of Pastrami, 24 Million Bowls of Chicken Soup."  --It feels like I'm reading obituaries on your website.

Reviews.Author: Anastasia A.
Reviews.Content: canters is my secret favorite happy hour spot!! not so much canters, as the kibitz room in the back. the bartenders are super nice and attentive and give you tasty chips and salsa as soon as you sit down. the drinks are strong and the shots are huge! also they have happy hour food that's super delicious as well.

Reviews.Author: sarah p.
Reviews.Content: I don't get it.  It's not that I don't enjoy a good triple decker pastrami on rye, it's that I don't enjoy a bad one.  The food is OK at best and the wonderful exceptions are mostly behind the bakery case.  Although, yes, last cold and flu season I carried out five delicious matzo ball soups in four days... and nearly declared bankruptcy.  But why anyone would want to eat a regular meal of Canter's food under premeditated circumstances is beyond me.  It smells like stale dishrags and the prices are outrageous!   A tuna sandwich is like ten dollars and I mean tuna + mayo + bread + plate.  No side dishes, no tomatoes.  I don't even remember lettuce included in the initial quote, although apparently a random human hair was.  Oh, they're a Hollywood landmark, you say?  Well, c'mon, so is the mall.  They're open all hours?  So is the frozen food aisle at Ralph's.  Frozen foods don't sound so appealing?  Then, please remind me, why did you just pull into the valet line at Canters?

Reviews.Author: Valerie M.
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Ok, well it's like this. Back in the day you'd go to Canter's for a very late night snack after a night of partying or club going or watching Fear or The Plimsouls sing their little hearts out. You went for the experience that is Canter's. The psychedelic stomach turing plastic ceiling, the nauseating flourescent lighting, but mostly for the people. There was a drunken energy that filled that place up by 3:00 am that was unlike anything I'd ever experienced (except for White Castle at 3:00 am, but I digress). I remember my friends and I giggling over the site of a large cockroach crawling amongst the rugaleh in the bakery case while we waited on line. Once I grew up and stopped eating my french fries dipped in overly salty brown gravy in a pot induced stooper I wandered elsewhere and discovered the awful truth about Canters. The food is really pretty darn disgusting. I could not believe what matzo ball soup was actually supposed to be like until I tried it at Jerry's deli. You mean it's supposed to have chicken and yummy noodles and warm soft carrots in it?? And the matzo ball itself wouldn't double as a softball in a pinch? Wow - eye opening. Still, I'd give this 2 1/2 stars just because it's Canter's and it's an institution and some of my best memories are right there. But if you ever want to try really good matzo ball soup -- take out a second on your house and head on over to Jerry's.

Reviews.Author: Abe G.
Reviews.Content: delicious sanwiches but expensive. came here with the family and spent a total of $73 for 2 pastrami sanwich combos and a grilled cheese. really old fashion joint, probably dating back to the 80's, takes both cash and credit..:)

Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: i have yet to try a legitimate meal here, but what i can tell you is that i ordered about half the bakery, pointing to every and all of the chocolate smothered, fruit-filled, with-icing-on-top treat and it was less than $5. cha ching.

Reviews.Author: Stefano Y.
Reviews.Content: Went to Canter's for the first time after a show at House of Blues Foundation Room and devoured a brisket sandwich.  So glad to find a late-night eatery after a year living in this city.  But I'll subtract a star for... location.  A place like this needs to be spitting distance from the Hollywood music venues, but it isn't.  It's not really Canter's fault that everything is so sprawled in this town, but I couldn't find the Yelp page for "City of Los Angeles" so...

Reviews.Author: Michael G.
Reviews.Content: is it just me or does this place get more and more expensive? regardless this place is a landmark and there's nothing better than stopping buy for a meal and maybe a cup of coffee after a long night of fun. great corned-beef and beef-dipped sandwiches and pretty decent breakfasts. tried my first and last cup of matzo ball soup here and was very disappointed but realized it may just be that i generally don't like matzo ball soup. i would pick this place over denny's at 3 am every time.

Reviews.Author: Roberta B.
Reviews.Content: Canter's has been around much longer than I, and if it ever closes down, I will be very sad.  The Brooklyn Avenue is to die for, and the breakfasts are really good, too.  The pickles are the best, as is the rye bread.  Some of the servers are rude, but I usually ignore it, because the food is worth it.  The dinners have never been very good.  I've never ordered one, but I've heard.  I would stick with the corned beef, pastrami, pickles or breakfast special, and you'll have a great meal.  Oh, the potato salad is really good, too.

Reviews.Author: Audrey F.
Reviews.Content: My complaint has nothing to do with the food or the waitress that served me, but really only the lady at the register. She was an older lady who was giving me attitude regarding splitting a check. We were upfront upon approaching the register in saying that we needed to split our check three ways, I was just about ready to tell her how we would like to split it, and she cuts me off. She was very rude about everything. I feel like most restaurants should be accustomed and used to splitting checks, and really, our situation was not difficult. Especially at an established LA restaurant like Canters you would think that splitting checks wouldn't be that difficult. I would also like to emphasize that I was not being rude or condescending. The entire time she didn't seem like she wanted to deal with me and even when I tried to make it easier for her, she gave me lip. Sorry if you had a bad day lady, but you really don't have to let it out on me.

Reviews.Author: Janet T.
Reviews.Content: Canters may have been a hit back in the day but I'm not so sure nowadays. The only cool thing is that it's located right next to Animal, which is pretty awesome. It's a pretty old restaurant that could use some updating. This place reminds me of Jerry's but older but the foods pretty similar in style. The bf and I decided to stop into Canters to grab a quick pastrami sandwich before our show. I ordered the french dip which came with a side of fries while the bf ordered their famous pastrami sandwich on rye. My french dip was so dry that I only ate 1/4 of the massive sandwich and passed it to my bf to box for his lunch the next day. His pastrami sandwich was really moist and delicious. I'm not really sure what sets canters apart from all the other deli's around town but the only thing I'd come here again for are their french raspberry cookies which were good but more on the expensive side.

Reviews.Author: Joanne S.
Reviews.Content: oh, this matzo ball soup is so good.

Reviews.Author: John K.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this place is allowed to be as dirty as it is. I walked in, sat down, stood up and left. Let's start with the floor. It was greasy. My foot could not get a firm grip and stay in one place while seated. There was visible schmutz and debris all over the place -  stuffed into the seat too. I guess that is where I need to end too because I left before I ordered. Really gross.

Reviews.Author: Jin Y.
Reviews.Content: pastrami reuben FTW. corned beef reuben FTW. potato pancakes FTW. racetrack cake FTW. cream cheese to go FTW. bagels galore FTW.

Reviews.Author: Aaron I.
Reviews.Content: late nite jewish deli, mmmmmmmm!

Reviews.Author: christopher George s.
Reviews.Content: this place needs to grow a pair.

Reviews.Author: Pam R.
Reviews.Content: how is this place still open? my pastrami sandwich was super dry and the pickle they gave me was VERY old :(

Reviews.Author: Kristine C.
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of Canter's, I knew we needed to go. Took the family - two teenage boys and the hubby. Hubby ordered a Philly cheese steak and said it was delicious - cheese was perfectly melted and had a ton of steak. Oldest son ordered a double cheeseburger. He used many napkins to keep the condiments from staining his clothes. Youngest son had the tradional Thanksgiving dinner and was disappointed. The meat was as thin as a deli sandwich and didn't have any flavor. The slimy, watery potatoes were out of a box and the stuffing was too spicy. I ordered the turkey sandwich. It was good, but the meat was a bit bland and it was the same meat used in my son's dinner. Pros: A ton of food and great service. My sons like to ask the wait staff how long they have worked for the restaurant. Our waitress has worked at Canter's for 30 years. My son had a vanilla shake that was to die for! It was the best he said he had ever had. Parking was great - didn't cost a thing. Cons: Fake potatoes, bland turkey. A typical dinner for four cost $97.

Reviews.Author: Marilyn V.
Reviews.Content: Visited last night and had a fabulous server, fast and helpful. Wish I could say the same for the row over I heard many complaints coming from that section the gal finally exclaimed "can we just order already, we've been waiting :30 minutes to order" oops! I found the atmosphere and service pleasant.  As a baker I have to say the baked good are definitely a work of art, such a large variety, and so much talent packed into the offering!  We started with a few cocktails and the Mac n' Cheese the bread that complemented our side was delicious and so was the mac after that and our pickles we already felt fairly full.  I personally found the pickles a bit odd, I appreciate the work that is put into them but they had a very distinct canned bamboo shoots smell and slight taste, weird but not bad at all.  We also shared some pickled herring which was good.  I ordered the sunrise burger medium and received a well done burger and a very over cooked egg, our waitress replaced the burger seamlessly, great service.  I was surprised the egg was still well cooked, being a sunrise I did expect a loose egg but the burger was moist and quite tasty and cooked correctly, glad I sent the first one back.  My husband ordered the tongue and found it tasty but the sides seemed to be a after thought that clearly tasted like boxed mashed and canned corn. The menu was quite extensive and we felt that might be part of the undoing of the quality, when you do so much it's difficult to do everything well.  I would definitely revisit, given the opportunity and was not dissatisfied.  We both left quite full with 1/2 of our entree's left over for lunch today :)  Took some black and whites for the kids sure they're going to love them, I took the chocolate pastry for breakfast today, i found it delightful but a bit dry, but it was not bad just a personal preference.  Thank you for the great experience!

Reviews.Author: Marisa T.
Reviews.Content: nice place to eat late with lots of l.a. history. the old lady waitresses are cute too, like the one from scotland. beautiful deli & bakery!

Reviews.Author: Jack M.
Reviews.Content: Spectacular!Love vern the waitress

Reviews.Author: Dave Y.
Reviews.Content: a fun jewish deli that's an LA landmark. it is a fun experience coming here. the food is ok, i'd give the food probably 3-4 stars. i had a really good reuben here tho, just as i should. it's a bit pricey, and it doesn't at all compare to the other big city famous jewish deli, katz's in nyc. but it's still a pretty cool place. and i'd come here over any jerry's in a heart beat (hate jerry's). for some reason, it's more ok for this place to charge more $ but not jerry's... if you're looking for cheap nasty eats or just a place to go after you go clubbing or something, go to denny's or worms...i mean norms, instead. don't be a cultural philistine by badmouthing places like this or the pantry

Reviews.Author: Ryan T.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were starving from driving all day from the SF Bay Area, and were ready to scarf down some major grub. So glad to have Canter's as the answer to my hunger. So my friend ordered a half sandwich and soup, oh I'm not wanting to guess the meat but I think it was salami on rye, with potato salad, and vegetable soup, which came with the nice touch of some bagel chips. Wow, that was a mighty high pile of meat given on the plate! For my meal I had a lox and onion omelet with potatoes, served with a bagel. I thought the potatoes were very different in that they had been sliced very thinly, then griddled until the pieces directly on the grill were rather crisp, but the remainder were cooked but still on the soft side. A bit saltier omelet than I expected--perhaps the eggs should have been undersalted to compensate for the saltiness of the lox? And my, what mighty pickles they have, with a flavor profile that really sings, unlike the crass commercial preparations off grocery store shelves most people experience--that's what you get for made-on-the-premises items. We were too sated to try the bakery items. Perhaps this calls for yet another visit. If you're a deli aficionado, look no further.

Reviews.Author: Kristin S.
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I love Canter's.  THE BEST matzo ball soup I have ever had in my life. Its actually the best chicken soup I've ever had in my life.  The chocolate rugelah are also amazing.  GO!  Check it out!

Reviews.Author: Sandra S.
Reviews.Content: this is one of my all time favorite places. it seems like it's always like 2am and i'm half awake when i walk into this place so the menu is always so damn overwhelming, but it's def something to appreciate. the old school decor is something special and the bakery is to diiiiiieee for. half the time the bakery is what i come for, okay 3/4 of the time. i mean hey i just came from 4 hours of hip jivin' bootey bumpin' on the dance floor and i've gotta refuel! black and white cookies all the way, napoleans are amazing. i had my first one when i was like 5. been hooked ever since. i can't say i've ever gotten anything i didn't love. and i do mean love. they're only closed one day a year and they're open 24 hours a day. so anytime you're hard up for some pastries or matzo ball soup, get you're buns down to this place.

Reviews.Author: Taylor R.
Reviews.Content: this place makes me want to shoot myself (not literally) its so awful! i could die! (again not literally)

Reviews.Author: Marc H.
Reviews.Content: What can one say about Canter's? It is, along with Nate and Al's, the best deli on the West Coast. Everything about it is stellar: the enormous pastrami, tongue and corned beef sandwiches, the great French fries, the thick, meaty soups, the pickles, the desserts. (Canter's has its own bakery and you can buy fantastic coffee cakes, cookies, danishes, etc.) Not the least of its virtues is its funky, Jewish, old-time atmosphere. When we're in L.A. the first thing we always do is to go to Canter's. By the way, it's a good place to see movie stars: we've seen Pamela Anderson and Howard Morris there. If you're in L.A. don't miss it!

Reviews.Author: Shelley H.
Reviews.Content: while this place definitely has a unique funky fun ambiance, i realized that the food here is not very good if you're sober.  i had the corned beef which was actually not too bad.  but my sister's brisket was really dry.  and her latke was not too flavorfull.  the service was very friendly and considerate and it was still fun and huge portions.  but it just didn't taste very good.

Reviews.Author: B. Stuart W.
Reviews.Content: This was my first time meal at Canter's Deli, my former better half, Cindy, treated.  Parking was an issue, as the lot was full, and we had to drive around a bit before we could find a place .  This must be normal, as the deli  had only half it's tables occupied when we arrived.  We got the potato pancakes as starters.  I ordered the corned beef sandwich, Cindy ordered the pastrami sandwich.  We tasted each other's order and, though I liked the corned beef, I agreed, that the Pastrami was the tastier dish - both came with delicious potato salad.  The food was absolutely excellent, as was the service.  In fact, perhaps because of where we were sitting, the waiter seemed to know what we wanted, as we discussed it.  (Either this is excellent service, or  we were mistaken for food critics).  Bottom line, the service and the meal was excellent, but the prices were high.  Potato pancakes were $7 for three or $9 for six. (We got six and took two home) I got the 1/2 sandwich, soup and potato salad.  Cindy chose the Pastrami sandwich and a side of , what she considered, delicious pickles.  I did not upgrade the soup to matzo as it seemed prohibitively expensive.  My only other authentic deli experience was at Izzy's in Santa Monica, where the food seemed as good and I remember the prices seeming more reasonable.  Thank you, Cindy.

Reviews.Author: F S C.
Reviews.Content: Something changed here.  Service isn't the same.  Menu isn't the same.  It isn't the same place I used to go to.

Reviews.Author: Max M.
Reviews.Content: Apparently there's a rule somewhere that says if you're going to open a deli in Los Angeles, sandwiches have to cost $13. To hell with that. The whole point of corned beef is that it's cheap beef cooked enough so you can't tell you're poor. Kishka? Knishes? These are table scrapings turned into entrees by enterprising Jews. So let's not kid ourselves that delis are fine dining. Tell Jerry's and Art's to kiss your ass, you're not paying that much money for what they've got. Canter's is still too high, but it's closer to what it should be. You can get a huge sandwich for about ten bucks, and a bowl of chicken soup with noodles, kreplach, rice, and a matzo ball will only set you back five bucks. When you need an emergency dose of Jewish penicillin, Canters hits the spot. They also have a great pastry and dessert counter at the front that is worth its weight in poppy seed. Average price for two people tends to be around twenty to twenty five bucks.

Reviews.Author: Roman I.
Reviews.Content: One of the few Jewish Deli's I have been to, no complaints here.

Reviews.Author: Linda D.
Reviews.Content: I have the flu and my friend brought me some chicken noodle soup from Canter's. Unfortunately he didn't realize that $13 didn't actually get you chicken in the soup; just broth and noodles. $2 more for chicken. Weak. I ordered from Greenblatts the next day and got awesome soup with chicken and vegetables. Never again will I order from Canters.

Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: Pastrami piled mile high, free pickles, deli mustard and the best potato salad on the planet.  Now this is heaven.

Reviews.Author: Damir T.
Reviews.Content: Food was Bad i had better pastrami sandwich at the mexican restaurant which is embarrassing for a jewish deli if you ask me i hope they close this place down soon my 2 friends had Eggs and on two separate plates they found egg Shells ?????...Service was Bad...and they overcharged us we didn't figure it out until we got to the cash register.

Reviews.Author: Connor J.
Reviews.Content: The food is very bland and usually badly prepared.  The service is slow and uncaring.  I've been to delis all over LA and NYC, but this place lacks the charm or food.

Reviews.Author: dae m.
Reviews.Content: where r u gonna find a place that serves salami and eggs? exactly! and hey least it ain't denny's right?

Reviews.Author: sarah i.
Reviews.Content: i don't know if i believe in paying $7 for a fist-sized matzo ball in chicken broth. but i did it anyway.

Reviews.Author: june l.
Reviews.Content: ahhh, canter's... one of my favorite places to sober up.  the servers are of the "been there done that variety" and that's why they don't mind when you fall out of a booth or accidently fall asleep in your ranch dressing.

Reviews.Author: Arthur F.
Reviews.Content: I've lived in L.A. for eight years now and had never been to canters, wtf was i thinking right?? first of all this place really makes you feel like you are in an old deli, its nice to get away in a place like that in L.A., luckily i had gotten laid the same morning i strolled into here for lunch, also canters was a drunken choice of somewhere to get lunch the night before, and i followed through, YAY FOR ME! okay so i never had pastrami before other than at oki dog, but i got the "reuben" and the onion rings and the lady got pastrami and motza ball soup, all phenominal, i will be back until i die i will prob eat here a million times this place effin rules and i gave it 5 stars free refills promptly of diet coke i loved it, and don't ask what the noise is in the back the waitresses are sick of telling you a holes, its the god damn bread maker in the back, yeah that shits fresh as fuck, APPRECIATE THAT!

Reviews.Author: Ken D.
Reviews.Content: much love for canters! the food and portions are always amazing! prices rule and its always a shit show at two in the morning on a weekend! its fun and yummy what more could you ask for! its goddamn legendary!

Reviews.Author: Zoe W.
Reviews.Content: Canter's, I feel an obligation to say positive things about this place because A) I was raised Jewish B) I grew up living a walk away from here C) It's a Los Angeles tradition/staple, yet all these things combined, I still have a general disliking for the place.  I certainly understand I must be one of the few that feel this way based upon the yelp reviews but ever since I saw a news report cracking down on restaurants in LA for health code violations and etc (with a feature on CANTER'S, by the way) I have not gone back since.  They showed rotting fruit in the kitchen and roaches on the floor and although apparently they had fixed all the problems, I have never wanted to go back.  The food, although with a great selection of traditional deli foods are all very mediocre in taste.  I feel that if you are in LA, it is very easy to find a myriad of other similar places (along Pico/Olympic/Fairfax) with the same items with the pleasure of knowing the food is fresh and hygienic.

Reviews.Author: F P.
Reviews.Content: Best pastrami on the West Coast, excellent service always many returns should learn from this place, when I come to LA, I love coming here...and I do...

Reviews.Author: Caroline W.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Canter's at least 6 times in my life. Whenever my family and I are in the area, we always make a point of trying to go there. I'm trying to stay away from red meat and Canters' turkey burger is the best I've had. Barney's in Los Angeles is a far second. I've been to a lot of other places and ordered the turkey burger just to compare it to Canter's and none come close. They all taste like sausage.

Reviews.Author: LA E.
Reviews.Content: This review is for the cookies. I tried several this evening. All dreadful. Some tasted salted. Others tasted like a dash of lipstick with flour. These make the average synagogue parve assortment seem appealing.

Reviews.Author: L J.
Reviews.Content: The chicken noodle soup is great for a cold and the roast beef sandwich is hearty.  It's open 24 hours and has a bakery and deli.  There are too many treats to name, but I like to come here and browse all the cookies and sweet treats.

Reviews.Author: Dalia M.
Reviews.Content: I've only done take out here...twice in two days. I don't live in LA but a local (born and raised 40 year old) recommended this place to us for 1. Thanksgiving desserts to-go and 2. Pastrami with brown mustard on rye. Now, I don't really eat pastrami and I tend to HATE mustard, but OY VEY, this is unbelievable. I'm not kidding when I say I am craving this within hours of having eaten it already. I'm debating to see if they can ship some up to SF so we can enjoy it. We didn't sit down so I can't comment on the table service but the people at both the dessert counter and sandwich counter were cordial and fast. The only downfall here is the prices. I couldn't believe that two sandwiches (with nothing but pastrami and mustard on them) and two small water bottles were 26$. Definitely overpriced for a sandwich, and this wasn't a big one either. So that's why it loses it's star. But if you like pastrami, which I have discovered I do then go eat one of these cuz they are to die for. I had another sandiwich from here and it was okay so the stars off are for the ok sandwich and the prices.

Reviews.Author: Alison W.
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get a groupon for this place - just another reason to try this place. And I happened to be in the area during a weeknight so I tried it out. Small parking lot at the corner with an attendant. It wasn't full and there was an hour and half free parking with validation from the restaurant. Walked in and there's a bakery up front - more on that later. The place is old with the brown pleather seats and the linoleum tables - vintage old, not dirty old. But I feel like they could use an upgrade. The prettiest thing in the place is the stained glass they have for the ceiling and the part of the partitions. The design is red, gold, orange leaves like for fall. Anyways, we were seated quickly and a busboy immediately brought us silverware and the waitress brought out water. I had perused the menu earlier online so we were ready to order right then and there, within a minute of sitting down. We got the matzo ball soup and the Canter's Fairfax to share. The food came out pretty fast. In a minute, the soup arrived at our table. Just a bowl of chicken broth and a giant matzo ball - the size of a baseball. If matzo meal is supposed to be just matzo crackers, it tastes better darn good. Some of that chicken broth flavor is integrated into the ball. Our sandwich came out about 5 minutes later. It was so thick with corned beef and pastrami, I could barely fit it into my mouth. It was also very messy to eat. But in a good way - it wasn't too saucy or wet, pieces of meat fell out of the sandwich. I know they set the standard for pastrami here, but I have to say I preferred the corned beef over the pastrami. There seemed to be more corned beef and it wasn't overly salty. The pastrami had a sort of pepper rub on the outer edges of the meat that turned me off a bit.  Gotto have it with those delicious pickles too. Only 3 came on our plate so I'm not sure if you just ask to get more or not.  But overall, half the soup and half a sandwich were delicious and completely filling. Wasn't completely shocked by the prices this time as I frequented a deli in NYC a couple months before. But wow, Subway prices it is not. Stopped by the bakery portion of the restaurant on my way out and picked up one of those large black and white cookies ($2.50) for dessert. Way sweet so also good to share with a large cup of milk.

Reviews.Author: Drew B.
Reviews.Content: Wife and went to Lunch at Canter's using a $10 off Groupon. The place is getting tired. Sat in the side dining room. Hostess sat us at a table right at the end of the stairs (ie major traffic) maybe so she didn't have to walk very far. Asked if we could have one of the many booths that were open. That request was not met with a smile and no problem. Waiter said he would be right with us, nice check in. Ordered two pastami sandwiched and well done fries. Although the sandwiches are good, they are very small for $11. My wife noticed the menu said "one too little, two too much, order one and a half". Sounds like they know the sadwiches are small and won't fill you up. Fries were cooked well done but they were pretty greasey. The server was fast and no nonesense. I wouldn't go back anytime soon even with a discount. Now the bakery is a different story and wonderful to look at. Free parking in the lot if it's not full.

Reviews.Author: Alex V.
Reviews.Content: It's late, there's a huge line at Swingers, and none of the cool eateries in LA are open, you're surely not going to Mel's because let's be honest that place sucks worse than it's shit location and shithead clientele. So hey let's go to Canters, I remember that place being pretty good and it's huge so for sure there won't be a wait. Or wait, is there not a wait because the prices are ridiculously high for what you get? hum that might be it. Anyways, the plus is there's probably never a wait no matter what time it is, and they have a whole bunch of stuff on the menu, most of which you'd never eat or never want to eat for that matter, well unless you're jewish then it's probably legit. The staff is something out of a Steven King movie, some being nice and some just being rude, old and withered away at all angles. One good thing did come out of this late night adventure, the guy in the bakery gave me a free pastry as I only wanted one. he asked what I was going to do with it. Eat it of course. So he just handed it over. Now that I enjoyed. The rye bread though the sandwich came on was nasty and I'm not a big fan of pickles although if you're into that, you really will love this place. next time I'll just stick with waiting in the line at Swingers.

Reviews.Author: Josh W.
Reviews.Content: As far as deli's, this is as good as it gets in my opinion. I have been to Jerry's in L.A. and to a couple of places in NY.  Canter's definitely rates up there with them.  It is pricey, but this is a classic case of "you get what you pay for." Sandwiches are HUGE, meat is LEAN, we always leave STUFFED. The service is good too, and they always pay some attention to our daughter. My favorite here is the pastrami and corned beef sandwich. Their pastrami is lean and delicious. It blends well in my mouth with their corned beef and some swiss cheese. At the one in Vegas, they even add coleslaw in the sandwich which makes it all the better.  My wife always gets the lox plate, which comes with 2 bagels, tons of smoked salmon, a hunk of cream cheese, and onion and tomato. We always leave full, but we can't resist the dessert counter on the way out the door. As I said, my wallet may not care too much for this place(we usually spend around $50 for us and the kid), but the rest of us do, which is why we are loyal customers.

Reviews.Author: Lorraine K.
Reviews.Content: It is always amusing to see the one stars and the whining.  I feel sorry for the people who just don't get this place.  It is THE BEST!  Please, go to your trendy little fru fru places and whine there.

Reviews.Author: Bridget V.
Reviews.Content: It's always fun to go to a landmark restaurant, especially one that you have heard about for years.  Fiancé and I went here after hours of looking for a restaurant (we are picky), and after a minor car accident (hit and run, gotta love Sunset).  We drove past this place and decided to try it.  Yummy but pricey.  Fiancé had a corned beef sandwich with fries and a coke.  I had a beef dip (my favorite) with fries and a cherry phosphate (always wanted to try one).  I loved my sandwich, especially with the mustard.  Fiancé's sandwich was yummy too.  My cherry phosphate was interesting, a bit like cherry 7up.  All of that plus pickles came to $40, however, I think it was worth it.  Nice, decent food.  It takes forever to order from the menu though.  There are just so many choices.  We wanted to know what some of the Jewish items like Kishka were.  When we left, I was thinking about getting some yummy items at the bakery counter, but could not decide.  I couldn't even decide when they put out a plate of samples, that were very good.  I hope I get to come back here and try some of the other yummy food.

Reviews.Author: jen m.
Reviews.Content: canter's is an LA legend. it's open 24 hours a day and been around for ages. sadly i just can't get into the food that much. i suppose it you are a big jewish deli fan then it's great. but i look for more in a diner type place. they have really yummy black and white cookies though. i'll give it that. and the atmosphere takes you right back to the 70s. it's not the best looking but it's awesome in it's own kitchy way.

Reviews.Author: Lionel T.
Reviews.Content: Took out-of-towners for breakfast.  Food was tasty, if a little over-priced.  Service was good.  I don't know - people rave about Canter's, but you can definitely find better breakfast in LA.

Reviews.Author: Ric A.
Reviews.Content: seated very quickly since it was a sunday night.  i was set on eating breakfast for dinner & settled on the spanish omelette.  but i had to call an audible after i asked our waiter what made up the omelette since i couldn't eat pork or any red meat.  his sarcastic, dry, & witty remark was "you dont wanna order that. go to a mexican restaurant if you wanna eat that."  he didn't look too happy to be working there nor did he care that he was serving us, never breaking a smile.  after feeling embarrassed, i abandoned my quest for omelette & ordered the chicken milanese.  then a plate of pickles were brought to our table.  a few minutes later our food came out.  the chicken milanese was actually delicious.  i got 2 very generous pieces that were accompanied with a side of both salad & fries.  despite the waiter's earlier comment/attempt at being funny, his service was great.  he left us a pitcher of water which i didn't mind since our glasses were the size of shotglasses, & we were never short on ranch!  he came by about 3-4 times to ask if we needed anything else.overall, it was a good experience. the food was great, the venue has a real diner feel to it, & they have their own parking lot which they validate.  the menu might seem a bit overwhelming.  it looks like the cheat sheets you used to make in college.  a bunch of information/words crammed into a small paper with no regard for space.  i didn't even get a chance to look at the back side!  but that just means there is a TON of food selection to choose from!my 1st official review!

Reviews.Author: Wendy G.
Reviews.Content: Well I have been here two times with two different experiences... first time I would have given them a four... I was in and out of there and I received a massive pastrami sandwich with a delicious dill on the side all for the reasonable price of 10 bucks and some change... second time I decided to eat in... this time I gave them a two; perhaps it was because I went on a slow day and late in the afternoon, but service wasn't all that and neither was the food... my waiter looked like he had just been hired off of a "Homeboy Industries" job program (No offense to anyone!!)so you can imagine the type of abysmal service I'm referring to! Honestly speaking you can never go wrong with a good pastrami sandwich there but sadly I opted out for something more "homely" plate... I got the thanksgiving dinner!!! which I do not recommend! The cranberry sauce looked like it had just been squished out of a can and the turkey was so dry and cold I just didn't bother to take more than three bites, however I did enjoy the tasty gravy!! my brother who went for the safer plate ended up eating the turkey I had left along with the cranberry sauce... his remarks; bro: "Man! I don't know what you're talking about but that was good!!... why do you have to be so picky!"...me:"thank god I have a brother without taste buds!!"

Reviews.Author: B T.
Reviews.Content: food delicious, pastrami, potato pancakes to die for.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany R.
Reviews.Content: I always get the Mishmosh when I come here. It's the regular matzo ball soup with Kreplach, rice, and noodles. I add chicken and carrots to it as well. The bagel chips make it for me, I'd eat them every day of the week. I have never cared for the pickles much, they are usually a bit rubbery for my taste. I've always had very nice service from the servers here. I love the bakery as well. Stay away from the walnut brownies, I've had them on two different occasions, and they taste like cardboard, but maybe that is the price I pay for ordering something like that at a place like this. Everything else in the bakery is tasty, especially the black and white. I'm still a little puzzled by the phone jacks at the tables. Maybe I'll bring in an old 1960's looking phone one night and see if it works. And the ceiling? Some hipsters with too much disposable income would probably pay a lot of money to have something like that installed in their place.

Reviews.Author: Karney V.
Reviews.Content: Came here late night and it was not as good as I had expected.

Reviews.Author: Arianne K.
Reviews.Content: i had to meet a friend to invest in his biz but found myself needing to pee......as good a time as any to check this place out i thought.....feasted my eyes on their extensive bake goods going in and came out with a bag full of Jewish cookies........mmmmmm

Reviews.Author: Peter P.
Reviews.Content: place reminded me of the Seinfield diner haha. Got some good jazz and rock n roll playing live in the back. My waitress was pretty nice. The pastrami and corn beef is good.

Reviews.Author: K M.
Reviews.Content: i think its a little expensive for what it is. but it is a legendary place that has fed legendary people, so i guess its  worth it. i always get the 1/2 sandwich(corned beef piled high w/ coleslaw) and a cup of the chicken krepla soup. mmmm...and the jello is amazing!! i have also had the rueben (amazing but i think it took 2 years off my life) and the stuffed cabbage. the mini black and white cookies are my downfall. they are sooo good.

Reviews.Author: NYSD G.
Reviews.Content: when leaving for monterey at 4 in the morning we were wondering what to eat for breakfast and we decided on bagels. one small problem none of the bagel places in our area would be open, but by the time we got to LA their bagel places would. i don't know how we ended up at canters ordering deli at six in the morning, especially when we were talking about bagels but their brooklyn ave with swiss for breakfast was absolute killer. their brisket on rye at 6am to was super killer. i was worried and thoughts were swirling, "can the deli meats this early in the morning be any good?" "who eats deli this early", "do they steam their deli meats for 24hr service?" all this was answered as soon as we took our first bite. usually i'm the one that will speak first after a bite but the wife just let out "omg", "this is the juiciest brisket ive had ever in canters", "you've got to try it". sure enough, it was. canters brisket is very good but you got to make sure its hot not warm, there's a huge difference when it is. looking at the sandwich i could see all the brisket juice just oozing out and every single bite needed a napkin dab. killer brisket! the brooklyn ave with swiss which i get once in awhile cause the wife thinks its sacrilegious was the perfect sandwich for the time of day cause the dressing and slaw cuts down the saltiness of the pastrami. there was a teeny tiny minor miss, the swiss could've been melted a bit more, but all of it with the pastrami and the rye. hellooooo!its kind of nice to experience canters this early where you sat yourself and all you can hear throughout is the chatter and bustle of workers.

Reviews.Author: Chanti D.
Reviews.Content: It's a Hollywood classic. But at the end of the day it is still a deli. a good deli...but a simple deli

Reviews.Author: D'Anza A.
Reviews.Content: had a rough day at work and need a bar nearby? look no further, this dive bar will suit your needs! friendly peeps, awesome bartender!

Reviews.Author: Liza V.
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I had an anniversary breakfast last Saturday and this was my firrst to try in this deli. I had cheese blintzes and it was delicious. My hubby had egg Benedict and he said it was mouth watering. We were satisfied of what we ordered and enjoyed our anniversary breakfast. The waiter was very helpful and attentive and the place is nice. Definitely I'm coming back to try their pastrami and more pastries which are really yummy.

Reviews.Author: Patricia C.
Reviews.Content: I would probably still be considered a Canter's newbie considering the few times I've been, but they have all been pleasant and memorable experiences in their own way.  On one occasion following a night out at The Dime across the way, my sister's boss insisted on being seated in the booth between my sister and I at a table that included non-stationary chairs, and looking like the emperor, his wife, and his concubine, we had a wonderful 3am meal of matzo ball soup and pastrami.  And we were truly served like kings, even on a Saturday's e'en.  More recently, a friend in a drunken stupor talked wildly (and loudly) of her sexual escapades without causing a stir in the establishment.  This is the place to come when you're drunk because they've seen it all!  And finally, even the women in the bakery are sweethearts because when I still worked on Melrose and was itching for some sweets for myself with only $2 in my pocket and the brownie craving of a coworker to quell, the darling behind the counter made my meager change work and ensured a pleasant workday for me, my coworker, and all of our customers.  (They have a powerful brownie.)  It's just one of those institutions that still knows we're all human and cuts us some slack when we need it.

Reviews.Author: Eve W.
Reviews.Content: All Hype. I ordered the Pastrami on rye and I thought it was going to be piled high. No, it was a very skimpy, half-sandwich. I've been longing for some Nate & Al's....one day!

Reviews.Author: Sara C.
Reviews.Content: As a Jew who loves deli food, I have to weigh in on Canter's. I went there over Hanukkah to get my latke fix. They were just so-so, and way expensive. In fact, everything on the menu is way expensive. Want cole slaw with your corned beef sandwich? You'll have to pay extra! The bowl of soup is a SMALL bowl of soup (not the large variety at some of the LA delis). And don't even get me started on the wait staff. Where do they find these jokers anyway? Odd birds. And you wonder if they ever clean the place. Oh yeah, and if you want dessert, order it from the bakery counter at the end. Otherwise they charge you a premium.

Reviews.Author: Max D.
Reviews.Content: Bakery = 3.5 stars, deli = 3.25 stars.  True, the deli tends to be 10-20% overpriced, and the service can be inconsistent, but if you want matzo ball soup at 3:00 a.m., you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Author: Angelina Z.
Reviews.Content: Wow, I dont even know where to start! Ok, first of all I am married to an Israeli Jew. You really can't get any more Jewish than that. Second, let me say that I went here expecting to eat some yummy food, the kind my husband makes. YUCK! How can this place call it a Jewish deli  and cafe? This place first of all isn't Kosher ( not that I really care, I'm not Jewish myself and we don't eat Kosher, but c'mon your exploiting a Jewish theme here!). Also, there wasn't really any Israeli food. The food is overpriced ( $7 for 2 stuffed cabbages, my husband makes a pot of 20 for that amount.) I had a pastrami sandwinch, the pastrami wasn't flavorful and the bread was dry and nasty. My friends food was bland and tasteless. My friend from LA brought me here because she knew my husband was Jewish and wanted to show me "The best Jewish food in LA) HA! my husband lived in LA for 7 years and never heard of the place and goes to the valley for the real authentic stuff. If your coming here because your expecting Jewish Cuisine, BEWARE! This is NOT what you want to sign up for!

Reviews.Author: John S.
Reviews.Content: This is a cool place.  Its old school deli with good pastrami.  There is nothing great here although some baked goods border on great.  They r ush you in and rush you out but all in good fun.  Enjoy a good pastrami, corned beef or whatever.

Reviews.Author: Bunny H.
Reviews.Content: my favorite thing here is the PICKLES!

Reviews.Author: David E.
Reviews.Content: Friend of mine took me here one night and I had absolutely no expectations.  I am in love with Canter's.  What a great place.  They had a really good blues band playing in the bar and the food at the restaurant was AMAZING!  I'm not a big pastrami person.  I've had it, I like it, I never went out of my way for it.  My friend told me to try the pastrami.  Oh my god!  It was the best sandwich I've ever had in my life.  I never knew pastrami could be so good.  I would drive for hours to have another but luckily I don't have to.  My wife had the matzo ball soup, huge bowl, so delicious.  I really can't wait to go back here.  The guy on the harmonica that night was unbelievable.  The whole band was really good.  Just a great atmosphere with a live band, astounding food, open late, great location, absolutely love this place.

Reviews.Author: Yinpon B.
Reviews.Content: My husband & I and another couple went to Canter's for desserts after dinner.  We didn't know what "Russan coffee cake" is.  The staff at the bakery let us try it before we made our decision. Russan coffee cake tastes like bread. We ended up ordering Canter's carrot cake, 7-layer yellow cake with mocha chocolate filling, and one piece of cheesecake. They sell some cakes by weight. That's interesting. The Reuben sandwich looks so good (Yes, we just had dinner but we ordered a Reuben with pastrami to share). They are very generous with the pastrami. The sauerkraut is delicious. The sandwich is not too salty but very flavorful. The grilled rye bread is fresh. We all like the cheesecake the most (we were glad we got the last piece before it was sold out).  The carrot cake is delicious.  We were not into the chocolate cake too much. Well, maybe we were just too stuffed. They have their own parking lot. The service is great.  We will try Canter's breakfast and other deli next time.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan A.
Reviews.Content: expensive, slow unappreciative service when empty (8AM on a saturday)...won't be back...food was mediocore.

Reviews.Author: Paul N.
Reviews.Content: Being a fan of pastrami sandwiches, I had to stop by here while in the area. Besides Tommy Pastrami, the OC doesn't really have much options for great pastrami. The Hat is a joke because theirs meats are pre sliced swimming in a pool of broth. Can't a guy get his deli meat sliced fresh? The deli itself resembles the ones you see in New York City. I'd say this place is about two to three times the size of Carnegie Deli. That's a star right there because unlike Carnegie, you are not a inch away from your neighbor. As for the food itself, I had the Brooklyn Ave which was pastrami, coleslaw, and russian dressing served on sourdough. Sorry guys, but rye bread is nasty. The sandwich itself was delicious. I don't know about everyone else, but i like fat on my pastrami. You don't get the 2 lbs of pastrami like you would at Carnegie, but that's because the sandwiches here are cheaper. The only knock I have on the sandwich itself was the fact that the meat wasn't warm. They probably had a batch cut for the lunch crowd in order to meet the demand. Overall it was a great experience and I plan to come back when I am in the area(Can't stand going to LA so it will be a long time before I am back).

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: good lox.  delightful poppyseed cake.  my dad loves the matzo ball soup.  canter's is right around the corner from my dad's old office and it brings back a lot of comforting memories of sitting in the booth with my father and watching him sip a cup of coffee and eat matzo ball soup.  i wish we had a really good deli in san francisco.

Reviews.Author: Alison f.
Reviews.Content: canter's used to be better when the waitresses wore old school uniforms and there were telephones with cords at the tables.  but really, 24 hours is what it's got going for it, and the ceiling tiles with a backlit forest of one million orange leaves is pretty awesome. it's a scene, man, and the fruit cup rules.

Reviews.Author: katharine r.
Reviews.Content: Andy, our server, was the best.  Sure you get one fabulous 5 star napkin, and then you have to use the box of 1 star napkins.  I asked Andy, and my wish came true.  Pickles are a bit spicy, but I love it.  Never a dull star moment here - you never know who will come out.  From Lindsay Lohan, Sam Ronsom, Guns and Roses - whenever they are around, and Rodney Binghimer (sp?) from the KROQ 80's era.  You just never know.  The salmon dinner is super, as you get a slab of salmon, and lemon fresh cut, if you ask.  I love the Dr. John's (or whatever that soda is) Black Cherry in a bottle to boot.  No cans here.  My husband, the caveman of all cavemen, misses the Kishka which was recently removed as not enough takers.  Probably the blood scared them away.  If you are a fan, like the cashier said that everyone voted for Betty White on Saturday Nigh Live, maybe our votes when we order might help.  Try the buckwheat, mushroom gravy and pasta - as it rocks.  The brisket was tender and oh so New York Long Islandish.   At the bakery, get the salt sticks, so they do not discontinue those.  And avoid the apple pie, it is not all that it should be - hard apples, no flavor, too sweet and sugary crust.  The prune danish looks like the blueberry, so that might be something to keep track of.  Otherwise, it is a flashback in time, and in the 80's I found it a great late night hang, and it is a classic today.

Reviews.Author: Denise C.
Reviews.Content: very LA kitsch. i don't like how they haven't refurbished the interior in thirty years despite how many B-list rock bands stop in for a bite. touristy and not authentic, but very well adds to the LA food landscape. fun.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: I realize this place is legendary in LA but my first visit was a disappointment. Our server, Fran (sorry I had to call you out!) had about 15 white, long, coarse hairs protruding willy nilly all around her chin. Made my Matzo Brey (egg dish) highly unappetizing & I had trouble getting passed that. And it was kind of a boring meal anyway, nothing to waste more time talking about. On our way out though, I stopped at the bakery & asked for 1 item. He gave it to me free & said "consider it a sample." that was nice. I can say I've been there but doubtful I'd ever go back. Sorry Fran.

Reviews.Author: Big D.
Reviews.Content: Man the pastrami was super delicious. It had thick juicy slices of heaven. The sandwich is a tad bit high but worth the cost

Reviews.Author: Elle S.
Reviews.Content: As a native Los Angeleno yid, it's my duty to like Canters.  I've been coming here since I could walk. I've laughed and cried underneath the plastic ceiling emblazoned with leaves. It just doesn't get any Kitsch-ier in L.A. that THAT!  I've had most everything on the menu.  Well, not really.  I can't say anything stands out as good.  I like it all.  But I'll tell you a secret: their meat loaf dinner plate is fit for any hebrew king. I'm always stuffed yet always have room to eat a delectable sample (or 2 or 3) from the bakery when leaving.

Reviews.Author: M H.
Reviews.Content: The food is good. I've been coming here since the early 80's. As of late though the service has dropped off. The prices have gone up and the food can be hit or miss. Certain dishes are staples and always deliver. This place is not Kosher, so it makes it hard when I want to cheat.

Reviews.Author: b w.
Reviews.Content: i may have once split a meat sandwich here with a friend.was it good? yeah.was it healthy or good on the tummy... ah, no.i've randomly ended up here after a midnight drive to malibu (?) and had apple pancakes--great. i've come just for the mishmosh with carrots. i've sat and read over coffee, some bit of food (probably the pancakes with apples), or a half grapefruit tons of times, i've also avoided the kibitz room and watched sports through the windows between the back dining room and the bar.the wait staff is great in an aloof way, which is fine for me, so long as my egg cream comes on time (not the best, but you make do) and i get my food quickly.a buddy likes the hamantaschen and rugelach, but i've always been too full to stop at the bakery.the bathrooms are pretty dank.

Reviews.Author: Joe L.
Reviews.Content: came here after we went to area..props for being open late...i got the california burger with bacon...not a good idea..should've got the REUBEN - it is a delicatessen after allo DON'T get the quesadilla - i can make it better than they can. stick with the sandwiches and you should be fine.

Reviews.Author: mike s.
Reviews.Content: This place blows.  11.50 for a so-so pastrami sandwich.  The pickles were disgusting (I took a couple bites and threw the rest away).  And then there's the potato salad, which for some bizarre reason actually had cole slaw mixed in with it.  Not a little bit of cole slaw.  My potato salad was literally fifty percent cole slaw.  If I wanted cole slaw I would've ordered cole slaw.  Potato salad is potato salad, and cole slaw is cole slaw, and never the twain shall meet.  If I want a decent pastrami I'll go to The Hat, which is much better, much bigger, and much cheaper.

Reviews.Author: Aline Y.
Reviews.Content: So the hubby and I had to try this place out after hearing all about it's history and how people rave about the food.  We shared a pastrami sandwich and potato salad.  It was alright. The meat was a bit dry and not very tasty. The rye bread, however, was perfect. To me the food wasn't as good as Langers.  The environment of the restaurant was fun and nostalgic and I didn't have any complaints about the service.  I don't think I'll be returning there anytime soon, not unless we're out in Hollywood post-clubbing.

Reviews.Author: C R.
Reviews.Content: Big ass Rueben that was made by someone who knows what a rueben should taste like. I really cringed at spending 5 dollars on a Pabst though.

Reviews.Author: Francisco S.
Reviews.Content: i've been going to langers for a while now, and everytime i talk about  jewish deli's in LA everyone brings up canters.  now i understand the plus sides to this place, open late, have their own bar, cool west-side fairfax area.  But, when it comes down to it i want good food.  i ordered pastrami on rye and i couldn't even finish half the sandwich, it was pretty bad, plus the wait staff was pretty snobby.  i just couldn't get behind the hype

Reviews.Author: Chuy F.
Reviews.Content: Went here to cap off the day and wow was it worth it. Cold PBR  and a hot tongue (lengua) plate did hit the spoit. The tongue and mash were tender and melted as you ate them. A great place to eat.

Reviews.Author: Jess C.
Reviews.Content: I'm from NYC and I return here regularly. The corned beef is excellent. So are the fries. I wish they had green (new) or even half-sour pickles, but pickles cause cancer, so there's that. I really like the people who run it, too. And the bakery items. I'm not sure I'd eat a roasted chicken here and expect French chef results. But this is a Jewish deli, and short of Nate n Al this is the best one within miles. Greenblatts doesn't even count because a) they don't offer french fries (at a deli), and b) they sell wine. Bizarre place. But back to Canters. Go. Especially if you miss a real Jewish deli. It's not Katz's but it's something, and it's an important part of LA culture.

Reviews.Author: Lorena D.
Reviews.Content: one of the best bakeries in LA!!

Reviews.Author: Mitch S.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so maybe my memories of my grandmother taking me here mask my objectivity, but I'll do my best....The sandwiches are vast and varied, classic combos and old-school delectables....Entrees like their pasta and meatloaf are meant to provide sustenance, not win any iron chef competition...Breakfasts (superb) and late-night dwelling (some of the best cocktail mixing in the city) give you a glimpse of the LA populace like no other - picture old Jews, young rockers, and nostalgia seekers...the matzoh ball soup compares to the best in LA (take that, Brent's, Jerry's, Factor's et al)...The bakery though is what always does it for me - none better among the Jewish/kosher bakeries, and THE, yes, THE best hamentashen (so buttery, so thick) on the planet...ok maybe certain things are bland (my wife thought the gravy with the meatloaf came out of some bizarre goulash), but you go to Canter's to taste LA and life circa mid-late 20th Century, not 21st...

Reviews.Author: Portia I.
Reviews.Content: I have loved Canter's since I moved to LA over 20 years ago -- the food is great, authentic deli...BUT!!! -- recently I got a tuna on rye that had some weird black junk in it, yuck! I was horrified, I couldn't tell what it was - I found bits of this weird black junk inside my sandwich - thank God before I took a bite - (I happened to remove the top of piece of bread). I know that any restaurant can have a one time problem or accident like this so I showed the waitress and she took it away and replaced it. When she came back she said it was because the cook had used a knife that had been used on the pastrami. I was so turned off, I couldn't eat it at all and haven't been back since. I think she should have taken it off my bill rather than alienate me as a customer by telling me that pathetic excuse - and what if it were true, and I was a vegetarian? Anyway I thought it was a cheap and unsympathetic response, disrespectful of me as a customer and it has ruined Canter's as a favorite spot of mine -- though they do have some of the best double-fried french fries in LA, a fantastic pastrami sandwich and good challah and their Hungarian cheesecake is to die for. But tuna sandwich? Never again!

Reviews.Author: Michael T.
Reviews.Content: the best corned beef sandwich anywhere. better than carnegie, langers, nate n' al's, and anywhere else.unbelievable.go. try it.

Reviews.Author: Susan T.
Reviews.Content: My first experience at Canter's was couple of weeks ago. A friend was in from out of town so I thought we would try it out.  Our dining experience that day was great. The server was fabulous (I wish I remembered her name) and our food was just as great. I couldn't wait to come back. Well, I went back again yesterday and I took two more friends that have never been there before. I bragged about the food and the service continuously until they gave in. I must say I was very disappointed! Our dining experience was just the opposite! Our server was Fran. She was rude, disrespectful, impolite, and obviously did not belong in this business. Her attitude was so bad we couldn't believe it!!!  She basically told me I couldn't have fries with my sandwich. I would ask her a question about the menu and she would answer with disgust and in a disgruntled manner if she answered at all. It took everything I had to stay put long enough to eat my lunch. If you get Fran as your waitress, PLEASE ask for another. She will ruin your whole dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine G.
Reviews.Content: this is my favorite restraunt but for some reason, my friends never want to go. i dunno why. once i started a pantless party on the side of the street. the cops didn't seem to mind. i saw andy dick. I told him to join the party. he was too out of it to make real words come out of his mouth. what's up with that! oh yeah, the ruggulah is bomb.

Reviews.Author: kana m.
Reviews.Content: i don't think i had this good of a lunch in a long time.  and i don't know why it took me such a long time to actually try this place! nothing fancy - but the food/deli/sandwiches were made right, and it tasted wonderful!  the matzo soup was the highlight! :) i heart it!   the soup base was good, and the matzo ball was delicious!  i will definitely coming back!  no wonder they are in business this long! :)

Reviews.Author: Madison S.
Reviews.Content: The hot pastrami sandwich was anything but hot.  It was room temp.  The pastrami was dry.  The rye bread for the sandwich was really fresh and tasty though.  Onion rings were really good as well.  Cole slaw was too sweet and lacked flavor and crispness.  Tried some cookies from the bakery section.  Nothing special.  They looked good but the taste was so so.

Reviews.Author: Char H.
Reviews.Content: We came here basically because we were going to the mattress store next door and couldn't find their parking lot...  but was really happy that we did!  Just walking in, you could smell the pastrami...  Even before I saw the menu, I knew what to get!  The pastrami was awesome, with huge portions, and it was as good as I remember delis in NYC as being.  Plus, the servers were awesome -- I'm sensitive to gluten and she was kind enough to use potato pancakes instead of bread for my open-faced "sandwich".

Reviews.Author: DAVID K.
Reviews.Content: I used to love this place...All it took for me was one real bad experience and I never went back...My wife and her folks joined me for dinner.  My wife ordered a corned beef sandwich on a kaiser roll. The waitress told my wife that she had 3 kaiser rolls left and that she was saving them for her regular customers.....we all got up and left....We never went back

Reviews.Author: Koshka K.
Reviews.Content: Standard diner atmosphere - the interior is old and worn. For the area, it's a fast paced deli w an average priced menu and typical meal quantity.  I like the Matzah ball soup with chicken, though I wish the balls were a little more light and fluffier. It's the only place I've found for a quick-stop of Matzah soup, I'm still looking for a place that serves something "home-made." I also enjoy the tuna salad and the pastry selection. I don't care for the 'home-made' pickles, they're soggy and under seasoned.

Reviews.Author: Kat W.
Reviews.Content: I can't help loving this restaurant (and bakery - yummy)! I almost always order the Reuben with a Vanilla or Cherry Coke and I am always pleased!!  I get a side order of pickled herring and split it with my son and the experience is complete for me. He tells me that the Long Island Ice Tea will knock your socks off, too! On my way out, I stop in the bakery for a treat because I cannot eat a dessert right after that huge sandwich.  The place itself is awesome and retro!  Some of the waitresses have been there a LONG time I think - which really adds to the character of the restaurant!  All stars and both thumbs up to this L.A. Classic!

Reviews.Author: Lawrence T.
Reviews.Content: First is a distinctive odor that assaults you when you enter Canters. It is not a good smell or a terrible smell, it is a signature odor. Once sniffed it will be indelibly associated in your brain with the place.  I would say its main components are dill pickle brine, chicken soup broth, and the bleach they use when the floor is washed .
